abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 8 sts = 4" (10 cm); 9 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW BACK
Make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in adjustable ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring, place marker to indicate beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 4 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 5 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 6 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 7 sc, *2 sc into next sc, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 54 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 8 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 8 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 60 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 9 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 9 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 66 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 66 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 10 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 10 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 72 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 18: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 11 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 11 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 78 sc.

FINISHING
With yarn needle, whip st around half the circle to join both sides of the pillow. Insert the pillow form, then whip st around the remaining half of the circle. Weave in all loose ends.

PILLOW FRONT
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 7 sc in adjustable ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring, place marker to indicate beginning of round – 7 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 9, skip 1 ch, hdc in each of next 8 ch, sc in same st as last sc, *sc in next sc, ch 9, skip 1 ch, hdc in each of next 8 ch, sc in same st as last sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 14 sc, seven 8-hdc chs.
Pushing the 8-hdc ch pieces to the right side of the work, continue working in sc sts only:
Round 3: Ch 1, (Working in the first sc to the left of the 8-hdc ch) *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * 6 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 21 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 28 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, ch 9, skip 1 ch, hdc in each of next 8 ch, sc in next st, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 2 sc, ch 9, skip 1 ch, hdc in each of next 8 ch, sc in next sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 35 sc, seven 8-hdc chs.
Pushing the 8-hdc ch pieces to the right side of the work, continue working in sc sts only:
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 4 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 5 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 49 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 10: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 6 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 56 sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 7 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 63 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each of next 4 sc, pull up the first hdc ch from Round 2 (making sure sts aren't twisted), sc through both the top of it and the next sc, *sc in each of next 8 sc, pull up the next hdc-ch from Round 2 (making sure sts aren't twisted), sc through both the top of it and the next sc; repeat from * 5 more times, sc in last 3 sc, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 63 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 8 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 8 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 70 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] tall x 25" [63.5 cm] around.
gauge: 13 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Cactus
Note: Cactus is worked side to side.
With MC, ch 51.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 34 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in each of last 3 ch. Turn. 50 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 3 sl sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 34 sts. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in each of last 3 sl st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 3 sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 34 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in each of last 3 sl st. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 25" [63.5 cm], making sure to measure in center (widest section) of work, ending on a 3rd row.
Fasten off.
Flower (make 5)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Sl st in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS facing, fold Cactus in half and sew sides of Cactus tog. Gather one end of Cactus through edge sts. Stuff Cactus. Gather 2nd end of Cactus and fasten securely. Sew Flowers to one end of Cactus as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 3 skeins 1623 Mallard A; 1 skein 1101 Eggshell B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½ for pillow; 9 mm [US N-13] for snowflake.
18” (45.5 cm) x 18” (45.5 cm) poly-filled pillow form insert
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pillow Cover Measures 16” (40.5 cm) wide x 18” (45.5 cm) tall.
gauge: With 2 strands of A held together as one and smaller hook, 10¾ sts and 11¾ rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Snowflake Motif
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), [dc, ch 1] 11 times in ring, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 2 dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 2, dc in next ch-1 space, 2 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 5 times, ch 2, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-2 space**, dc in each of next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 4, [skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1] twice, *(dc, ch 3, dc) in ch-3 space**, [ch 1, skip next st, dc in next] 3 times; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 ch-3 spaces; 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, [dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] 3 times, *dc in next ch-3 space, ch 7, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 6 ch (spoke made), dc in same space in Round 4**, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, dc in dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 spokes.
Round 6: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1), [skip next st, hdc in next st, picot, ch 1] 3 times, skip next st, *skip first ch of spoke, slip st in next ch, slip st in next 4 ch sts of spoke, [ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch, slip st in top middle of spoke] twice, working on opposite side of the spoke, slip st in each of next 4 sc**, [ch 1, skip next st, hdc in next st, picot, ch 1] 5 times, skip next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, ch 1, skip next st, hdc in next, picot, ch 1, skip next st, slip st to 2nd ch of beginning ch-3, picot, slip st in first ch-1 sp. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
FINISHING
To shape snowflake, mist with water, flatten and pin out to shape. After motif is dry, center and pin to pillow. Using matching sewing thread and sewing needle, sew snowflake motif to pillow around edges.
Special Abbreviations
picot: Ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook.
Special Technique
adjustable ring: Holding yarn a few inches from the end, wrap around two fingers. Insert hook into wrap, pull up a loop, ch 1, remove loop from fingers. Work stitches of first round into the ring. To tighten ring, pull gently but firmly on yarn tail.
NOTES
For smooth, firm finish, pillow cover is worked in the round with yarn held doubled in un-joined rounds. The width has a 2” (5 cm) negative ease. It measures 2” [5 cm] shorter than pillow form for a tight, firm fit.
Keep pillow insert handy to check for fit. Alter size of pillow cover by adding or subtracting beginning chains & rounds as desired. Snowflake motif is worked separately in joined rounds with yarn held doubled and is sewn onto pillow top using matching sewing thread & sharp sewing needle for best results.
COVER
With smaller hook with 2 strands of A held together as one, ch 86 and without twisting ch, join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around, do not join—86 sc. Work in a spiral. Place marker in first st and move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2-57: Sc in each st around. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Turn cover inside out and whip stitch 1 end closed. Turn right side out, insert pillow form and whip stitch end closed. Set aside.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 324 Bright Yellow A; 390 Hot Red B; 321 Gold C; 254 Pumpkin D; 311 White E; and 706 Perfect Pink F.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [I-9 US]
Sewing needle and matching sewing thread
Bolster Pillow: 18” (45.5 cm) long bolster pillow form
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F = color A, B, C, D, E, F
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bolster pillow measures 22” (56 cm) long x 18” (45.5 cm) around. Star Pillow measures 17” (43 cm) in diameter at widest point.
gauge: 14 sts (1 repeat) = 3½” (7.5 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in Booster Pillow pattern. 10 sts = 4” (10 cm) in Star Pillow pattern.
instructions:
BOLSTER PILLOW
Cover
With A, ch 70 and without twisting ch, join into a ring with slip st in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in in each of first 5 ch, *3 sc in next ch, sc in each of next 5 ch, sc3tog over next 3 ch**, sc in each of next 5 ch; repeat from * around, ending last rep at **, join with slip st in first sc – 5 repeats.
Round 2: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in in each of first 5 sts, *3 sc in next sts, sc in each of next 5 sts, sc3tog over next 3 sts**, sc in each of next 5 sts; repeat from * around, ending last rep at **, join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 3-45: Repeat Round 2, in color sequence listed above. Fasten off.
End Circle (make 2)
With E, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), 13 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 14 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 28 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4 Repeat Round 3.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, *sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st, in first sc; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Repeat round 6
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each of next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st**, sc in next 3sts; rep from * around ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in first sc – 50 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With all 6 colors, make two 3” (7.5 cm) pom-poms. Sew one pompom to center of each End Circle. With sewing needle and matching sewing thread, sew End Circles to ends of pillow form. Insert pillow form into Cover, with equal amounts of fabric extending over each end, tack Cover to End Circles.

STAR PILLOW
Cover Half (make 2)
With B, ch 143.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook (place marker), sc in each of next 9 ch, *3 sc in next ch (peek made), sc in each of next 10 ch**, sc3tog over next 3 ch (valley made, place marker), sc in each of next 10 ch; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at ** (place marker in last st), turn – 6 peeks; 7 markers for 5 valleys and ends of row. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 9 sts, *3 sc in next st, sc in each of next 10 sts**, sc3tog over next 3 sts, sc in each of next 10 sts; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of next 9 sts. sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn. Fasten off B, leaving a sewing length, join F.
Rows 3-12: Working in color sequence as listed above, Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Assembly
*On wrong side, bring 2 markers of adjacent valleys together, with sewing needle and thread, sew foundation ch together from peek to valley point; repeat from * around, joining each section from peek to valley together forming 6 points. Sew center together. With matching sewing lengths, sew sides of Cover Half together across ends of rows. Sew other Cover Half in same manner.
Edging
With wrong sides of two Cover Halves together, matching sts, working through double thickness, join D with slip st in center sc of any point, ch 1, 3 sc in center sc of point, *sc in each of next 10 sc, sc3tog over next 3 sts, sc in each of next 10 sts**, 3 sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, stuff pillow with polyfill stuffing, repeat from * to ** once, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny Square™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m) - Contrast A Retro Pop (65004) 1 ball or 4 Squares
Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny Square™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m) - Contrast B Asphalt (65001) 1 ball or 4 Squares
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 22" [56 cm] square. To fit 20" [51 cm] square pillow form.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest section of color repeat) from center of ball, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• Color change occurs where yarn is spliced together and should align with sl st at end of rnd. 
• If splicing is visible on RS adjust sts so splice sits to WS, or work over splice on next rnd.
• At end of final rnd Motif should measure 10½" [26.5 cm] square. Cut yarn where Color 5 (longest section of color repeat) ends, leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] tail at end of Motif for joining. 
• Begin next Motif with Color 1 and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.

MOTIF (Make 4 each in A and B).
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off, leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] tail.

Assembly
Using rem long yarn tails from Motifs and yarn needle, join Motifs tog with RS facing and following Assembly Diagram. 
Fold piece in half widthwise, with WS tog, to form 2 x 2 square. With rem long yarn tails, join 2 sides. Insert pillow form and join rem side.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 256 Carrot A, 320 Cornmeal B, 316 Soft White C, 360 Café Latte D, 321 Gold E, 341 Light Grey F, 373 Petal Pink G, 706 Perfect Pink H, 885 Delft I, 672 Spring Green J, and 312 Black K
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.5mm [US E-4] and 5mm [US H-8]
Six ¼” (6 mm) black safety eyes
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 8 sts = 2” (5 cm); 8 rows = 2” (5 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
House of Bricks
With larger hook and A, ch 23.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—22 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn; change to B at end of Row 10. 
Row 11: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 12–22: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in first sc, 2 sc in same sc (corner made), sc in each sc across to last st, 3 sc in last sc (corner made); working in ends of rows, work 20 sc evenly down side changing to A as needed to match rows; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch (corner made), sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch (corner made); working in ends of rows, work 20 sc evenly up side changing to B as needed to match rows; join with slip st in first sc—92 sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join C with sc in first sc, sc in each sc around working 3 sc in center sc of each corner (corner made); join with slip st in first sc—100 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, working back loops only, sc in each sc around working 3 sc in center sc of each corner (corner made); join with slip st in first sc—108 sc. Fasten off.
Window Sill 
Row 1: With right facing and working in unworked front loops of Row 11, join C with sc in first sc, sc in each sc across—22 sc. Fasten off. 
House of Sticks 
Rows 1–10: With D, work same as Rows 1–10 of house of bricks.
Rows 11–22: With E, work same as Rows 11–22 of house of bricks.
House of Straw 
Rows 1–10: With B, work same as Rows 1–10 of house of bricks.
Rows 11–22: With F, work same as Rows 11–22 of house of bricks.
Wolf Panel
Rows 1–10: With J, work same as Rows 1–10 of house of bricks.
Rows 11–22: With I, work same as Rows 11–22 of house of bricks.
PIG (make 3)
Work all pieces with smaller hook.
Head (make 3) 
With G, ch 6.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join rounds until instructed; place marker on first st and move up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last 2 sc—18 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off.
Snout (make 3) 
With H, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join rounds until instructed; place marker on first st and move up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, slip st in each sc around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Ear (make 6) 
With H, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc3tog, sc in last sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc3tog (tip of ear made)—1 sc. 
Fasten off. 
Shirt (make 3 - 1 each with A, J, and K) 
Ch 15.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—14 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc. 
Fasten off. 
WOLF
Work all pieces with smaller hook.
Head 
With F, ch 9.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—16 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 7–9: Ch 1, sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—10 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—8 sc.
Rows 11–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 14: *Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch (ear made)*, skip first 2 sc, slip st in next 3 sc; repeat from * to * once, skip next 2 sc, slip st in last sc. Fasten off.
Nose
With K, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Neck 
With C, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn; change to F at end of Row 4. 
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Rows 7 and 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Fasten off.
BACK PANEL
With J, ch 51.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—50 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5–36: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 sixteen times. 
Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 3 sc in first sc (corner made), sc in each sc across to last sc, 3 sc in last sc (corner made); *working 1 sc in end of sc rows and 2 sc in end of dc rows, work 54 sc across side*; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch (corner made), sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch (corner made); repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first sc—216 sc.
Fasten off.
Round 2: Join C with sc in first sc, sc in each sc around working 3 sc in center sc of each 3-sc corner; join with slip st in first sc—224 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, working back loops only, sc in each sc around working 3 sc in center sc of each 3-sc corner; join with slip st in first sc—232 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Use photograph as a guide for placement of stitches and squares. 
House of Bricks With C, embroider back stitches horizontally between Rows 1 and 2, Rows 3 and 4, and each pair of rows thereafter. Separate bricks with back stitches worked vertically between horizontal lines. Begin first vertical line between first 2 stitches of Rows 2 and 3; begin first vertical line between 3rd and 4th stitches of Rows 4 and 5. Separate bricks by skipping 4 stitches between vertical stitches and alternate placement of stitches as you work across the square.
House of Sticks With D and K, embroider chain stitches for branches on each section. With J, embroider French knot leaves on branches.
House of Straw With B and E, embroider as many straight stitches as desired for pieces of straw.
Pigs
Snout With 6 strands of embroidery floss, embroider French knot nostrils and back stitches for smile. Sew snout in place. Insert black eyes and secure. If desired, vary the placement of eyes on each pig so faces appear different.
Ears Sew first row of ear to head, then pull tip of ear down over last 2 rounds of head. Tack in place.
Shirt Sew shirt in place on upper section of square. Place head on top edge of shirt and sew.
Wolf 
Sew nose on head. Embroider back stitches for smile. Insert yellow eyes and secure. With C, work a small back stitch over the first stitch of Row 8 of neck, work next back stitch close to the first allowing a ½-¾” (1.5-2 cm) long loop to form; *holding the loop in place, work next back stitch close to the last one made; repeat from * as many times as needed to create loops and back and forth across all C rows. Fasten off.
Sew neck and head to wolf panel.
Front Panel
Arrange houses and wolf panel and sew together through both sets of loops. 
Pull tails to wrong side of front panel to minimize weaving in ends.
Border
Hold front and back panels with wrong sides together, matching corners and easing sides to fit. 
Round 1: With larger hook and working in both sets of loops, join C with sc in center sc of any corner, 2 sc in same sc, *sc evenly spaced across to next corner, 3 sc in next corner; repeat from * twice; insert pillow form, sc evenly spaced across last side; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 360 Cafe Latte A and 1 skein 947 Marrakesh B or 2 skeins 726 Coral
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Pillows measure 15” x 15” (38 x 38 cm), with tight fit
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Dahlia Pillows
Add texture and color to any chair, sofa or bed with unique crocheted pillows. Choose to make your pillow monochromatic or contrast the flowers with any color that lifts your spirits.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first half fan, *fan in next sc, sc in center dc of next fan; repeat from * to beginning ch-4, sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4, turn—11 fans and 12 sc.
Rows 4–35: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 sixteen times. Do not fasten off.
Edging 
With right side facing, rotate square to first side, ch 1, working across ends of rows, skip first row, *work 3 hdc in next row, skip next row; repeat from * to Row 1; work 3 hdc in corner ch of Row 1, working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in each ch across to next corner ch, 3 hdc in next corner ch; working across ends of rows of 2nd side, skip first row, repeat from * to Row 35; work 3 hdc in first sc of Row 35, **hdc in each dc and ch-space of next fan, skip next sc; repeat from ** across Row 35; join with slip st in first hdc.
Fasten off.
FLOWER (make 9)
Note: Flower is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times. Join rounds with slip st in first st.
Base 
With B and leaving long tail for sewing, ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 13 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—14 dc.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr and ch 1), *tr in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—14 tr and 14 ch-1 sps.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—14 ch-3 sps.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc, ch 2, slip st in top of dc, hdc, sc) in same ch-3 space, *(sc, hdc, dc, ch 2, slip st in top of dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. 
Note: Base may cup inwardly, do not block flat.
Top
With B and leaving a long tail for sewing, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 11 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—11 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in first hdc, 3 dc in each remaining hdc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—33 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 dc in first dc, 3 dc in each remaining dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—99 dc. Fasten off.
Assembly
Pull tails to wrong side of each square. Block to final measurement, if necessary. Choose one square as front; with right side facing, sew flower bases to front in 3 rows of 3 bases each evenly spaced apart and with center of outer bases 3” (7.5 cm) from each edge. Tack one top on each base, sewing through Round 2 of base and wrong side of top to secure. Thread a length of A on yarn needle. Hold wrong sides of squares together with fans facing same direction and, with front facing and beginning at any corner, whipstitch squares together evenly spaced through inner loops only around 3 sides, working 3 sts in each corner; insert pillow form and continue to whipstitch evenly spaced across remaining side. Secure in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 3 skeins 661 Frosty Green A, 2 skeins 971 Camouflage B.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 10 sts = 4”; 11 rows = 4” in sc with smaller hook and double strand of yarn. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Head
With smaller hook and double strand of A; ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last st of round and move marker up each round.
Round 1: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Rounds 8-19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 22: * [Sc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * around – 28 sc.
Round 23: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.
Stuff Head with fiberfill, adding more as necessary before closing.
Shell
With larger hook and triple strand of B, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc throughout), 11 hdc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 12 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times; join – 24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc around; join.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 3 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last hdc; join – 36 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 5 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last 2 hdc; join – 48 sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 7 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last 3 hdc; join – 60 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 9 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last 4 hdc; join – 72 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 11 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; join – 84 sts.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in next 6 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 13 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc] 5 times, hdc in last 6 hdc; join – 96 sts.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around. Fasten off.
Pillow Cover
With smaller hook and double strand of A, ch 74; join with a slip st in first ch being careful that ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not join – 74 sc. Work in continuous rounds as for Head.
Rounds 2-50: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off leaving long tail for closing seam.
Closing Strap
With smaller hook and double strand of A, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 7 sc.
Rows 2-30: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off leaving long tail for attaching to pillow cover.
Finishing
Using a long needle and thick thread, create eyes by sewing the buttons onto the face as pictured. Weave and trim ends.
Sew end seam of pillow cover closed, using yarn tail. Insert pillow and close opposite seam in same fashion.
Center shell on turtle body. Attach by sewing using yarn, making seams 1” from the edge of the shell to form shell edge.
Working along the short sides of the rectangular pillow, locate the midpoint. Pin the closing strap at this midpoint and attach securely by sewing using yarn tail. On the opposite side sew a 2” wide piece of loop side of the Velcro to the pillow cover using matching sewing thread and a sharp needle. Sew hook part of the Velcro along the end of the strap.
Working along the longer side of the rectangular pillow, locate the midpoint of the pillow and attach the head securely with yarn and a tapestry needle.

materials: 9274 Biscuit A, 1 ball 4601 Off White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER (make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 54 loosely. 
Row 1: Working in back bumps of foundation ch, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in each ch across – 52 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st across. 
Rows 4-49: Repeat Rows 2-3. 
Fasten off after Row 49 and set aside. 
Repeat for 2nd piece but do not fasten off.
Joining Round 50: Holding two pieces with wrong sides together and sts aligned, working through both layers along side edges, slip st 62 sts evenly spaced across, turn and working through both layers of foundation ch, slip st in each ch across, turn to work along opposite side edge, work 62 slip sts evenly spaced along row edges, insert pillow form and slip st in each st across last edge to close, slip st in first st. 
Rounds 51-52: Ch 1, sc in each slip st around, working 3 sc in each corner st, slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
STARFISH ARMS (make 5)
With larger hook and holding 2 strands of B together, ch 14.
Round 1: Sc in first ch, place marker, sc in next 11 ch, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 12 ch, slip st in first sc – 28 sts.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same space, slip marker, sc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts, dc in next 5 sts, 4 dc in next st, ch 1, skip next 2 dc from previous round, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, skip next 2 dc, ch 1, 4 dc in next st, dc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in last 2 sts, slip st in first sc. Mark ch-2 space with yarn scrap for seaming. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING 
Hold 2 arms with wrong sides together at the marked ch-2 spaces. 
Working through both layers, join doubled yarn with slip stitch to ch-2 spaces, ch 1, sc in same space, working in the back loops of top arm sts and front loops of bottom arm sts, sc in next 7 dc. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Repeat to join remaining arms. Do not fasten off after joining last 2 arms. Edging: Slip st in next 2 sts from the arm sts, *ch 3, slip st in same space, slip st in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, slip st in first st. Fasten off.
There should be a picot in every other st around entire motif. Do not picot in row ends created from arm joins. 
Center: With right side facing, join 2 strands of B in any ch-2 space in center of motif, ch 1, 2 sc in same space, 2 sc in each ch-2 space around, slip st in first sc to join. Weave in ends.
Pin starfish to center of pillow. Smooth arms out towards edges and pin in place.
Using 1 strand of B and yarn needle, join motif with small whipstitches. Do not pull yarn too tightly in order to avoid puckers. Knot yarn securely. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 400 Grey Heather A, 312 Black B, 316 Soft White C, and 319 Cherry Red D.
Yarn needle; purchased black fabric-covered 16” square pillow; black sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: A, B, C = colors A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Motif = 3” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PiLLOW TOP
Square (Make 12 with A, 9 with B and 4 with C)
Ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 5, [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 3 times, 2 dc in ring; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in first ch-space, ch 1, [(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-2 space, ch 1] 3 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Assembly
Arrange squares, wrong side up, following diagram. Join Strip 1 of 5 squares to Strip 2 of 5 squares as follows: Holding 2 squares at a time with right sides together and working through both layers, join A in a corner ch-space with an sc; * [ch 3, sc in next ch-space] twice **, ch 2, pick up next pair of squares, sc in corner ch-space; repeat from * 3 more times, end at **. Fasten off.
Following diagram, join next strip of 5 squares to previously joined strips until all squares are joined horizontally. Now join strips vertically in the same manner.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing, join B in any corner ch-2 space; ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in corner space, [ch 3, sc in next space] 13 times, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, * 3 sc in corner space, sc in next sc, [3 sc in next space] 14 times **, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join in first sc – 46 sc on each side between center corner sc. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join C in center sc of any corner; ch 1, [3 sc in center corner sc, sc in each sc to next center corner sc] 4 times; join – 48 sc between center corner sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: Repeat Round 3 with D increasing 1 sc at center of each side – 52 sc between center corner sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, * (sc; ch 3, sc in top of sc just made – picot made; sc) all in center corner sc, sc in next 2 sc, picot, [sc in next 3 sc, picot] 16 times **, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; sc in last sc; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FiniSHinG
Center Pillow Top on purchased pillow. Sew in place with sewing needle and thread.

materials: RED HEART® “Designer Sport™”: 1 Ball each 3369 Cocoa CA and 3805 Sky CB [3 oz (85 g), 279 yd (255 m)]
abbreviations: CA, CB = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: To Change Color in Sc: Work last st before color change until 2 lps are left on hook, drop color in use, pick up next color to be used and draw through 2 lps on hook. Continue with new color. Hold color not in use against wrong side of work, working over the strand every 3 or 4 sts. BACK: With CA, ch 46. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 45 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Rep Row until 12” from beg. Fasten off. FRONT: With CA, ch 46. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 45 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Rows 3-10: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc with CA, * sc in next 8 sc with CB, sc in next 3 sc with CA; rep from * across ending with 2 sc of CA instead of 3; turn. Rows 11-14: Rep Row 2 with CA. Rep Rows 3-14 twice more times, then rep Rows 3-12 once more. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Front Edging: With right side facing, join CA in any sc; ch 1, work sc evenly around entire front, working 3 sc in each corner; join with a sl st to first sc. Work 1 more round sc. Fasten off. FINISHING: With wrong sides together, sew pillow back and front together leaving one side open. Insert pillow form and sew side closed.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbl = Double crochet in back loop
instructions:
Notes:  
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
• All sts are worked through back 
loops only.
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
With A, ch 4. 
1st rnd:  11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
Working in back loops only, 1 dcbl 
in same sp as last sl st. 2 dcbl in 
each dc around. Join with sl st to 
top of ch-3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in 
next dc. *2 dcbl in next dc. 1 dcbl 
in next dc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 dc.
4th rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in 
each of next 2 dc. *2 dcbl in next 
dc. 1 dcbl in each of next 2 dc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to top 
of ch-3. 48 dc.
5th rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in 
each of next 3 dc. *2 dcbl in next 
dc. 1 dcbl in each of next 3 dc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to top 
of ch-3. 60 dc.
Cont as established, inc 10 dc 
every rnd until piece measures 16" 
[40.5 cm] diameter when slightly 
stretched. Fasten off at end of last 
rnd.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back tog, join A with sl st 
to any st of last rnd through both thicknesses.
Joining rnd:  Ch 1. Working through both 
thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around, inserting 
pillow form before completing rnd. Join with 
sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 6 each in B, C and D)
Wind yarn around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly 
in middle and leave a long end for attaching 
to Pillow. Cut loops at both ends and trim to 
smooth round shape.
Sew Pompoms securely to edge of Pillow in 
the following sequence: A,B,C.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Light Teal (10734) 3 balls or 534 yds/448.5 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A White (04005) 1 ball or 210 yds/192 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of black yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
BODY
Beg at head, with MC, ch 11.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 22 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 28 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 34 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 40 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 44 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 48 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 52 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 56 sc.
12th to 17th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
18th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 52 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 48 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 44 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 40 sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 48 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 56 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 64 sc.
25th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 72 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 26th rnd until work from last inc rnd measures 20" [51 cm].
Do not fasten off.
Cont for Tail
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 66 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
11th and 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
14th and 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
17th and 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
20th and 21st rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Stuff Head and Body firmly. Stuff rem Tail as you work.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
23rd and 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
26th and 27th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
29th and 30th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
31st rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FEET (make 4)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 2 sc in each of next 10 sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Break A. Join with MC. 44 sc.
7th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (Sc2tog) 10 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 34 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 9th rnd until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. Join. 30 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 27 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Stuff Feet firmly and sew to Body as shown in photos.
SPIKES (make 5)
Spike Sides (make 2 for each Spike)
With A, ch 2.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. Ch 1. Cont around next 4 edges of Spike Side, sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each corner.
Fasten off.
Spike Assembly: Holding 2 Spike Sides with WS tog and stitching through back loops only, sew Sides tog, leaving bottom edge open.
Stuff Spikes firmly and sew along Body and Tail as shown in photo.
Eyes and Nose
Using length of black yarn, embroider Eyes and Nose as shown in photo using back stitch.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Burnt Orange (26087) 5 balls
Size U.S. U (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] diameter x 18" [45.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note
Pouf is made in 2 halves and then joined together with sl st joining rnd in the middle.
Top
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Bottom
Make as given for Top.
FINISHING
With WS of Top and Bottom facing each other and final (9th) rnds aligned, join yarn with sl st through both thicknesses to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, join Top and Bottom edges tog with sl st in each sc around, inserting pillow forms as you work. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Mega Bulky™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m) Claret (88532) or Olympia Blue (88128) or Linen (88021) 2 balls
Size U.S. S (19 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Bolster pillow form 6" [15 cm] in diameter x 14" [35 cm] long
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit bolster pillow form 6" [15 cm] in diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each of hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between sts of previous rnd (see diagram), 1 hdc in each hdc around. Do not join. Working in a spiral, rep from * until work from 3rd rnd measures approx 14" [35.5 cm]. Insert pillow form.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 9 sts. Fasten off.
Thread end through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) or (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Vintage White (10006) or (00006) 237 yds/215 m or 2 (3) balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 51. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. (Sl st in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch) twice. Sl st in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Ch 10. Skip next 10 sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Ch 10. Skip next 10 sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Sl st in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Sl st in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 32" [81.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. 
Fasten off.
Chain Links
With RS facing, twist 1st horizontal bar at foundation row to form loop. Draw 2nd horizontal bar through 1st bar without twisting. Rep, drawing next bar through previous bar without twisting until all bars have been worked. Sew last loop to second last loop to secure.
FINISHING
Sew 2 sides. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side closed.

materials: Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m) Contrast A Bonfire (65010) 3 balls or 10 Squares
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Pixie Pink (12008) 3 balls or 652 yds/596 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
gauge: Motif = Approx 10½" [26.5 cm] square. 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT
Motif
With A, make 10.
See Diagram on page 2.
Notes: 
•  Motifs begin with Color 1 
(shortest section of color rep) 
from center of ball, leaving a 
4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
•  All color changes occur at 
end of rnd where colors are 
spliced together.
•  Each color aligns with 1 rnd in 
the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
•  If too much color is left at end 
of rnd, pull back some sts and 
slightly loosen gauge to re-work 
sts and finish at color change. 
•  If too little color is left, pull back 
some sts and slightly tighten 
gauge to re-work sts and finish 
at color change.
•  Color change occurs where yarn 
is spliced together and should 
align with sl st at end of rnd. 
•  If splicing is visible on RS adjust 
sts so splice sits to WS or work 
over splice on next rnd.
•  At end of final rnd Motif should 
measure 10½" [26.5 cm] square. 
Cut yarn where Color 5 (longest 
section of color rep) ends, 
leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] tail at end of Motif for joining. 
•  Begin next Motif with Color 1 
and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.
•  Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc 
and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of 
ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to 
form ring.
1st rnd:  (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 
3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 
3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 
3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice 
more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 
3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in 
next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) 
in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice 
more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. 
Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds:  
Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc 
in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in 
each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1** 
(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 
Rep from * twice more, then from * 
to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off, leaving 42" [106.5 cm] tail.
Join Motifs into 2 horizontal strips, 
having 5 Motifs in each strip. Join 
2 Strips tog following Seaming 
Diagram.
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). 
With B, sl st Motifs tog, working 
through back loops only and 
keeping working yarn to WS of 
work to create a flat sl st chain 
detail on RS of work (see diagram).  
Note: Keep working yarn to WS 
of work so only flat sl st chain is 
visible on RS.
 
BACK (make 2 pieces alike).
Ribbing: With B, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back 
loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end 
of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg 
(when slightly stretched) measures 
21" [53.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. 
Work 37 sc evenly along side of 
Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from 
marker measures 27" [68.5 cm]. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap 
Back pieces to match Front, with 
ribbed sections in center to create 
opening to insert pillow form (as 
shown in photo). With RS facing, join 
B with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. 
Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses,  
work sc evenly around 4 sides of 
Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Stellar™: 2 balls 9804 Comet C and 1 ball each 9949 Star A and 9201 Galaxy B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Pillow measures 18” wide x 12” long (45.5 x 30.5 cm)
gauge: 8 sc = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER
Front Panel
With A, ch 38.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—37 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to B, turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2; change to C, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, 3 d
c in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, hdc in next st, dc in next st, 3 dc in next st, dc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st, turn—6 sc, 11 hdc, and 30 dc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next st, *3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, sc3tog, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 3 times, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, sc2tog; change to B, turn—47 sc.
Row 9: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), *dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, d
c3tog; repeat from * 4 times, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in last 2 sts, turn—6 sc, 12 hdc, and 19 dc.
Rows 10–14: Repeat Rows 6–10; change to A at end of Row 14.
Rows 15–24: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
Back Panel
With C, ch 38.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—37 sc.
Rows 2–24: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Joining Round: Hold panels with wrong sides together and front panel facing; working through both thicknesses, join C with sc in first st of last row, 2 sc in same st, 2 sc in next st, *skip next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across to last st, 3 sc in last st; ***working in ends of rows, 2 sc in each even-numbered row*** down first side; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, 2 sc in next ch, **skip next ch, 2 sc in next ch; repeat from ** across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; repeat from *** to *** up other side, inserting pillow form before completing round; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Fringe
Attach fringe only across side edges. Cut 28 strands of A, 12 strands of B, and 8 strands of C, each 10” (25.5 cm) long. Fold strand in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from front to back in end of same color row. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach matching fringe in end of each row.

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Linen (28021) or Wine (28532) or Taupe Grey (28048) 6 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only of next stitch.
Hdcfl = Half double crochet in front loop only of next stitch
RSPopcorn = 3 dc in indicated stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back in first dc. Pull dropped loop through.
WSPopcorn = 3 dc in indicated stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from back to front in first dc. Pull dropped loop through.
instructions:
Ch 42. See chart on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch-2 counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 41 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc throughout). 1 hdcfl in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row (Fringe row): Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Place marker at end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in next st. *RSPopcorn in back loop only of next st. 1 hdcbl in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdcbl in st. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcfl in each of next 2 sts. *WSPopcorn in front loop only of next st. 1 hdcfl in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 hdcfl in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: As 6th row.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 9th rows to form pat. Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 40" [101.5 cm], ending on a 3rd or 7th row.
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 6" [15 cm] long. Fold each strand in half and knot into fringe into rem loops of each st across each marked 3rd row (Fringe row) of pat. Trim fringe evenly.
FINISHING
Fold Pillow in half. With WS facing, sew 2 sides of Pillow tog using a flat seam. Insert pillow form. Sew rem seam.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Blackbird (32002) 1 ball or 234 yds/214 m
Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m) Contrast A Black (07421) 1 ball or 440 yds/402 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] using Bernat® Velvet™.
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike). Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: Skip first ch. 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
10th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 60 sc.
11th to 24th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each round (offsetting the inc on even rnds), until there are 144 sc.
25th to 27th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Join with sl st in first sc. Do not fasten off.
Join Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back tog, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc around, insert pillow form at halfway point and cont around to end. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 30): Wind A around 3 fingers approx 100 times. Tie tightly in center leaving long tails for attaching to Pillow. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape (finished Pompom should measures approx 2" [5 cm] in diameter). Use tails to secure Pompoms evenly spaced around Pillow (as shown in photo). Note: To ensure pompoms are secure, tie tails through last round of Front and Back and not just through joining round.

materials: Bernat® Sheepy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 149 yds/136 m)
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp St = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Hold working yarn over top of left index finger and pull up 1" [2.5 cm] loop. Grab working yarn behind index finger and pull through stitch. Hold loop in position with right hand to front of work. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Loop is formed on RS of work.
instructions:
Notes: Color changes are worked in intarsia technique. Wind small balls of colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. Start new colors at appropriate points. Do not carry color not in use along top of work. To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. 

FRONT
With B, ch 42. 
1st row:  (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 12 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. With B, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 41 sc. 
First row of chart is now in place. Keeping cont of chart, work each row in sc until chart is complete, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, and noting Lp sts are worked in Rows 28 and 30. Fasten off. 
Using back st, embroider Eyes and Mouth as shown in photo. Embroider Nose in satin st.

BACK
With A, ch 42.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 41 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm]. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Sew 3 sides of Pillow tog. Insert pillow form. Sew opening closed.

pattern_name: Ending With A Bobble Crochet Pillow Set
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Lapis (10800) or Malachite (10802) or Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Push tr sts worked on WS to RS of work to form bobbles.
Front and Back (make 2 alike)
Ch 22.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th to 8th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more.
9th to 25th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
26th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
28th to 33rd rows: Rep 26th and 27th rows 3 times more. Fasten off.
Joining Front and Back
1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Tassel Around Stackable Crochet Floor Pillow
materials: Bernat® Velvet Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 229 yds/209 m) Version 1 Main Color (MC) Bittersweet Bronze (40014) 6 balls
Bernat® Velvet Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 229 yds/209 m) Version 2 Main Color (MC) Midnight Plum (40010) 6 balls
Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Version 1 Contrast A Rich Terracotta (32079) 1 ball
Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Version 1 Contrast B Bronze (32082) 1 ball
Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Version 2 Contrast A Jewel Blue (32076) 1 ball
Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Version 2 Contrast B Burgundy Plum (32004) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2½" [6 cm] piece of cardboard for Tassels.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral moving marker onto first st of each rnd for easier counting.
FRONT and BACK (make 2 alike)
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Do not join. 8 hdc.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 dcbp around each hdc around. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
4th rnd: *2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
5th rnd: *2 dcbp around first st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 40 sts.
6th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th rnd: *2 dcbp around first st. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 56 sts.
8th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 64 sts.
9th rnd: 2 dcbp around first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 7 sts. 72 sts.
10th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 80 sts.
11th rnd: 2 dcbp around first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 9 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 7 sts. 88 sts.
12th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 96 sts.
13th rnd: 2 dcbp around first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 11 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 7 sts. 104 sts.
14th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 112 sts.
15th rnd: 2 dcbp around first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 13 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 7 sts. 120 sts.
16th rnd: *1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 128 sts.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sts evenly around each rnd until there are 280 sts.
Next row: 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Join Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS of Front and Back tog, join MC with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each st around, insert pillow form at halfway point and cont to end of rnd. Break MC. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 4. 2 tr in same sp as sl st (counts as 3 tr). Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. *Skip next 3 st. (3 tr. Ch 2. 3 tr) in next sc – Shell made. Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. 3 tr in first sc. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. Fasten off.
Tassels: (make 16 each with A and B). Wrap yarn around 2½" [6 cm] piece of cardboard 20 times. Tie securely at one end. Do not cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1" [2.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach Tassels alternating colors A and B at ch-2 sp of each Shell in final edging rnd.
Button Cover (make 2)
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Insert button.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely around button. Sew covered buttons into place through entire thickness of Pillow as shown in picture, centering 1 button on Back and 1 button on Front.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Cream (06003) 2 balls or 530 yds/485 m
Bernat® Maker Minis™ Set includes 10 balls (1.76 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), (61 yds/56 m each; 610 yds/560 m total) Classic (53001)
Contrast A Hyacinth 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast B Orange 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast C Sky Blue 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast D Pink 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast E Green 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast F Yellow 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Note: Pillow is made in 2 flat pieces and then seamed around pillow form.
FRONT and BACK (make alike) 
With MC, ch 60.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal "bump" at back of each ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 59 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Cross Stitch Embroidery: 
Measure approx 4¼" [11 cm] down from top of Front and mark center st. Line up marked st with center st of chart (see page 2) and work cross st embroidery using A, B, C, D, E and F yarn. Each square of chart represents 1 sc.
Joining Front and Back: With MC and WS facing, sew 3 sides tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side closed.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A and 312 Black B
12” long x 16” wide (30.5 x 40.5 cm) pillow form
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pillow measures 12” long x 16” wide (30.5 x 40.5 cm)
gauge: 3 repeats = 3½” (9 cm) across widest points in pillow pattern; 6 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Here’s the perfect gift for mustache lovers! This crocheted pillow fits into any décor and can be created without a huge investment in time.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3—9 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—10 sc.
Row 7: Repeat Row 4.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc—9 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—10 sc.
Rows 10-14: Repeat Rows 8 and 4 twice, then repeat Row 4 once more—8 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, sc2tog, turn—7 sc.
Rows 16 and 17: Repeat Rows 8 and 4 once—6 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, 2sc2tog, turn—5 sc.
Row 19: Repeat Row 8—4 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, turn. 
Rows 22 and 23: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 once.
Row 24: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc3tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 25: Ch 1, sc2tog, 2 sc in next sc, turn.
Row 26: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 27: Ch 1, slip st in first 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—2 sc.
Row 28: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, slip st in last sc, turn.
Row 29: Ch 1, skip first sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn.
Round 30: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around mustache; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

PILLOW 
Side (make 2) 
With A, ch 40.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), *skip next 3 ch, (sc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch; repeat from * to last 4 ch, skip next 3 ch, sc in last ch, turn—9 sc and 8 ch-3 sps. 
Rows 2–24: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, *skip next 3 dc, (sc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to beginning ch-3, sc in top of beginning ch-3, turn.
Row 25: Ch 3, dc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last 2 sts, dc in next dc, dc in top of beginning ch-3, turn.
Round 26: Ch 1, 3 sc in first st, *working across long side, sc 46 sts evenly spaced to last sc, 3 sc in last st, working across ends of rows of short side, sc 33 sts evenly spaced to last row,* 3 sc in last row; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first sc.

MUSTACHE 
First Half
With B, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in remaining 3 sc, turn—5 sc.

Second Half
Repeat Rows 1-28. 
Row 29: Ch 1, skip first sc, 2 sc in last sc, do not turn.
Round 30: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around mustache; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Using photograph as a guide, sew mustache halves in place on right side of one pillow side. With wrong sides of pillow sides held together, join A with slip st to inner loops of any pair of corner sts in Round 26. Working through inner loops only, sc in each st around 3 sides. Insert pillow form and sc in remaining sts; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Working through both layers of sides around base of Round 26, embroider with back st around pillow form. Secure last stitch and weave in remaining ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Bulky® (3.5 oz/100 g; 78 yds/71 m) Med Gray Heather (89044) 7 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 9 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Crunch St Pat.
instructions:
Back and Front (make 2 pieces alike)
Chain (Ch) 45.
