1st row: [Wrong Side (WS)]. Slip stitch (sl st) in 2nd ch from hook. *1 half double crochet (hdc) in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Repeat (Rep) from * to last ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn. 44 stitches (sts).
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first hdc. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last sl st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row for Crunch St Pattern (pat) until work from beginning (beg) measures 20" [51 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back facing each other, sew 3 sides of Front and Back together (tog) leaving foundation ch edge open. Sew foundation ch edge tog, leaving center 16" [41 cm] of seam open to insert pillow form. Button Loops: Place markers for 5 loops evenly spaced along open edge of Front. Join yarn with sl st at marker. Ch 8. Join with sl st back into same space as joining sl st. Fasten off. Sew on buttons along open edge of Back to correspond to loops. Insert pillow form.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed with new color.
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 15 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 32 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc) 15 times. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: With C, as 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. (1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 2 dc in next sc) 15 times. Join D with sl st to top of ch 3. 64 dc.
7th rnd: With D, as 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc) 15 times. Join E with sl st to top of ch 3. 80 dc.
9th rnd: With E, as 3rd rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 2 dc in next sc. (1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 2 dc in next sc) 15 times. Join F with sl st to top of ch 3. 96 dc.
11th rnd: With F, as 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc) 15 times. Join G with sl st to top of ch 3. 112 dc.
13th rnd: With G, as 3rd rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. 2 dc in next sc. (1 dc in each of next 6 sc. 2 dc in next sc) 15 times. Join H with sl st to top of ch 3. 128 dc.
15th rnd: With H, as 3rd rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Note: Insert pillow form at half-way point of joining Front and Back.
Join Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join H with sl st to any dc. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Working from left to right instead of from right to left, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Reverse Sc

materials: Bernat® Blanket Tie Dye-ish™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Tropical Sea (60008) 5 7 balls
Bernat® Sheepy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 149 yds/136 m) Contrast B Cotton Tail (43001) 2 3 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: S  24" [61 cm] square. M  36" [91.5 cm] square.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of Bernat® Blanket Tie Dye-ish™ held tog. 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of Bernat® Sheepy™ held tog.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes.
Notes: 
• All pieces of Base and Pocket are worked with 2 strands tog throughout. 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Top and Bottom Base (make alike)
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 43 (64). 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 42 (63) sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 24 (36)" [61 (91.5) cm]. 
Fasten off.
Side of Base
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 8. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures length to fit around ether Top or Bottom Base. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
With RS facing to each other, join foundation chain and last row tog with sc.

Pocket 
With 2 strands of B held tog, ch 49 (73). 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 48 (73) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 63 (95) hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 17 (28)" [43 (71) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Join Bottom Base and Side of Base
With WS facing each other, pin Side around Bottom Base edge, aligning seam at any corner. Join 1 strand of A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc around Bottom Base. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join Top Base, Side and Pocket
Cut 4 or 5 layers of quilt batting to measure 1/3" [1 cm] less than outer measurement of Top Base. 
Place WS of Bottom Base/Side and Top Base pieces tog with quilt batting between pieces and pin tog. Pin Pocket to Top Base. Join 2 strands of B with sl st in any corner. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work in sc around Top Base and Pocket. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch inserting hook from back to front to back. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch inserting hook from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
To change colors, work to last loops on hook. Drop previous color from hook, draw new color through rem loops and proceed.
Carry colors when not in use loosely up side of work.
With A and larger hook, ch 55.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 54 sc.
2nd row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 dc in each sc across to last sc. 1 hdc in last dc. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat 9 times more. (42 rows in total). Fasten off A. Do not fasten off B.
Change to smaller hook and cont as follows for edging:
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. Work 3 sc in first hdc, 1 sc in each of next 52 sts, 3 sc in last st, 50 sc evenly down side of Pillow, 3 sc in corner, 1 sc in each of next 52 sts across foundation row, 3 sc in corner and 50 sc evenly up side of Pillow. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in each corner sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of pieces facing each other, sew Front and Back tog leaving one side open to insert pillow form. Insert pillow form. Sew side closed.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (00319) 2 balls or 625 yds/572 m
Contrast B Soft White (00316) 2 balls or 429 yds/392 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below
instructions:
FRONT
Notes:
• To change color, work to last loop on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through loop, tighten previous color and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work unless otherwise stated.
• Each skipped sc has chain space worked above it for 2 rows. (You will chain 1 more stitch than the number of stitches you will be skipping. For example, if you skip 1 stitch, you will chain 2 (counts as 1 st); if you skip 2 stitches, you will chain 3; etc. Each chain space counts as the number of sts you skipped).
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row.
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. The chain-spaces sit behind Mosaic Dc.
With A, ch 78. See diagram on page 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 77 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 22 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of last 21 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 22 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 27 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 22 sts. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 22 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 22 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 23 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 29 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 23 sts. Join B. Turn.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 20 sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 23 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 20 sts. Join A. Turn.
9th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of last 20 sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 21 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 25 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 21 sts. Join B. Turn.
11th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 4. Skip next 3 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 4. Skip next 3 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 18 sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 4. Skip next ch-4. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 19 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 4. Skip next ch-4. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 18 sts. Join A. Turn.
13th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 Mosaic Dc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 Mosaic Dc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of last 18 sc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 19 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 21 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of last 19 sts. Join B. Turn.
15th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 16 sc. Turn.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Join A. Turn.
17th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 16 sts. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Join B. Turn.
19th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Turn.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in next st. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Join A. Turn.
21st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sc. *1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 Mosaic Dc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. (1 Mosaic Dc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join B. Turn.
23rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn.

60th row: As 4th row.
61st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 22 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of last 22 sc. Turn.
62nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
BACK (make 2)
Notes:
• To change color, work to last loop on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through loop, tighten previous color and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work
Ribbing: With A, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 49 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join A. Turn.
5th and 6th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from marker measures 14½" [37 cm] ending on a 6th row. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with Ribbing sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With WS tog, join A with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner.
Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Stripes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Big Sky Country (76024) 8 balls or 1744 yds/1596 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 queen size bed pillows 20 x 26" [51 x 66 cm].
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
Ch 48. See diagram on page 2.
Bottom Section: 1st row: (RS). 
1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Sc3tog, 
inserting hook first into same ch 
as previous sc, then into each of 
next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting 
hook first into same ch as last leg 
of previous sc3tog, then into each 
of next 2 ch. Rep from * to last ch.  
1 sc in same ch as last leg of  
previous sc3tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.  
Sc3tog, inserting hook first into 
same place as previous sc, then 
into top of next sc3tog, then 
into next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Sc3tog,  
inserting hook first into same 
place as last leg of previous  
sc3tog, then into top of next  
sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. Rep 
from * to end of row, working 3rd 
leg of last sc3tog into last sc. 1 sc 
in same sc as last leg of last sc3tog. 
Turn.
Rep 2nd row for Trinity Stitch Pat. 
Cont in pat until work from beg 
measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a 
WS row. Do not fasten off.
First Middle Section: 
**Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each 
st and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn. 
Place marker at end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Next row:  1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog, 
inserting hook first into same st 
as previous sc, then into each of 
next 2 sc. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting 
hook first into same sc as last leg 
of previous sc3tog, then into each 
of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc.  
1 sc in same sc as last leg of  
previous sc3tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.  
Sc3tog, inserting hook first into 
same place as previous sc, then into 
top of next sc3tog, then into next 
ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting  
hook first into same place as  
previous sc, then into top of next 
sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. Rep 
from * to end of row, working 3rd 
leg of last sc3tog into last sc. 1 sc 
in same sp as last leg of last sc3tog. 
Turn. 
Rep 2nd row for Trinity Stitch Pat. 
Cont in pat until same number of 
rows as Bottom Section have been 
worked, ending on a WS row.**
Second Middle Section: Work 
from ** to ** as given for First  
Middle Section. 
Upper Section: Work from ** to ** 
as given for First Middle Section. 
Fasten off.  
Create pillow dividers: Place 
Front and Back tog with WS facing  
each other and edges aligned. 
With Front facing, join yarn with 
sl st at edge of work at 1st marked 
row (between Bottom and Middle 
Sections). Join Front to Back along 
marked row using sl st through 
both thicknesses . Rep for 2nd and 
3rd marked rows (between 2  
Middle Sections and Top Sections). 
Join edges: With RS of Front  
facing, join yarn with sl st through 
both thicknesses at any corner.   
Ch 1. Working through both  
thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly 
around entire edge, having 3 sc in 
each corner and inserting pillows  
in Upper, 2 Middle and Lower  
Sections before joining last edge. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1001 White A, 1562 Jadite B
one 12” x 16” (30.5 x 40.5 cm) pillow form
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pillow measures 16” wide x 13” long (40.5 x 33 cm)
gauge: 19 sc = 4” (10 cm) in ripple pattern; 8 rows = 5” (12.5 cm), measured from top to bottom of a peak. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 78.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, [sc in next 8 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 8 ch, 3 sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in next 8 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 8 ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—77 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, [sc in next 8 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, 3 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 8 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to 2nd color.
Rows 5–8: Repeat Row 2; change to A at end of Row 8.
Rows 9–12: Repeat Row 2; change to 2nd color at end of Row 12.
Rows 13–60: Repeat Rows 5–12 six times.
Rows 61–64: Repeat Rows 5–8 once more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides held together, whipstitch first and last rows together. Whipstitch one side edge closed, matching same color rows. Turn right side out, insert pillow. Whipstitch 2nd side closed, matching same color rows. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 4313 Aran Fleck A, 334 Buff B, 360 Café C, and 656 Real Teal D.
abbreviations: A, B, etc. = color A, B, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Small square = 7” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Side 1-Small Square (Make 4)
Increase Rows
Row 1 (Right Side): With larger hook and A ch 6; dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 2 ch; turn – 1 segment.
Row 2: Ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 2 ch, (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in ch-3 space of Row 1; turn – 2 segments.
Row 3: Ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 2 ch, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in ch-3 space of last row] twice; turn – 3 segments. Fasten off.
Row 4: Attach color B in top of last dc made; ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 2 ch, * (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across; turn – 4 segments.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 2 ch, * (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across; turn – 6 segments at end of Row 6. Fasten off.
Rows 7, 8 and 9: Repeat Rows 4-7 with C, increasing one segment each row – 9 segments at end of Row 9. Fasten off.
Decrease Rows
Row 10: Attach D in ch-space of last segment made; (ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-3 space, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space] 7 times, slip st in next ch-3 space; turn – 8 segments.
Row 11: Slip st across first 3 dc, * (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last ch-3 space; slip st in last ch-3 space; turn – 7 segments.
Rows 12-17: Repeat Row 11, decreasing one segment each row – 1 segment at end of Row 17. Fasten off.
Side 2-Small Square (Make 4)
Work Rows 1-17 same as Side 1 in the following color sequence: Rows 1-3: C; Rows 4-6: B; Rows 7-9: A; Rows 10-17: D.
ASSEMBLY
Lay Side 1 squares down, right sides up, to form a larger square with D at the outer four corners; sew together. Weave in ends.
Lay Side 2 squares down, right sides up, to form a larger square with D at the outer four corners; sew together. Weave in ends.
Edging
Rnd 1: Hold the 2 large squares with wrong sides together; with smaller hook attach D at a corner; working through both layers, ch 1, work sc evenly around 3 sides, working 3 sc in each corner, insert pillow form, complete working across last side; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, working from left to right, work Reverse sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Stripes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Sand Dunes (76022) 5 balls or 1016 yds/929 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Sand (10014) 3 balls or 564 yds/515 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket Stripes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Seaglass (60009) 5 balls or 944 yds/863 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Pale Gray (10046) 4 balls or 734 yds/671 g
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
3 standard size pillows 20 x 26” [51 x 66 cm].
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Both Versions:
FRONT AND BACK  (make 2 alike)
With larger hook and A, ch 48.
Bottom Section: 1st row:  (RS).
1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same ch as previous sc, then into each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same ch as last leg of previous sc3tog, then into each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. 1 sc in same ch as last leg of previous sc3tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same place as previous sc, then into top of next sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same place as last leg of previous sc3tog, then into top of next sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row, working 3rd leg of last sc3tog into last sc. 1 sc in same sc
Rep 2nd row for Trinity Stitch Pat. (See diagram).
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Middle Section: Next row:  Ch1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same st as previous sc, then into each of next 2 sc. *Ch1. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same sc as last leg of previous sc3tog, then into each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in same sc as last leg of previous sc3tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same place as previous sc, then into top of next sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, inserting hook first into same place as previous sc, then into top of next sc3tog, then into next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row, working 3rd leg of last sc3tog into last sc. 1 sc in same sp as last leg of last sc3tog. Turn.
Rep last row for Trinity Stitch Pat.
Cont in pat until same number of rows as Bottom Section has been worked, ending on a WS row.
Break A. Join B.
Next row: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Upper Section: Cont even in sc until work from last marker measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Create pillow dividers: Place Front and Back tog with WS facing each other and edges aligned. With Front facing and larger hook, join A with sl st at edge of work at 1st marked row (between Bottom and Middle Sections). Join Front to Back along marked row using sl st through both thicknesses. Rep for 2nd marked row (between Middle and Top Sections).
Join edges:  With Front facing and larger hook, join B with sl st through both thicknesses at 2nd marked row (between Middle and Top Sections).
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, (work sc evenly to corner. 3 sc in corner) twice.
Insert pillow form in Upper Section. Work sc evenly to same marked row as last sl st. Join A. Break B. With A, cont working sc through both thickness around entire edge, having 3 sc in each corner and inserting pillow forms in Middle and Lower Sections before joining last edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Lion Version only:
Mane
With RS facing and larger hook, join A with sl st to back loop only of first sc of "Join edges".
Fringe row: (RS). Ch 1. *Sl st in back loop only of next sc. Draw up a loop 10" [25.5 cm] long. Twist loop 25 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself. Rep from * around entire Upper section, ending at color change of "Join edges". Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
Inner Ear: With smaller hook and medium brown section of A yarn, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. 1 hdc. 3 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) all in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. 2 sc in next dc. 3 sc in next dc. 2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Fasten off.
Outer Ear: With B, work as for Inner Ear.
Join Ears:  With WS facing each other, place Inner and Outer Ears tog. With Inner Ear facing and smaller hook, join B with sl st to first sc.
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. Working into back loops only of Inner Ear and both loops of Outer Ear, 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Do not turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Tail
Note: Tail is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds. Place marker at beg of rnd and move marker up each subsequent rnd.
With smaller hook and B, ch 16. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Next rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 15" [38 cm].
Next rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm].
Next rnd:  *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 4 sc. Fasten off.
Tassel:  Wind A around a piece of cardboard 8" [20.5 cm] wide 20 times. Tie through loops securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around Tassel 2" [5 cm] down from tied end. Fasten securely. Sew Tassel to end of Tail.
Nose
With smaller hook and dark brown section of A yarn, ch 2.
1st rnd:  (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) 3 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Finishing:  Sew Ears, Nose and Tail to Pillow as seen in picture. With dark brown section of A yarn, embroider eyes and mouth with chain st embroidery as seen in picture.
Elephant Version only:
Ears (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.

pattern_name: Round and Round Crochet Slip Stitch Pouf
materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick Celeste™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 65 yds/59 m)
Orion Green (14010) 2 balls or 96 yds/87 m
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Two 20" [51 cm] diameter round pillow form.
abbreviations: Sl sttbl = Slip stitch through back loop
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] diameter, including thickness of fabric and edging.
gauge: 2 sc and 2 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 3 sl stbl and 5 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Work in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

TOP AND BOTTOM (make alike)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: (Sl stbl) twice in each sc around. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: *(Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
4th rnd: *Sl stbl in next st. (Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in next st. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
5th rnd: *(Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 40 sts.
6th rnd: *Sl stbl in each of next 2 sts. (Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th to 14th rnds: Sl stbl in each st around.
Cut yarn, leaving end approximately 4" [10 cm]. Pull end through loop to fasten off.


FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: (RS). With WS of Front and Back facing each other, working through back loops of both thicknesses of Front and Back, join yarn with sl st. Working through back loops only, work sl st around edge of Pouf, inserting 2 pillow forms at halfway point and cont around to end. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge Fur™ (7 oz/200 g; 260 yds/238 m) Slate Blue (0807) 2 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Notes:
• Place marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
• Cushion is stuffed with larger diameter pillow form to create a sturdier cushion.
• Pattern calls for 4 ties to secure cushion to top of stool. If your stool has a different leg configuration than shown in photo you may need to adjust the number and spacing of ties.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Top and Bottom (make 2)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
Cont in this manner inc 6 sts evenly each rnd until diameter of work measures 14" [35.5 cm] across widest measurement. PM at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marker measures 1" [2.5 cm].
Fasten off.
Ties (make 4)
Ch 40.
Fasten off.
Adding Ties: With RS of Bottom facing, taking one Tie, fold in half and knot through any sc along marked rnd. Rep for rem 3 ties, ensuring ties are spaced evenly around cushion along marked rnd.
Seaming: With WS of Top and Bottom facing each other and final rnds aligned, join yarn with sl st through both thicknesses to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around, stuffing cushion as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Sewing needle and matching sewing thread
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Each Motif = 4¾” x 4¾”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FIRST MOTIF
With Color 1, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 12 dc. Fasten off Color 1, join A between first and last dc of round 1.
Round 2: With Color 2, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc between next 2 dc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 24 dc. Fasten off Color 2, join Color 3 between first and last dc of round 2.
Round 3: With Color 3, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, *skip next 2 dc, 3 dc between last skipped and next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch 4 – 36 dc. Fasten off Color 3, join Color 4 between first and last dc of round 2.
Round 4: With Color 4, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, *[ch 1, skip next 3 dc, 2 dc between last skipped and next dc] twice, ch 1, skip next 3 dc, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) between last skipped and next dc; repeat from * twice; repeat from * to ** once join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 4 corner ch-1 spaces; 9 dc and 3 ch-1 spaces on each side. Fasten off. 

SECOND MOTIF (joining across one side)
Work same as First Motif joining to previous motif(s) while completing round 4 by replacing ch-1 spaces on side to be joined with sc in corresponding ch-1 space(s) on preceding motif(s), following assembly diagram for placement. Fasten off.

BORDER
Round 1: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-1 space, ch 1, *2 sc in corner ch-1 space, sc in each st and space across; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc – 56 sc on each side.
Round 2: Ch 1, *2 sc in sc, sc in each sc to next corner; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc to next corner; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
With sewing needle and matching thread, sew pillow cover to top of pillow.

materials: 3 balls STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Full o’ Sheep™” in 2260 Clementine A
1 ball each of 2925 Passion fruit B, 2205 Little Lamb C, and 2012 Black Sheep D
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = color A, B, C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Pillow measures 14” wide x 10” high after felting.
gauge: 10 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Body (Make 1)
Round 1: With A, ch 3, 7 hdc into 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch – 8 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, 2 hdc in each hdc around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 7 times; join – 24 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 7 times; join – 24 sts.
Continue to increase 8 sts every round working one more hdc between each of the 8 increases until the circle measures 20” across. Fasten off leaving 36” long yarn tail.
Wings (Make 2)
Round 1: With B, ch 20; 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next 16 ch, 4 hdc in last ch, working on opposite side of beginning ch, hdc in next 16 ch; join – 40 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, 2 hdc in next 3 hdc, hdc in next 16 hdc, 2 hdc in next 4 hdc, hdc in next 16 hdc; join – 48 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, * [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next hdc] 3 times, 2 hdc in next hdc *, hdc in next 17 hdc; repeat from * to *; hdc in next 16 hdc; join – 56 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, * [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc] 3 times, 2 hdc in next hdc *, hdc in next 18 hdc; repeat from * to *; hdc in next 16 hdc; join – 64 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 hdc, * [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc] 3 times, 2 hdc in next hdc *, hdc in next 19 hdc; repeat from * to *; hdc in next 16 hdc; join – 72 sts.
Continue to increase 8 sts every round as established every round for 5 more rounds – 112 sts. Fasten off leaving 36” long yarn tail.
Eyes (Make 2)
Round 1: With C, ch 3, 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch – 8 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, 2 hdc in next 2 hdc, (hdc, dc, tr, dc, hdc) all in next hdc, 2 hdc in next 3 hdc, (hdc, dc, tr, dc, hdc) all in next hdc; join. Fasten off leaving 18” long yarn tail.
Beak (Make 1)
Row 1: With D, ch 3, 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; turn – 4 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, 2 hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in top of beginning ch; turn – 8 sts.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, 2 hdc in each hdc across and in top of ch-2; turn – 32 sts at end of Row 4. Fasten off leaving 18” long yarn tail.
Assembly
Fold body circle in half. Sew beak to one end. Arrange eyes and wings to be symmetrical on each side (front and back) of body. Sew each piece down to circle. Tack wings in several places to hold them snuggly against the body. With D, embroider pupils on eyes. Fold batting in several layers to fill bird shape. Cut to correct shape. Slip st around edge of body to close pillow, adding more stuffing to corners and edges. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.
Felting
Place assembled pillow in washing machine with old towels or jeans. Use hot water, detergent and longest wash cycle. Check felting progress frequently. When felted as desired, remove from washer and rinse in sink. Squeeze out excess water. Pull and stretch to desired shape, tugging at batting to even out filling. Allow to dry in warm draft for a day or two. With C, embroider dots on wings.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 4 skeins each 1502 Iced Aqua A and 1932 Minty B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Pillow measures 20" wide x 24" long (51 x 61 cm).
gauge: 4 pattern repeats = 4" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one slip stitch and one half double crochet); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm) in slip stitch and half double crochet; 9 dc = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 5" (12.5 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Pillow cover is made of one long panel, folded and seamed.
2. Hold 2 strands of yarn together throughout.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Fasten off old color.
Special Technique
Join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.
PILLOW Cover
With 2 strands of A held together, loosely ch 45.
Row 1 (right side): (Slip st, hdc) in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—44 hdc.
Row 2: (Slip st, hdc) in each hdc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 24" (61 cm) long, changing color to 2 strands of B in last row.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn—44 dc.
Repeat last row until piece measures 47" (119.5 cm).
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold cover in half widthwise. With wrong sides held together, working through both thicknesses, and holding 2 strands together, sc join B in end of top row, sc in end of each row across to fold. Fasten off. Repeat for 2nd side edge. Weave in ends. Insert pillow form. Sew buttons evenly spaced across A-colored top edge, using spaces between dc as buttonholes or place buttons on B-color top edge and sew through both thicknesses to permanently close cover.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 236 yd (215 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1001 White A and 1 skein 1909 Holly Berry B
RED HEART® Soft®: 2 balls 4600 White A and 1 ball 5142 Cherry Red B
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 20 sts = 7 inches (18 cm); 22 rows= 7 inches (18 cm); in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW (make 40 with A, make 10 with B)
Ch 10. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—9 sc. 
Rows 2-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using whipstitch and following diagram, sew 25 squares together for each side of pillow.
With wrong sides together, A, and using whipstitch, seam pillow together along 3 sides. Weave in ends. Insert pillow form; sew remaining side.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 360 Café Latte A
RED HEART® Boutique Fleecy™: 1 ball 9969 Leopard B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.5mm [US E-4] and 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Pillow measures 16” (40.5 cm) diameter including ruffle.
gauge: Rounds 1–9 = 4” (10 cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Side (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in back bar of ch; do not join—6 sts. Place marker for beginning of round and move as instructed.
Round 2: Sc in marked st, [2 sc in next st] 5 times—11 sts.
Round 3: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, [2 sc in next st] 5 times—12 sts.
Round 4: Sc in marked st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—18 sts.
Round 5: Sc in marked st, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times—23 sts.
Round 6: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times—24 sts.
Round 7: Sc in marked st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—30 sts.
Round 8: Sc in marked st, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times—35 sts.
Round 9: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times—36 sts.
Round 10: Sc in marked st, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—42 sts.
Round 11: Sc in marked st, sc in next 6 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 5 times—47 sts.
Round 12: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 6 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 5 times—48 sts.
Round 13: Sc in marked st, sc in next 7 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—54 sts.
Round 14: Sc in marked st, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 5 times—59 sts.
Round 15: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 5 times—60 sts.
Round 16: Sc in marked st, sc in next 9 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—66 sts.
Round 17: Sc in marked st, sc in next 10 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 5 times—71 sts.
Round 18: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 10 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 5 times—72 sts.
Round 19: Sc in marked st, sc in next 11 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—78 sts.
Round 20: Sc in marked st, sc in next 12 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 5 times—83 sts.
Round 21: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 12 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 5 times—84 sts.
Round 22: Sc in marked st, sc in next 13 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—90 sts.
Round 23: Sc in marked st, sc in next 14 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 14 sts] 5 times—95 sts.
Round 24: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 14 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 14 sts] 5 times—96 sts.
Round 25: Sc in marked st, sc in next 15 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 15 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—102 sts.
Round 26: Sc in marked st, sc in next 16 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 sts] 5 times—107 sts.
Round 27: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 16 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 sts] 5 times—108 sts.
Round 28: Sc in marked st, sc in next 17 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 17 sts] 5 times, sc in same marked st as first sc, place marker in first st made—114 sts.
Round 29: Sc in marked st, sc in next 18 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 18 sts] 5 times—119 sts.
Round 30: Working in sts 2 rounds below, 2 sc in marked st, place marker in first st made, sc in next 18 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 18 sts] 5 times—120 sts.
Round 31: Sc in marked st and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With sewing needle and thread, sew a few stitches from front to back through center of pillow form to make a small indentation.
With wrong sides of pillow sides held together, whipstitch together through inner loops of stitches (back loop of front side and front loop of back side) halfway around, insert pillow form, and whipstitch remaining stitches together. Weave in ends.
Buttons (make 2)
Cut a 1½” (4 cm) length of B and remove all threads and loops. Following package directions, cut this piece to necessary size and snap in place in button form.
Sewing through indentation at center of Round 1, attach buttons to each side of pillow.
Ruffle (work 2 – 1 on each side)
With loop edge up, hold first hole of B in front of 2nd hole. Work first stitch through both “thicknesses”.
Round 1: With smaller hook and working in unused loops of last round, insert hook in any st of A, insert hook from front to back in first hole of B, draw top strand through st (first ruf slip st made), ruf ch 1, *ruf slip st in next st of A, ruf ch 1; repeat from * around to last st of A; skip next 2 holes of B and cut fabric, with last hole held in front of next-to-last hole and working through both “thicknesses”, ruf slip st in last st of A, pulling B loop up to longest length possible. Remove hook from loop; with sewing needle and thread, sew first and last loops of B together.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Malachite (10802) or Lapis (10800) or Scarlet (10810) 2 balls or 440 yds/402 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 8½ sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Pillow Front
Note: Tr sts worked on WS will push towards RS of work to form bobbles.
Ch 36.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th and 5th rows:  Rep 2nd and 3rd rows.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th to 17th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows once more, then rep 2nd to 7th rows once.
Fasten off.
Fringe Strips (make 2)
Ch 36.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. *Sl st in next sc. Draw up a loop 10" [25.5 cm] long. Twist loop 25 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Pillow Back (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 35 sc along side of ribbing. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
FINISHING
Sew Fringe Strips to Front of Pillow, below 1st and 2nd textured areas, as shown in photo. Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Chocolate (9750) 2 balls or 371 yds/340 m
Contrast B White (9701) 1 ball or 75 yds/69 m
Contrast C Red (9729) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Ch 1 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
FRONT 
**With A, ch 32. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 30 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 32 hdc.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 4th rows 6 times more, ending on a 4th row. 44 hdc. Place marker at end of last row.**

ROOF
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. Working into back loops only, Hdc2tog over first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 42 sts.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last 4 rows, dec 2 sts at each end of every row and working every 4th row into back loops to 4 sts. 
Last row:  (RS). Working into back loops only , ch 1. (Hdc2tog) twice. 
Fasten off.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front.

Roof
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Hdc2tog over first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 42 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last row, dec 2 sts at each end of every row to 4 sts. 
Last row:  (RS). Ch 1. (Hdc2tog) twice. 
Fasten off.
FRONT ONLY
Roof Snow
With RS of Front facing, turn piece with Roof tip pointing towards you (marked row of Roof will be at top). Join B with sl st to rem (front) loop of first hdc of marked row (before Roof shaping).
1st row: (RS). Working in rem loops of row, *Skip next hdc. 5 dc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row, ending with sl st in last st. Fasten off.
Rep on rem rows worked in back loop only (6 rows of ‘Snow’ in total).

GUSSET
With A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Pillow. 
Fasten off.

DOOR
With B, ch 9. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
3rd and 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: As 2nd row. 12 sc.
6th to 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
14th to 16th rows:  As 13th row. 4 sts at end of 16th row.
Fasten off.

With RS facing, join B with sl st to Door at bottom right. Ch 1. Work 16 sc up side edge to top (1 sc into side of each row). Work 1 sc in each of top 4 sts. Work 16 sc down left side of Door. 36 sc.
Fasten off.

Door Candy Trim
With RS facing, join C with sl st to first sc. Ch 3. Remove hook and pull loop to make it larger so it will not unravel. Join B with sl st to next sc. With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 3. *Make loop larger and remove hook. Insert hook into A loop. Bring ch-3 to front over ch-3 of B just worked. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Remove hook from A and insert into B loop. With B, bring ch-3 to front over ch-3 of A just worked. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last sc. Fasten off both A and B.

Sew Door to Front in center, aligning bottoms.

Candy Canes (Make 2)
With C, ch 21.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. Remove hook and pull loop to make it larger so it will not unravel. Join B with sl st to next ch. With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 3. *Make loop larger and remove hook. Insert hook into A loop. Bring ch-3 to front over ch-3 of B just worked. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Remove hook from A and insert into B loop. With B, bring ch-3 to front over ch-3 of A just worked. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch. Fasten off both A and B.
Sew Candy Canes to Front as shown in photo, curving pieces into shape at top.

FINISHING
With WS of Front and Gusset tog, join B with sl st to bottom right corner. 
Join Gusset: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sl st evenly around all edges of Front and Gusset, working through both thicknesses to join. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Rep for Back, stopping approx 8" [20.5 cm] from beg of rnd. Stuff Pillow evenly, being sure to get all corners.
Cont joining Back and Gusset with sl st to end of rnd. Join with sl st. Fasten off.

Snow Edging
With Front facing, join B with sl st to sl st at beg of Roof shaping. Working into back loop of sl sts, *Skip next sl st. 5 hdc in next sl st. Skip next sl st. Sl st in next sl st. Rep from * up right side of Roof and down to beg of Roof shaping on left side. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (197 g/7 oz; 389 m/426 yds)
1¼" [3 cm] button with shank (to be covered for ‘nose’)
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide x 13" [33 cm] high.
instructions:
Note: The friendly fox’s snout lifts up and there is a special opening to tuck in your pjs!
FRONT
Top of Head and Snout
Snout: Beg at base of Snout, with A, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn.
3 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
5 sc.
6th to 9th rows: As 2nd row.
10th row: As 5th row. 7 sc.
11th and 12th rows: As 2nd row.
13th row: As 5th row. 9 sc.
14th to 16th rows: As 2nd row.
17th row: As 5th row. 11 sc.
18th to 20th rows: As 2nd row.
21st to 24th rows: As 5th row. 19 sc at end of 24th row. Fasten off and set aside to be joined to Sides later.
Right Side of Head
With A, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn.
5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn.
7 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Left Side of Head
Work as for Right side of Head, noting RS and WS are reversed. Do not fasten off.
Join Sides of Head to Snout: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc of Left side of Head. Ch 8. Work 1 sc in each of next 19 sc of Snout. Ch 8. Work 1 sc in each of next 8 sc of Right side of Head. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn.
51 sc. Place markers at each end of row.
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 43 sts at end of 6th row.
7th row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
8th to 13th rows: As 7th row. 15 sts rem at end of 13th row. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st at corner of Left Side of Head at side edge. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge of Top of Head and Snout, working 2 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Lower Section of Front
Beg at lower edge, with B, ch 30.
**1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 29 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 45 sc at end of 9th row.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
12th to 15th rows: As 10th and 11th rows twice more. 51 sc at end of 15th row.
16th to 32nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.** Place markers at each end of last row.
33rd to 35th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 45 sts rem at end of 35th row.
Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for edging: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down side of piece, across foundation ch and up opposite side. Fasten off.
BACK
Beg at lower edge, with A, ch 30.
Work from ** to ** as given for Lower Section of Face.
33rd to 36th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 43 sts rem at end of 36th row.
37th row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
38th to 43rd rows: As 37th row. 15 sts rem at end of 43rd row. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for edging: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge, working 2 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Front Ear (make 2): With C, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Edging: (RS). Join A with sl st at lower corner. Ch 1. Work 6 sc up side edge, 3 sc in point and 6 sc down opposite side edge. Fasten off.
Back Ear (make 2): With A only, work as given for Front Ear (including edging).
Join Front and Back Ears: Place WS of Front and Back Ears tog. With RS of Front Ear facing, join A with sl st through both thicknesses in first sc of edging. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc up side, 3 sc in point and 1 sc in each sc down opposite side. Working through both thicknesses, sl st across lower edge, then work 1 more row of sc up side, 3 sc in point and down opposite side to lower edge. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
**With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.**
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.
Nose Button Cover
Work from ** to ** as given for Eyes.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd. Fasten off.
Place button inside button cover. Stitch around cover opening, leaving shank free to attach to Pillow.
FINISHING
With RS of pieces facing, place Lower Section of Front Face under Top of Head and Snout, matching marked rows. Pin overlapping sections on each side to secure.
Join Back and Front: Place WS of Back against WS of Front Sections and match outer edges. With RS of Front facing, working through all thicknesses, join A with sl st in corner of Top of Head and Snout at side edge. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around outer edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With B, embroider lower section of eyes with satin stitch as shown in picture. Sew Ears and Eyes in position as shown in picture. 
Button loop: With RS facing, join A with sl st at side edge at base on ‘Snout’. Ch 9. Join with sl st at opposite side edge. Fasten off.
Mark position for button on Lower Front Section to correspond to button loop. Sew button in position.

materials: Peaches & Creme® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (11006) 2 balls or 239 yds/218 m
Contrast B Mint (11230) 1 ball or 46 yds/42 m
Contrast C Bright Orange (11628) 1 ball or 63 yds/57 m
Contrast D Pastel Pink (11421) 1 ball or 64 yds/59 m
Contrast E Bright Blue (11742) 1 ball or 75 yds/69 m
Contrast F Gold (11605) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast G Black Currant (11318) 1 ball or 29 yds/27 m
Contrast H Red (11095) 1 ball or 62 yds/57 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join each rnd with sl st to top
of beg ch-3.
• RS of work is facing when
working rnds.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 1 rnd.
With B, work 1 rnd.
With C, work 1 rnd.
With A, work 1 rnd.
With D, work 1 rnd.
With E, work 1 rnd.
With A, work 1 rnd.
With F, work 1 rnd.
With G, work 1 rnd.
With A, work 1 rnd.
With C, work 1 rnd.
With B, work 1 rnd.
With A, work 1 rnd.
With D, work 1 rnd.
With E, work 1 rnd.
With A, work 1 rnd.
With H, work 1 rnd.
These 17 rnds form Stripe Pat.

FRONT and BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 3. Join. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to end of rnd. Ch 1. Join. Fasten off.
First 4 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 4th rnd until all 17 rnds of Stripe Pat are worked, joining with A at end of last rnd. Do not fasten off.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, working 5 sc in each corner ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
Joining rnd: With WS facing tog, join A with sl st to any sc. Working through both thicknesses, and working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work reverse sc evenly around 3 sides having 3 sc in each corner sc. Insert pillow form. Work in reverse sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Kittens and Puppies for Sale Pillows
materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 2 skeins 1401 Pewter J
2 hanks black and 1 hank pink 6-strand embroidery floss
white carpet thread (optional for mouse whiskers)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Each pillow measures 16” x 16” (40.5 x 40.5 cm).
instructions:
Rows 2–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sc; change to J, sc in last 11 sc, turn.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc; change to first color, sc in last 8 sc, turn.
Rows 16 and 17: Repeat Rows 14 and 15.
Row 18: Repeat Row 14.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc; change to first color, sc next 3 sc; change to J, sc in next 2 sc; change to first color, sc in last 3 sc, turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc; change to J, sc in next 4 sc; change to first color, sc in next 2 sc; change to J, sc in last 11 sc, turn.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc; change to first color, sc in next sc; change to J, sc in next 6 sc; change to first color, sc in last sc. Fasten off first color, leaving a long tail for sewing. Cut J.
Back Side
With J, ch 58.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—57 sc.
Rows 2–63: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.
Mouse
With A, ch 27.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 9 ch; leave remaining ch unworked for tail, turn—11 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first st), dc in next 6 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in first st, sc in next 8 sts, hdc2tog—9 sts. Fasten off.
Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 3.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—6 hdc. Fasten off.
Special Stitch
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Special Technique
Join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.
Notes
1. Nine kitten and nine puppy motifs are made separately in squares and sewn together for fronts of pillows. J is the background color of all squares and remaining colors are each worked once (“first color”).
2. Cat applique is made separately and sewn to back of puppies pillow. Mouse applique is made separately and sewn to back of kittens pillow.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Drop old color but do not cut until instructed. Proceed with new color.
4. Use photograph as a guide for embroidery and placement of sewn-on pieces.
FREE KITTENS PILLOW
Front Side
Square (make 9 – 1 each in A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I)
With first color, ch 20.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—19 sc.
= 2” (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
FINISHING FOR KITTENS PILLOW
Faces
Thread embroidery floss onto needle and fold over to double the strands. With all 12 strands held together, embroider French knot eyes and nose. Sew one vertical straight stitch from nose and 2 stitches as an inverted “V” for mouth.
Mouse
With floss, embroider French knot eye and satin stitch nose.
Place mouse on back side. Tuck one ear between head and back side and place other ear slightly on top of head. Sew body and ears in place leaving top of ears and tail unsewn. Add strands of carpet thread as whiskers, if desired.
Weave in ends.
Pillow
Using assembly diagram as a guide and with right sides facing, sew squares together with ending tails for front side. Pull tails to wrong side of piece to minimize weaving in.
Joining Round: With wrong sides held together and working through both thicknesses, join J with sc in first st of top row, 2 sc in same st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; working across ends of rows, sc in each row to bottom row; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; insert pillow form; working across ends of rows, sc in each row to top row; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
PUPPIES FOR SALE PILLOW
Front Side
Square (make 9 – 1 each in A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I)
Rows 1–13: Work same as Rows 1–13 of squares of kittens pillow.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc; change to J, sc in last 9 sc, turn.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in next 9 sc; change to first color, sc in last 10 sc, turn.
Rows 16–19: Repeat Rows 14 and 15 twice; change to J in last st of Row 19, turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first sc; change to first color, sc in next 8 sc; change to J, sc in last 10 sc, turn.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc; change to first color, sc in next 6 sc; change to J, sc in last 2 sc. Fasten off J. Cut first color, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Ear (make 18 – 2 each in A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I)
Ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, 5 hdc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch—9 sts. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
Back Side
Work same as back side of kittens pillow.
Cat
With A, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—11 sc.
Rows 4–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 7–9: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—5 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * once, turn—7 sc.
Row 12: Repeat Row 2—9 sc.
Rows 13–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 16: Repeat Row 7—7 sc.
Row 17: *Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch*, skip first 2 sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * to * once, skip next 2 sc, slip st in last sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
Tail
With A, ch 30.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, [sc2tog] 5 times, sc in remaining ch—24 sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING FOR PUPPIES PILLOW
Faces
Embroider faces same as kittens pillow.
With pink floss, embroider satin stitches vertically for tongue.
Sew matching ears on Row 20 at 2nd and 9th stitches from edge.
Cat
Embroider eyes and nose same as kitten’s face. Embroider smile with back stitches.
Sew cat and tail on back of pillow.
Pillow
Follow assembly and joining directions same as kitten pillow.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Plus™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 78 yds/71 m) Pink Dusk (56005) 2 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes
Rounds are worked in continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rounds.
Front and Back (make alike)
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch-2 does not count as st).10 hdc. Do not join. 
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc (at back of work below loops normally worked – see diagram). Place marker on first of these 2 sts. 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below each hdc around. 20 hdc.
Note: WS of work is shown in diagram.
3rd rnd: Moving marker to first st of rnd, *2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. Rep from * around. 30 hdc.
Cont to move marker at beg of each rnd, proceed as follows: 
4th rnd: *2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. 40 hdc. 
5th rnd: *2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. 50 hdc. 
6th rnd: *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. 60 hdc. 
7th rnd: *2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. 70 hdc. 
8th rnd: *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. 80 hdc. 
9th row: 1 sc in first hdc. Sl st in next hdc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS tog (noting spiral ridge is on RS), join yarn with sl st to any st of last rnd through both thicknesses.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around inserting pillow form before completing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Holiday Yarn”: 4 balls 6060 Green/Green A
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
gauge: One ripple = 6½” wide; 6 rows = 3”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER (make 2)
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With A ch 72; sc in 2nd ch from hook, skip next ch, [sc in next 10 ch, 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 10 ch, skip next 2 ch] 2 times, sc in next 10 ch, 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 10 ch, skip next ch, sc in last ch; turn—3 ripples.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, [sc in next 10 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc, skip next 2 sc] 2 times, sc in next 10 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc, changing to B at end of Row 5; turn. Fasten off A.
Row 6: Ch 3, skip first 2 sc, *popcorn in next sc, ch 1, [skip next sc, popcorn in next sc, ch 1] 4 times, skip next sc, (popcorn, ch 1, popcorn) in next sc, ch 1, [skip next sc, popcorn in next sc, ch 1] 4 times, skip next sc, popcorn in next sc**, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * 2 more times, end at **, skip next sc, dc in last sc, changing to A; turn. Fasten off B.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *[sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next popcorn] 5 times, 3 sc in next ch-1 space, [sc in next popcorn, sc in next ch-1 space] 5 times**, skip next 2 popcorn; repeat from * 2 times, end at **, skip next popcorn, sc in top of beginning ch-3; turn.
Rows 8–11: Repeat Rows 2-5, changing to C at end of Row 11. Fasten off A.
Row 12: Repeat Row 6, changing to A at the end of row; turn. Fasten off C.
Row 13: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 14–84: Repeat Rows 2–13 five times, then repeat Rows 2–12. Fasten off C.
ASSEMBLY
Fold pillow cover in half, with right sides together, bringing first row up to meet last row. With A, whipstitch first row to last row. Flatten pillow so seam is centered on back. Whipstitch one side seam. Turn pillow cover right side out, insert pillow form, and whipstitch remaining side seam. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Contrast A Retro Stripes (4971) 3 balls or 635 yds/580 m
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 117 yds/107 m
Contrast C Black (0312) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 pair of nylon pantyhose/stockings for stuffing casings (this holds stuffing in place and makes sure stuffing does not show through crochet fabric)
Piece of cardboard, approx 5" x 7" [12.5 x 18 cm] for shoe sole inserts
