abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] diameter. Arms and Legs measure approx 15" [38 cm] long.
instructions: PILLOW FRONT AND BACK (Make 2 alike) See diagram on page 4. Note: Front and Back are worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds. Simply work directly into next stitch, noting marker to indicate end of rnd will move up each rnd. With A, ch 4. 1st rnd: 10 dc in 4th ch from hook. Place marker on first dc. Do not join. 2nd rnd: 2 dc in each dc around. 20 dc. 3rd rnd: *2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. 30 dc. 4th rnd: *2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. 40 dc. 5th rnd: *2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. 50 dc. 6th rnd: *2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. 60 dc. Cont as established, inc 10 dc every rnd for 10 more rnds. 160 dc. (Piece should measure approx 20" [51 cm] diameter when slightly stretched). Sl st in first dc at end of last rnd. Fasten off. MAKE LEG AND ARM CASINGS Stuff legs of pantyhose/stockings lightly to create 4 ‘casings’ approx 7" [18 cm] circumference x 15" [38 cm] long. Cut pantyhose/stockings and tie tightly at ends to close. You should be able to make 2 casings out of each pantyhose/stocking leg. LEGS (Make 2 alike) Note: Legs are worked from bottom up. Beg at Sole of Shoe: See diagram on page 5. **With B, ch 9. 1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 2 hdc in last ch (same ch as first hdc). Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 22 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 28 hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) twice. Join with sl st to first hdc. 34 hdc.** Sides: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: With B, as 2nd rnd. Fasten off. Toe: Join B with sl st to 11th sc of last rnd. Ch 10. Skip next 12 sc. Join with sl st in next sc. Sl st in last sc skipped (sc just before sl st join). Turn. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each ch of ch-10. Sl st in each of first 2 skipped sc of 11th rnd. Turn. 10 sc. 2nd row: Sc2tog over first 2 sc of Toe. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Sl st in each of last 2 skipped sc of 11th rnd. Turn. 8 sts. 3rd row: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Sl st in each of next 2 skipped sc of 11th rnd. Turn. 6 sts. 4th row: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Sl st in each of last 2 skipped sc of 11th rnd. 4 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Using tail end, sew last row of Toe to rem unworked sc of Side to close Toe. Shoe: Join C with sl st to first sc of 3rd rnd of Side. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Working in rem loop of Toe ch-10, 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc of 3rd rnd of Side. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 23 sts. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc at end of 7th rnd. Sock: 8th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 hdc in each sc around. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Fasten off. Side Emblem With B, ch 3. 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Pull tail to close ch and fasten securely. Fasten off. Sew Emblem to outside of Shoe as shown, being sure to make both a Left and a Right Shoe. Shoelaces With B, ch 70. Fasten off. ‘Lace’ through holes of sc at front of Shoe and tie in bow as shown. Trace Sole of Shoe onto piece of cardboard and place into Shoe to add structure and keep sole flat. Stuff Shoe. LEG See diagram on page 5. 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to first hdc at top of Sock. Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. PM on first st. Do not join. 22 sts. 2nd rnd: 1 hdc in each st around. Rep last rnd, working in a continuous spiral, until Leg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm]. Insert Leg casing, and continue to work in continuous spiral around casing, until Leg measures approx 15" [38 cm] from bottom of Shoe. Fasten off leaving a long tail at end of last row. **You may wait to insert casing if preferred, but it becomes increasingly difficult to get it into the Arm/Leg easily as the piece gets longer. (If casing needs more or less stuffing, make appropriate adjustments now). Fold top of Leg flat, with Shoe facing forward. Sew top of Leg closed with tail along last rnd. HANDS (Make 2) See diagram on page 6. Fingers (Make 4) With B, ch 3. 1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. PM on first hdc. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. 10 hdc. 2nd rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Working in continuous rnds, 1 hdc in each hdc around for a further 5 rnds. 7 rnds total. Sl st in first hdc and fasten off at end of 7th rnd for 3 Fingers, leaving a tail approx 4" [10 cm] long. Do not fasten off at end of 4th Finger. Join Fingers: 1st rnd: Work 1 hdc in first hdc. PM in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc of first finger. Work 1 hdc each of first 5 hdc of second finger. Work 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc of third finger. Work 1 hdc in all of 10 hdc of fourth finger. Working in rem hdc of each finger, work 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. 40 hdc. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. 2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. 4th rnd: *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * around. 36 sts. 5th rnd: 1 hdc in each st around. 6th rnd: *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. 30 sts. 7th rnd: As 5th rnd. 8th rnd: *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. 24 sts. 9th to 11th rnds: As 5th rnd. Break B, join A at end of 11th rnd. Stuff Fingers very lightly using lengths of B as stuffing. ARM With A, work in continuous rnds, 1 hdc in each hdc around until Arm measures approx 5" [12.5 cm]. Insert Arm casing (adding stuffing around casing to fill-out Hand) and continue to work in a continuous spiral around casing, until Arm measures approx 15" [38 cm]. Fasten off at end of last rnd leaving a long tail for seaming. (If casing needs more or less stuffing, make appropriate adjustments now). Fold top of Arm flat, with Hand facing forward. Sew top of Arm closed with tail along last rnd. EYES (Make 2) See diagrams on page 7. Work from ** to ** as given for Shoe Sole. Fasten off at end of last rnd leaving a long tail for seaming. Pupil With C, ch 7. 1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Working in rem loop of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 2 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using tail, sew Pupil to Eye at center bottom. SMILE See diagram on page 7. With C, ch 15. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Fasten off leaving a long tail. FINISHING Pin Eyes and Smile into place on Front. Sew into position using long tails from fasten off. Join Front and Back With WS tog, join A with sl st to any dc of last rnd. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses to join, work 1 sc in each dc around, stopping mid-way to insert pillow form and then completing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew Arms and Legs to Sides and Bottom. On Right Hand, fold first and last fingers towards center and secure by sewing through both fingers and attaching to palm to create a peace sign.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Contrast A Cream (06003) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
gauge: 9.5 splhdc and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pat. 10 sc and 11 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
FOOTSTOOL COVER
Notes:
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across WS top of row and work sts around it being sure to maintain gauge. Holding yarn to WS will keep colorwork on RS clean and help define the checkerboard effect.
SIDES 
Note: Make 5 pieces alike, noting bottom of Footstool Cover is left open.
With B, ch 35.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn. 34 sts.
Beg working Chart as follows:
Note: Each row begins with a ch 1, each square represents 1 splhdc, and 8-st rep will be worked 4 times. Also note that 8-row rep will be worked 4 times:
1st and 3rd rows:  With A, ch 1. 1 splhdc in first st. *With A, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. With B, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 splhdc in last st. Turn.
2nd and 4th rows:  With B, ch 1. 1 splhdc in first st. *With B, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. With A, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 splhdc in last st. Turn.
5th and 7th rows:  With B, ch 1. 1 splhdc in first st. *With B, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. With A, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 splhdc in last st. Turn.
6th and 8th rows:  With A, ch 1. 1 splhdc in first st. *With A, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. With B, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 splhdc in last st. Turn.
Rep 1st to 8th rows 3 times more. Chart is complete.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 splhdc in first st. *With B, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. With A, 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 splhdc in last st. Fasten off.
Blocking:  Pin pieces to 14” [35.5 cm] square. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
Joining: Place WS of Sides facing each other when joining. With RS facing and A, work 1 row of sc to join sides tog to form a cube with 1 open side. Make sure to keep cont of checkerboard pat, noting top will only align in checkerboard pat on 2 sides. Joining rows of sc will create ridges on RS.
Trim: With RS facing, join A with sl st in any st along open edge of Footstool Cover. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around bottom edge of Footstool Cover. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
POUCH
Note: Pouch is worked in 1 piece, then folded and seamed in Finishing.
With A, ch 16.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 24” [61 cm].
Fasten off.
FINISHING:
Fold Pouch so foundation ch and final row meet in center to form opening (see diagram on page 2).
Seaming: Top Edge: Join A with sl st to corner of Pouch to work across top edge. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly across top edge. Fasten off.
Bottom Edge:  Work as for top edge across bottom edge.
Sew top edge of Pouch along bottom edge of Footstool Cover so that Pouch will fold and be hidden inside cover (see diagram on page 3 and photo).
CHECKERS  (make 12 each in A and B)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in first hdc. Fasten off.
Position Footstool Cover over footstool. Store Checkers in Pouch when not in use.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Bernat® Blanket Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Double-loop-st = Wrap yarn around index finger twice and hold behind work, insert hook into indicated stitch and between yarn wraps and your finger, remove your finger from wraps and draw wraps through stitch (leaving part of each wrap on other side of fabric to form loops). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Note: Loops form on side of project facing away from you
instructions:
Note: WS of Pillow will be facing you as you work project. Double-loop-st forms loops on side of project facing away from you.
With A, ch 39.
1st rnd: (WS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 4 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 37 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 82 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 2nd rnd 8 times more. Break A. Join B.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 double-loop-st in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 9 times more. Break B. Join A.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 9 times more. Break A. Join B.
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Fasten oﬀ.
FINISHING
Turn Pillow RS out. Insert pillow form. Sew top edge closed.

materials: Caron® Tea Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 204 yds/186 m) English Breakfast (20001) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
instructions:
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in ring. Ch 1. (4 dc in ring. Ch 1) 3 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Skip 1 dc. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next ch-1 sp. Skip 1 dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st in next dc and next popcorn. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 4th rnd until piece measures 14" [35.5 cm] square.
Next rnd: Sl st in next dc and next popcorn. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each dc across to next popcorn. (4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in top of next popcorn. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Next rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each dc across to next ch-1 sp. (4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 6th rnd until piece measures 28" [71 cm] square. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold 3 corners to meet in center, as shown in diagram, to form a square. Sew seams, leaving 4th corner open to insert pillow form. Insert pillow form. Sew rem seam.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 3 skeins 3933 Dove A
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Fringe™: 3 balls each 1968 Indigo B and 1975 Misty C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
gauge: 10 sts = 3½” (9 cm); 8 rows hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Cover
With A, ch 53.
Foundation Row (right side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—52 hdc.
Rows 1 and 2: Ch 2 (does not count as first st here and throughout), hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 3 (wrong side): Ch 2, working in front loop only, hdc in each st across, turn. Place st marker on end of row.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 6 (right side): Ch 2, working in back loop only, hdc in each st across, turn. Place st marker on end of row.
Repeat Rows 1–6 until piece measures 42” (106.5 cm). Fasten off.
With wrong side of cover facing, center pillow on cover and overlap ends to encase pillow. Pin side edges together and turn pillow so front of cover is facing. Place an additional marker on the first Row 3 closest to top edge to indicate first Ruffle Row. Remove all pins and stitch markers except those markers on the double-marked Row 3 and the next 10 marked rows down the front.
Cut eleven 3” (7.5 cm) strands of A (for fastening off mesh yarn at end of each Ruffle Row).

Ruffles
With B, work first Ruffle Row in double-marked Row 3.
Ruffle Row: Fold under cut edge and insert hook from back to front through doubled “thickness” of first space; working across marked row, insert hook in first unworked loop of cover, insert hook from front to back in next space and draw strand through all loops on hook (1 loop on hook), ruf hdc in each unworked loop across to last loop, insert hook from back to front in next space, fold B under and insert hook through double “thickness” of next space, insert hook in last unworked loop, pick up strand of A and draw through all loops on hook. Tie ends of A tightly in a square knot and cut B.
Repeat Ruffle Row with C in next marked row; repeat alternately with B and C in next 8 marked rows; then repeat once with B in last marked row.

FINISHING
Optional Apply fabric sealant to cut edge of mesh yarn to prevent unraveling.
With right side facing, place stitch marker on each side of row 18” (45.5 cm) below first Ruffle Row. With right sides together, fold lower section of cover at marked row over ruffles, then fold upper section at first Ruffle Row over lower section, overlapping evenly and ensuring that side edges match. Pin side edges closed. With A and working through all thicknesses, sew side edges together. Weave in ends. Turn cover right side out and insert pillow.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each of 1308 Tan A, 1907 Boysenberry B, 1620 Clover C, 1623 Mallard D, and 1601 Lettuce E.
Two 17” (43 cm) square pieces of felt in color close to Tan yarn
One 12” (30.5 cm) x 16” (40.5 cm) pillow form
Two 13” (33 cm) x 17” (43 cm) pieces of felt in color close to Tan yarn
Sewing needle and matching sewing thread
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = color A, B, C, D, E
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Square pillow = 16” (40.5 cm) x 16” (40.5 cm); Rectangular pillow = 12” (30.5 cm) x 16” (40.5 cm)
gauge: Square Pillow: First 5 rounds = 5” (12.5 cm) across; completed square = 8½” (21.5 cm) across. Rectangular Pillow: First 3 rounds = 7” (18 cm) long x 3” (7.5 cm); completed rectangle = 9” long x 5” (12.5 cm) wide.
instructions: Covering your pillow forms with tan felt makes sure that white doesn’t show through. Round 5: Slip st in next 2 dc, ch 1, sc in same (center) dc, *shell in next sc, sc in 2nd dc of next corner shell, shell in next dc, sc in next dc, shell in next sc, sc in center dc of next shell; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—12 shells. Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, dc in each of next 4 sts, 3 dc in next (center) dc (corner made), dc in each of next 4 sts, hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, dc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in next dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—17 sts across each side; 3 dc at each corner. Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each st around, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in center dc of each corner; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—21 sc on each side; 4 corner ch-2 spaces. Round 8 (wrong side): Ch 1, *[sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc] across to next corner, (sc, ch 2, sc) in corner ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * twice, [sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc] 5 times; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—11 ch-1 spaces on each side. Fasten off. Top Panel Row 1 (right side): With right side of Square facing, join C with a slip st in any corner ch-2 space, ch 1, sc in corner ch-2 space, sc in each sc and ch-1 space across to next corner ch-2 space, sc in corner ch-2 space, turn—25 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—12 ch-1 spaces. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and each ch-1 space across, turn—25 sc. Fasten off. Row 4: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Row 5: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off B. Bottom Panel: With right side facing, working across opposite side of Square, join C with a slip st in corner ch-2 space. Repeat Top Panel across bottom edge. First Side Panel Row 1 (right side): With right side of piece facing, join E with a slip st in row-end st of Row 12 on one long side of piece, ch 1, sc in each of first 12 row-end sts, working across side edge of Square, sc in corner ch-2 space, sc in each sc and each ch-1 sp across in next ch-2 space, sc in corner ch-2 space, sc in each of next 12 row-end sts on other panel, turn—49 sc. Rows 2-12: Repeat Rows 2-12 of Top Panel, working in the following color sequence: 2 more rows E; 2 rows D; 2 rows A; 3 rows E; 2 rows D. Second Side Panel: With right side facing, working across opposite side of piece, join E with a slip st in row-end st of Row 12 on other long side of piece. Repeat First Side Panel across opposite side edge. Back Edging: Designate front and back of pillow. Round 1: With right side of back facing, join A with a slip st in top left-hand corner st, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in same sc, sc in each ch-1 space, each sc and in each row-end st around, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner sc; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off—49 sc on each side; 4 ch-2 spaces. Front Edging: With right side of front facing, work same as Back Edging. Do not fasten off. Weave in ends. Border: Place front and back together, with right sides facing out, matching sts, working through double thickness, pick up dropped loop at end of Front Edging, ch 1, working across 3 sides of pillow cover, *sc in each sc across to next corner ch-2 space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in corner ch-2 space *; repeat from * to * twice; insert pillow form into cover; repeat from * to * once; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. RECTANGULAR PILLOW COVER Pillow Front/Back (make 2) Center Rectangle: With A, ch 14. Round 1: Working in back loops of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 11 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 12 ch, ch 2, join with a slip st in first sc—13 sc on each side; 2 ch-2 spaces. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *[skip next 2 sc, shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] twice, shell in next ch-2 space*, sc in next sc; repeat from * to * once; join with a slip st in first sc—6 shell. Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 4 dc in same st, *[sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc] twice, sc in 2nd dc of next shell, shell in next dc, sc in next dc*, shell in next sc; repeat from * to * once; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—8 shells. Round 4: Ch 3, *hdc in next dc, sc in each of next 2 dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next sc, hdc in next dc, sc in each of next 3 dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next sc, hdc in next dc, sc in each of next 2 dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next dc, (dc, tr, ch 2, tr, dc) in next sc (corner made), hdc in next dc, sc in each of next 3 dc, hdc in next dc, (dc, tr, ch 2, tr, dc) in next sc (corner made)*, dc in next dc; repeat from * to * once; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—21 sts across top and bottom; 9 sts across each side; 4 corner ch-2 spaces. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each st around working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner ch-2 space; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—23 sc across top and bottom; 11 sc across each side; 4 ch-2 spaces. Round 6 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in same sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in corner ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next sc, [sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc] across to next corner; repeat from * to * around, ending last repeat; join with a slip st in first sc—12 ch-1 spaces across each long side; 6 ch-1 spaces across each short side; 4 corner ch-2 spaces. Fasten off. Finishing Work Top and Bottom Panels (with 27 sc); Side Panels (with 39 sc); and Edgings same as Square Pillow Cover. Work Border (with 51 sc across each long edge; 39 sc across each short edge) same as Square Pillow Cover, inserting covered pillow form before joining last side.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m) Main Color (MC) White (10501) 1 ball or 378 yds/346 m
Contrast A Black (10503) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ghost Front and Back (make 2 alike)
With MC, ch 19.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
18 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 28 sc after 6th row.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 30 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 32 sc.
11th to 22nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. PM on first st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. PM on last sc. Turn.
24th to 31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
32nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. PM on first st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. PM on last sc. Turn.
33rd to 46th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
47th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
48th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
49th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
50th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
51st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
52nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
53rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
54th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
55th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
56th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
57th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
58th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
59th row: Ch 1. Skip sl st. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
60th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 
61st row: Ch 1. Skip sl st. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
62nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
63rd row: Ch 1. Skip sl st. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
64th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
65th row: Ch 1. Skip sl st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
66th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
67th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
68th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Arms (make 4 alike)
With MC, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 5 sc.
Fasten off.
Matching Arms with st markers on Ghost, sew Arms to Ghost.
Edging: Holding Front and Back of Ghost tog, join A with sl st to tip of Ghost ‘tail’. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses,  work sc evenly around Ghost, stuffing firmly before completing rnd. Join.
Eyes (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 6.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
Fasten off.
Sew Eyes to Ghost as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Tweeds™  (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m)
Contrast A Burgundy Tweed (11007) 1 ball or 304 yds/278 m
Contrast B Midnight White (11001) 1 ball or 124 yds/113 m
Contrast C Blue Tweed (11008) 1 ball or 181 yds/166 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Scbl2tog = Draw up a loop in back loop only of each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only of next stitch
Scfl2tog = Draw up a loop in front loop only of each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loop on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Pillow Front is worked from corner to corner.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook, yoh with new color. Pull through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in new color.

FRONT and BACK (make 2 alike)

Stripe Pat 1
With A, work 8 rows. Join B. Break A.
With B, work 2 rows. Join C. Break B.
With C, work 2 rows. Join A. Break C.
With A, work 2 rows. Join C. Break A.
With C, work 2 rows. Join B. Break C.
With B, work 2 rows. Join C. Break B.
With C, work 2 rows. Join A. Break C.
With A, work 10 rows. Join C. Break A.
With C, work 4 rows. Join B. Break C.
With B, work 2 rows. Join C. Break B.
With C, work 4 rows. Join B. Break C.
With B, work 2 rows. Join C. Break B.
With C, work 2 rows. Join A. Break C.
With A, work 2 rows. Join C. Break A.
With C, work 6 rows. Fasten off.
These 60 rows form Stripe Pat 1.

With A, ch 2.

Inc section: 1st row:  (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 2 scfl in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row:  Ch 1. 2 scfl in first sc. 1 scfl in each sc to last sc. 2 scfl in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat 1 are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat 1, rep 3rd and 4th rows 13 times more. Turn. 60 sc.
PM at both beg and end of last row.
First 30 rows of Stripe Pat 1 are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat 1, proceed with Dec Section as follows:

Dec Section: 1st row:  (RS). With A, ch 1. Scbl2tog. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sc. Scbl2tog. Turn. 58 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Scfl2tog. 1 scfl in each st to last 2 sc. Scfl2tog. Turn. 56 sc.
First 32 rows of Stripe Pat 1 are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat 1, rep 1st and 2nd rows 13 times more. 4 sc.
Next row: With C, ch 1. Scbl2tog twice. Turn. 2 sc.
Next row:  Ch 1. Scfl2tog. Fasten off.

Weaving:

Stripe Pat 2
With A, weave 3 rows.
With B, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 4 rows.
With C, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 8 rows.
With C, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 4 rows.
With B, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 4 rows.
With B, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 4 rows.
With C, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 8 rows.
With C weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 4 rows.
With B, weave 2 rows.
With A, weave 3 rows.
These 58 rows form Stripe Pat 2.

With RS facing, turn work 45 degrees so last row is at top and work looks like a diamond. Beg working from right to left beg at right tip of diamond. Using the marked row (30th row) as a guide proceed as follows. 
Note: See diagram on page 3.
1st row:  With RS facing and taking 2 strands of A with tapestry needle, weave under each of rem 3 loops along 2nd row of rem loops. Fasten ends of strands in place, ensuring strand does not gather fabric.
2nd row:  With RS facing and taking 2 strands of A with tapestry needle, weave under each of rem 5 loops along 3rd row of rem loops. Fasten ends of strands in place, ensuring strand does not gather fabric.
3rd row:  With RS facing and taking 2 strands of A with tapestry needle, weave under each of rem 7 loops along 4th row of rem loops. Fasten ends of strands in place, ensuring strand does not gather fabric.

4th row:  With RS facing and taking 2 strands of B with tapestry needle, weave under each of rem 9 loops along 5th row of rem loops. Fasten ends of strands in place, ensuring strand does not gather fabric.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat 2 are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat 2, cont in this manner, weaving under each row of rem loops across (as shown in diagram), breaking and joining yarn as necessary.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back:  With WS facing each other, join B with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Softened Blue (32008) 2 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
gauge: 12 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Waffle Pat.
instructions:
FRONT
Note: Waffle Pat worked over foundation ch multiple of 4 ch +5.
Ch 61.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc).  1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 59 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows of Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a RS row.
Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.  6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row:  Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 59 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Pin in place for easier joining. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Insert Pillow form.

materials: 1 skein each 1308 Tan B and 1970 Taupe C
5" [12.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard (for making tassels)
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pillow measures about 18 x 18" [45.5 x 45.5 cm]
gauge: 9 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc), with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER PIECE (make 2)
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 40. 
Row 1 (wrong side): Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—39 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 sts, Bobble in next st, [sc in next 7 sts, Bobble in next st] 4 times, sc in last 3 sts—34 sc and 5 Bobbles.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across—39 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 5 sts, Bobble in next st, [sc in next 3 sts, Bobble in next st] 7 times, sc in last 5 sts—31 sc and 8 Bobbles.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across—39 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 7 sts, Bobble in next st, [sc in next 7 sts, Bobble in next st] 3 times, sc in last 7 sts—35 sc and 4 Bobbles.
Rows 8–10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Rows 11–42: Repeat Rows 3–10 four more times.
Rows 43 and 44: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Edging Round: With right side facing and 2 strands of B held together, join yarn with slip st in any st of last row, ch 1, work sc stitches as evenly spaced as possible along all 4 sides of piece, working 3 sc in each corner. Take care to work the same number of sc along each side; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Seaming: Hold the two pieces together with Bobble zig-zags running in the same direction, stitches matching and wrong sides facing inwards. With right side facing and 2 strands of B held together, working in inner loops of both pieces at the same time, join yarn with slip st in any edging st, slip st in each remaining edging st all the way around, and insert pillow form before completing seam. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4)
Holding 1 strand each of A, B, and C together, Wrap yarn about 10 times around 5" (12.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard. Thread a 10" (25.5 cm) single strand of any of the yarn colors under the top of the wraps and tie into a tight knot for top of tassel. Do not trim the ends of the tie. Slip wraps off of cardboard. Tie a 10" (25.5 cm) length of yarn around wraps about ¾" (19 mm) from top for tassel neck. Wrap ends of tie around wraps about 6 times and then draw ends to inside of tassel. Cut the lower ends of the wraps and trim to even. Use yarn needle and ends of tie (at top of tassel) to sew one tassel securely to each of the four corners. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 72 yds/65 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook, yoh with new color. Pull through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in new color.
Front and Back (make alike).
With A, ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 22 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join B. Break A. Turn. 28 sts.
6th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) three times. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 34 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join C. Break B. Turn.
9th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 40 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Break C. Join D. Turn. 46 sts.
12th row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 52 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join E. Break D. Turn.
15th row: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 58 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 64 sts.
18th to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Seaming: With RS facing, sew Front and Back together aligning stripes and leaving a small space open for stuffing. Stuff Pillow making sure to shape into a rainbow arc. Sew remaining seam.

materials: Patons® CanadianaTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Tangy (10628) or Raspberry (10413) or Fool’s Gold (10610) 5 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
Ch 68.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 66 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 dc. Bobble in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
Edging: Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Blue Gold (09045) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 sts and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Moss St Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Obtaining exact stitch and row gauge is critical for successful planned pooling to achieve the pattern shown in photo.
• When joining new ball, join at exact point in color sequence as previous ball.
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 80.
1st row: (RS) 1 sc in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 79 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 sc in 1st ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last ch-2 sp. Turn.
Rep 2nd row for Moss St Pat until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm]. Fasten off.
Edging: Joining Front and Back:
1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Bounce Back™ (7.9 oz/225 g; 285 yds/261 m) Indigo (41002) or Gray Squirrel (41004) Tigerlily (41007) 2 balls or 385 yds/352 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2" [5 cm] piece of cardboard for pompoms.
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2)
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch-3.
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 dc.
6th rnd: ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 dc.
10th rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 dc.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 132 dc.
12th rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back facing each other and final rnds aligned, join yarn with sl st through both thicknesses to any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around, inserting pillow form as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 sc. Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 22): Wind yarn around 2" [5 cm] cardboard approx 90 times. Tie yarn tightly in the middle and leave long ends for attaching to Pillow. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew pompoms evenly around pillow edge (as shown in photo).

pattern_name: Donut Crochet Pouf Sprinkles & Bolster Pillows
materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A School Bus Yellow (12003) 1 ball or 147 yds/134.5 m
Contrast B Bright Pink (12042) 1 ball or 147 yds/134.5 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast C Terracotta Rose (10880) 1 ball or 147 yds/134.5 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Sprinkle = Approx 31/2" [9 cm] long. Bolster Pillow = Approx 18" [45.5 cm] long.
instructions:
SPRINKLES (make 10 each in A, B, and C):
Ch 8.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Sew Sprinkles all over Donut Pouf as shown in photo on page 2.
Note: Link for Donut Pouf see on page 2. 
SPRINKLE BOLSTER PILLOW (make 1 each in A, B, and C):
Front and Back (make alike) Ch 22.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next 19 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next 19 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 62 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next 19 sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 74 sc. Fasten off.
Bolster Pillow Assembly:
With Front and Back held WS tog, join yarn with sl st.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through back loops only and through both thicknesses,1 sc in each sc around. Stuff firmly before finishing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Note: See link for Bernat Donut Ask Me to Wake Up Crochet Pet Bed Pattern.

materials: 1 skein 3950 Charcoal or 400 Grey Heather B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Gauge: 17 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 17 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Crab Stitch: Sc in last st of previous row or round, * sc in next st to the RIGHT of last st worked; rep from * to end of row or round (reversing normal direction of work).
FRONT
With A, ch through 2 full color sequences, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as a st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed. Count the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway and note it down. Work 1 more full color sequence, maintaining the same number of sc made in each individual color, then work one more st repeat (sc, ch 1). Leave remaining ch sts unworked, turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1, it will work out.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until length of piece is equal to its width, ending on a Row 3 (right side row).
Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
Border
With right side facing and smaller hook, join B with slip st in ch-2 space at beginning of last row.
Round 1 (right side): 2 sc in the same ch-2 space as joining slip st, sc in each ch-1 space and each sc across last row, 3 sc in corner sc, sc in each row edge down the side, 3 sc in corner sc, sc in each foundation st, 3 sc in corner ch-2 space, sc in each row edge up other side, sc in beginning ch-2 space (same space as joining slip st), join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2 (right side): Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining slip st. * sc in each sc to corner, 3 sc in corner st; repeat from * twice more, sc in each sc to end, sc in first st (same st as joining slip st), join with slip st in first sc.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 17 x 17" (43 x 43 cm).
Fasten off.
FOR TEXTURED BACK
Buttonhole Piece
With B, ch 59.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 58 sc
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, * dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st, turn.
Repeat Rows 2 until work measures 15¾" (40 cm) from beginning, ending after a wrong side row.
Next Row (buttonhole row, right side): Ch 1, sc in first st, [dc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, * ch 1, skip next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 4 times, sc in next st; repeat from * 3 more times, ch 1, skip next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 4 times, turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first st, [dc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, dc in next st, * sc in next ch-1 space, [dc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, dc in next st; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in next ch-1 space, [dc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, dc in last st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 as above twice more.
Fasten off
Button Panel
With B, ch 59.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 58 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Repeat the last row twice more.
Fasten off.
With wrong sides facing together, pin the Button Panel to top of Front piece, and Buttonhole Panel to sides and bottom of Front piece.
FOR PLAIN BACK
Buttonhole Panel
With B, ch 55.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 54 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Work evenly in sc until work measures 8¼" (21 cm) from beginning, ending after a wrong side row.
Next Row (buttonhole row, right side): Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 sts, * ch 2, skip next 2 sts, sc in each of next 9 sts; repeat from * 3 more times, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, sc in last 4 sts, turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 sts, * 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 9 sts; repeat from * 3 more times, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each of last 4 sts, turn.
Work 2 more rows evenly in sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Pebble Beach Varg (11019) 5 balls or 1330 yds/1210 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 round pillows for stuffing - 24" [61 cm] diameter x 8" [20.5 cm] deep
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop from front to back to front around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] diameter x 16" [40.5 cm] high.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Top and Bottom: Make 2 pieces alike.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 16 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around each dc around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 32 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *(Dcfp around post of next dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between 2 groups of 2 dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 48 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *(Dcfp around post of next dcfp) twice. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *(Dcfp around post of next dcfp) twice. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 64 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 4. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 80 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 96 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
12th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 112 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
14th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 128 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
16th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 144 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Ch 6. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Rep last rnd (with no further increases) until work from center (radius) measures approx 15" [38 cm] or 30" [76 cm] total width.
Make chain links: With RS facing, twist first horizontal ch-4 bar of 7th rnd to form loop. Draw 2nd horizontal ch-6 bar of 8th rnd through first loop without twisting. Rep, drawing next horizontal ch-6 bar through previous loop without twisting until all loops have been worked. Note: Twisting only first horizontal ch-4 bar will prevent gaps in work.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around post of next dcfp. Sl st in rem loop of chain link to secure. Dcfp around post of next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Fasten off.
Join Pieces: With WS of Top and Bottom facing each other and final rnds aligned (taking care to match pat), join yarn with sl st through both thicknesses to any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, join Top and Bottom edges tog with sl st in each st around, inserting pillow forms as you work. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

measurements: Cube measures 16" x 16" x 16" (40.5 x 40.5 x 40.5 cm).
instructions:
POUF
Side (make 6)
Leaving an 8-inch tail, ch 13.  
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—12 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Repeat last row until piece measures 16" (40.5 cm).  Fasten off, leaving an 8-inch  
(20 cm) tail. 
FINISHING
Pull beginning and end tails to wrong side of each Side as work progresses to 
eliminate weaving in. 
Holding wrong sides of 2 pieces together and working through both 
thicknesses, join yarn with slip st in first corner, slip st evenly across in each st 
or in end of row. Fasten off. Repeat to 
join 2 Sides to form open cube (no top 
or bottom). Align another Side on top 
and slip st in same manner around open 
cube. Place pillow forms in open cube 
and slip st last Side to bottom of cube. 
Tuck remaining tails in to wrong side.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ Big Ball (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Baby Lilac (04310) 2 balls
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 72 yds/65 m) or (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B White (03005) or (04005) 1 ball
Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m) Contrast C Oatmeal (53010) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. L/11 (8 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: For use as pajama or soft toy storage, you will require one 18" [45.5 cm] long zipper or 4 large buttons.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] tall when sitting.
gauge: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ 7 dc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
BODY
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
With larger hook and A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 14 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 15 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 45 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. * 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 75 dc.
6th to 18th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
19th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming.
EYES (make 2).
With larger hook and B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 14 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
3rd rnd: 4 hdc in first sc. *Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. 4 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
EYE OUTLINE
With larger hook, join A with sl st around any sc in 2nd rnd. *Insert hook behind post of next sc from right to left and pull up a loop. Draw through loop on hook. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sl st.
Fasten off.
NOSE
With smaller hook and C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 12 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Stuff Body. Sew top edge of Body tog. Sew Eyes, buttons and Nose in position as shown in photo.
Optional: To use as pajama or soft toy storage, sew in zipper along top edge or make button loops and sew on buttons to correspond to loops.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Breezy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from back to front, to form 2" [5 cm] loop. Yoh and draw up loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions: Notes: Cushion is worked from corner to corner in 2 pieces (Front and Back). Front and Back are joined tog in Finishing. FRONT Inc section: Ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc. Rep 3rd row until side edge measures approx 20" [51 cm] from corner, ending on a WS row. Turn. Dec Section: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 Lp st in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. Rep last 2 rows until 4 sts rem. Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc. Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off. BACK Inc section: Work as for Front Inc Section. Dec Section: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. Rep last row until 4 sts rem. Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc. Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off. FINISHING Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Cushion. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Cushion, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 376 Burgundy A, 3941 Chile B, 3950 Charcoal C, 400 Grey Heather D, 3946 Razzle E, 360 Café Latte F, 726 Coral G
Yarn needle, three 18” (45.5 cm) knife edge square pillow forms
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 4” (10 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
This colorful granny starts out round and then becomes a square. By just changing the order of the colors, you can crochet the perfect trio of pillows.
Round 6: Join next color with slip st in any ch-2 space, ch 3, dc in same space, *ch 1, 2 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to beginning ch-3, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch 3—48 dc and 24 ch-1 spaces. Note: In Round 7, count each dc and each ch-1 space as a stitch. When you are instructed to skip or work into a stitch, the stitch may be a dc or it may be a ch-1 space.
Round 7: Slip st in next dc and ch-1 space, ch 4 (counts as tr), (tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in same ch-1 space (first corner made), *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] twice, [ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st] 4 times, [ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] twice, ch 1, skip next st, [2 tr, ch 3, 2 tr] in next ch-1 space (next corner made); repeat from * twice, [ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] twice, [ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st] 4 times, [ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] twice, ch 1, skip next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4—16 tr, 36 ch-1 spaces, and 4 corner ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 8: Join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in each st and ch-1 space to next corner, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in corner ch-3 space; repeat from * twice, dc in each st and ch-1 space to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—100 dc.
Round 9: Slip st in next dc and corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in each dc to next ch-3 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in each corner ch-3 space; repeat from * twice, dc in each dc to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—116 dc. Fasten off.
Round 10: Join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, skip next dc, *(2 dc in next dc, skip next dc) to next corner, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next corner ch-3 space, skip next dc; repeat from * twice, (2 dc in next dc, skip next dc) to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—128 dc.
Round 11: Slip st in next dc and corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *[2 dc in space between next two 2-dc groups] 15 times, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * twice, [2 dc in space between next two 2-dc groups] 15 times to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—136 dc. Fasten off.
Round 12: Join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 4, (tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in same ch-3 space, *tr in each dc to next corner ch-3 space, (2 tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * twice, tr in each dc to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4—152 tr.
Round 13: Slip st in next tr and corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, ch 1, dc between first 2 tr, [ch 1, dc between next 2 tr] 18 times, *ch 1, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, [ch 1, dc between next 2 tr] 19 times; repeat from * twice, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—92 dc and 76 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 14: Join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in each dc and ch-1 space to next corner ch-3 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next corner ch-3 space around; repeat from * twice, dc in each dc and ch-1 space to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—184 dc. Fasten off.
Round 15: Join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch-3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in each dc to next corner ch-3 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next corner ch-3 space around; repeat from * twice, dc in each dc to beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—200 dc. Fasten off.
Assembly
With wrong sides of 2 identical squares held together and working through both layers, join yarn of Round 15 with slip st to any dc, slip st in each dc and ch-space, working 3 slip st in each corner, until 3 sides are joined. Insert pillow form, slip st in each remaining dc and ch-space to first slip st; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Hold working yarn over top of left index finger and pull up 1" [2.5 cm] loop. Grab working yarn behind index finger and pull through stitch. Hold loop in position with right hand to front of work. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Loop is formed on RS of work.

LPst3tog = *Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Hold working yarn over top of left index finger and pull up 1" [2.5 cm] loop. Grab working yarn behind index finger and pull through stitch. Hold loop in position with right hand to front of work. Rep from * twice more. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Loops are formed on RS of work.
Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
• To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of previous stitch.
• Draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• To join new color on LP st, finish to end of st. Draw new color through loop and tighten loop of old color. Proceed in new color.
• Pillow is worked in one piece.
With MC, ch 68.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 sc in each of next 9 ch. Sc-3tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. 3 sc in next ch. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 67 sts.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 3 sc in next st. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row.
4th row:  As 2nd row. Break MC. Join A.
5th row: (RS). With A, as 2nd row.
6th row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 Lp sts in first st. *1 Lp st in each of next 9 sts. LPst3tog. 1 Lp st in each of next 9 sts. 3 Lp sts in next st. Rep from * once more. 1 Lp st in each of next 9 sts. Lpst3tog. 1 LP st in each of next 9 sts. 2 LP sts in last st. Turn.
7th row: As 2nd row.
8th row: As 6th row. Break A. Join MC.
9th to 12th rows: With MC, as 2nd row, Break MC. Join A at end of 12th row.
Rep 5th to 12th rows for pat until piece measures approx 60" [152.5 cm] from point of beg chevron to valley of final chevron, ending with 4 rows of A. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold sides and match foundation row to final row. Sew these edges tog at center back of Pillow, matching peaks and valleys in pat. Sew top seam. Insert pillow form. Sew bottom seam.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 2 Skeins 505 Aruba Sea A; 1 Skein each 316 Soft White B and 373 Petal Pink C.
Fiberfill, standard size pillow, two 1” buttons, 1½” diameter or doll safety eyes, hook & loop fastener, black embroidery thread, stitch markers, yarn needle.
abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

A, B, C = Color A, B, C; ch = chain; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tog = together; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Pillow Cover fits standard size pillow, 18” across x 14” front to back.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Head: Starting at muzzle with larger hook and B, ch 11. Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in same st, sc in next 8 ch, 4 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 8 ch, 2 sc in last ch, place marker for beginning of round – 24 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next 4 sts, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in last 2 sts – 32 sts. Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice – 40 sts. Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 4 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st – 46 sts. Rounds 5-11: Sc in each st around. Round 12: Change to A, sc in each st around. Round 13: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 22 sts] twice – 48 sts. Rounds 14-16: Sc in each st around. Round 17: [Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 54 sts. Round 18: Sc in each st around. Round 19: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times – 60 sts. Round 20: Sc in each st around. Round 21: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times – 66 sts. Round 22: Sc in each st around. Round 23: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times – 72 sts. Rounds 24-27: Sc in each st around. Round 28: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times – 78 sts. Rounds 29-33: Sc in each st around. Round 34: [Sc2tog, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times – 72 sts. Round 35: [Sc2tog, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times – 66 sts. Round 36: Sc in each st around. Round 37: [Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times – 60 sts. Round 38: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times – 54 sts. Round 39: [Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times – 48 sts. Pillow pals are a unique way for a child to have a stuffed friend that is also a pillow. The fantasy unicorn is perfect for a little girl’s imaginary play. Crochet him in her favorites colors. Round 40: [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times – 42 sts. Round 41: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times – 36 sts. Stuff Head with fiberfill, adding more as necessary before closing. Round 42: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times – 30 sts. Round 43: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times – 24 sts. Round 44: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times – 18 sts. Round 45: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times – 12 sts. Round 46: [Sc2tog] 6 times – 6 sts. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through sts and pull to close. Knot to secure. Ears (Make 2): With smaller hook and A, ch 9, slip st in first st to join, place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Sc in each ch around – 9 sc. Round 2: Sc in each st around. Round 3: [2 sc in each st] around – 18 sc. Rounds 4-10: Sc in each st around. Round 11: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times – 12 sts. Round 12: Sc in each st around. Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 4 times – 8 sts. Round 14: Sc in each st around. Round 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] twice, sc2tog – 5 sts. Round 16: Sc in next st, [sc2tog] twice – 3 sts. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through sts and pull to close. Knot to secure. Mane: With larger hook and C, ch 26. Row 1: Working in back nub of foundation ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 25 sc. Round 2: Turn to work in opposite side of foundation ch, [ch 8, slip st in next st] in each ch across, turn to work along sc, [ch 8, slip st in next st] in each sc. If desired, work [ch 8, slip st in next st] down center of foundation ch to add fullness. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Tail: With larger hook and C, ch 13. Row 1: Working in back nub of foundation ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 12 sc. Round 2: Turn to work in opposite side of foundation ch, [ch 12, slip st in next st] in each ch across, turn to work along sc, [ch 12, slip st in next st] in each sc. If desired, work [ch 12, slip st in next st] down center of foundation ch to add fullness. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Horn: With smaller hook and B, ch 12, slip st in first st to join, place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Sc in each ch around – 12 sc. Rounds 2-4: Sc in each st around. Round 5: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] twice – 10 sc. Rounds 6-9: Sc in each st around. Round 10: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] twice – 8 sts. Round 11: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] twice – 6 sts. Round 12: [Sc2tog] 3 times. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through sts and pull to close. Knot to secure. Pillow Cover: With larger hook and A, ch 90. Round 1: Hdc in 3rd chain from hook and in each ch across, slip st to first st to join – 88 sts. Rounds 2-49: Hdc in each st around. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Closing Strap: With smaller hook and A, ch 8. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each sc across – 7 sts. Rows 2-30: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. FINISHING: Using long tails, flatten Ears and sew on either side of Head. Attach buttons or safety eyes on upper portion of Head. Stuff Horn and sew on Head in between Ears. Using black embroidery thread and straight stitches, sew nostrils on Muzzle. Sew Mane from just behind Horn down center of Head. Sew last round of Pillow Cover closed. Insert pillow and sew opposite end closed. Sew Head in center of one long edge of Pillow Cover. Sew Tail in center of opposite long edge of Pillow Cover. Sew one end of Closing Strap in center of one short side of Pillow Cover. Sew one side of hook and loop fastener to opposite end of Closing Strap. Sew corresponding side of hook and loop fastener to corresponding spot on opposite short side of Pillow Cover. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 624 Tea Leaf A, 347 Light Periwinkle B, 313 Aran C, 341 Light Grey D, 726 Coral E, 321 Gold F, 530 Orchid G, 368 Paddy Green H, 381 Light Blue I, 365 Coffee J, 320 Cornmeal K, 360 Café Latte L, and 256 Carrot M
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75 mm [US F-5] and 5 mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
