gauge: 9 sts = 2½” (6.5 cm); 6 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm) in alternating rows of double crochet and single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Sides (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 51.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—50 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–21: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 nine times; change to B at end of Row 21.
Rows 22–37: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 eight times, do not turn at end of Row 37.
Last round (right side): Working in ends of rows of first side, sc evenly across changing to A in Row 22; working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows of other side, sc evenly across changing to B in Row 21, 3 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Note: Work all remaining pieces with smaller hook. Fasten off with long tails for sewing.

GIRL
Head and Body
Beginning at top of head, with C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn—14 sc.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 12–15: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 3 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st, turn—6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sts, turn—5 sc.
Rows 17 and 18: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 19: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st; change to D, turn—7 sc.
Rows 20 and 21: Ch 4, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, sc in each st, turn—15 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—17 sc.
Rows 23 and 24: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Do not fasten off.

First Arm
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off.

Jumper
Row 1 (right side): With right side of Row 24 facing, skip first unworked st, join E with sc in next unworked st, sc in next 8 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Fasten off.

Second Arm
Row 1 (right side): With right side of Row 24 facing, skip next unworked st, join D with sc in next unworked st, sc in remaining sts, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.

Edging
Last Round: Ch 1, working in each st and in ends of rows, sc evenly around arms, body, and head working 3 sc in each outer corner of arms and changing colors as needed to match each section. Fasten off.

Jumper Strap (make 2)
With E, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–7: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off.

Collar (make 2)
With D, ch 10.
Row 1: Working in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook, sc2tog, hdc in next ch, [yo, insert hook in next ch, pull up a loop] 3 times (7 loops on hook), yo and draw through all 7 loops, hdc next ch, sc2tog. Fasten off.

Ear (make 2)
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.

Hat
With F, ch 31.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—30 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, [dc2tog] 9 times, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in last 4 sts, turn—21 sts.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next 11 sts, hdc in next st, sc in last 4 sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, dc in next 11 sts, hdc in next st, [sc2tog] twice, turn—17 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, dc in next 7 sts, hdc in next st, [sc2tog] twice, turn—13 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, [sc2tog] twice, turn—9 sts.
Rows 9 and 10: Ch 1, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in last st, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog, hdc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc2tog, turn—7 sts.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc2tog, hdc in next 3 sts, sc2tog—5 sts. Fasten off.

Bow
With E, ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): *Ch 2, 12 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch* (first bow loop made), ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form 2nd ring; repeat from  * to * once (2nd bow loop made), **ch 7, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, slip st in last slip st of 2nd bow loop just made; repeat from ** working last slip st in last slip st of first bow loop. Fasten off.

FLOWER (make 7)
Petals
With G, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): [(Hdc, ch 1, slip st, ch 1) in 2nd ch from hook] 4 times; join with slip st in same ch. Fasten off.

Small Leaf (make 7)
With H, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): *Sc in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch, slip st in last ch*, ch 4; repeat from * to * once. Fasten off.

EGG (make 2)
With I, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in sc, turn—2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—4 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice; working in sts and in ends of rows, sc evenly around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.

BRANCHES
Large Branch
With J, ch 24.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 13 ch, hdc in next 6 ch, dc in last 3 ch—23 sts. Fasten off.

Small Branch
With J, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, hdc in last 3 ch—9 sts. Fasten off.

Large Leaf (make 3)
With H, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in first sc, (sc, hdc) next sc, 3 dc in next sc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch, 2 dc in next sc, (hdc, sc) next sc, 2 sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

SUN
With K, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn—8 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn—10 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 4 sc, turn—12 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 5 sc, turn—14 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 6 sc, turn—16 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 7 sc, turn—18 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 8 sc, turn—20 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 9 sc, turn—22 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 10 sc, turn—24 sc.
Row 13: Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch, skip first 2 sc, slip st in next sc, *ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.

ROBIN (make 2)
Head and Body
With L and smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Continue in rows.
Row 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice. Fasten off.

Breast
With M, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 3 ch, sc in last ch. Fasten off.

Tail
With L, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last 2 ch, turn—7 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), dc in next dc, hdc next 2 sts, sc in last 3 sts. Fasten off.

Wing
With L, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), hdc in next 2 ch, slip st in last ch, turn—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip slip st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, ch 2, slip st in next st; leave remaining sts unworked. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Use photograph as a guide for embroidery stitches and placement of pieces. Position all pieces with right side facing. To minimize finishing, draw ends of all tails to wrong side.

Girl
Jumper straps Sew to top of jumper and over shoulders.
Collar Overlap edges of pieces at neck and sew in place between jumper straps.
Ears Sew in place on sides of head.
Head and Body
With black embroidery floss, embroider a French knot for each eye, straight stitches for eyebrows and nose, and curved couch stitch for mouth. Color cheeks with red crayon. Position head and body on front side, aligning lower edges of arms and jumper with Row 1 of front side, and sew to pillow with matching colors and leaving ears unsewn.
Braid (make 2)
Wrap C around 10” (25.5 cm) piece of cardboard 9 times. Cut a 12” (30.5 cm) length of C and tie it tightly around wraps at one end of cardboard. Cut wraps at other end. Fold the bundle in half at tied end so that you have 18 strands; separate into 3 hanks and braid to 3½” (9 cm) or desired length. Tie a short strand of yarn around the bottom of the braid and trim ends evenly. Thread tying tails through pillow on side of head and secure to wrong side of front. Sew braid as desired to front side.
Hat and Bow Fold up brim and sew hat in place leaving front edge of brim unsewn. Sew bow to hat where desired.
Flowers Randomly arrange petals on A-colored section of front side and sew in place. Sew a small leaf under each petal piece.
Branches, Large Leaves, and Eggs Sew branches, large leaves, and eggs in place. To make a nest, with L, embroider straight stitches of varying lengths and at different angles around and over lower edges of eggs. Sun Sew to upper right corner.
Bird Sew tail to end of body and breast under body of bird. Overlap lower half of wing on upper body. With K, embroider French knot eye. Sew 1 bird to top of hat and other bird to B-colored section of back side. With 2 strands of F held together, embroider open beak with straight stitches on each bird and on bird on back side only, embroider legs with straight stitches.
Sides
Hold front and back sides with wrong sides together.
Round 1: With larger hook and working through inner loops, join A with sc in any st, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center st of each 3-sc group and inserting pillow form before 4th side is completed; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 505 Aruba Sea A, 1 skein each of 722 Pretty in Pink B, 312 Black C, 324 Bright Yellow D, 254 Pumpkin E, 886 Blue F, 368 Paddy Green G
6 removable stitch markers (5 of one color and one of a different color)
2 pieces of quilt backing each about 15 x 20” (38 x 51 cm)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Pillow measures about 13” (33 cm) wide and 15” (38 cm) tall.
gauge: Rounds 1–9 of skull = GAUGE. Use any size to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SKULL (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; do not join with slip st, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place the different colored stitch marker in last sc made for end of round and move marker up as each round is completed. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—48 sc. Place five more stitch markers (for a total of six markers, including the end of round marker) to divide the round into six equal sections.
Rounds 9–29: Sc in each st around and work one sc-inc in each of the six sections between markers. Place the sc-inc into a different stitch in each round so that you are never working sc-inc into another sc-inc—174 sc in Round 29. 
Do not fasten off. Remove all of the markers.
Jaw
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), turn, skip first st, dc2tog, dc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 28 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next st, dc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked—38 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, dc2tog, dc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 26 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next st, dc2tog—36 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, dc2tog, dc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 24 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next st, dc2tog—34 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, sc in next 28 sts, hdc in next st, hdc2tog—32 sts.
Rows 5–10: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog—20 sc in Row 10.
Rows 11 and 12: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each st across to last 4 sts, [sc2tog]—12 sc in Row 12.
Do not fasten off. 
Prepare Quilt Batting
Place skull onto a piece of paper and trace around the edge. Add a ½” (13 mm) border all the way around the traced outline. Cut out the paper pattern. Place paper pattern onto quilt batting and cut around it. Repeat to cut two pieces of batting. Set aside.
Edging 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, do not turn, work 16 sc evenly spaced across side edge of jaw, sc into each of the 133 unworked sts of skull, work 16 sc evenly spaced across other side edge of jaw, sc in each st of Row 12 of jaw. Place a marker in the last sc made, for end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–4: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off. Remove marker.
Work second skull same as first, but do not fasten off.
Assemble Pillow
Hold both skulls with wrong sides together and stitches matching. Working through both thicknesses, slip stitch about ¾ of the way around skulls. Place both pieces of batting between the skulls. Place polyester fiberfill between the pieces of batting, stuffing very firmly. Then slip stitch the remainder of the skulls closed, adding additional fiberfill as needed.
Fasten off.
EYE FLOWERS (make 2)
Center
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Rounds 1–3: Work same as Rounds 1–3 of skull—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—24 sc. 
Round 5: Slip st in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Front Petals
Working behind the Round 5 slip sts and into the front loops only of the sc sts of Round 4, join D with slip st in the first st, 
[(hdc, 2 dc) in next st, (2 dc, hdc) in next st, slip st in next 2 sts] 5 times, (hdc, 2 dc) in next st, (2 dc, hdc) in next st, slip st in last st; join with slip st in first slip st—6 petals. 
Fasten off.
Back Petals 
Working behind the Round 5 slip sts and into the back loops only of the sc sts of Round 4, join E with slip st in the 3rd st 
(behind the first (2 dc, hdc) of Front Petals), 
[(hdc, 2 tr) in next st, (2 tr, hdc) in next st, 
slip st in next 2 sts] 5 times, (hdc, 2 tr) in next st, (2 tr, hdc) in next st, slip st in next st; join with slip st in first slip st—6 petals. 
Fasten off.
SMALL FLOWERS (make 9)
Make flowers using the following colors
Make 4 with F for Round 1 and B for Round 2.
Make 2 with F for Round 1 and D for Round 2.
Make 2 with F for Round 1 and E for Round 2.
Make 1 with E for Round 1 and F for Round 2.
With first color, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (flower center): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring. Fasten off.
Round 2 (petals): Insert hook in same st as join, yarn over with 2nd color and draw up a loop, ch 1, (sc, 2 dc, sc) in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
NOSE
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, beginning in same st as join, 
[(sc, hdc, dc) in next st, (dc, hdc, sc) in next 
st] 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. 
Fasten off.
Round 3: Insert hook in back loop of same 
st as join, yarn over with F and draw up a 
loop, slip st in back loop of each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
ZIG-ZAG LINES (make 2)
With G, leaving a long beginning tail, make 
a chain that measures about 25” (63.5 cm) 
long. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
TEETH
Lower Teeth
With B, ch 34.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bumps 
of foundation ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook, 
sc in next 7 ch, hdc in next 16 ch, sc in last 
9 ch—33 sts. Place a marker in the last ch 
worked into.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sts, hdc in 
next 16 sts, sc in last 9 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, [skip next st, 
5 hdc in next st (shell made), skip next st, sc 
in next st] 8 times—8 shells. Fasten off.
Line between Lower and Top Teeth:  
With right side facing and working across 
opposite side of foundation ch, join C with 
slip st in marked ch (do not remove the 
marker), slip st in next 32 ch—33 slip sts. 
Fasten off.
Top Teeth
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, 
working behind the slip sts of the Line 
between Lower and Top Teeth and into the 
opposite side of foundation ch, draw up a 
loop in marked ch, ch 1, sc in same ch, sc 
in next 7 ch, hdc in next 16 ch, sc in last 9 
ch—33 sts.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 8 sts, hdc in 
next 16 sts, sc in last 9 sts.
Fasten off.
Edging
With right side facing and working into the 
back loops only of sts in last row of Lower 
Teeth, draw up a loop of C in first sc, [slip 
st in next 5 hdc, slip st in next sc, spike into 
top loop of the slip st in the Line between 
Lower and Top Teeth that is directly below 
(do not work the spike too tightly)] 7 times, 
slip st in next 5 hdc; work 7 slip sts evenly 
spaced across next side edge of teeth; 
working into the back loops only of sts in 
last row of Top Teeth, [slip st in next 4 sts, 
spike into free loop of the same slip st as 
next spike of Lower Teeth] 7 times, slip st 
in next 5 sts; work 7 slip sts evenly spaced 
across side edge of teeth.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Block pieces if needed. 
Assembly
Note: When possible, use the long yarn tails 
to sew pieces in place. When a long yarn tail 
is not available, use a separate length of yarn.
Attach Teeth: Pin Teeth to pillow so that 
the Line between Lower and Top Teeth runs 
along the first row of Jaw. With C, sew Teeth 
to pillow, sewing all the way around outer 
edge.
Attach Eye Flowers: Pin Eye Flowers to 
pillow using photograph as a guide. The 
center of each Eye should be about 3” (7.5 
cm) to each side and ½” (13 mm) below the
center ring of the skull. With C, sew Eye to
pillow, sewing around edge of center of Eye
and leaving the petal edges free.
Attach Nose: Pin Nose to pillow so that the 
center of the Nose is about 3¼” (8.5 cm) 
below center ring of the skull. With F, sew 
Nose to pillow, sewing all the way around 
outer edge.
Attach Flowers and Zig-Zag Lines: Pin 
Zig-Zag Lines and Flowers to pillow, using 
photograph as a guide. Sew pieces in place.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300g; 220 yds/201 m) Fired Clay (42008) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• If desired, separate colors by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.

FRONT and BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next hdc. 1 hdc in same hdc as dcfp. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in next each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 100 sts.
Fasten off.

Join Front and Back:
With WS facing each other, sew Front and Back together, stuff firmly before closing completely.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each of 1303 Aran A, 1401 Pewter B, and 1308 Tan C
Two 12” (30.5 cm) square pillow forms, one 8” (20.5 cm) square pillow form, pins, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Large pillows each measure 13” (33 cm) square. Small pillow measures 9½” (24 cm) square.
gauge: 6 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 8 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 17 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 8 sts; insert hook in top of beginning ch, yarn over with C and draw through all loops on hook to complete round and change color—92 sts (21 dc across each side). Fasten off A.
Round 7: With C, ch 3, dc in next 10 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 21 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 10 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—108 sts (25 dc across each side).
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 12 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 25 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 12 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—124 sts (29 dc across each side).
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next 14 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 29 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 14 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—140 sts (33 dc across each side).
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next 16 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 33 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 16 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—156 sts (37 dc across each side between 2-tr at corners).
Fasten off.
SIDE FOR SMALL PILLOW (make 2)
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rounds 1–7: Work same as Rounds 1–7 of Side for Large Pillow—108 sts (25 dc across each side).
Fasten off.
Notes
1. Each pillow is made from two sides.
2. Letters are worked separately, as long strips of crochet that are arranged on the front of each pillow and sewn in place.
3. Two sides (front and back) are sewn together, a pillow form inserted, and edging round worked to complete each pillow.
SIDE FOR LARGE PILLOW (make 4 – 2 for each of the 2 pillows)
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st (corner made), dc in next st; repeat from * 2 more times, (2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—28 sts (5 dc across each side between 2-tr at corners).
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—44 sts (9 dc across each side).
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 9 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 sts (13 dc across each side).
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sts, *(2 dc, tr) in next st, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 13 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, dc in last 6 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—76 sts (17 dc across each side).

AMPERSAND (& – for small pillow)
With B, ch 48.
Row 1: Work (3 dc, ch 2, slip st) in 3rd ch from hook (first end of letter made), sc in each remaining ch across.
Row 2: Turn, skip first 2 sc, (2 dc, ch 2, slip st) in next sc (second end made); leave remaining sts unworked.
Fasten off. Shape piece into an “&”, pinning in place on one of the Sides for Small Pillow. Sew in place and remove pins.
M (make 2 – 1 for each large pillow)
With B, ch 51.
Rows 1 and 2: Work same as Rows 1 and 2 of Ampersand.
Fasten off. Shape piece into an “M”, pinning one “M” in place on each of two Sides for Large Pillow. Sew in place and remove pins.
R (make 2 – 1 for each large pillow)
With B, ch 20.
Rows 1 and 2: Work same as Rows 1 and 2 of Ampersand.
Fasten off. Shape piece into an “r”, pinning one “r” in place following each “M”. Sew in place and remove pins.
S (for “Mrs” large pillow)
With B, ch 25.
Rows 1 and 2: Work same as Rows 1 and 2 of Ampersand.
Fasten off. Shape piece into an “s”, pinning in place following the “r”. Sew in place and remove pins.

FINISHING
Assemble Large Pillows
Hold one front (with letters) and one back (with no letters) with wrong sides together. With yarn needle and C, sew pieces together across three sides, sewing between Rounds 9 and 10. Insert pillow form and sew fourth side closed.
Edging Round: With right side facing and working in back loops only of Round 10 of both thicknesses, join C with slip st, slip st all the way around. Fasten off.

Assemble Small Pillow
Assemble same as large pillow, using A to sew piece together between Rounds 6 and 7. Work Edging Round, same as for large pillow.

Weave in ends.

materials: plastic storage basket measuring 13¼" wide x 13¼" long x 13" high
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Ottoman measures 13¼" wide x 13¼" long x 13" high.
gauge: 9 sc = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet; Rounds 1 and 2 of motif = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COVER
Motif (make 8 as show in Color Sequence)
Note: Refer to Assembly Diagram and work appropriate Round 4 when joining motifs to adjacent pieces.
With first color, ch 4; join with slip st to a form ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1 here and throughout), (dc, [ch 1, dc] 10 times) in ring, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—12 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join 2nd color with slip st in any ch-1 space, beg popcorn in same space, [ch 3, popcorn in next ch-1 space] around, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beg popcorn—12 popcorns and 12 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. 
Round 3: With right side facing, join 3rd color with slip st in any ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same space, (ch 1, 3 dc) in each ch-3 space around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. 
Round 4 (no join): With right side facing, sc join F in any ch-1 space, ch 3, sc in same space, skip next st, sc in next st, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, *(dc, [ch 3, dc] 3 times) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, [(sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st] twice; repeat from * around to last ch-1 space, (dc, [ch 3, dc] 3 times) in last ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st; join with slip st in first sc—28 sc, 16 dc, and 20 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
RHC0520-016573M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019
CROCHET  
SKILL LEVEL
EXPERIENCED
SHOP KIT
HEXAGON BLUES OTTOMAN | CROCHET    1 of 3
See next page for assembly diagram and alternate photo
Round 4 (1-sided join): With right side facing, sc join F in any ch-1 space, ch 3, sc in same space, skip next st, sc in next st, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, (dc, ch 3, dc, [ch-3 join, dc] twice) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, [(sc, ch-3 join, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st] twice, (dc, [ch-3 join, dc] twice, ch 3, dc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, *[(sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st] twice, [dc, (ch 3, dc) 3 times] in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—28 sc, 16 dc, 14 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-3 joins. Fasten off.
Round 4 (2-sided join): With right side facing, sc join F in any ch-1 space, ch 3, sc in same space, skip next st, sc in next st, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, *(dc, ch 3, dc, [ch-3 join, dc] twice) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st, [(sc, ch-3 join, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st] twice, (dc, [ch-3 join, dc] twice, ch 3, dc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st*, [(sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next st] twice; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first sc—28 sc, 16 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces, and 12 ch-3 joins. Fasten off.
Body
Round 1: With right side facing, join F with slip st in any join between motifs, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, [hdc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, *3 dc in next join between motifs, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, [hdc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—64 sc, 24 hdc, and 24 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, [sc2tog, sc in next 14 sts] 6 times, sc2tog, sc in each remaining st; join with slip st in first sc—105 sc. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, sc join A in any st, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With F, repeat Round 3.
Round 5: With B, repeat Round 3.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: With C, repeat Round 3.
Round 8: Repeat Round 4.
Round 9: With D, repeat Round 3.
Round 10: Repeat Round 4.
Round 11: With E, repeat Round 3.
Round 12: Repeat Round 4.
Rounds 13–22: Repeat Rounds 3–12. Do not fasten off at end of last round.
Rounds 23 and 24: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Border
Round 1: With right side of bottom edge of motifs facing, repeat Round 1 of body.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 5 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next st, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts] 7 times, sc2tog, sc in next st, sc2tog, sc in each remaining st; join with slip st in first sc—96 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing and working in back loops only, sc join C in any st, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 5–7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Place cover over basket.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first st, [ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st] around, ch 1, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc and 48 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. 
Top
Rounds 1–3: With colors of Sequence 1, repeat Rounds 1–3 of motif.
Round 4: With right side facing, repeat Round 4 (no join).
Round 5: With right side facing, join D with slip st in center ch-3 space between dc, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, *ch 1, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, [(ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space] 4 times; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 dc, 20 ch-1 spaces, and 4 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing, join E with slip st in any ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, 3 dc in next 5 ch-1 spaces, *(3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, 3 dc in next 5 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—84 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
Round 7: With right side facing, join F with slip st in any ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same space, *dc in each st around to next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, dc in each st around to next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—92 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
Round 8: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same space, dc in each st around to next ch-1 space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, dc in each st around to next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—100 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
ASSEMBLY
Hold top and body with wrong sides together, matching sts and ch spaces of last round of top to last round of body.
Joining Round: Working through both thicknesses, sc join C in any st, sc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size 8 mm (U.S. L/11) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Two pieces of fabric 18" [45.5 cm] square for pillow form.
Small amount of black yarn for nose embroidery.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] diameter, excluding arms and legs.
instructions:
Note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
PILLOW FRONT
With MC ch 13. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 24 sc at end of 7th row.
8th, 10th, 12th and 14th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
9th, 11th, 13th and 15th rows: As 2nd row. Join A at end of 15th row. 32 sc. 
16th to 22nd rows: With A, as 8th row. 
23rd, 25th, 27th and 29th rows: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 24 sc at end of 29th row.
24th, 26th, 28th and 30th rows: As 8th row.
31st to 36th rows: As 23rd row. 12 sc at end of 36th row.
Fasten off.
PILLOW BACK
Base: With B, ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 dc. 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 96 dc. Fasten off.
OUTER RUFFLES
With RS of Base facing, join B with sl st in first unworked front loop of 1st rnd. 
1st rnd: Working in unworked front loops of 1st rnd of Base only, *(1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first sl st. Ch 3. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in first unworked loop of 2nd rnd. Working in unworked front loops of 2nd rnd of Base only, *3 dc in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first sl st. Ch 3. 
3rd to 8th rnds: Sl st in first unworked loop of next rnd. Working in unworked front loops of Base rnd only, *Miss next st. 5 dc in next st. Miss next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first sl st. Ch 3. Do not work ch 3 at end of 8th rnd. Fasten off.
FACE RUFFLES (make 2).
With B, ch 85.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 84 sc.
2nd row: Sl st in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Fasten off.
EARS (make 2).
With A, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. Turn. 14 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew side ends of Ears tog, creating a cupped shape.
ARMS (make 2).
Stripe Pat
With MC, work 3 rnds.
With A, work 3 rnds.
These 6 rnds form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 10. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.
Lightly stuff.
LEGS (make 2).
With B, ch 7. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sts.
Stuff foot.
8th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off after last rnd.
Finish stuffing.
FINISHING
POM-POM (make 2).  Wind A around 4 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach to face as shown in picture.
Pillow form: Cut two 17" [43 cm] diameter circles from fabric pieces. With RS of circle pieces tog and using a ½" [1 cm] seam allowance, sew pieces tog leaving a 4" [10 cm] opening. Stuff pillow form. Sew opening closed.
Sew Front and Back tog leaving large enough opening to slide pillow form in. Insert pillow form. Sew rem opening closed.
Sew 2 rows of Face Ruffles around face as shown in picture. Sew Ears, Arms and Legs into position as shown in picture. With small amount of black yarn, embroider nose. Sew black buttons to face as shown in picture for eyes.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 3 balls 1870 Denim A
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 4 shells = 2” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Front
Row 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook, 
dc in next 2 ch; turn – 1 shell.
Row 2: Ch 6, dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch – 
beginning shell made; (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) all over ch-3 of 
previous row – shell made; turn – 2 shells.
Row 3: Beginning shell, * shell; repeat from * across 
changing to B in last dc; turn – 3 shells.
Row 4: Beginning shell, * shell; repeat from * across; turn.
Repeat Row 4 for pattern, increasing 1 shell each row, in 
the following color sequence:
2 more rows B, 7 rows A, 1 row B, 3 rows A, 3 rows B, 2 
rows A – 22 shells at end of last row.
Row 23: With A, ch 1, slip st in first 3 dc, * shell; repeat 
from * to last shell; slip st in last ch-3 changing to B; turn – 
21 shells.
Row 24: Ch 1, slip st in first 3 dc, * shell; repeat from * to 
last shell; slip st in last ch-3 space; turn – 20 shells.
Repeat Row 24 for pattern, decreasing 1 shell each row, in 
the following color sequence:
2 more rows B, 3 rows A, 1 row B, 7 rows A, 3 rows B, 3 
rows A – 1 shell. Fasten off.
Back
Work same as Front EXCEPT reverse the colors using A 
in place of B and B in place of A.
Assembly
With wrong sides together and working through both 
thicknesses, join A and work 1 round sc evenly around 3 
sides; insert pillow form; complete sc round; join with a slip 
st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Plus™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 78 yds/71 m) Golden Moss (56002) 13 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
gauge: 6 sts and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Basketweave Pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows counts as hdc throughout.
Ch 79 (multiple of 6 ch + 7).
Foundation row:  (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. 77 dc. Turn.
1st row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st.  1 hdc in last st. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row.
4th row: As 1st row.
5th row: As 1st row.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th row:  Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each st to last 10 sts.  1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each st to last 10 sts.  1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
9th row: As 8th row.
10th row: As 7th row.
Rep 7th to 10th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 44½” [113 cm], ending on 8th row of pat.
Rep 1st to 6th rows once more. 
Fasten off.
Top Crochet Fringe: 
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first st of last row of Blanket.
Next row: (RS). Ch 11. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Skip first st. *Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 11. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Rep from * to end of row. Sl st in same st at base of last ch. Fasten off.
Bottom Crochet Fringe:  With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first ch at bottom edge of Blanket. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, work as given for Top Crochet Fringe.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m) Navy (27011) 5 balls
Size U.S. P/Q/19 (15 mm) hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
SIDES (make 6 pieces alike)
Chain (ch) 21.
1st row: [Right side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off.
FINISHING:
With RS facing, slip stitch (sl st) sides together (tog) to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Sl st seams will create ridges on RS. Stuff with 4 Pillow Forms stacked on top of each other. For added stability, tack each stacked Pillow Form to the one below.
Sl st opening closed.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
All Letter and Number Pillows (make 2 pieces alike, noting RS and WS will be reversed for Front and Back).
Note: Follow directions shown on each chart for shaping and pattern instructions. See pages 2 to 16.
Main Gusset
Ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Letter or Number shape. Fasten off.
Sew Gusset seam.
Interior Gusset (optional) Work as for Main Gusset for each section of Letter shape that requires a separate gusset.
FINISHING
Position Main Gusset seam at lower edge of Pillow and pin Main Gusset in position. With WS tog and working through both thicknesses, join Front of Pillow and Main Gusset tog with 1 rnd of sc.
If necessary, attach Interior Gusset piece(s) in same manner.
Rep for Back of Pillow, leaving an opening approx 4" [10 cm] wide. Stuff Pillow. Join opening closed. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Dark Gray (10044) 5 balls or 1040 yds/947 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Sewing thread and needle (optional if applying zipper)
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked in one piece from top edge down.
Ch 34.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 32 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 70 sc. Place marker on last st and move this marker up each rnd.
2nd rnd: *Ch 6. Sl st in front loop only of next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to front loop only of first sc.
3rd rnd: Holding ch-6 loops forward to reveal rem back loop of each sc in previous rnd, ch 1. 1 sc in rem back loop of first sc. *1 sc in rem back loop of next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds for Chain Loop Pat until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Optional zipper application: Sew 1" [2.5 cm] seam at each end, leaving 18" [45.5 cm] opening. Pin zipper in position and sew into opening using needle and thread. Sew entire lower edge closed if you are not applying zipper.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge:
10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] 
Motif = Approx 10" [25.5 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes: When joining colors, work 
to last 2 loops on hook of first 
color. Draw new color through 
last 2 loops and proceed.
Stripe Pat
1st and 2nd rows: With B. Join C, 
Break B.
3rd and 4th rows: With C. Join D. 
Break C.
5th and 6th rows: With D. Join A. 
Break D.
7th and 8th rows: With A. Join B. 
Break A.
9th and 10th rows:  With B. 
Join C. Break B.
11th and 12th rows:  With C. 
Join D. Break C.
13th and 14th rows:  With D. 
Join A. Break D.
15th to 22nd rows:  Rep Rows 7 
to 14.
23rd row: With A.
These 23 rows form Stripe Pat.
Motif (make 8 alike)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first 
ch to form ring.
Foundation rnd: (RS). Ch 1. (2 sc 
in ring. Ch 2) 4 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Join B in 
first ch-2 sp.
Cont working in rows and 
proceed in Stripe Pat along 
2 edges of Motif as follows: 
1st row:  With B, ch 1. 1 sc in 
same ch-2 sp as joint. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in 
next ch-2 sp (corner made). 1 sc 
in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next 
ch-2 sp. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
to corner sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in 
corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Join C. Break B. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are 
complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 
2nd row 21 times more, ending 
with 1 row of A. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Motifs: Sew 4 Motifs tog, 
as per diagram, to make 2 pieces 
alike to form Front and Back.
Joining Front and Back:  Rnd 1: 
With WS facing each other, join 
B with sl st to any corner st of 
Cushion. Ch 1. Working through 
both thicknesses, work sc evenly 
around 3 sides of Cushion, having 
3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow 
form. Complete rnd of sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Stitch Club Chunky Waffle Crochet Pillow
materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Main Color (MC) White (28005) 3 balls or 324 yds/297 m
Contrast A Black (28040) 3 balls or 324 yds/297 m
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Notes:  Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. Waffle Pat worked over foundation ch multiple of 4 ch +5.

With MC, ch 53.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 51 dc. 
2nd row:  Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
3rd row:  Ch 3. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Waffle Pat once more. Break MC. 
**Next row: (RS). Join A with sl st to first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next 2 rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first sc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row:  Ch 3. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows for Waffle Pat once more. Break MC.
Next row: (WS). Join A with sl st to first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next 2 rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Next row: (WS). Join MC with sl st to first sc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Waffle Pat twice more. Break MC.**
Rep from ** to ** once more. Fasten off.

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: With A, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 24" [61 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 51 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 13" [33 cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Pin in place for easier joining. With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Insert Pillow form.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge:
1 square = Approx 3" [7.5 cm] square.
11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
NOTES
1. Pillow is worked in rows of Squares beg at lower edge/foundation ch to top point.
2. Side sloped sections (shaded areas on diagram - see page 6) are filled in after primary rows of Squares are complete.
3. Pillow is worked in one piece (Big Triangle) and then folded and sewn to form “pyramid" shape.
4. To change colors, work to last loops on hook of first color, draw new color through last loops and proceed.

BIG TRIANGLE  (points D-D-D on diagram - see page 6)
Foundation ch: With A, ch 100 for 1st row of Squares.

First Row of Squares: 
1st Square (SB): 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Sc3tog over next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. Leave rem foundation ch unworked. 17 sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join B. Turn. 15 sc.

3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 13 sc.

4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join A. Turn. 11 sc.

5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 9 sc.

6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join B. Turn. 7 sc.

7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 5 sc.

8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in next sc. Join A. Turn. 3 sc.

9th row: With A, ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.

**2nd Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st at 9th row (left side) of Previous Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of Square. Work 1 sc in each of next 8 ch from foundation ch. Turn. 17 sts.

With A only, work 2nd to 9th rows as given for SB, omitting all reference to color changes.

3rd Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st at 9th row (left side) of Previous Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of Square. Work 1 sc in each of next 8 ch from foundation ch. Turn. 17 sts.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as given for SB.**

4th to 11th Squares: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more.

Second Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in joining sp between Squares 10 and 11 in First Row. Ch 8. Fasten off.

12th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 10th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 10th Square, then 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

**13th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 9th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 9th Square, then 8 sc across side of 12th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

14th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 8th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 8th Square, then 8 sc across side of 13th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.**

15th to 20th Squares: Rep from ** to ** 3 times more.

Third Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in joining sp between Squares 19 and 20 in Second Row. Ch 9.

21st Square (SB): (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Work 9 sc across top of 19th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

**22nd Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in side edge of 21st Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 21st Square, then 8 sc across top of 18th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

23rd Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in side edge of 22nd Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 22nd Square, then 8 sc across top of 17th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.**

24th to 27th Squares: Rep from ** to ** twice more.

Fourth Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in top left corner of 27th Square. Ch 8. Fasten off.

28th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 27th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 27th Square, then 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

**29th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 26th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 26th Square, then 8 sc across side of 28th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

30th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 25th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 25th Square, then 8 sc across side of 29th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.**

31st to 34th Squares: Rep from ** to ** twice more.

Fifth Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in joining sp between Square 33 and 34 in Fourth Row. Ch 9.

35th Square (SA): (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Work 9 sc across top of 33rd Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

36th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top left corner of 35th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 35th Square, then 8 sc across top of 32nd Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

37th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top left corner of 36th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 36th Square, then 8 sc across top of 31st Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.**

38th and 39th Squares: Rep from ** to ** once more.

Sixth Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in top left corner of 39th Square. Ch 8. Fasten off.

40th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 39th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 39th Square, then 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

**41st Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 38th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 38th Square, then 8 sc across side of 40th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

42nd Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 37th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 37th Square, then 8 sc across side of 41st Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.**

43rd and 44th Squares: Rep from ** to ** once more.

Seventh Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in joining sp between Square 43 and 44 in Sixth Row. Ch 9.

45th Square (SB): (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Work 9 sc across top of 43rd Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

46th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in side edge of 45th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 45th Square, then 8 sc across top of 42nd Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

47th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in side edge of 46th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down side of 46th Square, then 8 sc across top of 41st Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

Eighth Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in top left corner of 47th Square. Ch 8. Fasten off.

48th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 47th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 47th Square, then 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

49th Square (SB): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 46th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 46th Square, then 8 sc across side of 48th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

50th Square (SA): With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner of 45th Square. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of 45th Square, then 8 sc across side of 49th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

Ninth Row of Squares: With RS facing, join A with sl st in joining sp between 49th and 50th Squares in Eighth Row. Ch 9.

51st Square (SA): (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Work 9 sc across top of 49th Square. Turn. 17 sc.

Work 2nd to 9th rows as before.

Top Triangle  
1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in top right corner of 51st Square.  
Ch 1. Work 9 sc evenly across. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Join B. Turn.

3rd and 4th rows: With B, as 2nd row, joining A at end of 4th row.

5th and 6th rows: With A, as 2nd row, joining B at end of 6th row. Place markers at each end of last row.

7th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.

8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join A. Turn.

9th row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.

10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Join B. Turn.

11th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.

12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Join A. Turn.

13th row: With A, ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten

FINISHING
Mark each side (points A, B, and C shown with blue lines on diagram). Fold sides at marked points. Sew sides B to D and C to D. Stuff Pillow. Sew rem side A to D, at same time adjusting stuffing placement for desired triangle shape.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 5 skeins of 960 Orange/Navy OR 940 Red/Blue.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
instructions:
FOOTREST
Panel (Make 5)
Ch 46.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 45 hdc.
Rows 2-37: Ch 2 (does not count as st), hdc in each hdc across; turn.
Row 38: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc across; do NOT turn but pivot to work Edging.
Edging
Ch 1, working down length, * [sc in each of next 4 row-end sts, 2 sc in next row-end st] 7 times, sc in last 3 row-end sts, ch 1 *, working across foundation ch, sc in each ch across, ch 1; repeat from * to * once more; sc in each hdc across Row 38, ch 1; join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
When joining panels, place right sides together, join yarn in corner st and sc through back loops of both squares matching st for st.
Forming Cube
For sides of cube, join four panels to form a strip. Using fifth panel as top of cube, join strip to top. Lastly, join remaining ends of strip together. Turn right side out.
Cube Edging
With right side facing, join to bottom edge of cube in any stitch; ch 1, sc in each st and each ch-1 around; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Note: 1 ball of Contrast A, B and C will make 3 Pillows.
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of Black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
• Do not join at end of rnds. 
• Work rnds in continuous 
spiral, placing marker on first 
st and moving marker each 
subsequent rnd.
Flower Center (make 2).
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
8 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 
16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 
sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. Sl st in 
each of next 2 sc. Fasten off.
First Petal: With A, ch 16. Join with 
sl st to form ring, being careful not 
to twist.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch 
around. 16 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
**2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 
20 sc. 
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 
24 sc. 
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 
28 sc.
8th and 9th rnds: 1 sc in each sc 
around.
10th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of 
next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
11th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of 
next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
13th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. 12 sc.
14th rnd:  *Sc2tog. Rep from * 
around. 8 sc.
Break yarn. Weave end through 
rem sts and fasten securely. Stuff  
Petal.**
Second Petal: With B, ch 12. 
1st rnd:  Working into opposite 
side of foundation ch of First Petal, 
1 sc in each of first 4 ch. Working 
into beg ch created before first 
4 sc, 1 sc in each of first 12 ch. Do 
not join. 16 sc. PM for beg of rnd. 
Work in continuous spiral for each 
subsequent rnd. 16 sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for First 
Petal. 
Third Petal: With C, ch 12.
1st rnd: Working into opposite side 
of foundation ch of previous Petal , 
skip first 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 
4 ch. Working into beg ch created 
before first 4 sc, 1 sc in each of first 
12 ch. Do not join. 16 sc. PM for beg 
of rnd. Work in continuous spiral for 
each subsequent rnd. 16 sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for First 
Petal.
Fourth Petal: With A, work as given 
for Third Petal.
Fifth Petal: With B, work as given 
for Third Petal.
Sixth Petal: With C, work as given 
for Third Petal. 
Petal Edging:  Working across 
opposite side of foundation ch at 
base of Petal, skip first 8 ch of First 
Petal (4 ch rem before Second 
Petal). Join C with sl st in next ch of 
First Petal.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. * Working across 
opposite side of foundation ch at 
base of Petal, 1 sc in each of next 
4 ch. Rep from * around. 24 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten 
off.
Join Flower Center: Align last rnd 
of Flower Center with Petal Edging.
Working into back loops only and 
through both thicknesses, join Petal 
Edging and Flower Center with sl st 
in each st around. Join with sl st to 
first sl st.
Stuff Flower Center. Sew rem seam 
between First and Sixth Petals.
FINISHING
With black worsted weight yarn, 
embroider eyes with French Knot, 
and Mouth with Stem St.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Indigo Velvet (32007) 2 balls
Sizes U.S. 10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. 11 (8 mm) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Kfb = Increase 1 stitch by knitting into front and back of next stitch
Sl1Pwyib = Slip next stitch purlwise with yarn in back of work
Sl1Pwyif = Slip next stitch purlwise with yarn in front of work
gauge: 17 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger needles in Basketweave Pat. 11.5 sts and 23 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller needles in garter st.
instructions:
Notes:
• Basketweave Pat worked over multiples of 3 sts.
• Pillow is worked in 1 piece from side to side and folded in half and seamed on 3 sides in Finishing.
• Fringe is added in Finishing
Pillow
With larger needles, cast on 117 sts. 
1st row: (RS). Knit.
2nd row:  P3. *Sl1Pwyif. P2. Rep from * to end of row.
3rd row:  K2. *Slip next st onto cable needle and leave at front of work. K2. Slip st from cable needle onto right-hand needle without working it. Rep from * to last st. K1.
4th row: *P2. Sl1Pwyif. Rep from * to last 3 sts. P3.
5th row:  K1. *(Sl1Pwyib) twice. Slip next st onto cable needle and leave at front of work. Slip first 2 slipped sts from right-hand needle back onto left-hand needle. Slip st from cable needle onto right-hand needle without working it. K2. Rep from * to last 2 sts. K2.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows to form Basketweave Pat. Cont in Basketweave Pat until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm]. Cast off.
Fringe Strip (make 2)
With smaller needles, cast on 7 sts.
1st row: (RS). Kfb. K2tog. K4. 7 sts.
2nd row: K4. Kfb. K2tog. 7 sts.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row, noting that Fringe Strip will stretch to approx 14" [35.5 cm] when unravelled.
Cast off 2 sts. Fasten off st on right-hand needle. Slip rem 4 sts off needle and unravel every row to create looped fringe.
FINISHING
Seam Pillow: Fold pillow in half, aligning 2 side edges, sew side and bottom seams. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side seam closed.
Attach Fringe: Sew Fringe Strips to side seams of Pillow (as shown in photo).

materials: Bernat® Crushed Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 83.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end. Turn. 
82 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
7 sc. *Ch 8. Skip next 8 sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to 
end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
7 sc. *1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 1 sc 
in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat 
until piece from beg measures 40” 
[101.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. 
Fasten off.
Chain Links
With RS facing, twist 1st horizontal 
bar at foundation row to form 
loop. Draw 2nd horizontal bar 
through 1st bar without twisting. 
Rep, drawing next bar through 
previous bar without twisting 
until all bars have been worked. 
Sew last loop to second last loop 
to secure.
FINISHING
Fold piece in half. Sew 2 sides. 
Insert Pillow form. Sew rem side 
closed.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Ball each 378 Claret A, 256 Carrot B and 376 Burgundy C for Version 1
OR 1 Ball each 378 Claret A, 656 Real Teal B and 528 Medium Purple C for Version 2.
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; 13 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CENTER PANEL
With C, ch 16.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in back loops, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 13 ch, leave last ch unworked for Edging – 14 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Rows 3-49: Working in sc, [work 9 rows total with C, 11 rows with B] twice, work 9 rows with C.
Fasten off.

LEFT PANEL
Row 1: Working along long edge, join A in edge of last row with ch 1, sc in edge of each row to last ch – 50 sc.
Working in sc, work 4 more rows with A, 3 rows with C, 5 rows with B.
Fasten off.

RIGHT PANEL
Row 1: Working along opposite long edge, join A in edge of last row with ch 1, sc in edge of each row to last ch – 50 sc.
Working in sc, work 2 more rows with A, 5 rows with B, 3 rows with C, 5 rows with A, 7 rows with B.
Fasten off.

EDGING
Round 1: With right side facing and A with ch 1, sc in evenly spaced around, working 3 sc in each corner, slip st in first st to join.
Rounds 2-3: Sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in center corner sc, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Holding Pillow Front and Back pieces with wrong sides together, whipstitch pieces together along 3 sides.
Insert pillow form and sew last side closed.
These pillows are easier than they look!
First crochet the center horizontal stripes, and then add vertical stripes to each side.

materials: Bernat® Felted™ (9.2 oz/260 g; 249 yds/228 m) Amber Fleck (80021) 3 balls or 545 yds/495 m
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Hdchb = Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar below space normally worked, created by hdc at front of work (see diagram).
gauge: 12 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Pillow is worked in one piece with center back opening for pillow form.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Ch 62.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 44" [112 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS tog, fold in first and last rows to overlap by 2" [5 cm] in center back to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams with whip stitch. Turn pillow RS out. Insert pillow form.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m) or Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held together.
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked holding 2 strands of yarn together throughout.
Front and back (Make alike)
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join B with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 dc. Break A.
4th rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops only, 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in first dc. *1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in next st. 2 tr in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last st. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Join Front and Back: With WS of Back and Front tog, align sts. Join B with sl st to first sc. Working through both thicknesses to join, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of last 2 sts, stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Crushed Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds /288 m) Soft Gray (16001) 3 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Double-loop-st = Wrap yarn around index finger twice and hold behind work, insert hook into indicated stitch and between the yarn wraps and your finger, remove your finger from wraps and draw wraps through stitch (leaving part of each wrap on other side of fabric to form loops), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Note: Loops form on side of fabric that is facing away from you.
instructions:
FRONT
Ch 2.
1st rnd: (WS). (Double-loop-st. Ch 2) 4 times, all in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first st.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Double-loop-st in next st. (Double-loop-st. Ch 2. Double-loop-st) all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Double-loop-st in each st to ch-2 corner sp. (Double-loop-st. Ch 2. Double-loop-st) all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Double-loop-st in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first st.

Rep last rnd until a total of 21 rnds have been worked.

Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each st to ch-2 corner sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first st.

Rep last rnd until work measures 22" [56 cm] across.

Fasten off.

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 22" [56 cm]. Do not fasten off.

1st row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 66 sc evenly across side of ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 13½" [34 cm].

Fasten off.

FINISHING
Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Coal (10040) 2 balls or 270 yds/246 m
Contrast B Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast A Red Rust (10963) 2 balls or 270 yds/246 m
Contrast B Toasted Birch (10962) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
FRONT AND BACK (make alike).
With A, ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 33 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row twice more.
Beg working Chart, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
Work 1st to 14th rows twice.
Break B.
Next row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 3 times more.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS tog, join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Cont working in rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 2 balls 9313 Loofa
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, 1 yd (1m) of 5½" (14 cm) wide burlap ribbon
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 11 sts = 4" (10 cm) from peak to peak; 8 rows = 3¾" (9.5 cm) with smaller hook.
instructions:
PILLOW Cover
With smaller hook, ch 63.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc), *dc in next 3 ch, dc3tog, dc in next 3 ch, 3 dc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, 2 dc in last ch, turn—61 dc.
Rows 2–34: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, *dc in next 3 dc, dc3tog, dc in next 3 dc, 3 dc in next dc; repeat from * across to beginning ch, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Scallop Shell Side Section (make 4)
With larger hook, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—3 sc.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc3tog; working in ends of rows, sc in each row across side edge to Row 1, 3 sc in Row 1; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, skip last ch; working in ends of rows, 3 sc in Row 1, sc in each remaining row across; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Center Section
With larger hook, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [sc2tog] twice, turn—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Round 9: Work same as Round 7 of Side Section—26 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
