Arrange 2 Side Sections on each side of Center Section. With right sides held together and working through ends of rows, sew 5 Sections together.
Hinge
Row 1: With right side of narrow end of Shell facing, join yarn with sc in first st, evenly space 7 sc across, turn—8 sc. 
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 4 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave end tail through last row and pull tightly to gather sts. Secure tail. Do not cut or weave in.
Triangle
With larger hook, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—10 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
ASSEMBLY & FINISHING
Cover With end tail, sew side edges of Cover together. Roll seam to center back of piece. Flatten Cover and sew top edges together. Insert pillow form and sew bottom edges together.
Scallop Shell Lay burlap ribbon on a flat surface and mark approximate center. Referring to photo as a guide, position Triangle on lower half of ribbon at center mark, place Hinge on top of Triangle, and arrange Shell on burlap to desired width, with bottom edge touching top of Hinge. Pin all pieces in place. 
With end tail, sew Triangle to ribbon. Sew Shell to burlap, bunching sections slightly for a realistic appearance and lightly stuffing each section with fiberfil as sewing progresses. Work back stitches between sections to prevent fiberfill from shifting. Sew Hinge in place, lightly stuffing with fiberfill as work progresses.
Fold cut edges of ribbon under and wrap ribbon around pillow snuggly. Sew back seam.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 706 Perfect Pink A, 373 Petal Pink B, 324 Bright Yellow C, and 406 Medium Thyme D
Yarn needle, purchased 12” (30.4 cm) pillow form
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 14 sts = 4”(10 cm); 8 rows = 3” (7.6 cm) in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 7: Join D with sc in any front loop of Round 5, sc in next 4 front loops, 2 sc in next front loop, [sc in next 5 front loops, 2 sc in next front loop] 3 times; join – 28 sc. Fasten off.
Round 8: Join B with sc in a back loop of Round 7, sc in each back loop around; join in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * [2 dc in next sc] twice **, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
First (Outside) Petal Layer 
Row 1: With A, ch 7; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 7 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2 (does NOT count as hdc), 2 hdc in first sc, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in last 4 sc; turn – 8 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, hdc in last 4 hdc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc dec, hdc in next 2 hdc, sc in last 4 sc; turn – 7 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, sc dec; turn – 6 sc. 
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in 6 sc **, ch 7; turn; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn. Now work Rows 2-6 across the 6 new sts to form next petal and then repeat Row 7 to begin the next petal until 7 petals in all have been formed, end at ** on Row 7. 
Next Row: Ch 1, work 7 sc across base of each petal; turn – 49 sc.
Next row: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc dec] 7 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 42 sc. 
Fasten off.
Outside edge of petals: Rejoin yarn with sc in any outside edge st. Sc evenly around all petals. Fasten off.
Note: Leave long end of yarn at end of each piece to sew in place on pillow.
Special Abbreviation: hdc dec = [yarn over and draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
sc dec = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
PILLOW
Cover (Make 2)
With D, ch 40.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 39 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip first st, dc in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first dc (counts as first slip st), * dc in next dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from * across working last slip st in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-25: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 26: Repeat Row 2.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
FLOWER
Center
With C, ch 4.
Round 1: 11 Dc in 4th ch from hook; join with a slip st in top of ch-4.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining and in each st around; join with a slip st in back loop of first sc – 24 sc.
Rounds 3-5: Ch 1, working in back loops only sc in each sc around; join in back loop of first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, working in back loops only [sc dec] 12 times – 12 sc. Fasten off.
2nd Petal Layer
Row 1: With B, ch 5; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first sc, hdc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc; turn – 6 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, hdc in next 3 hdc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc dec, hdc in next hdc, sc in last 3 sc; turn – 5 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc dec; turn – 4 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in 4 sc **, ch 5; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn. Now work Rows 2-6 across the 4 new sts to form next petal and then repeat Row 7 to begin the next petal until 7 petals in all have been formed, end at ** on Row 7. 
Next Row: Ch 1, work 7 sc across base of each petal; turn – 49 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc dec] 7 times; turn – 42 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc dec] 7 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 35 sc. 
Fasten off.
Outside edge of petals: Rejoin yarn with sc in any outside edge st. Sc evenly around all petals. Fasten off.
3rd (Inside) Petal Layer
Row 1: With A, ch 3; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first sc, sc in last 2 sc; turn – 4 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, hdc in next 2 hdc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc dec, sc in last 2 sc; turn – 3 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc dec; turn – 2 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in 2 sc **; ch 3; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn. Now work Rows 2-6 across the 2 new sts to form next petal and then repeat Row 7 to begin the next petal until 7 petals in all have been formed, end at ** on Row 7. 
Next Row: Ch 1, work 7 sc across base of each petal; turn – 49 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc dec] 7 times; turn – 42 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc dec] 7 times; turn – 35 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, sc dec] 7 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 28 sc. Fasten off.
Outside edge of petals: Rejoin yarn with sc in any outside edge st. Sc evenly around all petals. Fasten off.
Sew layers in place on pillow front beginning with First (Outside) Petals and pinning in place before attaching. Repeat with other layers, having center of petals come between petals of previous rows. Sew center in place. Sew 3 sides of pillow cover and insert pillow form before sewing 4th side.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Main Color (MC) Sunflower (10549) 2 balls
Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Contrast A Picnic (09056) 1 ball
Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Contrast B Lush (09057) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as stitch.
FRONT 
Weaving Strips (Make 30 in MC, 15 each in A and B.)
Ch 92.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 90 hdc.
2nd row: (WS) Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
BACK (Make 2 pieces alike)
With MC, ch 89.
1st row: (RS). With MC, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 87 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Front Weaving
Lay all MC Weaving Strips, RS up, with sides of long edges touching to form a square. Use safety pins to hold Weaving Strips tog along left side. Weave 1 A Strip, RS up, through the MC Strips. Weave 1 B Strip, RS up, in opposite Strips from A. Rep with rem Strips, alternating A and B. See Diagram. When weaving is complete, secure ends of Strips with safety pins. With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides to secure ends of Strips, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with WS tog leaving opening in center back to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) Light Teal (10734) 3 balls or 534 yds/448.5 m
Contrast A Vintage White (10006) 2 balls or 440 yds/400 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of black yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
BODY
Beg at head, with MC, ch 11.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 22 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 28 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 34 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 40 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 44 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 48 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 52 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 56 sc.
12th to 17th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
18th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 52 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 48 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 44 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of rem sc around. Join. 40 sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc . 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 48 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 56 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 64 sc.
25th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join. 72 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 26th rnd until work from last inc rnd measures 20" [51 cm].
Do not fasten off.
Cont for Tail
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 66 sts.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 st in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
11th and 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
17th and 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
20th and 21st rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Stuff Head and Body firmly. Stuff rem Tail as you work.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
23rd and 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
26th and 27th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
29th and 30th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
31st rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FEET (make 4).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 44 sc.
7th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (Sc2tog) 10 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 34 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 9th rnd until work from 7th rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Proceed as follows: 
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. Join. 30 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 27 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 21 sts.
8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
Fasten off.
Stuff Feet firmly and sew to Body as shown in photos.
Large Spikes (make 9).
Spike Sides (make 2 for each Spike).
With A, ch 2.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. Ch 1. Cont around next 2 edges of Spike Side, sc evenly around, having 3 sc in foundation chain.
Fasten off.
Small Spikes (make 18).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) twice. Join. 6 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Join. 8 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) twice. Join. 10 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) twice. Join. 12 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. Join. 10 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Spike Assembly: Holding 2 Spike Sides with WS tog and stitching through back loops only, sew Sides tog, leaving bottom edge open.
Stuff Large Spikes and sew along Body and Tail as shown in photo.
Stuff 6 Small Spikes firmly and sew 3 at Head and 3 at end of tail as shown in photo.
Fold rem 12 Small spikes flat and sew opening closed. Sew 3 Small Spikes along 7th rnd of each Foot for Claws as shown in photo.
Eyes and Nose
Using length of black yarn, embroider Eyes and Nose as shown in photo using back stitch.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Stripes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Mineral Teal (05010) 2 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
FRONT
Ch 52. 
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 dc. 
Proceed in pat as follows:
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around 1st dc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm]. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 6. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off.
1st row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 2. Work 50 dc evenly across side of ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Vertical Rib Version: Pebble Beach Varg. (11019) 3 balls
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: BPdc = Yoh and draw up a loop from back to front to back around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
FPhdc = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next hdc from front to back to front. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
FPdc = Yoh and draw up a loop from front to back to front around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Basketweave and Chain Texture Versions: 18" [45.5 cm] square. Vertical Rib Version: 16" [40.5 cm] square.
instructions: Basketweave Version (Make 2 pieces alike.) Ch 52. Foundation row:  1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 dc. 1st to 4th rows:  Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *FPdc around each of next 4 sts. BPdc around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch. Turn. 5th to 8th rows: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *BPdc around each of next 4 sts. FPdc around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch. Turn. Rep 1st to 8th rows for Basketweave Pat 4 times more. Fasten off. FINISHING: Sew 2 pieces tog on 3 sides. Insert pillow form. Sew remaining side closed. Chain Texture Version (Make 2 pieces alike.) Ch 53. Foundation row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Ch 12. Rep from * to last 4 ch. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Turn. 52 sc. 1st to 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Ch 12. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn. Rep 1st to 4th rows 13 times more, then rep 1st to 3rd rows once. Beg at bottom of piece, interlock ch-12 loops in each column through each other to form a chain. Next row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc, at same time, working over top loop of ch-12 to secure. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Fasten off. FINISHING: Sew 2 pieces tog on 3 sides. Insert pillow form. Sew remaining side closed. Vertical Rib Version (Make 2 pieces alike.) Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Ch 45. Foundation row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 sts. 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. FPhdc around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. Rep last 2 rows for pat until piece from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off. FINISHING: Sew 2 pieces tog on 3 sides. Insert pillow form. Sew remaining side closed.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Piece of cardboard 4" [10 cm] wide for tassels.
abbreviations: Dcbl = Double crochet in back loop
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
• All sts are worked through back loops only.
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
With A, ch 4. See diagram on page 2. 
1st rnd:  11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
Working in back loops only, 1 dcbl in same sp as last sl st. 2 dcbl in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in next dc. *2 dcbl in next dc. 1 dcbl in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 dc.
4th rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in each of next 2 dc. *2 dcbl in next d.c. 1 dcbl in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
5th rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcbl in each of next 3 dc. *2 dcbl in next d.c. 1 dcbl in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 60 dc.
Cont as established, inc 10 dc every rnd until piece measures 16" [40.5 cm] in diameter when slightly stretched. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back tog, join A with sl st to any st of last rnd through both thicknesses.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around, inserting pillow form before completing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4 each with B, C and D).
Wrap yarn a 4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard around 30 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end and trim evenly. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end, and fasten securely. Attach Tassels evenly around edge of Pillow in following order: B, C, and D.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Black (0312) 1 ball or 204 yds/186.5 m
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 164 yds/150 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
• Pillow is worked using Tapestry Crochet techniques.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of previous row and work color in use around it.
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 20 dc (5 groups of A and 5 groups of B).
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 dc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Join. 40 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join. 50 dc.
Cont as established, inc 10 dc every rnd, until piece measures 16" [40.5 cm] in diameter. Fasten off.
FINISHING:
With WS tog, join A with sl st to any dc. Working through both Front and Back to join, proceed as follows: Joining Rnd: With A, ch 4. Remove hook and pull loop to make it larger so it will not unravel. Join B with sl st in next dc. With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 4. *Make loop larger and remove hook. Insert hook back into A loop. Bring ch-4 over ch-4 of B just worked to front. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 4. Remove hook from A and insert into B loop. With B, bring ch-4 over ch-4 worked in A to front. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 4. Rep from * around, stopping to insert pillow form before finishing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Happy Holidays (100 g/3.5 oz; 219 m/240 yds) or (300g/10.5 oz; 656 m/718 yds)
Main Color (MC) 100g 300g (31709 or 26005 Twinkle White) 2 1 ball(s)
Contrast A (31710 or 26707 Silvered Red) 2 1 ball(s)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Black and white felt for eyes.
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 alike).    
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc. Wrap yarn around right index
finger and make loop 1 inch [2.5 cm] long. Insert hook in st. Yoh and
draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – loop made)
all in first sc. *Loop in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. (Loop. 2 sc) in
last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each st to last sc. 2 sc in last sc.
Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until one side edge measures 14 ins [35.5 cm],
ending on a 4th row.
Shaping: Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 
2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 
1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. *(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw
through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next st. Yoh and draw through
all loops on hook – cluster made. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last
2 sts. Sc2tog. Break MC, join A. Turn.
Next row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog.
Turn.
Rep last row to 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw
through all loops on hook – sc3tog. Fasten off.
Nose
With A, ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch.
Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg measures 3 ins [7.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stitch A loosely around outer edge of piece and gather to form Nose.
Stuff lightly. 
Pom-pom: Wind MC around 4 fingers 80 times. Tie tightly in the
middle and leave a long end for attaching to hat. Cut loops at both
ends and trim to smooth round shape.
Finishing: Pin Front and Back tog. Join corresponding color to any
corner of pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc
across 3 sides, changing color when neccessary. Insert pillow form.
Work in sc across rem edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd:Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left
as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around, changing color vhen
neccessary. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten  off. 
Cut ovals from white felt and circles from black felt for eyes (see
diagram) and glue to front of Pillow as shown in photo. Sew Nose to
Front of Pillow as shown in photo. Attach Pom-pom to tip of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1546 Iris A and 1907 Boysenberry B
¾ yd (.75 m) light beige fabric
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Rounds 1–3 of Motif #1 = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Motif #2
Size Extra Large (make 3: 1 with A and 2 with B)
Ch 8; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in ring, *(ch 1, dc) in ring; repeat from * 5 times, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—8 dc and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *ch 5, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *ch 8, skip next ch-5 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ch 8; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-8 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, (2 sc, hdc, dc, ch 3, dc, hdc, 2 sc) in each ch-8 space; join with slip st in first sc—8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in next 3 sts and first ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in same space, (ch 8, sc) in each remaining ch-3 space, ch 8; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-8 spaces. Fasten off.

Size Large
With B, work same as Rounds 1–3 of motif #2. Fasten off.

Size Medium (make 4: 2 with each color)
Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of motif #2. Fasten off.

Size Small 
With A, work same as Round 1 of motif #2. Fasten off.

Motif #1
Size Large (make 2: 1 with each color)
Ch 8; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 15 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, *ch 2, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, 2 sc in next dc, (ch 1, dc, ch 2, dc, ch 1) in first ch-2 space, *2 sc in next 2 dc, (ch 1, dc, ch 2, dc, ch 1) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—16 dc, 32 sc, 16 ch-1 spaces, and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *ch 4, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, skip next ch-1 space, skip next dc, 5 dc in next ch-2 space, skip next dc, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * 6 times, ch 4, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; join with slip st in first sc—eight 5-dc groups, 16 sc, and 8 ch-4 spaces. Fasten off.

Size Medium (make 3: 1 with A and 2 with B)
Work same as Rounds 1–3 of motif #1. Fasten off.

Size Small (make 4: 2 with each color)
Work same as Round 1 of motif #1. Fasten off.

Motif #3 
Size Extra Large (make 3: 2 with A and 1 with B)
Ch 8; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 16 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, dc) in same st as join, ch 2, (dc, sc) in next sc, *(sc, dc) in next sc, ch 2, (dc, sc) in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—16 dc, 16 sc, and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in next st and first ch-2 space, ch 3, dc in same space, (ch 5, 2 dc) in each remaining ch-2 space, ch 5; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *ch 6, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc and 8 ch-6 spaces.

Size Large (make 3: 1 with A and 2 with B)
Work same as Rounds 1–3 of motif #3. Fasten off.

Size Medium (make 4: 2 with each color)
Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of motif #3. Fasten off.

Size Small (make 2 with A)
Work same as Round 1 of motif #3. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pillow Cover 
Cut 2 fabric squares each measuring 19” x 19” (48.5 x 48.5 cm). With right sides together and leaving ½” (12.7 mm) seam allowance, sew around 3 sides and slightly into each end of the 4th side, leaving a large opening for pillow form. Turn right side out and insert pillow form. Turning in ½” (12.7 mm) seam allowance, sew 4th side closed. Weave in ends on motifs. Using photograph as a guide for placement, whipstitch motifs to pillow with sewing needle and thread.

materials: Bernat® Mega Bulky™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m)
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
To join colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of previous color. Draw new color through loops and proceed with new color.
PILLOW FRONT
**With A, ch 32.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. *1 hdc in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 31 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sl st. *Sl st in next hdc. 1 hdc in next sl st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first hdc. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last 2 rows for pat 3 times more, then rep 2nd row once, joining B at end of last row. 
With B, work 4 rows in pat, joining A at end of last row.
With A, work 2 rows in pat, joining B at end of last row.
With B, work 4 rows in pat, joining A at end of last row.
With A, work 10 rows in pat. Fasten off. 
PILLOW BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Pillow Front.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until 30 rows in total have been worked. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew 3 sides of Pillow tog leaving 1 side open. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side closed.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds/117 m)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
½ yard [.5 m] of 45" [115 cm] wide white fabric to use behind Wing Motifs to enclose stuffing.
Susan Bates® locking stitch markers or safety pins for assembly.
measurements: Approx 24" wide x 20" tall [61 x 51 cm].
instructions:
WING MOTIF (make 8)
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp throughout). [(2 dc. Ch 1) twice. 2 dc. Ch 2. (2 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off. 6 x 2-dc clusters, 4 x ch-1 sps, 2 x ch-2 corner sps.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to first corner ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. 2 dc in first corner ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to first corner ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. 4 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 4 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.* (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join D with sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc between 2nd and 3rd dc of next 4-dc group. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. 3 dc between 2nd and 3rd dc of next 4-dc group. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.* (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.
5th rnd: Join A with sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (4 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice.* (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.

BODY (make 2)
See Diagram on page 3.
With B, ch 31.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch, placing marker on first of these 3 sts. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch, 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 62 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to marked st, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, moving marker to first of these 6 sts, 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to marked st. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times, removing marker. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 74 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Do not fasten off at end of second Body piece.

Join Body: Align 2 Body pieces with WS facing tog and second Body piece (with working yarn attached) facing on top.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around, stuffing Body lightly before end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Note: Use locking st markers or safety pins to assemble Wings.
Assemble Wings: Place 2 Wing Motifs side by side with RS facing up and corners aligned as seen in Assembly Diagram. Sew Wing Motifs tog from corner ch-2 sp to center of Motif side, ending at 2nd dc of center 4-dc cluster. Rep - joining pairs of 2 Wing Motifs to create 4 Wings.
Note: Using shapes of Assembled Wings as a guide, cut out 4 pieces of fabric to match each Wing and place against WS of Wing before completing joining rnd and final stuffing.

Left Wing: Place 2 Wings tog with WS facing each other and 2 un-seamed corner ch-2 sps pointing to the left.
Join A with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp of Wing.
Joining rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp around, working 3 sc in each corner ch-2 sp and stuffing Wing lightly before end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Right Wing: Place next 2 Wing Motifs tog with WS facing each other, and 2 un-seamed corner ch-2 sps pointing to the right.
Work Joining rnd as given for Left Wing.

Join Left Wing to Body: Center long left edge of Body along flat edge of Left Wing (see Assembly Diagram), with RS of each piece facing up. **Use locking stitch markers or safety pins to hold pieces in place. Join D with sl st to back loop only of st where Body meets Left Wing at marker. With yarn at back and working through back loops only, sl st in each st between markers to join. Fasten off.**

Join Right Wing to Body: Center long right edge of Body along flat edge of Right Wing (see Assembly Diagram), with RS of each piece facing up. Work from ** to ** as given for Join Left Wing to Body.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Motif 
See Chart on page 2.
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3. Fasten off. Skip ch‑3. Join Color 2 in first sp. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next dc. 2 dc in next sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3. Fasten off. Skip first ch‑3. Skip next dc. Join Color 3 in next sp between 2 dc.
3rd rnd: With Color 3, ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp. Rep from * twice more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3. Fasten off. Join Color 4 in first ch‑2 sp.
4th rnd: With Color 4, ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch‑2 sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch‑2 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp) twice. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3. Fasten off. Join Color 5 in first ch‑2 sp.
5th rnd: With Color 5, ch 2 (counts as hdc). (2 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in same ch‑2 sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 hdc in next sp) 3 times. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch‑2 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Skip next 3 hdc. 3 hdc in next sp) 3 times. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3. Fasten off.
Follow Guides below for colors and quantities of Motifs:
FINISHING
Front and Back (make alike): Sew Motifs tog following Seaming Diagram. Joining Front and Back: With WS facing each other, place Front and Back pieces tog. With RS of Front facing, Join A with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Cushion, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form before joining last side. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Sky (26015) 5 balls
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) Susan Bates® Xtreme™ Wood crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Purchased Pouf approx 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35 cm] high
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35 cm] high.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). 2 dc in each of next 11 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). *1 dc in next dc  2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). *(1 dc in next dc) twice. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Rep 5th rnd until work measures approx 31" [79 cm] from center ring. Fasten off.
Thread elastic through final row of dc and adjust length to fit over purchased Pouf. Join ends of elastic securely.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
instructions:
Notes:
• When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it to avoid stranding.

FRONT
With MC, ch 79.
(See Chart on page 3).
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 78 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
7th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *With MC, 1 sc in next 4 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Turn.
8th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
9th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *With MC, 1 sc in next st. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
10th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, Popcorn in next sc. (With A, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
11th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Break A. Turn.
12th and 13th rows: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
14th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
15th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
16th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *With MC, 1 sc in next sc. With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
17th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
18th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With B, Popcorn in next sc. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc) twice. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
19th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Break B. Turn.
20th and 21st rows: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
22nd to 29th rows: As 6th to 13th rows, substituting C for A.
30th to 37th rows: As 14th to 21st rows, substituting A for B.
38th to 45th rows: As 6th to 13th rows, substituting B for A.
46th to 53rd rows: As 14th to 21st rows, substituting C for B.
54th to 85th rows: As 6th to 37th rows once more.
86th to 88th rows: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 88th row.

BACK (make 2 alike)
Ch 9. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 8 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 22" [56 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
Turn work sideways and proceed as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 78 sc evenly across side of ribbing. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until work from beg (including ribbing) measures 14” [35.5 cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Overlap Back pieces to match Front measurements with ribbing at center. Place Back pieces on Front with WS facing each other. Pin Back pieces to Front to secure while joining as follows:
With RS of Front facing, join C with sl st to both thicknesses at top right corner of Pillow.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around all edges, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to st. 
Fasten off.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 foam cushion forms (approx 16 ins [40.5 cm] square)
measurements: To fit 16 in [40.5 cm] square foam cushion.
instructions: Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed. Top and Bottom (make alike) Stripe Pat Work 6 rows with MC. Work 5 rows with A. Work 5 rows with MC. Work 5 rows with B. Work 5 rows with MC. Work 5 rows with C. Work 5 rows with MC. Work 5 rows with B. Work 5 rows with MC. Work 5 rows with A. Work 6 rows with MC. These 57 rows form Stripe Pat. With MC, ch 61. 1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Ch 1. Turn. 60 sts. 2nd row:1 sc in ﬁrst sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Ch 1. Turn. 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 57 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Do not break MC. **Next row:(RS). Ch 1. Working along one side of piece, 1 sc in side of ﬁrst row. *Ch 1. Miss next row. 1 sc in side of next row. Rep from * down side. Ch 1. Turn. 58 sts. Next row:Ch 1. 1 sc in ﬁrst sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.** With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to corner of opposite side. Rep from ** to ** as given for ﬁrst side. Block to 16 ins [40.5 cm] square. Gusset: With MC, ch 9. 1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Turn. 8 sc. 2nd row: 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Turn. Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Cushion. Sew ends of Gusset. Pin Top and Gusset together with WS facing to each other, having Gusset seam at back of Cushion. Crochet Top and Gusset together. Insert Cushion foam. Crochet Bottom and Gusset together. Ties:(make 2). With MC, ch 51. Turn chain sideways. Sl st in center ‘bump’ at back of 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next bump and each bump to end of ch. Fasten off. Fold tie in half and sew center of Tie to back corners of Cushion as shown in picture. Daisy Motif: Make 2 Daisy Motifs. With Yellow, ch 5. Join in rnd. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join White with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: With White, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals. Note: 5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd. Fasten off. Loop: With MC, ch 6. Fasten off. Attach chain across back of Daisy Motif to form a loop. Slip tie through loop on back of Daisy Motif and position Daisy Motif as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Clay (606002) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bullion = (Yoh) 12 times and draw up a loop in next stitch, pulling through 12 loops on hook making sure to pull loop up to row height. Yoh and draw through 2 rem loops on hook.

Lp st(s) = Loop stitch(es) (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from back to front, to form 2" [5 cm] loop. Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
Sc  = Single crochet in front loop only of next stitch
instructions:
Note: Worked over foundation ch multiple of 2 ch.

Ch 50.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 49 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.

4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.

5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Bullion in next rem loop 3 rows below (2nd row). Skip next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Bullion in next rem loop 3 rows below. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.

8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.

9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Bullion in next rem loop 3 rows below skipping next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep 6th to 9th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 19½" [49.5 cm], ending on a 9th row.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.

Fasten off.

BACK

Ch 50.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 49 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Rep 2nd row until piece from beg measures 19½" [49.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

FINISHING

Joining Front and Back: With Back facing you and WS facing each other, holding 2 strands of yarn together, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work Lp sts evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 Lp sts in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of Lp sts. Join with sl st to first Lp st. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft™: 3 balls 4608 Wine A, 1882 Toast B, or 9522 Leaf C.
18” square pillow form for each pillow
Sewing needle and thread to match yarn.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in Subtle Texture pattern. 13 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in Waffle Weave pattern. 12 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in Braided Cables pattern.
instructions:
BACK (Worked the same for all 3 pillow fronts)
With A or B or C, ch 53.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 52 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 17½” from beginning. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band 
Ch 53.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 52 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, * ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 9 sc; repeat from * to last 5 sc; ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in last 3 sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, * sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 sc; sc in last 3 sc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

Textured Pillow Trio
Crochet stitches add interest to your décor with these three pillow covers—Subtle Texture in Wine, Waffle Weave in Toast and Braided Cables in Leaf. All feature the same back with button band, so you can remove covers and easily wash them.

FRONT-Subtle Texture
With A, ch 54.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Sc, hdc, dc) in 2nd ch from hook, skip next 2 ch, * (sc, hdc, dc) in next ch, skip next 2 ch; repeat from * to last ch; sc in last ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc) in first sc, skip next dc and hdc, * (sc, hdc, dc) in next sc, skip next dc and hdc; repeat from * to last st; sc in last sc; turn.
Repeat Row 2 for Subtle Texture pattern until 17½” from beginning. Fasten off.

Finishing
With wrong sides together, place Back over Front. Place Buttonhole Band over Back, lining up top and side edges. Pin layers in place.
Edging: With Front facing and working through Front and top edge of Button Band only, join yarn and work sc in each st across to corner, 3 sc in corner; now work through Front, side edges of Button Band and Back, sc evenly around next 3 sides, working 3 sc in corners; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sew on buttons to Back, matching buttonholes. Insert pillow form and button back closed.

FRONT-Waffle Weave
With B, ch 59.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 57 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, FPdc in next 3 dc, * dc in next dc, FPdc in next 3 dc; repeat from * to last st; dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next 3 sts, * FPdc in next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to last st; dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 for Waffle Weave pattern until 17½” from beginning. Fasten off.
Finish same as for Subtle Texture Pillow.

FRONT-Braided Cables
With C, ch 52.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 51 sts.
Rows 2 and 4: Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in each hdc across and in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, * skip next 2 sts 2 rows below, FPdtr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, working in front of last 2 sts made, FPdtr around the 2 skipped sts 2 rows below, FPtr around next 2 sts 2 rows below (skip the 6 hdc behind the sts just made), hdc in next 5 hdc; repeat from * to last st; hdc in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, * FPtr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, skip next 2 sts 2 rows below, FPdtr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, working behind last 2 sts made, FPdtr in each of the 2 skipped sts 2 rows below (skip 6 hdc behind the sts just made), hdc in next 5 hdc; repeat from * to last st; hdc in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 2-6 for Braided Cables pattern until 17½” from beginning, end wrong side row. Fasten off.
Finish same as for Subtle Texture Pillow.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Race Car Red (12001) 2 balls or 408 yds/373 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast A Vintage White (00006) 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
instructions:
PILLOW
Notes:
• Pillow is worked in 3 pieces (Front, Back, and Inner Pocket) and seamed in Finishing.
• Inner Pocket is placed in center of Pillow to create opening for hand to be inserted inside pillow
• Surface Slip Stitch Embroidery details are added in Finishing.
Front and Back (make 2 mirrored pieces)
Notes:
• To create mirrored Front and Back pieces: Front begins on 1st row as RS and will be turned at end of 42nd rnd before working Trim.
• Back begins on 1st row as WS and is NOT turned at end of 42nd rnd before working Trim.

With MC, ch 24.
1st row: (RS for Front/WS for Back). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 23 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 25 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 29 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 33 sc.
13th to 17th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 32 sts.
19th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 31 sts.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 30 sts.
21st and 22nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 29 sts.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 28 sts.
25th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 5 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 23 sc.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 22 sts.
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 5 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 17 sc.
28th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 16 sts.
29th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 12 sc.
30th to 40th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
41st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.
42nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn to work around Front only. Do Not Turn to work around Back. 8 sts. Do not fasten off.

Cont working Trim around as follows:
Trim: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge. Join with sl st in first sc. Do not fasten off.
Cont working around for Sides of Pillow as follows:
Side: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Inner Pocket
Note: Inner Pocket is worked in the round and seamed on one end.
With MC, ch 33. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 33 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm].
Fasten off.
Fold Inner Pocket flat and sew one end tog.

FINISHING
Surface Slip Stitch Embroidery: With RS of Front facing, join A with sl st to lower right corner where embroidery design begins. (See diagram on page 3). Taking care to not work tightly to prevent buckling, and keeping working yarn to WS, work surface sl st as follows: *Insert hook through next st and draw up a loop through loop on hook. Rep from * to work Surface Slip Stitch Embroidery on Front. Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY (see Assembly Diagram on page 3)
Seaming Front and Back: With WS facing each other, use yarn needle to join MC 1" [2.5 cm] from bottom right corner of Pillow along bottom edge. Sew Front and Back tog joining around last rnd of Side, ending approx 1" [2.5 cm] from bottom left corner of Pillow along bottom edge, leaving 6" [15 cm] opening for Inner Pocket.
Stuff Pillow: Stuff Pillow firmly, being sure to maintain shape of hand and stuffing evenly, noting Inner Pocket will be inserted into middle of Pillow between stuffing.
Install Inner Pocket: Insert Inner Pocket into center of 6" [15 cm] opening, sandwiching it evenly between Front and Back of Pillow, having stuffing evenly distributed around it. With yarn needle and MC, sew open edge of Inner Pocket to Pillow to finish seaming Pillow closed. Note Inner Pocket should be flat and fully hidden inside Pillow leaving a slit in bottom of Pillow to slide hand inside.
Secure Top of Inner Pocket: With yarn needle and MC, weave yarn up through center top of Inner Pocket and through top of Pillow. Fasten securely in place taking care not to bunch up Pillow. Inner Pocket is now secure and will not pull out of Pillow when wearing as a “foam finger”.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver ® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes • Body, head, hat, and arms are worked in continuous rnds (spiral) with RS always facing. Pieces are sewn tog to form Santa. • Work tightly so stuffing will not show between stitches. • To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color. • Carry color not in use loosely up inside of work.
SANTA
BODY
Beg at bottom of body, with A, ch 12.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 9 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working along opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each off next 9 ch. 2 sc in last ch. 24 sc. PM in last sc to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. 30 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 54 sc.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 60 sc.
8th to 24th rnds: 1 sc in each 1 sc around.
25th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 54 sc.
26th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 48 sc.
27th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 42 sc.
28th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sc.
29th rnd: 1 sc in each 1 sc around.
30th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sc.
31st to 36th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
37th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sc.
38th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sc. Fasten off. Stuff body.
HEAD
Beg at top of head with B, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds (spiral). PM in last sc to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each round is completed.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
8th to 15th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd: (Sc2tog) 15 times. 15 sts. Stuff head.
17th rnd: (Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in last sc. 8 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
BEARD
Wrap C around 7" [18 cm] piece of heavy cardboard 120 times. Cut wraps at one end of cardboard to make strands 14" [35.5 cm] long. Hold 2 strands tog and fold in half. Insert hook around a stitch near center of 9th rnd of head for first fringe at top of beard. Place fold on hook and draw fold through to form a loop. Insert ends of strands in loop and pull to tighten fringe. Attach 6 more fringe on one side of first fringe and 5 more fringe on other side of first fringe on 9th rnd (total of 12 fringes in first row of beard). Attach 12 more fringes on each of the next 4 rnds (10th to 13th rnds), below fringe of 9th rnd. Trim fringe to shape beard, as desired.
NOSE
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in first sc. 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail onto yarn needle and weave through the top of the 6 sts. Pull tail firmly to gather and sew in place at center of the first row of beard fringe.
EYES
With F, embroider French Knot eyes above nose. Using long tail still attached to head, sew head to neck opening of body. Take care to sew securely and avoid trapping beard in the sewing stitches.
HAT
Beg at top of hat with A, ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). PM in last sc to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each round is completed.
2nd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 8 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join D in last sc of 5th rnd. Do not break A, carry inside of Hat.
6th and 7th rnds:  With D, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A in last sc. Do not break D, carry inside of Hat.
8th rnd:  With A, (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 12 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: With A, (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D in last sc. 18 sc.
12th and 13th rnds: With D, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A in last sc.
14th and 16th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: With A, (1 sc in next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D in last sc. 24 sc.
18th and 19th rnds:  With D, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A in last sc.
20th to 22nd rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
23rd rnd: With A, (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D in last sc. 30 sc.
24th and 25th rnds:  With D, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A in last sc.
26th to 28th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
29th rnd: With A, (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D in last sc. 36 sc.
30th and 31st rnds: With D, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A in last sc.
32nd to 35th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Put hat on head. Using photograph as a guide, arrange hat above eyes and with lower edge meeting sides of beard. Using long yarn tail, sew in place.
HAT CUFF
With C, ch 40.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 39 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using long yarn tail, sew cuff around bottom of hat Sew ends of cuff tog.
ARMS
Beg at top of arm with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds (spiral). PM in last sc to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 17th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join B in last sc.
18th to 21st rnds:  With B, 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff arm lightly.
22nd rnd: With B, (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail onto yarn needle and weave through top of sts. Pull tail firmly to gather. Using photograph as a guide, sew arms in place on sides of body with top of arms near head.
SLEEVE CUFF
With C, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 14 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using long yarn tail, sew cuff around sleeve above B. Sew ends of cuff tog.
GIFT HALF (make 2)
With E, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. 9 sc. Turn.
2nd to 10th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Start working in rnds:
11th rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc (for corner). 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 3 sc in last sc (for corner). 1 sc in end of each row down side edge. Working along opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch (for corner). 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch (for corner). 1 sc in end of each row up rem side.
12th rnd:  Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd:  Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew sts of last rnd of both halves tog, stuffing gift lightly before closing seam.
Ribbon
With A, ch 120. Fasten off. Wrap ribbon around gift and tie ends into a bow.
BELT
With D, ch 65.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. 64 sc. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using long yarn tail, sew belt around waist.
BUCKLE
With F, ch 16. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in next ch)3 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 ch. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Using long yarn tail, sew buckle to front of belt.
FINISHING
Weave in any rem ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”: 4 balls 4601 Off White.
Yarn needle, stitch markers, 16” diameter round pillow form.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Pillow measures 16” diameter (not including ruffle) x 3” deep.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4½” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Front
With smaller hook, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st), 12 hdc in ring; do not join, work in continuous spiral with right side facing at all times—12 hdc.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, 2 hdc in each hdc around—24 hdc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, [hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—36 hdc.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, [hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—48 hdc.
Note: Continue to work in back loops only in all following rounds.
Round 5: [Hdc in next 3 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—60 hdc.
Round 6: [Hdc in next 4 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—72 hdc.
Round 7: [Hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—84 hdc.
Round 8: [Hdc in next 6 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—96 hdc.
Round 9: [Hdc in next 7 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—108 hdc.
Round 10: [Hdc in next 8 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—120 hdc.
Round 11: [Hdc in next 9 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—132 hdc.
Round 12: [Hdc in next 10 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—144 hdc.
Round 13: [Hdc in next 11 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—156 hdc.
Round 14: [Hdc in next 12 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—168 hdc.
Round 15: [Hdc in next 13 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—180 hdc.
Round 16: [Hdc in next 14 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—192 hdc.
Round 17: [Hdc in next 15 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—204 hdc.
Round 18: [Hdc in next 16 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—216 hdc.
Round 19: [Hdc in next 17 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 12 times—228 hdc.
Round 20: Hdc in each hdc around. Place a marker in first st of this round.
Sc in back loop of marked stitch. Fasten off.
Ruffle
Row 1: With outside edge facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sc in unworked front loop of marked st, sc in each unworked front loop to center of pillow front, turn.
Row 2: Change to larger hook, ch 1, (sc, hdc) in first sc, *dc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc; repeat from * around spiral to last st, (hdc, sc) in last sc. Fasten off.
BACK
With smaller hook, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rounds 1–19: Work Rounds 1–19 of front—228 hdc.
Sides
Rounds 20–24: Working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc around. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Place front and back with wrong sides together, and match stitches. Working through both thicknesses and working in back loops only of both layers, join yarn with slip st in any st, slip st in each st around, inserting pillow form before seam is completely closed. Fasten off and weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”, Art. E728 available in solid color 5 oz (140 g), 256 yd (234 m) and print 4 oz (113 g), 204 yd (187 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® Dreamy™: 1 ball each 8372 Rose A, 8341 Grey B, and 8311 Ivory C
For each Pillow: 18" [45.5 cm] square pillow form 4 buttons, 1" [2.5 cm] each
RED HEART® Dreamy™, Art E861 available in solid color 8.8 oz (250 g) approx. 466 yd (426 m) balls
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Pillow Cover #1: 3 repeats = 4½" [11.5 cm] and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]; Pillow Cover #2: 12 dc = 4" [10 cm] and 4 rows = 4” [10 cm]; Pillow Cover #3: 3 repeats = 3¾” [9.5 cm] and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
PILLOW COVER #1
GAUGE: 3 repeats = 4½" [11.5 cm] and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Special Stitch
CL (Cluster) = [Yarn over, insert hook and draw up a loop] 4 times in same st, yarn over and draw through all 9 loops on hook.
Front
With A, ch 46.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch-2 counts as first hdc, now and throughout) and each ch across—45 hdc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 2, *CL in next st, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * across—34 hdc, 11 CLs.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st across—45 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 sts, CL in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * across—34 hdc, 11 CLs.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until Front measures 17" [43 cm]; fasten off and weave in ends. 
Back (Make 2)
With B, ch 47.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch-3 counts as first dc, now and throughout) and each ch across—45 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each st across.
Repeat Row 2 until Back measures 10" [25.5 cm]; fasten off and weave in ends.
Finishing
Overlap Back pieces by 3" [7.5 cm] to make a 17" [43 cm] square. Referring to photo for placement, sew buttons to lower piece and push buttons between stitches of upper piece. Holding Front and Back with Wrong Sides together, with A, sc pieces together around 3 sides. Insert pillow form and sc last side together. Fasten off and weave in ends.

PILLOW COVER #2
GAUGE: 12 dc = 4" [10 cm] and 4 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Special Stitches
Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front to back and to front again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous row; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops twice.
Bpdc (Back post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back to front and to back again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous row; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops twice.
Front
With C, ch 49.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch-3 counts as first dc) and each ch across—47 dc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc, now and throughout), *Fpdc in next 3 sts, Bpdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, Fpdc in next 3 sts, dc in top of turning ch—24 Fpdc, 21 Bpdc, 2 dc.
Rows 3 & 4: Ch 2, *Bpdc in next 3 sts, Fpdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, Bpdc in next 3 sts, dc in top of turning ch—24 Bpdc, 21 Fpdc, 2 dc.
Rows 5 & 6: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 3-6 until Front measures 17" [43 cm]. 
Back (Make 2)
With A, work same as for Pillow #1.
Finishing
With C, work same as for Pillow #1.

PILLOW COVER #3
GAUGE: 3 repeats = 3¾” [9.5 cm] and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Note: The last dc of each 4-dc block will lay on top of the first 3 sts. Be sure to pull up a long enough loop so the fabric does not pucker. The stitch should look similar on both sides.
Front
With B, ch 51.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—50 sc. 
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), *skip next sc, dc in next 3 sc, dc in skipped sc (see Note); repeat from * across to last st, dc; turn—12 4-dc blocks, 2 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn—50 sc.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until Front measures 17" [43 cm].
Back (Make 2)
With C, work same as for Pillow #1.
Finishing
With B, work same as for Pillow #1.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 885 Delft B, 381 Light Blue C, 389 Hunter Green D, 365 Coffee E, 319 Cherry Red F, 313 Aran G, 320 Cornmeal H, 341 Light Grey I
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 9 sts = 2½” (6.5 cm); 6 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm) in alternating rows of double crochet and single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
