Pillow is made from 2 sides worked back and forth in rows with larger hook. All other pieces are worked separately with smaller hook and sewn to sides of pillow. Fasten off all pieces with long tails for sewing. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color. 

**PILLOW**

**Sides (make 2)**

**Grass**
With larger hook and A, ch 51.

Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—49 sts.

Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, 2 dc) in first st, *skip next 2 sts, (sc, 2 dc) in next st; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—32 dc and 17 sc.

Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn—49 sts.

Rows 4–11: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 four times.

Row 12: Repeat Row 2; change to B.

**Sky**
Row 13: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each st across, turn.

Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.

Row 15: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.

Rows 16–33: Repeat Rows 14 and 15 nine times.

Row 34: Repeat Row 14. Fasten off.

Last Round: With right side facing, join C with sc in any st, sc evenly around working sc in end of each sc row, 2 sc in end of each dc row, and 3 sc in each corner; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Note: Work all remaining pieces with smaller hook. Fasten off with long tails for sewing.

**TREE**

**Tree Top (make 3)**
Beginning at top, with D, ch 2.

Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sts.

Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sts.

Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.

Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next st, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—7 sts.

Row 5: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.

Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—9 sts.

Row 7: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.

Rows 8–11: Repeat Rows 6 and 7 twice—13 sts.

Row 12: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.

Row 13: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn. Fasten off.

**Trunk (make 3)**
With E, ch 7.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—6 sc.

Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.

**GIRL**

**Hood** 
Beginning at neck edge, with F, ch 31.

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—30 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in first 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in next sc, dc in next sc, 2 dc in next 2 sc, dc in next dc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, slip st in remaining 5 sc. Fasten off.

**Face** 
With G, ch 6.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—5 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next st, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.

Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each st to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.

Rows 4–8: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.

Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc. Fasten off.

**Dress** 
Beginning at neckline, with C, ch 8.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—7 sc.

Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—14 sc.

Rows 7–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.

**Arm (make 2)** 
With G, ch 2.

Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join or turn—6 sc. Continue in rows.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—2 sc.

Rows 3–9: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.

Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog. Fasten off.

**Cape (make 2)** 
With F, ch 7.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—6 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.

Rows 3–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.

**Leg (make 2)** 
Leaving a long tail for sewing, with E, ch 5.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 chs, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, turn—4 sc.

Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc; change to G; leave remaining sc unworked, turn—3 sc.

Rows 4–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off. 

**Basket** 
With H, ch 8.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—7 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—14 sc.

Rows 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, [sc2tog] 5 times, sc in last 2 sc, ch 10, slip st in first sc (handle made), turn.

Row 7: Slip st in each ch across, slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 

**WOLF** 

**Head and Body** 
Beginning at top of head, with I, ch 2. 

Row 1 (right side): Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—4 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.

Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each st to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—10 sc.

Rows 6 and 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 8: Ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 chs, sc in each sc across, turn—15 sc.

Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc, turn—14 sc.

Rows 11 and 12: Repeat Rows 9 and 10—13 sc.

Row 13: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.

Row 14: Repeat Row 10—11 sc.

Row 15: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc; leave remaining sc unworked, turn—8 sc.

Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.

Rows 17 and 18: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Rows 19–22: Repeat Rows 5 and 6 twice—10 sc.

Rows 23–26: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Rows 27–29: Repeat Row 16 three times—4 sc. 

Fasten off.

**Hind Leg (make 2)**
Beginning at top of leg, with I, ch 7. 

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—6 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc, turn—5 sc.

Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc; leave remaining sc unworked, turn—3 sc.

Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.

Row 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—5 sc.

Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.

Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, sc2tog, turn—5 sc.

Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc, turn—4 sc. Fasten off.

**Front Leg (make 2)** 
With I, ch 4.

Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—5 sc. 

Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.

Rows 5–10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Row 11: Ch 1, sc3tog. Fasten off.

**Ear (make 2)** 
With I, ch 4.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, 5 hdc in next ch; working on opposite of foundation ch, hdc in first ch, sc in next 2 ch. Fasten off.

**Tail** 
With I, ch 12.

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—11 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, 2 loop sts in each sc across, slip st in last sc. Fasten off.

**GRANDMA’S HOUSE**

**Front**
With G, ch 13. 

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—12 sc.

Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Rows 9–12: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—4 sc.

Row 13: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc.

Row 14: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.

**Roof**
Row 1: With right side of front facing, join F with sc in end of Row 8, 2 sc in same row; working in ends of rows of first side, sc in next 6 rows, 3 sc in st of Row 14; working in ends of rows of other side, sc in next 6 rows, 3 sc in next row. Fasten off.

**Door** 
With C, ch 6.

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—5 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, sc in end of row; working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch. Fasten off. 

**Flowers (make 5 – 2 with C and 3 with H)**
Ch 4. 

Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, skip next ch, slip st in last ch (first petal made), *ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, skip next ch, slip st in last ch of first petal (petal made); repeat from * twice—4 petals. Fasten off.

**FINISHING**
Use photograph as a guide for embroidery stitches and placement of pieces. Position all pieces with right side facing unless otherwise instructed. For best results, place and sew pieces in the order listed. To minimize finishing, draw ends of all tails to wrong side.

**Trees**
Turn trunks so that rows are vertical. Position trunks and tree tops evenly spaced along top edge of grass on pillow front and sew in place.

**Girl**
Position hood slightly over edge of face and sew in place with neck edges of hood meeting at chin. With E, embroider straight stitch bangs and satin stitch eyes. With F, embroider smiling mouth with back stitches. Color cheeks with a red crayon. Sew lower edge of head to top edge of dress. Sew arms in place, leaving hands free until basket is sewn. Do not cut yarn tail from arms. 

Wrap one cape piece around neck, keeping most of cape to front side of dress and draping over arm. Sew back of cape to wrong side of dress. Sew top edge to neckline and across ends of rows ¾” (2 cm) down front of dress. Repeat for other cape piece. 

Position top row of each leg under dress and sew in place. Place basket under one hand and sew hands in place. Sew basket in place and stuff with fiberfill before sewing is completed.

Sew girl to left half of pillow front, changing colors as needed to match each piece. Do not sew shoulder edges of cape to front.

**Wolf**
With E, embroider satin stitch nose and eyes. Embroider back stitch smile. Place ears at top of head, tucking left ear behind head. Sew in place.

With wrong side of one hind leg facing and right side of other leg facing, sew straight edge of hind legs to wrong side of body. Center front legs to front of body and sew.

Sew first row of tail to wrong side of body above right hind leg. 

Sew wolf to right half of pillow front leaving loops of tail and top of right ear unsewn.

**Grandma’s House**
With F, embroider chain stitches along inner edge of roof to cover stitches worked in ends of rows. With D, embroider straight stitches for windows. Place door vertically and sew in place. With F, embroider a French knot door handle. Sew house with lower edge at top of grass.

**Flowers** Sew in place as shown. With A, embroider a French knot in center of each flower.

**Sides**
Hold front and back sides with wrong sides together. With a long strand of C, sew through inner loops around 3 sides, insert pillow form, and sew through remaining stitches to close pillow sides. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART Soft Yarn, 5oz/140g balls, each approx 256yd/234m (acrylic)
I/9 (5.5mm) crochet hook or any size to obtain correct gauge
Two 13"/33cm square pieces of coordinating fabric
instructions:
FRONT
Starting in center with A, ch 6. Join with sl st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side) Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2 sp), (dc in ring, ch 2) 7 times – 8 dc and 8 ch-2 sps. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5.
Round 2 *Work (sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-2 sp (petal made); repeat from * around – 8 petals. Join with sl st in first sc.
Round 3 Ch 4; *sc between next 2 petals, ch 4; repeat from * around – 7 sc and 8 ch-4 sps. Join with sl st in joining sl st.
Round 4 *Work (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-4 sp (petal made); repeat from * around – 8 petals. Join with sl st in first sc.
Round 5 Repeat Round 3.
Round 6 *Work (sc, hdc, 7 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-4 sp (petal made); repeat from * around – 8 petals. Join with sl st in first sc.
Round 7 Repeat Round 3.
Round 8 *Work (sc, hdc, dc, 7 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-4 sp (petal made); repeat from * around – 8 petals. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Round 9 Join B with sl st in center tr on any petal, ch 1, sc in same tr; *ch 7, [(tr cl, ch 4) twice, tr cl] in center tr on next petal, ch 7**; sc in center tr on next petal; repeat from * 3 times more, ending final repeat at ** – 12 tr cl, 4 sc, 8 ch-7 sps and 8 ch-4 sps. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Round 10 Join C with sl st in center tr cl of any 3 tr cl group, ch 3 (counts as dc now and throughout), 2 dc in same st; *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-4 sp, [(ch 1, 3 dc) two times in next ch-7 sp] two times, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-4 sp, ch 1**; (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next tr cl; repeat from * 3 times more, ending final repeat at **; 3 dc in next tr cl; ch 1, join with hdc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 (counts as ch-3 sp) – 96 dc, 4 ch-3 sps and 28 ch-1 sps.
Rounds 11-13 Ch 3, 2 dc around post of joining hdc; *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 sp; repeat from * across to next ch-3 sp**; ch 1, work (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-3 sp; repeat from * 3 times more, ending final repeat at **; ch 1, 3 dc in last ch-sp; ch 1, join with hdc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 (counts as ch-3 sp) – 108 dc, 4 ch-3 sps and 32 ch-1 sps at end of round 11. At end of round 13 – 132 dc, 4 ch-3 sps and 40 ch-1 sps. Fasten off at end of round 13.
BACK
With C, ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side) Ch 3 (counts as dc now and throughout), 2 dc in ring, (ch 3, 3 dc in ring) 3 times; ch 1, join with hdc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 (counts as ch-3 sp now and throughout) – 12 dc and 4 ch-3 sps.
Round 2 Ch 3, dc around post of joining hdc, dc in same ch as joining and in next 2 dc; *(2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * 2 times more; 2 dc in next ch-1 sp; ch 1, join with hdc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 – 28 dc and 4 ch-3 sps.
Rounds 3-8 Ch 3, dc around post of joining hdc, dc in same ch as joining and in each dc across to next ch-3 sp; *(2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp, dc in each dc across to next ch-3 sp; repeat from * 2 times more, ending final repeat at **; 2 dc in next ch-1 sp; ch 1, join with hdc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 – 44 dc and 4 ch-3 sps at end of round 3. At end of round 8 – 124 dc and 4 ch-3 sps.
Round 9 Ch 3, 2 dc around post of joining hdc; *(ch 1, sk next 3 dc, 3 dc in next dc) two times; (ch 1, sk next 2 dc, 3 dc in next dc) 7 times; ch 1**; (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp; repeat from * 3 times more, ending final repeat at **; 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, ch 3 – 132 dc, 4 ch-3 sps and 40 ch-1 sps. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
finishing
Align two 13"/33cm pieces of fabric with right sides together. With sewing needle and thread, sew seam around 3 edges of fabric with 1⁄2" /1.25cm seam allowance. Turn fabric to right side. Insert pillow form and stitch last edge of fabric with 1⁄2"/1.25cm seam allowance. Weave in all ends on front and back pieces. With wrong sides of front and back together, whipstitch edges together, inserting pillow before joining last edge. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.6 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Gray Splash (51096) or Green Splash (51093) or Caramel Splash (51097) 2 balls or 52 yds/47.5 m
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) Susan Bates® Luxite crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 17½" [44.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 2 half double crochet (hdc) and 1.6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Pillow is worked in continuous rounds from side to side and seamed on one end.
Chain (ch) 8.
1st round (rnd): [Right Side (RS)]. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Rotate work to continue working along opposite side of foundation ch: 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. 14 hdc.
Do not join, continue working in spiral as follows:
Place marker for beginning of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses.
2nd rnd: Skip ch-1. Beg working in first hdc of last rnd. 1 hdc in each hdc around. 14 hdc.
3rd rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
Repeat 3rd rnd until work from beg measures approx 17½" [44.5 cm].
Slip st (sl st) in first hdc of last rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Insert pillow form.
Join yarn with sl st to first stitch at side edge of Pillow.
Seaming open end with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). Sl st last rnd of Pillow together (tog), working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to wrong side (WS) to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).
Fasten off.
Flat Sl St Joining Diagram
Note: Keep working yarn to WS so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

materials: Bernat® Maker Outdoor Stripes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 249 yds/228 m) Fresh Black Stripe (96004) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
8" x 24" [20.5 x 61 cm] bolster pillow form.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] diameter by 24" [61 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between sts of previous rnd (see diagram), 1 hdc in each hdc around. Do not join.
Working in a spiral, rep from * until work from 8th rnd measures approx 24" [61 cm].
Insert pillow form.
Dec as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
Fasten off. Thread end through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Plus™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 78 yds/71 m) Olive (56011) 2 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
3 yds (2.75 m) of matching smooth worsted weight yarn for seams
instructions:
PILLOW – worked in 1 piece
Chain (Ch) 35.
1st row: (Right side - RS). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 34 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working into back loop only of each stitch (st), 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) last row until Pillow measures 40" [101.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten oﬀ.
Place markers along top and bottom edges 20" [51 cm] from foundation row.
FINISHING
Fold Pillow piece in half at markers with Wrong Side (WS) facing each other. Sew bottom and top edges using matching worsted yarn.
Insert pillow form. Sew side seam using matching worsted yarn.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Main Color (MC) Jeweltone (7195) 3 O’Gos or 593 yds/542 m
Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Contrast A White (7100) 1 O’Go or 124 yds/113 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble Pompom = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] tall x 20" [51 cm] wide, excluding Bobble Pompom Edging.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plas-
tic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting! 
• Use O’Go to self-stripe as you go.

FRONT AND BACK HEART (make alike)
Lower Heart
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th to 26th rows:  Rep 3rd row 23 times more, inc 2 sts each row. 52 sts at end of 26th row.
27th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 54 sts.
29th to 44th row:  Rep 27th and 28th rows 8 times more, inc 2 sts every other row, ending on a WS row. 70 sts at end of 44th row.
45th to 56th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Proceed with Right Lobe as follows:
Right Lobe
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 34 sc. Turn leaving rem sts unworked. 34 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 32 sts.
4th and 5th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th to 8th rows:  Rep 3rd to 5th rows once more. 30 sc at end of 8th row.
9th row: As 3rd row. 28 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th to 15th rows:  As 3rd row. 18 sts at end of 15th row.
16th row:  Ch 1. Skip first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.

Left Lobe
With RS facing, skip next 2 unworked sc of 56th row of Lower Heart. Join MC with sl st to next sc. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 34 sc.
Beg with 2nd row, work as for Right Lobe across left side of Lower Heart.

Trim
1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to bottom tip of Lower Heart. Work sc evenly around Heart, making sure total number of sc is a stitch mul -
tiple of 4. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: (RS). With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join A with 
sl st to any edge st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around, leaving 
approx 4" [10 cm] hole for stuff -
ing. Stuff Pillow. Complete rnd of 
sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.

Proceed with Bobble Pompom Edging as follows:
Note: Bobble Pompom Edging worked over st multiple of 4 sts.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 4. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times all in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close - Bobble Pompom made. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook (Bobble Pompom will naturally fold in half forming a ball shape). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Bobble Pompom in 4th ch from hook. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc.  Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
ALL PILLOWS
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
With MC, ch 4.
1st rnd: 17 dc in 4th ch from hook.
Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 18 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 27 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in next dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3 45 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 54 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 63 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 72 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc) 8 times. 2 dc in last dc. 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 81 dc.
Cont in same manner, inc 9 dc every rnd until there are 126 dc. Next rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
HEART EYES EMOJI PILLOW
HEART EYES (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 10 sc.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 12 sc.
9th row: As 5th row.
10th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 14 sc.
11th row: As 5th row.
12th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 16 sc.
13th row: As 5th row.
Make Humps:
First Hump: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Second Hump: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st to next unworked sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: As 2nd to 5th rows for First Hump. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around Heart, having 3 sc in bottom of Heart. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
MOUTH
With B, ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Beg decs: 5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 24 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th to 10th rows: Rep 5th and 6th rows twice more. 20 sts at end of 10th row.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. 18 sts.
Rep last row 4 times more. 10 sts. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge of Mouth, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
LAUGH CRYING PILLOW
TEARS OF JOY (make 2)
With C, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc at end of 5th row.
6th to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
13th row: As 11th row.
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
15th row: As 11th row.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
17th row: As 11th row.
18th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
19th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around outer edge of Tear, having 3 sc in top tip. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
EYES (make 2)
With B, ch 14.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
EYEBROWS (make 2)
With B, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
MOUTH
With D, ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off at end of last row.
Next row: With RS facing, Join B with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Beg decs: 1st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 24 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 6th rows: Rep 1st and 2nd rows twice more. 20 sts at end of 6th row.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. 18 sts.
Rep last row 4 times more. 10 sts. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around edges of Mouth, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
SUNGLASSES EMOJI PILLOW
LENSES (make 2)
With B, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 12 sts.
Rep last row twice more. 8 sts. Fasten off.
Join Lenses
With RS facing of one lens, join B with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1.
Working down left side edge, work 3 sc evenly (1 sc in each edge st of last 3 rows). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc. Turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Align Lenses and sew last row worked to right side edge of second Lens.
FRAMES
With RS facing, join B with sl st to rem loop of foundation ch at top right corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around, having 3 dc top right and left corners. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, having 3 dc in each center dc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
SMILE
With B, ch 23.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 8 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING: ALL VERSIONS
Join Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back tog, join MC with sl st to any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each st around, insert pillow form at halfway point and cont around to end. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Eyes, etc to front of each Pillow as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Maker Outdoor™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 249 yds/228 m) Beach Red (99006) 2 balls
Bernat® Maker Outdoor Stripes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 249 yds/228 m) Fresh Red Stripe (96006) or Fresh Navy Stripe (96015) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 9 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked in rnds, but work is turned at the end of each rnd to alternate RS and WS rows in order to produce a straight seam. Ch 72. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Sl st in next ch. *1 hdc in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Sl st in next hdc. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm] ending on a WS rnd. Do not fasten off. Button Flap: Beg working in rows as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Sl st in next hdc. (1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc) 17 times. 36 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Sl st in next hdc. *1 hdc in next sl st. 1 sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 
Rep last row twice more.
Next row (Button Loop row): (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. (1 sc. Ch 7. Join with sl st in first ch) in next st. *1 sc in each of next sc 7 sc. (1 sc. Ch 7. Join with sl st in first ch) in next st. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 sc in each of last 6 sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew bottom seam. Sew buttons to correspond with Button Loops.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Turqua (0512) 3 balls or 593 yds/542 m
Contrast A Saffron (0234) 1 ball or 124 yds/113 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble Pompom = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] tall x 20" [51 cm] wide, excluding Bobble Pompom Edging.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK HEART (make alike)
Lower Heart
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th to 26th rows: Rep 3rd row 23 times more, inc 2 sts each row. 52 sts at end of 26th row.
27th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 54 sts.

29th to 44th row: Rep 27th and 28th rows 8 times more, inc 2 sts every other row, ending on a WS row. 70 sts at end of 44th row.
45th to 56th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Proceed with Right Lobe as follows:
Right Lobe
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 34 sc. Turn leaving rem sts unworked. 34 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 32 sts.
4th and 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Rep 3rd to 5th rows once more. 30 sc at end of 8th row.
9th row: As 3rd row. 28 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th to 15th rows: As 3rd row. 18 sts at end of 15th row.
16th row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.

Left Lobe
With RS facing, skip next 2 unworked sc of 56th row of Lower Heart. Join MC with sl st to next sc. 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 34 sc.
Beg with 2nd row, work as for Right Lobe across left side of Lower Heart.

Trim
1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to bottom tip of Lower Heart. Work sc evenly around Heart, making sure total number of sc is a stitch multiple of 4. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: (RS). With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join A with sl st to any edge st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc around, leaving approx 4" [10 cm] hole for stuffing. Stuff Pillow. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.
Proceed with Bobble Pompom Edging as follows:
Note: Bobble Pompom Edging worked over st multiple of 4 sts.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 4. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times all in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close - Bobble Pompom made. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook (Bobble Pompom will naturally fold in half forming a ball shape). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Bobble Pompom in 4th ch from hook. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 7 skeins 4313 Aran Fleck A; 2 balls each 376 Burgandy B and 633 Dark Sage C; 1 Ball 631 Light Sage D.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Throw measures 42” x 57½”. Pillow measures 15” x 15½”.
gauge: 13 sts = 3”’ 10 rows = 3” in Afghan st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
THROW
Block (Make 20)
With Afghan hook and A, ch 31.  
Row 1: First Half: Insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yo, draw yarn through st, *insert hook in next ch, yo, draw yarn through st; repeat from * across – 31 loops on hook; 
Second Half of Row: Yo, draw yarn through first loop on hook, *yo, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across until 1 loop remains on hook, (counts as first loop of next row).
Rows 2-29: Beginning with Row 2, follow Chart through Row 29.
Row 30: Slip st in each vertical st across.
Fasten off.
Block Border
With right side facing and crochet hook, join A in upper right hand corner st.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in corner st, dc in next 2 sts, [skip next st, dc in next 3 sts] across to 3 sts from corner, skip next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, ch 2, turn to work along side edge, 2 dc in edge of first row, dc in edge of each row to last row, 2 dc in last row, ch 2,  turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, [skip next st, dc in next 3 sts] across to 3 sts before next corner, skip next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, ch 2, turn to work along side edge, 2 dc in edge of first row, dc in edge of each row to last row, 2 dc in last row, ch 2, slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Arrange Blocks, 4 Blocks wide by 5 Blocks long, for Throw. 
Holding wrong sides together, join A in one Block with crochet hook, working through sts of two Blocks, slip st Blocks together. Repeat until all Blocks are joined.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing and crochet hook, join A in upper right hand corner dc, ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each dc and ch-space around, working (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each corner ch-2 space, join with slip st to top of beginning ch.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc around, working (2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in each corner ch-2 space, join with slip st to first sc. 
Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each sc around, working (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each corner ch-2 space, join with slip st to top of beginning ch 3.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each dc around, working 4 sc in each corner ch-2 space, join with slip st to first sc.
Round 5: Ch 3 with B, [dc with D in next sc, dc with B in next sc] around, end with D, join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 6: With D only, ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in same st, ch 1, skip next dc, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 56 times, [2 dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 4 times, turn to work along side edge, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 85 times, [2 dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 4 times, turn to work along next edge, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 57 times, turn to work along side edge, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 85 times, [2 dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 3 times, join with slip st to top of beginning ch 3.  Fasten off.
Round 7: Join B in top of beginning ch 3, ch 1, sc in same space, *[sc in next dc, dc in next dc 2 rounds below, pulling dc up to current level of work] across to first set of 2 dc of next corner, [sc in next 2 dc, dc in next dc 2 rounds below,  pulling dc up to current level of work] 4 times; repeat from * around to last side, [sc in next dc, dc in next dc 2 rounds below, pulling dc up to current level of work] across to first set of 2 dc of next corner, [sc in next 2 dc, dc in next dc 2 rounds below,  pulling dc up to current level of work] 3 times, join with slip st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
PILLOW  
Back
With Afghan hook and A, ch 51.
Row 1: First Half: Insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yo, draw yarn through st, *insert hook in next ch, yo, draw yarn through st; repeat from * across – 51 loops on hook; 
Second Half of Row: Yo, draw yarn through first loop on hook, *yo, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across until 1 loop remains on hook, (counts as first loop of next row).
Repeat Row 1 until 41 rows have been worked.
Last Row: Slip st in each vertical st across.
Fasten off.
Front
With Afghan hook and A, ch 51.
Row 1: First Half: Insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yo, draw yarn through st, *insert hook in next ch, yo, draw yarn through st; repeat from * across – 51 loops on hook; 
Second Half of Row: Yo, draw yarn through first loop on hook, *yo, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across until 1 loop remains on hook, (counts as first loop of next row).
Repeat Row 1 until 8 rows have been worked.
Begin Chart
Next Row: Work 5 sts, beginning with Row 3, work Chart across 31 sts, work 5 sts. 
Continue to work Chart as established until 29 rows have been worked. 
Repeat Row 1 for 6 rows. 
Last Row: Slip st in each vertical st across.  
Fasten off.
Block Border
Round 1: With right side of Front facing, join D in upper right hand corner st, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in corner st, ch 1, [skip next st, dc in next st] across to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn to work along side edge, 2 dc in edge of row, [ch 1, skip next row, dc in next row] across to last 2 rows, ch 1, skip next row, 2 dc in last row, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, 3 dc in first st, ch 1, [skip next st, dc in next st] across to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn to work along side edge, 2 dc in edge of row, [ch 1, skip next row, dc in next row] across to last 2 rows, ch 1, skip next row, 2 dc in last row, ch 1, join with slip st to top of beginning ch 3.  
Fasten off.  
Round 2: Join B in top of beginning ch, ch 1, sc in first 3 dc, *[dc in next dc 2 rounds below, pulling dc up to current level of work, sc in next dc] across to first dc of corner 5-dc, sc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around to last side, [dc in next dc 2 rounds below, pulling dc up to current level of work, sc in next dc] across to last 2 dc, sc in next 2 dc, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, *[skip next st, sc in next 3 sts] 12 times, sc in next 48 sts; repeat from * around to last side, [skip next st, sc in next 3 sts] to last 2 sts, sc in next 2 sc, join with slip st in first sc.
Repeat Border around Pillow Block.
FINISHING
Round 1: Holding wrong sides together, join B in one Block with crochet hook, working through sts of two Blocks, ch 1, sc in each st around 3 sides, turn to work along last side, sc in each st across on only 1 piece 
Fasten off. 
Insert pillow form. 
Whipstitch opening closed. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 429 yds/450 m) Cuddly Cloud (86018) or Misty Gray (86016) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] from point to point.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike)
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd/row counts as dc.
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). 3 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 25 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dc. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 35 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 45 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 55 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 65 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 75 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 85 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 95 dc.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *(2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 105 dc. Do not fasten off.
Make 1st Point: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 20 sts. Turn. 21 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc (counts as Dc2tog). 1 dc in each dc to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 19 dc.
Rep last row 8 times more. 3 dc rem.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. Dc2tog. Fasten off.
Make 2nd to 5th Points: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to next rem unworked dc of rnd 10. Work as given for 1st Point.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join yarn with sl st to last st of any Point.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc evenly around edge of Pillow working 3 dc in last st of each point and sc2tog at base of each Point (where Points meet), stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Minis™ - Kit includes 10 balls (2.1 oz/60 g; 42 yds/38 m) each; Total (21 oz/600 g; 420 yds/384 m) Classic (71001)
Contrast A Tomato 1 ball or 32 yds/30 m
Contrast B Dark Teal 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Contrast C Crystal Blue 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Contrast D Dark Gray 1 ball or 32 yds/30 m
Contrast E Burgundy Plum 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast F Sunsoaked 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join with sl st to first hdc at end of each rnd.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops, and proceed in new color.
FRONT AND BACK
Make 1 Front - Color 1 is A, Color 2 is B, Color 3 is C.
Make 1 Back - Color 1 is D, Color 2 is E, Color 3 is F.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 hdc in center of ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. 32 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join Color 2. Break Color 1. 48 hdc.
6th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
PETALS
Note: Petals are worked back and forth in rows.
First Petal
**1st row: (RS). With Color 2, ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Join Color 3. Break Color 2.
2nd and 3rd rows: With Color 3, ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
5th and 6th rows: Rep last row twice more. 4 sts.
Fasten off.**
Second Petal
Join Color 2 with sl st to next unworked hdc of 7th rnd of Flower Center.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal.
Third to Sixth Petals
Work as given for Second Petal 4 times more.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back
With WS of Front and Back tog, RS of Front facing, and Petals aligned, join B with sl st to first st of any Petal.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, *1 sc in each of 4 sts along top edge of Petal, 6 sc down side of Petal, 1 sc before next Petal. 6 sc up side of next Petal. Rep from * around, stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home DecTM (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Contrast A Steel Blue (11006) 1 ball or 105 yds/96 m
Contrast B Cream (11009) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Contrast C Aqua (11005) 1 ball or 305 yds/279 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Front
With A, ch 55.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 54 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Chart are complete. Chart is shown on page 2.
Work Chart in sc until 58th row of Chart is complete, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Fasten off at end of last row.
Back
With C, ch 55.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 54 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back measures same as Front. Fasten off.
Finishing
Holding WS of Front and Back tog, and working through both thicknesses, join C with sl st in corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each corner and inserting pillow form before joining 4th side. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Crushed Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g ; 315 yds/288 m) Burgandy (16005) 3 balls
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. 1 dcbp made.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. 1 dcfp made.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row counts as dc.
FRONT
Ch 60.
Foundation row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 58 dc. Turn.
1st to 3rd rows:  Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
4th to 6th rows:  Ch 2. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
These 6 rows form Basketweave pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a 3rd or 6th row. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 alike)
Ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm].
Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sidewise. Ch 1. Work 58 sc along side of ribbing. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 12½" [32 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Soft White (316) 2 balls or 660 yds/600 m
Contrast B Black (312) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes:
• Skeleton Pillow is worked in sections: Head (worked from jaw up, in rows); Torso (worked from bottom up, in rows); Limbs (Arms, Legs, worked in continuous rnds).
• Head and Torso will be stuffed. Limbs will not be stuffed.
HEAD (make 2)
With A, ch 17. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn. 18 sc.
12th to 18th rows: Rep 11th row. 32 sc at end of 18th row.
19th to 40th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.

TORSO (make 2)
With A, ch 33.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sc.
2nd to 46th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 46th row.
Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Skip first 13 sts. Join A with sl st in next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont on 6 center sts for neck.
Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.

LIMBS (make 4)
Note: Limbs are worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
Beg at bottom edge, with A, ch 9.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 16 sc. Place marker on last st.
2nd to 60th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around, moving marker up each rnd (see Note).
Fasten off, leaving 24" [61 cm] yarn tail (sew this edge to Torso).

EYES (make 2)
With B, make magic ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off, leaving 16" [40.5 cm] yarn tail.

MOUTH
With B, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 10 sc. Fasten off, leaving 16" [40.5 cm] yarn tail.

SPINE
With B, ch 22.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. 20 dc. Fasten off, leaving 36" [91.5 cm] yarn tail.

FINISHING
Using yarn tails, sew Eyes and Mouth onto Head as shown in photo.
With B, embroider Nose by forming an upside-down V between Eyes and Mouth using Straight Stitch.
With B, embroider Mouth by embroidering 3 vertical lines using Straight Stitch evenly across length of Mouth.
Join Head: With WS of Head pieces tog, join A with sl st through both thicknesses and work 1 rnd of sc around outer edges to join pieces leaving 8" [20.5 cm] opening to insert stuffing. Stuff Head and complete joining rnd. Fasten off.
Torso: Using yarn tail, sew Spine onto Front piece of Torso as shown in photo.
With length of B, embroider 3 horizontal lines using Back Stitch across Spine as shown in photo.

Join Torso: With WS of Torso pieces tog, join A with sl st through both thicknesses and work 1 rnd of sc around outer edges to join pieces leaving 8" [20.5 cm] opening at bottom edge to insert stuffing. Stuff Torso and complete joining rnd. Take care to stuff neck firmly. Fasten off.

Limbs: Tie knots in each Limb as shown in photo to mimic elbow and knee joints.
Using yarn tails, sew Limbs to Torso as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Contrast A Black (06004) 2 balls or 450 yds/410 m
Contrast B Cream (06003) 2 balls or 450 yds/410 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Do not break yarn at end of each rnd. Carry yarn not in use up WS of work.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 4 dc) in ring 3 times. Ch 3. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd:  With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each dc to next ch-3 sp. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each dc to next ch-3 sp. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to top of ch-3.
Cont as established, working 1 rnd each in A and B until square measures approx 28" [71 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold 3 corners to meet in center as shown in Diagram to form a square. Sew seams leaving 4th corner open to insert pillow form. Insert pillow form. Sew rem seams.

materials: Bernat® Mix Home™ (8 oz/225 g; 183 yds/167 m) In the Clouds (97008)                       8 balls
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Front
Ch 92.
1st row: (RS) 1 hdc in 3rd ch from 
hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 90 hdc.

bar created below st in previous 
row (bar is below loops normally 
worked on WS-see diagram) in 
each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg 
measures 36" [91.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Back (make 2)

1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back 
loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of 
row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from 
beg (when slightly stretched)

Proceed as follows:

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Bolster pillow form 6" [15 cm] diameter x 17" [43 cm] long.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter x 17" [43 cm] long.
instructions: Note: To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook. Drop previous color from hook, draw new color through 2 loops and proceed. BIRCH LOG End With B, ch 2. (See Chart on page 3) 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. 4th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 5th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 sts. 6th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 44 sts. Break A and B. Bark: 7th rnd: With C, ch 2 (counts as hdc). Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 8th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Working in both loops, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. Rep last rnd until work from beg of 6th rnd measures approx 17" [43 cm], joining A at end of last rnd. Break C. Pull up a long loop with A and return hook to work when Surface Sl St Lines are complete. Surface Sl St Lines: Note: Surface sl st lines are worked before End of Pillow is closed for ease of working. With RS facing, join A with sl st to any Bark area of Pillow between posts of sts. Keeping yarn at WS of work, sl st a line of any length following the direction of rows. Fasten off. Rep Surface Sl St Lines of various lengths randomly over entire Bark area as seen in picture. Insert pillow form. End: Next rnd: Return hook to A loop and tighten on hook. With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first st. 40 sts. Next rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first st. 32 sts. Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. Next rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 16 sts. Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, Sc2tog around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. OAK LOG Ends (make 2) (See Chart on page 3) With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. 4th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 5th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 sts. 6th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sts. Fasten off. Bark Note: Work is turned at end of every 2nd row. (See Chart below) With C, ch 38. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Remove hook from last st leaving a long loop to prevent unraveling. Do not turn. With RS still facing, join A with sl st to back loop only of first sc. 2nd row: (RS). With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Remove hook from last st leaving a long loop. Turn. Pick up C loop from 1st row and tighten on hook. 3rd row: (WS). With C, ch 4 (counts as tr). Working in front loops only, *1 tr in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Remove hook from last st leaving a long loop. Do not turn. With WS still facing, pick up A loop from 2nd row and tighten on hook. 4th row: (WS). With A, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Remove hook from last st leaving a long loop. Turn. Pick up C loop from 1st row and tighten on hook. 5th row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in 1st sc. *1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 tr in each of next 3 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Remove hook from last st leaving a long loop to prevent unraveling. Do not turn. With RS still facing, join A with sl st to back loop only of first sc. 6th row: (RS). As 2nd row. Rep rows 3 to 6 until work from beg measures approx 18¾" [47.5 cm], ending on a 6th row. Fasten off. Sew last row to foundation ch to form tube. FINISHING Sew one End to open side of Bark. Insert pillow form. Sew other End to rem open side.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Coral Rose (10641) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch-3.
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each of next 11 dc. Join. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 dc.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 dc.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 132 dc.
Fasten oﬀ.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS of Front and Back facing each other and final rnds aligned, join yarn with sl st through both thicknesses to any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around, inserting pillow form as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 sc.
2nd rnd: *Ch 8. Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around ending with sl st in bottom of first ch-8. Fasten oﬀ.
Fringe Tassels: Cut strands of yarn 7" [18 cm] long. Taking 10 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe in each ch-8 sp around. Trim Fringe Tassels evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast oﬀ edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons ® Classic Wool (100 g / 3.5 oz; 192 m / 210 yds)
Sizes 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) and 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
12 x 18 ins [30.5 x 45.5 cm] pillow form.
gauge: 16 sts and 12 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with smaller hook in pat. 14 dc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Pillow
With smaller hook and MC, ch 74.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 73 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat. Until work from beg measures 24 ins [61 cm]. Fasten off.
Small Flower (make 7)
With larger hook and A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: (petals) *Ch 11. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 4 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in next sc of 1st rnd. Rep from * around. 8 petals.
3rd rnd: Sl st around outer edge of each petal. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Small Flower Center (make 7)
With larger hook and MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Sew one Small Flower Center to center of each Small Flower.
Large Flower (make 3)
With larger hook and A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 16 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: (petals) *Ch 15. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 6 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * around. 16 petals.
3rd rnd: Sl st around outer edge of each petal. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Large Flower Center (make 3)
With larger hook and MC, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Sew one Large Flower Center to center of each Large Flower.
Finishing.
Sew 3 sides of Pillow tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side closed. Sew all Flowers to one side of Pillow as seen in picture.

materials: Red Heart® With Love® (7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m)
Sizes U.S. H/8 [5 mm] and U.S. P/16 [11.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
gauge: 16 dc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and one strand of yarn.
instructions:
Notes
• Front panel is worked with one strand of yarn. Back panel is worked with two strands held together throughout.
• Pillow is made from two panels of different sizes worked back and forth in rows. When joining, ease the back panel to fit the front panel.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of row counts as hdc.
PILLOW COVER 
Front Panel 
With smaller hook, ch 88. 
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 2 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 86 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. Dcfp around each of next 4 dc. *Dcbp around each of next 4 dc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. Dcbp around each of next 4 dcfp. *Dcfp around each of next 4 dcbp. Dcbp around each of next 4 dcfp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcbp. *Dcbp around each of next 4 dcfp. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcbp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th row: Ch 3. Dcbp around each of next 4 dcbp. *Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Dcbp around each of next 4 dcbp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
7th row: As 4th row.
8th and 9th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. 
10th row: Ch 3. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. *Dcbp around each of next 4 dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep 3rd to 10th rows until work from beg measures approx 24" [61 cm], ending on 3rd or 7th row. Fasten off.
Back Panel 
With 2 strands held together and larger hook, ch 44. 
1st row: (RS).  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx 24" [61 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS held tog, whipstitch edges together, tucking in ends and easing back panel to fit front panel. After 3 sides are joined, insert pillow form, then whipstitch remaining edges. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 15 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 1 Motif = 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st. Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.

MOTIF (make 18)
With A, ch 3. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Join MC with sl st to back loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. (1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc) in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * twice more. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Join. 48 sts.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in both loops, 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in each st to next corner tr. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next corner tr. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. 56 sts.
7th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around, working 3 hdc in corner dc. Join. 64 sts. Fasten off.
With RS facing each other and using MC, working through both thicknesses, crochet 3 Motifs into Strip. With MC, crochet 3 Strips tog to make Front and Back pieces. With WS facing of Front and Back tog, working through both thicknesses, join MC with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *Work 45 sc across to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Rep from * twice more. Insert pillow form. Work 45 sc to end of rnd. 1 sc in same sp as first 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. 6 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 6 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® With Love®: 1 skein each 1538 Lilac A, 1308 Tan B, 1601 Lettuce C and 1701 Hot Pink D (1 skein of each will make all 3 pillows)
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US size J-10]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 12” x 16” (30.5 x 40.6 cm) for Rectangle Pillow and 14” x 14” (35.5 x 35.5 cm) for Square Pillows
gauge: 10 dc = 4” (10 cm); Rounds 1–4 = 6” (15 ¼ cm) across for Rectangle Pillow; 13 dc = 5” (12.7 cm); 6 rows = 3½” (8.9 cm) for Square Pillows. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
Pillow Side #1
With D, ch 15.
Round 1: (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in 4th ch from hook (corner), working in top loops of beginning ch, dc in next 10 chs, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in last ch (2nd and 3rd corners), working across opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 10 chs, work 3 dc in same ch as first corner, join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off D.
Round 2: Join B with slip st in space created by join, beginning corner in same space as join, dc in top of next ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 16 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 16 dc, ending corner same space as beginning corner. Fasten off B.
Round 3: Join C with slip st in space created by join, beginning corner in same space as join, dc in top of next ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 20 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 7 dc, corner in next ch-2 space, dc in next 20 dc, ending corner same space as beginning corner.
Rounds 4–8: Beginning corner in space created by join, dc in top of next ch 3, [dc in each dc across to next ch-2 space, corner in next ch-2 space] 3 times, dc in each dc across to last corner, ending corner same space as beginning corner. Fasten off C at end of last round.
Border
With RS facing, join B with slip st in upper right hand corner, ch 1, sc in same st as beginning ch-1 and in each st across to last st, (sc, ch 1, sc) in last st (corner); turn piece, working in ends of rows, work 35 sc evenly across to next last st, sc in last st, ch 1, join in first sc. Fasten off.
Make 2 squares in each color combination as follows:
SQUARE PILLOWS 
Pillow 1:  
[2 rows in C, 2 rows in B, 2 rows in A].
Pillow 2:  
[2 rows in D, 2 rows in B, 2 rows in C].
Finished Size: 14” x 14” (35.5 x 35.5 cm)
GAUGE: 13 dc = 5” (12.7 cm); 6 rows = 3½” (8.9 cm) CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
Side (Make 2 in each color combination)
Ch 38.
Row 1: Dc in 2nd ch from hook (skipped ch does not count as a st) and in each remaining ch across, ch 1, turn—37 dc.
Row 2: Hdc in each st across, ch 2, turn. Fasten off—37 hdc.
Row 3: With RS facing, join next color with slip st in first st, ch 3, dc in same st as beginning ch-3 and in each remaining st across, ch 1, turn—37 dc.
Row 4: Repeat row 2. Fasten off—37 hdc.
Rows 5–6: With next color, repeat rows 3 & 4. Fasten off.
Rows 7–24: [Repeat rows 1–6 consecutively] 3 times.
Border
With RS facing, join B with slip st in upper right hand corner, ch 1, sc in same st as beginning ch-1 and in each st across to last st, (sc, ch 1, sc) in last st (corner); turn piece, working in ends of rows, work 35 sc evenly across to next last st, sc in last st, ch 1, join in first sc. Fasten off and weave in end.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.
With B and WS together, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across three sides, insert pillow form and slip st across last side. Fasten off and weave in end.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Sparkle™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Moonlight Sparkle (71001) or Rose Glow Sparkle (71002) 2 balls or 240 yds/219 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Rosy Posey (04862) 2 balls or 240 yds/219 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike)
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 5 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 5 sc and 5 ch-1 sps.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1) twice in same ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc Rep from * around. Join. 10 sc and 10 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
6th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
8th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
9th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
11th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
