12th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of pieces facing each other, align edges of Front and Back. Join yarn with sl st at any ch-2 sp at point of star.
Joining rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in each ch-2 corner sp and stopping to stuff Pillow before finishing round. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) Baby Pink (04200) 2 balls or 285 yds/261 m
Contrast A White (04005) 1 ball or 76 yds/71 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = (Insert hook into front loop only of next sc) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Invisible Sc2tog made.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter x 15½" [39.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Notes:
• Work rnds in continuous spiral, placing marker at first st and moving marker each subsequent rnd.
• Work sc2tog as invisible sc2tog described in Abbreviations.
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 8 sc. PM for beg of next rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
10 rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc.
11th rnd: As 6th rnd.
12th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc.
13th rnd: As 6th rnd.
14th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 80 sc.
15th rnd: As 6th rnd.
16th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 88 sc.
17th and 18th rnds: As 6th rnd.
19th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc.
20th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc.
21st rnd: As 6th rnd.
22nd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc.
23rd and 24th rnds: As 6th rnd.
25th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc.
26th rnd: As 6th rnd.
27th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 56 sts.
28th and 29th rnds: As 6th rnd.
Stuff Egg firmly.
30th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
31st and 32nd rnds: As 6th rnd.
33rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 40 sts.
34th and 35th rnds: As 6th rnd.
36th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
37th rnd: As 6th rnd.
38th rnd: 1 sc in next sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. 24 sts.
39th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
Complete stuffing Egg.
40th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and secure tightly.
SPOTS (make 1 each sizes S and M; make 2 size L).
Notes:
• Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
• Sizes S, M and L apply for size of Spots only.
All Sizes: With A, beg using magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in loop. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
Sizes M and L only:
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
Size L only:
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
All sizes: Do not fasten off.
Finish with invisible join: Cut A, leaving a long yarn tail. Pull loop on hook up until yarn tail passes through last st (no loops rem on hook). Thread yarn tail onto yarn needle. Insert needle under top 2 loops of next st from front to back. Insert needle through back loop only of last st worked, from front to back. Pull gently to close gap and make yarn tail look like st. Use yarn tail to sew Spots onto Egg as shown in picture.

pattern_name: DIAGONAL STRIPES AND TEXTURE CROCHET PILLOW
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) White (10955) 2 balls or 375 yds/343 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Alternatively, use an 18" [45.5 cm] square pillow form to overstuff the pillow for a greater pop.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Fdc (Foundation double crochet) = Ch 3 (counts as first st). Yoh. Insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dc made). *Yoh. Insert hook into ch stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dc made). Rep from * for as many fdc as called for in pattern.
gauge: 8 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Diagonal Stripes Pat.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (make 2).
1st row: (WS). Work 32 fdc. Turn.
2nd row: (RS) Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row through 7th row twice more, and then 2nd row through 6th row once more, for a total of 24 rows worked.
Edging rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across last row worked. Ch 2. Work 32 sc along side of pillow. . Ch 2. Work 32 sc across bottom loops of 1st row. Ch 2. Work 32 sc evenly along side of square. Ch 2. Join with sl st in first sc of rnd. 128 sc.
Assembly: Use stitch markers to hold WS of front and back together. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of reverse sc around 3 sides of pillow, working 3 reverse sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Insert pillow form. Reverse sc through both thicknesses of final side of pillow. Weave in ends. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Soft Essentials™ (5 oz/141 g; 131 yds/120 m) Main Color (MC) Greyhound (7405) 5 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
gauge: 11.5 sts and 6.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat. 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT
Notes:
• Worked over foundation ch multiple of 10 ch +7.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.
Stripe Pat
With MC, 1 row.
With A, 1 row.
With B, 1 row.
These 3 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 57. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. *Skip next 3 ch. 7 dc in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc into each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 4 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 4 dc in last ch. Join A. Break MC. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. *Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 7 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 7-dc cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 4-dc cluster made. Join B. Break A. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 3 dc in top of 4-dc cluster. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 7 dc in next 7-dc cluster. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join MC. Break B. Turn.
4th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as ddc). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 3-dc cluster made. *Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 3. 7-dc Cluster over next 7 sts. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Join A. Break MC. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *7 dc in top of next 7-dc cluster. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3-dc Cluster. 4 dc in top of last 3-dc Cluster. Join B. Break A. Turn.
Cont in Stripe Pat, rep 2nd to 5th rows until work from beg measures approx 19½" [49.5 cm], ending on a 4th row. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: With MC, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 19½" [49.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 54 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off. Insert Pillow form.
Fringe: Cut strands of MC 7" [18 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe in every st around 4 sides of Pillow. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) Coal (10040)  2 balls or 390 yds/355 m
Contrast A Marrakesh (10814) 2 balls or 375 yds/342 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 10 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked in the round (rnd). Carry colors when not in use loosely up inside of work. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
With MC, chain (ch) 148. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form a ring, being careful not to twist chain.
1st round (rnd):  Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in same space (sp) as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (Rep) from * to last ch. Ch 1. Skip last ch. Join A with sl st in first sc. 148 sts.
2nd rnd: With A, sl st in next ch-1 space (sp). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc.  Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join MC with sl st in first sc.
3rd rnd:  With MC, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp.  *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1.  Skip last sc. Join MC with sl st in first sc. Rep last 2 rnds for pattern (pat) until piece measures approx 30" [76 cm] from beginning (beg), ending on 3rd rnd of pat (MC). Join A. Break MC.
Closure Flap:  Work back and forth in rows as follows:
1st row:  [Right Side (RS)]. With A, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc  in same sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 35 times more. Join MC. Break A. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) 75 sts unworked.
2nd row:  [Wrong Side (WS)]. With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.  *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts.  1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Break MC. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc.  Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join MC. Break A. Turn.
4th row:  With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Turn cushion cover WS out. With WS facing, lay flat with closure flap centered along one side of top edge. Sew bottom seam.
Turn cushion cover RS out. Insert pillow form. Fold closure flap to inside. Sew on buttons evenly spaced using holes in pat stitch for buttonholes. Buttons should be inside the cushion so they are not visible.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (0319) 1 ball or 204 yds/186.5 m
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 164 yds/150 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
• Pillow is worked using Tapestry Crochet techniques.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of previous row and work color in use around it.
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike) With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 20 dc (5 groups of A and 5 groups of B).
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 dc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Join. 40 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join. 50 dc.
Cont as established, inc 10 dc every rnd, until piece measures 16" [40.5 cm] in diameter. Fasten off.
FINISHING With WS tog, join A with sl st to any dc. Working through both Front and Back to join, proceed as follows: Joining Rnd: With A, ch 4. Remove hook and pull loop to make it larger so it will not unravel. Join B with sl st in next dc. With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 4. *Make loop larger and remove hook. Insert hook back into A loop. Bring ch-4 over ch-4 of B just worked to front. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 4. Remove hook from A and insert into B loop. With B, bring ch-4 over ch-4 worked in A to front. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 4. Rep from * around, stopping to insert pillow form before finishing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Anniversary Cakes™ (35.3 oz/1000 g; 1061 yds/970 m) Fuchsia Fusion (47011) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes
• When changing colors, do not break yarn. Keep yarn not in use at back of work for next rnd.
• To create the color effect shown, you will be working from both the inside and outside of the ball – results will vary.
• The inside end of ball will be referred to as A. The outside end of ball will be referred to as B.
• You may wish to divide the ball into two at the start for ease of use.
Motif
With A - inside end of ball, ch 2.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (1 sc. Ch 2) 4 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd row: Join B – outside end of ball, with sl st in next ch-2 sp. Do not ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. (Corner made). *Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop B.
3rd row: With A, sl st in next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop A.
4th row: With B, sl st in next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop B.
5th row: With A, sl st in next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop A.
6th row: With B, sl st in next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop B.
7th row: With A, sl st in next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) to next ch-2 corner. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) to next corner. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Drop A.
Cont as established, working 1 rnd each in B and A, until piece measures 28" [71 cm], ending on any color. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold 3 corners to meet in center, with WS facing up (RS on outside), as shown in diagram to form a square. Sew seams, leaving 4th corner open to insert pillow form. Insert pillow form. Sew rem seam.

materials: Bernat® Casa™ (7.9 oz/225 g; 170 yds/155 m) Hazelnut (22021) 6 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 8 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Blanket is worked corner to corner.
• Fur section of yarn will be used for edging only.
• As Fur yarn appears in ball, cut yarn and save Fur yarn for edging when Blanket is complete.
• Rejoin yarn from ball after Fur section is removed.
• To maintain consistent texture changes, join new ball of yarn to match last texture change of previous ball. This will help to ensure texture repeat will match as closely as possible.
BLANKET
Ch 2. See Notes – do not use Fur section of yarn in Blanket Section-save for Edging.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work measured along straight edge (bottom edge) measures 50" [127 cm], ending on WS row.
Work sides even: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog over next ch-1 sp and last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until longest straight edge measured from corner (side edge) measures 62" [157.5 cm], ending on WS row.
Decrease corner: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog over next ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn. 
Rep last row until there are 5 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog over next ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Fasten off.
Fur Loop Edging: Join tog all pieces of fur yarn to create a continuous length and wind into a ball. With RS facing, join Fur yarn with sl st in any corner of Blanket. *Ch 6. Sl st in next sp along edge of Blanket. Rep from * evenly around outer edge of Blanket. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] wide x 24" [61 cm] high.
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
COVER
With A, ch 3 loosely.
1st rnd:  8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 8 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd:  With B, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd:  With A, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd:  With B, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
8th rnd:  Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
9th rnd:  With A, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
10th rnd:  Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 80 hdc.
11th rnd: With B, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 88 hdc.
12th rnd:  Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join C with sl st to first hdc. 96 hdc.
13th rnd: With C, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 104 hdc.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 12 hdc) 7 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 112 hdc.
15th rnd: With B, ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 120 hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc) 7 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Join C with sl st to first hdc. 128 hdc.
17th rnd: With C, ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 136 hdc.
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. Break C. PM at end of rnd.
Rep last rnd, working Stripe Pat: 2 rnds of B, 2 rnds of A, until work from marked rnd measures 19" [48 cm].
Cont in Stripe Pat as follows:
Next rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Hdc2tog) 8 times. 128 sts rem.
Next rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. (Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc) 7 times. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 120 sts rem.
Next rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Hdc2tog) 8 times. 112 sts rem.
Next rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. (Hdc2tog. 1 sts in each of next 12 hdc) 7 times. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 104 hdc rem.
Next rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Hdc2tog) 8 times. 96 sts rem.
Next rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. (Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc) 7 times. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 88 sts rem. Fasten off.
Insert Bean Bag. Thread 2 strands of A or B through last rnd. Pull slightly to secure cover on Bean Bag. Tie securely.

pattern_name: Crochet Granny’s Eye on You Pillow
materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds/177 m)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: ½ yard [.5 m] of 45" [115 cm] wide white fabric to cover pillow form
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK  (make 2 pieces alike)
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout). 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop only of first st. Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3, working in both loops, 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Join C with sl st to back loop only of any st (counts as first st). *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. 2 dc in next st. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next st - corner made. 2 dc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.** Skip next 7 sts. Join C with sl st to next st (counts as st). Rep from * to **.
5th rnd: Join A with sl st in back loop of corner ch-1. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same ch-1 sp. *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in back loop of next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * to ** once more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
6th rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of 2nd sc to right of first corner ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 hdc and ch-2 sp). *Working in back loops only, skip next 3 sts (sc, ch-1, sc). 3 hdc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. (2 hdc. 1 dc) in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. (3 tr. Ch 2. 3 tr) in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. (1 dc. 2 hdc) in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc.** 3 hdc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * to **. 2 hdc in same sc as first st of rnd. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.
7th rnd: Join C with sl st to first corner ch-2 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 hdc and ch-2 sp). 3 hdc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each of next 3 ch-1 sps. (3 tr. Ch 2. 3 tr) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each of next 3 ch-1 sps.** (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to ** once more. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join A with sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp). 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5 sp. Fasten off.
9th rnd: With B, as 8th rnd.
10th rnd: With C, as 8th rnd.
11th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp. *1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.
12th rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each dc around, working (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in corner ch-2 sps. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Optional: Using shapes of Back and Front as a guide, cut out 2 pieces of fabric to cover pillow form and place against Back and Front pieces before completing joining rnd.
Joining rnd: Place Front and Back tog with WS facing each other. Join A with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around, working 3 sc in each corner ch-2 sp and inserting pillow form before closing last side. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Designer Sport™”: 2 Balls each 3002 Black CA and 3101 Ivory CC, small amount of 3701 Blossom CD for the nose and mouth, small amount of 3650 Pistachio CE for the eyes.
abbreviations: dec1 (decrease 1 st) = draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dec2 (decrease 2 sts) = draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
To Change Color in Sc: work last sc before change until 2 loops are on hook, drop color in use, with next color to be used yarn over and draw through 2 loops; continue with new color.
measurements: Cat Neck Pillow measures 34” long x 8” wide.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 14 rnds = 4” in sc with 2 strands of yarn. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. With any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MUZZLE: With C, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 2 Sc in each ch around – 8 sc.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Rnds 6-8: Sc in each sc around – 40 sc.
Rnd 9: [Sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc. Break off C.
Rnd 10-HEAD: With A, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 16 times – 48 sc.
Rnds 11-21: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 22: [Sc in next 4 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
BODY-Row 23: Sc in next 19 sc, 2 sc in next sc, drop A, with C, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 19 sc; turn – 42 sc.
Row 24: Ch 1, sc in next 20 sc, 2 sc in next sc, drop C, with A, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc to end; turn – 44 sc.
Row 25: Ch 1, sc in each A sc to last A sc, 2 sc in next sc, drop A, with C, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across – 46 sc; turn.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc in each C sc, drop C, with A, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 27-40: Repeat Rows 25 and 26 – 60 sc at end of Rows 39 and 40.
Row 41: Ch 1, sc in each A sc, drop A, with C, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 42: Ch 1, sc in each CC sc, drop C, with A, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 43-70: Repeat Rows 41 and 42.
Row 71: Ch 1, sc in each sc of A to last 3 A sc, dec2 changing to C, with C, dec2 over next 3 sc, sc in each sc across; turn – 56 sc.
Row 72: Ch 1, sc in each C, drop C, with A, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 73-80: Repeat Rows 71 and 72 – 40 sc. Break off CC.
Rnd 81: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, bring opposite end around, sc in row end to form a ring – 40 sc. Now work in rnds without joining.
Rnd 82: [Sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 83: [Sc in next 2 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 84: [Sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next st] 8 times – 16 sc.
TAIL-Rnds 85-97: Sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Rnds 98-105: Skip the first sc, sc in each sc around – 8 sc at end of last rnd.
Rnd 106: Sc in every other sc around – 4 sc.
Rnd 107: Slip st in every other sc to close tip of tail – 2 sts.
Fasten off, leaving 8” end. After assembly (below), thread this end into needle, weave needle in and out of every other rnd on top of tail and into end of body. Draw yarn up, to gather tail slightly and causing tip of tail to curve. Secure and weave in end.
ASSEMBLY: Stuff and shape head, body and base of tail (DO NOT STUFF TAIL). Sew body opening closed. Thread needle with A, weave needle in and out of top of body, (just above body seam) turn and continue to weave needle in and out of bottom of body, (just below body seam). Holding starting and ending gather ends together, carefully gather sides, causing body to curve to desired shape. Tie gather ends to secure. Weave in ends.
LEGS (Make 4): With C, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 2 Sc in each ch around – 8 sc.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 4-8: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 9: [Sc in every other sc] 8 times, sc in each sc around – 16 sc. Break off C.
Rnds 10-22: With A, sc in each sc around. Stuff and shape paw (DO NOT STUFF LEG).
Row 23: Ch 1, flatten leg opening to close, turn, slip st through both thicknesses to close – 8 slip sts. Fasten off, leaving end long enough to sew leg onto body. Overlap back legs slightly when attaching.
Optional Toe: With ONE strand of yarn, stitch through paw, tighten and secure, weave in ends. Repeat twice on each paw.
EARS (Make 2): With A, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, dec1, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, dec1; turn – 5 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 5 and 6: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 – 3 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, dec2. Fasten off. Sew ear onto to head and shape.
NOSE: With D, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off. Sew nose onto muzzle.
Mouth: With 2 strands of D, embroider mouth with Split Stitch, slipping needle between the 2 strands.
Whiskers: With 1 strand of A, embroider whiskers with straight stitch.
EYES (Make 2): With E, ch 2; hdc in 2nd ch from hook, with A dc in same ch, with E (hdc, sc) all in same ch. Fasten off. Sew onto head.
HINT: After attaching eyes, push needle out through back of head, repeat same for second eye, out through the same st in back of head. Tie ends together (as you tighten, head will shape); weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 319 Cherry Red A
1 skein each 368 Paddy Green B and 316 Soft White C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
12x16" (30.5 x 40.5 cm) and 18x18" (46 x 46 cm) pillow forms
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Pillows measure 12 x 16" (30.5 x 40.5 cm) and 18 x 18" (46 x 46 cm)
gauge: 13 dc = 4" (10 cm); 8 dc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Round 1 (right side): Fdc 39 (59), rotate work 180 degrees, dc in back loop of each foundation ch, do not join, do not turn – 78 (118) dc.
Next 31 (35) rounds: Stacked dc in first dc, dc in each dc around, do not join, do not turn.
Fasten off, leaving a tail at least 48 (54)" (122 (137) cm) long.

RIBBON
With B, ch 279 (345).
Row 1 (right side): Stacked dc in first ch, dc in each of next 2 ch, * ch 3, sk 3 foundation ch, dc in each of next 3 foundation ch; repeat from * to end.
Fasten off.
With right side facing, join C with slip st in first dc,
Row 2: Sc in same dc and in each of next 2 dc, * working around ch sts of Row 1, dc in each of next 3 ch of foundation row, sc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * to end.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Insert pillow form and whip st top seam using yarn tail.
Tie Ribbon around pillow.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m) Pink Mist (86013) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Front and Back (Make 2)
Ch 2.
1st row: (WS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 6 sc.
4th to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
7th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 4th to 7th rows 6 times more. more. 48 sc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 50 sc.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep these 2 rows 6 times more. 62 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Top: Right Side Shaping:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Place marker on next st. Turn. 29 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 27 sc.
5th, 7th, 9th, 11th and 13th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 17 sc at end of 13th row.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 13 sc.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 9 sc.
19th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Left Side Shaping: Join yarn with sl st to marked st. Work from ** to ** as given for Right Side Shaping, beg in same st as last sl st.
FINISHING
Place WS of Back and Front facing each other. With RS of Front facing and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sl st to bottom point, and work in sc around outer edge of Pillow, stuffing Pillow before rnd is complete. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/435.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Contrast A Deep Sea Teal (10647) 1 ball or 487 yds/446 m
Contrast B Grass Green (10620) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 19" [48 cm] long x 16" [40.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 8 hdc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Notes:
• Each Side of Pillow is worked from center outwards. Right Side will be made first, and then Left Side will be made by working into rem loops of foundation ch.
• Ch 1 at beg of row does not count as stitch.
FRONT & BACK (Make alike)
RIGHT SIDE
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 40. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 38 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 37 sts.
**3rd row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 33 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th to 10th rows: Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 21 sts at end of 10th row.
11th row:  Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave last 3 sts unworked. 16 sts.
12th row:  Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 14 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
14th row:  Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
15th row (Note: This row is worked in sc, not hdc): Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts (Pict 1). * Draw up a loop in side of last st of previous row (Pict 2). Draw up a loop in side of last st 2 rows below (Pict 3). Draw up a loop in first unworked st 3 rows below (Pict 4). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Closing Sc3tog made (Pict 5). 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * 5 times more. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in side of st of last row.** Fasten off.
LEFT SIDE
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to rem loop of foundation ch at top of Leaf.
1st row:  Ch 1. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, Hdc2tog over first 2 ch. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 37 sts.
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Side (noting RS and WS are now reversed). Join with sl st to dc at top of Right Side. Fasten off.
SURFACE CROCHET
(See Diagram on page 3)
Lay piece flat with RS facing up. Place marker on 3rd hdc of 1st row of Right side. Place a second marker along this same row, approx 2" [5 cm] down from tip of Leaf. Holding 2 strands of B tog at back of work, insert hook from front to back at first marker and pull up a loop. Working across each hdc of this row (taking care to keep sts evenly tensioned to prevent buckling), work surface slip stitch as follows: *Insert hook into next st and draw up a loop through loop on hook. Rep from * to second marker at top. Fasten off.
Place a marker along line of surface slip stitch just worked, 3" [7.5 cm] from beg of row, and a second marker 5" [13 cm] up from first marker. Place 2 additional markers at each side edge, approx 2" [5 cm] up from center markers, and 1½" [4 cm] from each side edge. 4 markers total.
Beg Surface slip stitch line one stitch out from center line at center marker, working in a slight diagonal to side marker as shown in photo.
JOIN PIECES
With WS tog, and pieces aligned, join 2 strands of A with sl st to bottom of Pillow at center. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around to join. Leave a 4" [10 cm] space to stuff Pillow before completing rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Use separate balls of yarn for each area of color in the design. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. 
FRONT
With B, ch 58. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 57 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Note: Chart is shown on page 2.
Work Chart in sc until 56th row of Chart is complete, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right and joining A at end of last row.
Next 2 rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Fasten off at end of last row.
BACK
With D, ch 58.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 57 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back measures same as Front. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Holding WS of Front and Back tog and working through both thicknesses, join D with sl st in corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each corner and inserting pillow form before joining 4th side. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 341 Light Grey B, 313 Aran C, 706 Perfect Pink D, 885 Delft E, 672 Spring Green F, 324 Bright Yellow G, 319 Cherry Red H, 321 Gold I, 254 Pumpkin J, 360 Café Latte K, and 312 Black L
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, stitch marker, 16” (40.5 cm) square pillow form, red crayon (to shade cheeks), black embroidery floss (for facial features), 8” (20.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 9 sts = 2½” (6.5 cm); 6 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm) in alternating rows of double crochet and single crochet with larger hook.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Last round (right side): Working in ends of rows, sc evenly across first side changing to A in Row 11 (first A-colored st will be in Row 10); working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows, sc evenly across other side changing to B in Row 10 (next B-colored st will be in Row 11), 3 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Note: Work all remaining pieces with smaller hook. Fasten off with long tails for sewing. 
GIRL
Head and Body 
Beginning at top of head, with C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn—14 sc.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 12–15: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 3 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st, turn—6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sts, turn—5 sc.
Rows 17 and 18: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to D at end of Row 18, turn.
Row 19: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st; change to D, turn—7 sc.
Rows 20 and 21: Ch 4, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, sc in each remaining st, turn—15 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—17 sc.
Rows 23 and 24: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Do not fasten off.
Special Stitches 
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Special Technique
Join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.
Notes
1. Pillow is made from 2 sides worked back and forth in rows with larger hook.
2. All other pieces are worked separately with smaller hook and sewn to sides of pillow.
Fasten off all pieces with long tails for sewing.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.
PILLOW
Sides (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 50.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—49 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times.
Row 10: Repeat Row 2; change to B, turn.
Row 11: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 12–35: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twelve times.
YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
FIRST ARM
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off.
BODY
Row 1 (right side): With right side of Row 24 facing, skip first unworked st, join D with sc in next unworked st, sc in next 8 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Fasten off.
SECOND ARM
Row 1 (right side): With right side of Row 24 facing, skip next unworked st, join D with sc in next unworked st, sc in remaining sts, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
EDGING
Last Round: Ch 1, working in each st and in ends of rows, sc evenly around arms, body, and head, working 3 sc in each outer corner of arms and changing colors as needed to match each section; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
EAR (make 2) 
With C, ch 3. 
Row 1: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.
HAT
Crown
Beginning at bottom edge, with E, ch 16.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—15 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, sc2tog, *sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * once, turn—12 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, *sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * once, turn—9 sc. 
Row 9: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, sc in next st, [sc2tog] twice, turn—5 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next st, sc2tog, turn—3 sc. Fasten off.
Brim
With E, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–20: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off. 
Scarf
Neck cover
With F, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–12: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off.
Bow
With F, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–30: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off.
Button (make 3) 
With G, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
CARDINAL 
Body 
With H, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous (spiral) rounds. Place marker on first stitch and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * twice—18 sc. Do not fasten off.
Head
Continue in rows.
Row 4: Slip st in next st, ch 1, 3 sc in next 2 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, turn. 
Row 6: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 3 times, turn—3 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Beak 
With I, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Tail 
With H, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc3tog, sc in last st, turn—3 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Wing 
With H, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, 2 hdc in next ch, sc in last ch. Fasten off.
SNOWMAN
Body 
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous (spiral) rounds. Place marker on first stitch and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * 4 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off.
Head 
Work Rounds 1–4 of snowman body; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 4. Fasten off.
Carrot 
With J, ch 6. 
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in last ch. Fasten off. 
Arm (make 2) 
With K, ch 6. 
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in same ch as base of ch-2, slip st in last 3 ch. Fasten off.
SNOWFLAKE (make 10) 
With A, ch 6.
Round 1 (right side): Dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc, ch 2), [ch 2, dc] 4 times in same ch, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—6 dc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: (Sc, ch 3, sc) in first ch-2 space, slip st in next dc, *(sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-2 space, slip st in next dc; repeat from * 3 times, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last ch-2 space; join with slip st in joining slip st of previous round. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Use photograph as a guide for embroidery stitches and placement of pieces. Position all pieces with right side facing. For best results, place and sew pieces in the order listed. To minimize finishing, draw ends of all tails to wrong side of pillow sides.
GIRL
Head and Body 
With black embroidery floss, embroider a French knot for each eye, straight stitches for eyebrows and nose, and curved couch stitch for mouth. Color cheeks with red crayon. Position head and body on front side, aligning lower edges of arms and jumper with Row 1 of front side, and sew to pillow with matching colors and leaving ears unsewn. 
Braid (make 2) 
Wrap K around 8” (20.5 cm) piece of cardboard 9 times. Cut a 12” (30.5 cm) length of K and tie it tightly around wraps at one end of cardboard. Cut wraps at other end. Fold the bundle in half at tied end so that you have 18 strands; separate into 3 hanks and braid to 3¾” (9.5 cm) or desired length. Tie a short strand of yarn around the bottom of the braid and trim ends evenly. Thread tying tails through pillow on side of head 1” (2.5 cm) above each ear and secure to wrong side of front. Sew braid, if desired, to front side. Top of braids will be hidden under hat.
Hat 
Sew crown at top edge of head and braids. Position brim across bottom edge of crown and top edge of head and braids and sew in place.
Scarf
Tie bow around center of neck cover and sew in scarf place between head and body.
Buttons Sew buttons evenly spaced apart on front of body.
Bird 
With L, embroider French knot eye on head and straight stitches along left edge of Rows 4 and 5.Sew wing to Round 1 of body. Place body on top of hat, position beak to head, tail to right side of body, and sew all pieces in place.
Snowman 
With L, embroider 2 French knot eyes on head, straight stitches for mouth, and 3 French knot buttons evenly spaced in center of body. Sew body and head to back side, placing lower end of body on A-colored section. Sew carrot on head and arms on each side of body.
Snowflakes 
Randomly scatter 9 pieces across front side and sew in place; sew last piece on back side above and to the right of snowman.
Sides
Hold front and back sides with wrong sides together. 
Round 1: With larger hook and working in inner loops, join B with sc in any B-colored st of last row, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center st of each 3-sc group, changing color as needed, and inserting pillow form before 4th side is completed; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Vapor Gray (32001) 2 balls
Size U.S. 10 (6 mm) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Kfbfbf = Increase 4 stitches by knitting into front and back of next stitch twice and then knitting into front once more.

MB (Make Bobble) = Kfbfbf. 5 sts. Turn. P5. Turn. K2tog. K1. Pass second st on right-hand needle over first st and off the needle. K2tog. Slip first 2 sts from right-hand needle back onto left-hand needle. Pass second st on left-hand needle over first and off the needle. Slip rem st from left-hand needle back onto right-hand needle. Bobble complete. Push Bobble to RS of work
gauge: 12 sts and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] in garter st.
instructions:
Note: Cover will stretch slightly to fit pillow form.
FRONT (See Chart on page 2)
Cast on 65 sts. 
1st row: (WS). Knit. 
2nd and 3rd rows: Knit.
4th row:  K2. *K6. MB. K5. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
5th row: Knit.
6th and 7th rows: Knit.
8th row: K2. *K5. MB. K1. MB. K4. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
9th to 11th rows: Knit.
12th row:  K2. *K4. MB. K3. MB. K3. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
13th to 15th rows: Knit.
16th row:  K2. *K3. MB. K5. MB. K2. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
17th to 19th rows: Knit.
20th row:  K2. *K2. MB. K7. MB. K1. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
21st to 23rd rows: Knit.
24th row:  K2. *K1. MB. K9. MB. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3.
25th to 27th rows: Knit.
28th row:  K2. *MB. K5. MB. K5. Rep from * to last 3 sts. MB. K2.
29th row: Knit.
Rep 6th to 29th rows 3 times more. Then rep 6th to 27th rows once.
Next row: (RS). K2. *MB. K11. Rep from * to last 3 sts. MB. K2.
Next 3 rows: Knit.
Cast off.
BACK (Make 2 pieces alike)
Cast on 65 sts. 
Ribbing
1st row:  K1. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row.
2nd row: P1. *K1. P1. Rep from * to end of row.
3rd to 10th rows:  Rep 1st and 2nd rows 4 times more. Do not cast off. 
Proceed as follows:
11th row: Knit.
Rep last row (garter st) until work from beg measures 14.5" [37 cm].
Cast off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed section in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Working through all thicknesses, seam 4 sides of Pillow. Insert pillow form.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m)
Size U.S. P/Q/19 (15 mm) crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes: Worked in multiples of 3 + 2 ch. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. Carry color not in use loosely up side of work. 
Stripe Pattern (Pat)
With MC, work 2 rows.
With A, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat.
FRONT and BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
With MC, chain (ch) 32.
1st row: [Right side (RS)]. 2 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. 3 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to last 3 ch. Skip next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next sc. 3 sc in next space (sp). *Skip next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *Skip next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sp. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Skip next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next sc. 3 sc in next sp. *Skip next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat complete. Keeping continuity (cont) of Stripe Pat, rep 3rd and 4th rows until work from beginning (beg) measures approximately (approx) 30" [76 cm], ending with 2 rows of MC. Fasten off.
Edging: Joining Front and Back: 1st round (rnd): With Wrong Side (WS) facing each other, join A with slip stitch (sl st) to any corner stitch (st) of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9779 Berry A and 9522 Leaf B.
Split-ring stitch marker, fiberfill, yarn needle, 18” x 18” pillow.
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Heart is 4¼” across at widest part x 3” long. Pillows 18” across.
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART (Make 4)
With A, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in last ch; pivot to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 6 ch – 32 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark first st of round and move up each round.
Round 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 5 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 7 sc – 38 sc.
Round 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 8 sc – 44 sc.
Round 4: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 2 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 8 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sc – 50 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, sc in next 9 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sc; slip st in next sc – 56 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Finishing
With wrong sides of 2 hearts held together, slip st through Round 5 of both layers until 1” remains open. Add fiberfill, slip st closed. Weave in ends. Repeat with remaining 2 hearts.
BAND
With B, ch 14.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next dc and in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Band is 30” long. Fasten off. Sew ends together and slip over pillow. Weave in ends.
Add a bit of hand-crafted style to plain, inexpensive pillows. This simple trim adds a touch of warmth to your surroundings. Finishing
With B, ch until 8” long. Fasten off. Pinch center of band and tie chain around it. Attach a Heart to each end of chain.

pattern_name: A LITTLE BIT LOOPY CROCHET PILLOW
materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m) Burgundy (10014) 2 balls or 615 yds/562 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from front to back, to form 2½" [6 cm] loop. Placing tip of hook behind yarn at front of index finger, Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
instructions:
FRONT
Ch 40.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 39 sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 1st sc. 1 Lp st in each sc to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.

Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a 3rd row.
Fasten off.

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 6.

Row 1: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.

Row 2: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:

1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 39 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pouf measures 27” diameter x 15” high x 87” circumference (68.5 x 38 x 221 cm)

instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com 
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Stylish Pouf
You’ll love having this perfectly striped pouf 
around to lean on or to rest your feet. It can 
be crocheted very easily (even by a beginner) 
and then a child’s bean bag chair is used for 
the stuffing.
Round 10: *Work 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 
sts; repeat from * around; change to A—
60 sc.
Round 11: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 7 sts; repeat from * around—66 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 4 sts; repeat from * around—72 sc.
Round 13: *Sc in next 11 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * around—78 sc.
Round 14: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 9 sts; repeat from * around—84 sc.
Round 15: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 7 sts; repeat from * around; change to 
B —90 sc.
Round 16: *Sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st, 
sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around—96 sc.
Round 17: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 11 sts; repeat from * around—102 sc.
Round 18: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 14 sts; repeat from * around—108 sc.
Round 19: *Sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, 
sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around—
114 sc.
Round 20: *Work 2 sc in next st, sc in next 18 
sts; repeat from * around—120 sc. Fasten off.
Top Panel 
Work same as bottom panel but do not fasten 
off at end of Round 20. Begin side panel.
Side Panel
Round 1 (right side): Working in back loop 
only, sc in each st around; change to A.
Round 2: Sc in each st around; change to B.
Repeat Round 2 until side measures 15” (38 
cm) (or length that will fit over bean bag when
slightly stretched), changing color at end of
each round and carrying color not in use on
wrong side until next needed, ending with B
round. Fasten off A. Do not fasten off B.

FINISHING
To minimize weaving in, draw all ends to 
wrong side of piece. Insert bean bag into 
cover. Place bottom panel on bean bag. To 
close pouf, working through front loops only 
of bottom and side panels, slip st in each st 
around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten 
off. Flatten top and bottom panels.
Weave in ends.
Notes
1. Pouf is made with top, side, and bottom
panels worked in continuous rounds with
right side facing. Side panel is worked
downward from top panel.
2. Pouf cover is intended to fit snugly around
the bean bag. Purchase a bean bag that
is slightly larger than the cover. The
assembled pieces may appear to be too
small to accommodate the bean bag but
the yarn will stretch.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old
color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new
color and draw through all loops on hook
to complete stitch. Proceed with new color.
Cut old color.
POUF
Bottom Panel 
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form 
a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring, do 
not join—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of 
round and move marker up as each round is 
completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat 
from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in 
next st; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * around; change to B—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * around—42 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 4 sts; repeat from * around—48 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc 
in next 3 sts; repeat from * around—54 sc.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ Extra Thick Perfect Phasing™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 65 yds/59 m)
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
FRONT & BACK (make 2 alike).
Begin working from yarn end in lightest shade.
See Diagram on page 2.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 4 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sc as sl st. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in last corner ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 28 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each dc to next corner ch-1 sp. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 44 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each dc to next corner ch-1 sp. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 60 dc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: With WS facing tog, join yarn with sl st to any sc. Working through both thicknesses and back loops only, work sl st evenly around 3 sides. Insert pillow form. Work sl st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sl st.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cinnamon Swirl Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 407 yds/372 m)
Contrast A Mai Tai (33004) 2 balls or 524 yds/480 m
Contrast B Bay (33010) 2 balls or 492 yds/450 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: 
• When changing color at end of 1st rnd, draw new color through 2 loops on hook and proceed in new color.
• Close and secure center of magic loop by pulling beginning and end tails of center color tightly and tying ends together. Cut yarn leaving approx 1" [2.5 cm] tail – no need to weave these ends in as they will be on inside of pillow and may be used to close spaces between Motifs once complete.
• Motifs are joined as you work.
• Work yarn from center of cake, allowing color changes to occur naturally.

**FIRST FLOWER MOTIF**
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 12 hdc in Magic loop. Join B with sl st to top of first hdc. Pull tail end tightly to close center hole and secure on WS. Break B.

2nd rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). Yoh and draw up a long loop, equal in height to beg ch-3 in same hdc as sl st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 6 times. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops. Ch 3. Sl st in same hdc – first Petal made. *1 sc in next hdc. (Sl st. Ch 3. Cluster. Sl st) in next hdc – Petal Cluster made. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in last hdc. 6 petals total.

3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *1 sc in top of next Petal. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

**SECOND MOTIF (Join 1 side)**
Work from ** to ** as given for First Motif, using B for 1st rnd and joining A to work subsequent rnds. 3rd rnd: With A, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 sc in top of next Petal. Join with sl st in sc in top of any Petal of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of next Petal of adjoining Motif. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

**NEXT MOTIF (Join 2 sides)**
Using B for 1st rnd and joining A to work subsequent rnds, work from ** to ** as given for First Flower Motif.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of first (right) adjoining Motif before existing join. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in same sc as existing join. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of second (left) Motif after existing join. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

**FINISHING**
Following Assembly Diagram as color reference, join rem Motifs. Fold piece and sew Petals at either end together, matching ‘peaks and valleys’. Align ‘peaks and valleys’ along sides and sew Petals tog on one side. Insert pillow form and sew opposite side edge.

materials: RED HEART® LusterSheen®: 1 skein 615 Tea Leaf, 001 White, or 824 Medium Blue.

abbreviations: picot = ch 3, slip st in side of last st.
beg cl (beginning cluster) = ch 2, holding back last loop on hook, dc in next 2 dc, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
3-dc-cl (3 double crochet cluster) = holding back last loop on hook, dc in next 3 dc, yo and through all 4 loops on hook.
gauge: Rounds 1-2 = 1¾” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
PILLOW TOP
Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 4, tr in same sc as joining, ch 2, [2 tr in next sc, ch 2] 7 times; join to top of ch-4.
Round 3: Ch 4, tr in next tr, [ch 4, tr in next 2 tr] 7 times; (ch 1, dc in top of ch-4) to join and form last ch-4 space.
Round 4: Slip st under dc, ch 4, (dc, hdc, sc) all over dc, *sc in next st, picot, sc in next st**, (sc, hdc, dc, tr, ch 4, tr, dc, hdc, sc) all in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, end at **; (sc, hdc, dc, tr) all in last space; (ch 3, sc in top of ch-4) to join and form last ch-4 space.
Round 5: [Ch 11, 2 sc in next ch-4 space] 8 times; join with a slip st to first ch of first ch-11.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 4 ch, *5 dc in next ch, dc in next 5 ch, dc in next 2 sc, dc in next 11 ch, dc in next 2 sc**, dc in next 5 ch; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st to top of ch-3.
Round 7: Slip st in next 4 dc, ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 5, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc, ch 4, skip 4 dc, dc in next 15 dc, ch 4, skip next 4 dc**, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in 3rd ch of ch-5, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, ch 4, sc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc] 7 times, ch 4**, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 4, sc in ch-4 loop, ch 4, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 4, sc in next ch-3 Loop, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 loop] 6 times, ch 4**, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 10: Ch 3, *dc in next dc, (dc, ch 5, dc) all in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, (dc, ch 5, dc) all in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 4, sc in next ch-3 Loop, [ch 3, sc in next loop] 5 times, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 11: Ch 3, *dc in next 2 dc, †ch 5, sc in ch-5 loop, ch 5, dc in next 3 dc, ch 4†, sc in ch-4 loop, ch 4, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from † to † once more; sc in next ch-3 loop, [ch 3, sc in next loop] 4 times, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 12: Ch 3, *dc in next 2 dc, †ch 5, [sc in next ch-5 loop, ch 5] twice, dc in next 3 dc†, ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from † to † once more; ch 4, sc in next ch-3 loop, [ch 3, sc in next loop] 3 times, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 13: Ch 3, *dc in next 2 dc, †ch 5, [sc in next loop, ch 5] 3 times, dc in next 3 dc, ch 4†, sc in ch-4 loop, ch 4, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from † to † once more; sc in next ch-3 loop, [ch 3, sc in next loop] twice, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 14: Ch 3, *dc in next 2 dc, †ch 5, [sc in next loop, ch 5] 4 times, dc in next 3 dc†, ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from † to † once more; ch 4, sc in next ch-3 loop, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 loop, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 15: Ch 3, *dc in next 2 dc, †ch 5, [sc in next loop, ch 5] 5 times, dc in next 3 dc†, ch 3, sc in ch-4 loop, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from † to † once more; ch 4, sc in ch-3 loop, ch 4**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 16: Beg cl, *ch 5, [sc in next loop, ch 5] 6 times, 3-dc-cl over next 3 dc**, 3-dc-cl over next 3 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join to top of beg cl.
Round 17: Slip st in next 2 ch, ch 1, *(sc, ch 3, sc) all in 3rd ch of ch-5 loop, ch 6, sc in 4th ch from hook, ch 2; repeat from * around; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Center pillow top over front of purchased pillow; pin in place. Sew to pillow.

ABBREViATiONS: ch = chain; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble crochet; yo = yarn over; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated; † = repeat directions between † as indicated; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 500 Grey Heather B
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; and 16 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Pillow Back
With B, ch 34.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 33 sc. 
Rows 2-43: ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off at the end of Row 43.
Border
With Right Side facing, join A in top right hand corner sc. 
Ch 1, sc in each sc across, ch 1, work 36 sc evenly spaced down edge, ch 1, working across bottom of foundation ch, 
sc in each ch across, ch 1, work 36 sc evenly spaced up edge, slip st to beginning sc. Fasten off.
Pillow Front
With B, ch 34.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 33 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in back loop of first 3 sc, ch 3, slip st in top of last sc made, *sc in back loop of next 2 sc, ch 3, slip st in top of last sc made; repeat from * to last 2 sc; sc in back loop of last 2 sc; turn. Fasten off.
Row 5 (Right Side): With A, join in back loop of first sc 2 rows below; ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Rows 6 and 7: Working in both loops, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 9-12: With B, repeat Rows 5-8.
Rows 13-52: Repeat Rows 5-12, 5 times.
Border
With right side facing, join A in back loop of first sc in top right hand corner of Row 51.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across Row 51, 
ch 1, work 36 sc evenly spaced along side edge, ch 1, 
working across bottom of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, ch 1, work 36 sc evenly spaced along side edge, 
ch 1, join with slip st to beginning sc. Fasten off.
Pillow Assembly and Border
Place front and back pieces with wrong sides together. 
Rnd 1: With A, beginning at upper right corner, ch 1, 
working through both front and back scs together (sc in 
each sc across, 2 sc in corner ch-space) 3 times; working 
through single thickness of pillow front only, sc in each sc 
across, 2 sc in corner ch-space, join with slip st to front 
loop of first sc.
Rnd 2: *Ch 5, slip st in front loop of next sc*, repeat from * 
around, join with slip st in front loop of first sc. Fasten off.
Rnd 3: Join B in back loop of first sc in upper right hand 
corner 2 rnds below, ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in back loop 
of first sc, 3 dc in back loop of each sc around, join with 
slip st to top of ch-3.
Rnd 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each dc around, join with 
slip st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Insert Pillow Form into pillow cover. With yarn needle and 
matching yarn, sew opening closed.

Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next st, skip next st, (dc, 
ch 1, dc) in next st, *skip next 2 sts, (dc, ch

Row 13: Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space

Special Stitch
InV-st (Inverted V-Stitch) (worked over 3 
stitches) = Yarn over, insert hook into indicated 
stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over 
and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), 
skip next stitch, yarn over, insert hook into 
next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop (4 
loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 
loops (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw 
through all 3 loops.
Notes
1. Pillow cover is one piece worked back and
forth in rows. Cover is folded and sewn on
3 sides to encase insert.
2. Pillow insert is sewn by hand or machine
from purchased fabric and stuffed with
polyester fiberfill.

Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Rows 6 and 7: Ch 3, dc in each st across, 
turn.
