of next st, hdc in front loop only of next st] 3 
times, hdc in back loop only of next st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, turn—72 
hdc. Fasten off.

Round 10: With 2 strands held together, join 
C with slip st in any st, ch 1, hdc in front loop 
only of first st, hdc in back loop only of same 
st, [hdc in front loop only of next st, hdc in 
back loop only of next st] 4 times, *hdc in front 
loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only of 
same st, [hdc in front loop only of next st, hdc 
in back loop only of next st] 4 times; repeat 
from * 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—80 hdc.
Round 11: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 4 times, hdc in front loop only of 
next st, [hdc in back loop only of next st, hdc 
in front loop only of next st] 4 times, hdc in 
back loop only of next st; repeat from * 3 times; join 
with slip st in first hdc, turn—88 hdc.
Round 12: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 5 times, *hdc in front loop only of 
next st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 5 times; repeat from * 6 times; 
join with slip st in first hdc, turn—96 hdc.

Round 13: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 5 times, hdc in front loop only 
of next st, hdc in back loop only of next st, 
hdc in front loop only of same st, [hdc in back 
loop only of next st, hdc in front loop only of 
next st] 5 times, hdc in back loop only of next 
st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—104 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 6 times, *hdc in front loop only of 
next st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 6 times; repeat from * 6 times; join 
with slip st in first hdc, turn—112 hdc.
Round 15: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 6 times, hdc in front loop only 
of next st, hdc in back loop only of next st, 
hdc in front loop only of same st, [hdc in back 
loop only of next st, hdc in front loop only of 
next st] 6 times, hdc in back loop only of next 
st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—120 hdc. 
Round 16: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 7 times, *hdc in front loop only of 
next st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 7 times; repeat from * 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—128 hdc.

Round 17: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 7 times, hdc in front loop only 
of next st, hdc in back loop only of next st, 
hdc in front loop only of same st, [hdc in back 
loop only of next st, hdc in front loop only of 
next st] 7 times, hdc in back loop only of next 
st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—136 hdc.

Round 18: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 8 times, *hdc in front loop only of 
next st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 8 times; repeat from * 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—144 hdc.

Round 19: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 8 times, hdc in front loop only 
of next st, hdc in back loop only of next st, 
hdc in front loop only of same st, [hdc in back 
loop only of next st, hdc in front loop only of 
next st] 8 times, hdc in back loop only of next 
st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—152 hdc.

Round 20: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc in 
front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop only 
of next st] 9 times, *hdc in front loop only of 
next st, hdc in back loop only of same st, [hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 9 times; repeat from * 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—160 hdc.

Round 21: Ch 1, hdc in front loop only of first 
st, hdc in back loop only of same st, *[hdc 
in front loop only of next st, hdc in back loop 
only of next st] 9 times, hdc in front loop only 
of next st, hdc in back loop only of next st, 
hdc in front loop only of same st, [hdc in back 
loop only of next st, hdc in front loop only of 
next st] 9 times, hdc in back loop only of next 
st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first hdc, 
turn—168 hdc. Fasten off.

Bottom Panel
Work same as Top Panel with changes in color 
as follows: work Rounds 1–6 with A, Rounds 
7–9 with B, and Rounds 10–21 with C.

FINISHING
Top Edge Piping
With wrong sides held together, place a marker 
on any stitch on each of the top and side 
panels. With locking stitch markers, pin panels 
together, joining every 12th stitch of the top 
panel to every 13th stitch of the side panel. 
With larger hook and 2 strands of D held 
together, join yarn with sc in inside loops (back 
loop of side panel and front loop of top panel). 
Round 1: Ch 1, *working in inside loops (back 
loop of side panel and front loop of top panel), 
sc in next 11 sts, sc2tog working first “leg” in 
back loop of side panel and front loop of top 
panel of next st and 2nd “leg” in back loop only 
of next st of side panel; repeat from * around; 
join with slip st in first sc, turn—168 sc.

Note: Stitches made in Round 1 will not be 
visible under stitches of Round 2. This is 
intentional and creates a thick piping.

Round 2: Ch 1, working in unworked outer 
loops (front loop of top panel and back loop 
of side panel) of previous round, sc in each sc 
around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Bottom Edge Piping
Stuff bean bag in piece. With side panel and 
bottom panel, work same as top edge piping.

Diamond Accent (make 2)
With smaller hook and single strand of D, ch 
390. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Place stitch marker on every 65th stitch.
Using photograph as a guide and starting at
the midpoint on the long edge of any lower
triangle, make diamond accent on side
panel as follows: position and sew accent
diagonally across the next square securing the
first marked stitch at the midpoint on the long
edge of the next upper triangle. *Changing the
direction of the diagonal, sew accent across
next square, securing the next marked stitch
at the midpoint of the next lower triangle.**
Changing the direction of the diagonal, sew
accent across next square, securing the next
marked stitch at the midpoint of the next
upper triangle. Repeat from * around, ending
at ** and sewing last chain to first chain.
Secure and fasten off.

Beginning at the midpoint on the long edge of
any upper triangle, work 2nd strand of accent
same as first with diagonals positioned opposite
to and crossing over the first accent chains.

Top Panel Diamond Accent
With smaller hook and D, ch 180. Fasten off, 
leaving a long tail for sewing. Place stitch 
marker on every 30th stitch.
Using photograph as a guide, position chains 
as joined diamonds with marked stitches as 
top and bottom points and sew in place.

Bottom Panel Circle Accents
Small circle: With smaller hook and D, ch 88; 
join with slip st in first ch. Fasten off, leaving a 
long tail for sewing.

Large circle: With smaller hook and D, ch 130; 
join with slip st in first ch. Fasten off, leaving a 
long tail for sewing.

Sew small circle at outer edge of Round 6; 
sew large circle at outer edge of Round 9.

Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 707 Pink Tones A
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 11 rows = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Panel (Make 2 with A and 1 each with B, C, and D)
Ch 46.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 45 hdc.
Rows 2-37: Ch 2 (does not count as st), hdc in each hdc across; turn.
Row 38: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc across; do NOT turn but pivot to work Edging.
Edging
Ch 1, working down length, * [sc in each of next 4 row-end sts, 2 sc in next row-end st] 7 times, sc in last 3 row-end sts, ch 1 *, working across foundation ch, sc in each ch across, ch 1; repeat from * to * once more; sc in each hdc across Row 38, ch 1; join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
Finishing
Join panels as shown in diagram: with right sides together, join yarn in corner st and sc through back loops of both squares matching st for st.
Forming Cube
With the D panel as the top of cube, wrap the tops of the A, B, A panels around to form a cube. Join panels as before around 3 sides of the D panel and then down last side between the A and C panels to form a cube. Turn right side out.
Cube Edging
With right side facing, join D to bottom edge of cube in any stitch; ch 1, sc in each st and each ch-1 around; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m)
Contrast A Fuchsia (62061) or Jadeite (62083) 1 ball or 72 yds/66 m
Contrast B Jadeite (62083) or Fuchsia (62061) 1 ball or 72 yds/66 m
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 22" [56 cm] diameter between far points of petals.
instructions:
Version 1: 
Contrast A as Color 1. 
Contrast B as Color 2. 
Version 2: 
Contrast B as Color 1.
Contrast A as Color 2.
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
To change color, work to last loop on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through loop and proceed with new color.

FRONT & BACK (Make 2 pieces alike) 
Flower Center 
With Color 1, ch 2.  
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join Color 2. Break Color 1. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 

PETALS 
Note: Petals are worked back and forth in rows. 
First Petal 
**1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts. Fasten off.** 
Second Petal 
Join Color 2 with sl st to next unworked sc of 3rd rnd of Flower Center. 
Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal. 
Third to Sixth Petals 
Work as given for Second Petal 4 times more. 

FiNISHING 
Joining Front and Back 
With WS of Front and Back tog and Petals aligned, join Color 2 with sl st to first st of any Petal. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, *1 sc in each of 2 sts along top edge of Petal, 3 sc down side of Petal, 1 sc before next Petal. 1 sc between Petals. 3 sc up side of next Petal. Rep from * around, stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Size U.S. N/P (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
gauge: 7½ sts and 10½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color. Carry color when not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.
Back and Front (make alike)
With A, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
1st and 2nd rows of Chart are complete. Work in Chart to end of chart, noting each square represents 1 splhdc, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
Cont in chart until 50 rows have been worked. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin Front and Back to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth to dry.
With WS facing, sew 3 sides tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side.

materials: Caron® Jumbo Twirl™ (12 oz/340 g; 578 yds/528 m)
Contrast A Mustard Ribbon (83010) 1 ball or 255 yds/232 m
Contrast B Soft Sage Ribbon (83013) 1 ball or 340 yds/311 m
Contrast C Off White Ribbon (83003) 1 ball or 340 yds/311 m
Contrast D Iris Ribbon (83013) 1 ball or 340 yds/311 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a long loop, equal in height to beg ch-3. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 6 times all in same hdc as sl st. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops.
instructions:
Notes: 
• When changing color at end of 
round, draw new color through 
2 loops on hook and proceed in 
new color.
• Motifs are joined as you work.
First Motif
See diagram on page 2.
**With A, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 2 ( does not count as 
hdc). 12 hdc in magic loop. Join 
Color 2 with sl st to top of first hdc. 
Break A. Pull end tightly to close 
center hole and secure on WS.

2nd rnd: With Color 1, ch 3 (counts 
as dc). (Yoh and draw up a long loop, 
equal in height to beg ch-3. Yoh and 
draw through 2 loops on hook) 6 times 
all in same hdc as sl st. Yoh and draw 
through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and 
draw through last 2 loops. Ch 3. Sl st in same hdc – first Petal made. *1 sc in next hdc. (Sl st. Ch 3. Cluster. Ch 3. Sl st) in next hdc – Petal Cluster made. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in last hdc. 6 petals total.**

3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). *1 sc in top of next Petal. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

Second Motif (Join 1 side)
Work from ** to ** as given for First Motif.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). 1 sc in top of next Petal. Join with sl st in sc in top of any Petal of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of next Petal of adjoining Motif. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

Next Motif (Join 2 sides)
Work from ** to ** as given for First Motif.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of first (right) adjoining Motif before existing join. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in same sc as existing join. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Sl st in sc in top of second (left) Motif after existing join. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Petal. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Fasten off.

Following Assembly Diagram as color reference, work rem Motifs, joining as shown.
FINISHING
When assembly is complete, fold piece and align ‘peaks and valleys’ along sides. Sew Petals tog on one side. Insert pillow form and sew opposite side edge.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 316 Soft White MC, 347 Light Periwinkle A, 320 Cornmeal B, 20 yds 962 Seascape C.
Pillow Form shaped to fit six-sided figure.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 1 Diamond = 3½” wide x 5” long. CHECK YOUR GAUGE: Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW FRONT & BACK
Diamond  (Make 12 in MC, 6 in A, 6 in B)
Ch 5. Slip st into first ch to form a loop.
Round 1:  Slip st into ch, ch 1; * [2 sc; hdc, dc, trc, ch 1 (for end space), tr, dc, hdc, 2 sc] all into ring; repeat from *.  Slip st into top of ch-1 to join.  
Round 2:  Ch 3 (for hdc and ch 1): * [skip 1 st, hdc in next st, ch 1] twice, skip next st, [dc, ch 1, dc, ch 1] in ch-1 end space; [hdc in next st, ch 1, skip 1 st] 2 times; hdc in next st, ch 1**, hdc in next st, ch 1; repeat from *, ending at **, slip st into 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 (16 ch-1 spaces).
Round 3:  Slip st in first ch-1 space; ch 2, * hdc, hdc in same space; [2 hdc in next space] twice; [2 dc, ch 1 for end space, 2 dc] in end space; [2 hdc in next space] 3 times; [hdc, ch 1 for side space, hdc] in next space; repeat from *; slip st in top of ch-2.  Fasten off.
Arrange 12 diamonds to make flower shape as shown (each with 6 in MC, one with center in A and one with center in B).   
With wrong sides together and using matching color, slip st through back loops of diamonds to join.
Make center bobble
Attach matching flower color to any ch-1 end space at center of flower.  Ch 3 (for dc), 5 dc in same space, drop loop of last dc, insert hook through top of ch-3, grasp loop and pull through to create bobble.  Cut yarn, leaving tail to sew in place.  Using long cut end, whip sides and end of bobble to cover center ends of flower diamonds.

Flower Border
Round 1:  Join MC in any outside corner.  Ch 2, * [fpdc around next st, hdc in next hdc] 4 times; fpdc around next st; hdc in ch-1 end space; dc in next ch-1 end space of joining, hdc in next ch-1 end space, [fpdc around next st, hdc in next hdc] 4 times, fpdc around next st; [hdc, ch 2, hdc] in ch-1 side space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 (counts as last hdc).  Fasten off.
Round 2:  Join C in any ch-1 side space.  Ch 3 for dc, * [hdc in hdc, fpdc around fpdc] 5 times, hdc in hdc, fpdc around dc, hdc in hdc, [fpdc around fpdc, hdc in next hdc] 5 times, [dc, ch 1, dc] in side space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat with slip st in top of ch-3.  Fasten off.
Assemble Pillow:  With Right Side facing, join MC in any outside ch-1 corner of one side of pillow. Ch 1, sc in same space, ch 2 for hdc, * fpdc around dc, [hdc in hdc, fpdc around fpdc] to next outside corner, [hdc, ch 1, hdc] in corner; repeat from * around.  Repeat for other side of pillow. With wrong sides together, join A in any outside corner, inserting hook through matching corners of each side.  Working from left to right, ch 1, [sc, ch 1, sc] in same corner, [sc in next hdc, ch 1, skip fpdc] around pillow, working [sc, ch 1, sc] in each outside corner.  When pillow is half assembled, insert pillow form and work to end. 
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Colorwhirl™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds/70 m)
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 5 dc and 2½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in Bargello Pat.
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
Stripe Pat 
With A, 2 rows.
With B, 2 rows.
With C, 2 rows.
These 6 rows form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 61. See diagram on page 2.
Foundation row:  (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch.  Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Slip st in next ch. *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Slip st in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of last 3 ch. Turn.
1st row: (WS). *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in top of next ch 3 from previous row. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Sl st in top of next ch-3 from previous row. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc and top of ch-3 from previous row. Turn.

2nd row:  (RS). Working in back loops only,  *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in top of next ch 3 from previous row. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Sl st in top of next ch-3 from previous row. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc and top of ch-3 from previous row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Bargello Pat. First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Cont in Bargello and Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 48" [122 cm], ending with 2nd row of C.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Fold work in half with WS tog. Sew 2 sides of tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem edge closed.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home DecTM (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Spike St = Insert hook in row indicated and draw up a long loop. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook.
instructions:
Front
With A, ch 46. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
45 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: As 2nd row. 
Join B at end of 4th row.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 
*Spike st in next sc 3 rows below.
Spike st in next sc 2 rows below. 
Spike st in next sc 1 row below.  
1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of 
row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to 
end of row. Turn.
7th to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each 
sc to end of row. Turn. Join C at end 
of 9th row. 
10th row: (WS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc 
in first sc. *Spike st in next sc 1 row 
below. Spike st in next sc 2 rows 
below. Spike st in next sc 3 rows 
below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 
to end of row. Turn.
11th row: As 6th row.
12th to 14th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc to end of row. Turn. Join D 
at end of 14th row.
15th row: With D, as 5th row.
16th row: As 6th row.
17th to 19th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc to end of row. Turn. Join A 
at end of 19th row.
20th row: With A, as 10th row.
21st row: As 6th row.
22nd to 24th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc to end of row. Turn. Join B 
at end of 24th row.
Rep 5th to 24th rows until piece 
measures approx 16" [40.5 cm] 
from beg, ending on a 6th or 11th 
row. 
Fasten off.
Back (make 2)
With B, ch 46. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
45 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until piece measures 
approx 10" [25.5 cm] from beg. 
Fasten off.
Finishing
With WS of Front facing up, align 
2 Back pieces so that they overlap 
approx 2" [5 cm] in the middle. 
Join B with sl st to any corner.  
Ch 1. Working through all 
thicknesses (Front and Back 
pieces), work 1 rnd of sc evenly 
around all sides of Pillow, working 
3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st 
to first sc. Fasten off.
Button Loop
Join B with sl st to 23rd sc of one 
Back piece. Ch 10. Sl st in same sp 
as last sl st. Fasten off.
Sew Button on other Back piece 
to correspond with Button Loop. 
Insert pillow form. Close button 
loop.

pattern_name: Add Some Wiggle To It Crochet Pillow
materials: Caron® Colorama Haze™ (8 oz/227 g; 649 yds/593 m) Sea Glow (92010) 1 ball or 532 yds/ 486.5 m
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch, at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 20 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in grid pat with larger hook.
instructions:
FRONT GRID
(see diagram on page 3).
With larger hook ch 85.
1st row: 1 hdc in 4th ch from hook (ch-3 counts as hdc, ch 1). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 84 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of last ch-3. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 41 rows in total have been worked. Fasten off.

FRONT WIGGLE STRIPES
(See diagram on page 3).
With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to ch-1 or hdc post indicated with a red arrow on Chart. Ch 3. 1 dc around same ch-1 or hdc post as last sl st. Work 2 dc around each ch-1 or hdc post, following arrows on Chart to create Wiggles.
Fasten off.
Rep for each section indicated in Chart.

BACK (make 2 alike)
With larger hook, ch 61.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10½” [26.5 cm].
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 14” [35.5 cm].
Fasten off.

Assembly
With RS tog, overlap Back pieces to match Front with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Symphony™ (7.9 oz/225 g; 309 yds/282 m) Pebbles (21001) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
FRONT AND BACK (Make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in each dc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next dc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 sts.

5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 sts.

Cont in pat as established, inc 8 sts every rnd until piece measures 16" [40.5 cm] diameter. Fasten off.
Note: Insert pillow form at halfway point of joining Front and Back.
Join Front and Back: With WS of pieces tog, join B with sl st to any st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
2 balls: Dk Blue (MC); small amounts of Black (A) and White (B).
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
FRONT
With MC, ch 13. 
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch.
T urn.
2nd row:Ch 4. 2 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in
each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc.  T urn.
3rd row:Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in
each sc to end of row. T urn. 
4th row:Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in
each sc to end of row. T urn. 
5th row:Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to
last sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 
6th row:Ch 3. 2 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to
last sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 30 sc. 
7th to 9th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc.
1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last
sc. T urn. 36 sc. 
10th to 13th rows:Ch 1. 2 sc in first
sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
T urn. 40 sc. 
14th to 18th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each
sc to end of row. T urn. 
Tail: 19th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in
each of first 9 sc. Tu rn . Leave rem sts
unworked. 
20th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last
2 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc.
Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
- Sc2tog made. T urn. 
21st row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts.
1 sc in each sc to end of row. T urn. 
22nd row:Ch 3. 2 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to
end of row. T urn. 
23rd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last
sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 
24th row:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in
each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 
2 sc. T urn. 
25th row:As 23rd row.  
26th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in
each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc.  T urn. 
27th row:Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to
last sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 
28th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last
sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 
29th row:Ch 1.1 sc in each sc to end
of row. T urn. 
30th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
4 sc. T urn.
31st row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc.
Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Fasten off.
With WS of work facing, miss next 
5 sc of 29th row. Join MC with sl st to
next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last
sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
T urn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last
2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc.  T urn. 
Next row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc.
1 sc in each sc to end of row. T urn. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc.
1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog
over last 2 sc. T urn. 
Next row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc.
1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off
Top of Head: With RS of work
facing, miss next 3 sc of 18th row.
Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 
1 sc in each sc to end of row. T urn.
28 sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last
2 sc.  Tu rn . Leave rem sts unworked. 
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first
2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc.
Sc2tog over last 2 sc. T urn. 
Next row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end
of row. T urn. 
Next 3 rows:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2
sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog
over last 2 sc. T urn. 16 sc. Fasten off
omitting turning ch at end of last row. 
BACK
Work as given for Front noting RS
becomes WS. 
Note: When joining Back and Front,
place stuffing inside. 
Joining Back and Front: Position
Back and Front matching shapes. Join
MC with sl st at end of beg ch.
Working through both thicknesses,
work 1 rnd of sc around shape. Join
with sl st in first sc. 
Fountain: With B, ch 12. Sl st in
second ch from hook. Sl st in each of
next 4 ch. Ch 7. Fasten off. Shape and
sew to top of Head as illustrated. 
With A, embroider eye and mouth
on both sides as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge™ (8 oz/227 g; 212 yds/194 m) Latte (8369) 4 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from front to back, to form 2½” [6 cm] loop. Placing tip of hook behind yarn at front of index finger, Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
instructions:
Notes:
• It is essential to work loop stitches as shown in diagram to ensure stitches are locked in place.
• Loop stitches are cut and yarn is un-plyed to create furry texture in Finishing.
FRONT
Ch 55.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 54 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 Lp st in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 20” [51 cm], ending on a 3rd row.
Fasten oﬀ.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20” [51 cm]. Do not fasten oﬀ. Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 54 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten oﬀ.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Fasten oﬀ.
Cut Loops: Working row by row cut the center of each loop on Front of Pillow to create 2 strands of yarn per loop. Using yarn needle, un-ply each strand to create curled fur texture (as shown in photo). Insert pillow form.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Half double crochet through back loop
Hdcfp = Half double crochet through front loop
Trfp = Treble crochet through front loop
measurements: Approx 12" x 16" [30.5 x 40 cm], excluding fringe
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc. 
Front and Back (make alike)
Ch 68. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 5 ch. *1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to last ch. Sl st in last ch. Turn. 67 sts.
2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only , 1 hdc in each of first 6 sts. *Sl st in each of next 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
4th and 5th rows:  Working in back loops only , sl st in each of first 6 sts. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Sl st in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. Sl st in last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 5½" [14 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Next row:  (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcfp around each dc to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 
Proceed in Lattice Pat as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of 2nd sc 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Skip next 3 sc 2 rows below. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next sc 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – first trfp cluster made. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of last sc worked 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Skip next 3 sc 2 rows below. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next sc at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – trfp cluster made. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 trfp around first trfp cluster. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp cluster over last trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. Rep from * to last 6 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp around last trfp cluster. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 trfp cluster over first trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp cluster over last trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Turn. 
8th to 17th rows: Rep 4th to 7th rows twice more, then rep 4th and 5th rows once. 
18th row:  (WS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
19th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcbp around each dc to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row:  (WS). Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 6 sts. *Sl st in each of next 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
2nd and 3rd rows:  Working in back loops only, sl st in each of first 6 sts. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Sl st in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. Sl st in last st. Turn.
4th row: As 1st row. 
Rep last 4 rows for pat until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. 
With WS facing of Front and Back tog, work 1 sc through both thicknesses across 3 sides, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Work sc across rem side to close. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off. 
Mini Tassels (make 24)
Wrap yarn around 3 fingers 25 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½" [1 cm] from tied end. Fasten securely. Attach Mini Tassels evenly spaced across dcbp rows on Front and Back as shown in photo.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 5" [12.5 cm] long. Taking 5 strands of random colors tog, fold in half and knot into fringe around entire Pillow. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 321 Gold A, 3945 Blue Suede B, 774 Light Raspberry C, 668 Honeydew D, 358 Lavender E, 726 Coral F, 512 Turqua G, 334 Buff H, 718 Shocking Pink I, and 624 Tea Leaf J.
Two 22 x 22" [56 x 56 cm] pillow forms, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C. etc.
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each pillow measures about 22 x 22" [56 x 56 cm].
gauge: Square I = 4 x 4" [10 x 10 cm]; Square II = 8 x 8" [20.5 x 20.5 cm]; Rounds 1 and 2 of Square II = 3 x 3" [7.5 x 7.5 cm]; Square III = 12 x 12" [30.5 x 30.5 cm]; Rounds 1–4 of Square III = 4 x 4" [10 x 10 cm]; Square IV = 16 x 16" [40.5 x 40.5 cm]; 15 sts = 4" [10 cm] and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern of Square IV. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
PATCH PILLOW
SQUARE I (make 8 – 1 each with D, E, F, G, H, and I; and 2 each with J)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Beg-Cl in ring, [ch 3, Cl in ring] 7 times; join with ch 1, hdc in top of beg-Cl—8 clusters and 8 ch-3 spaces. Note: The joining ch 1, hdc count as a ch-3 space.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc around post of joining hdc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, [(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space (corner made), 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, 3 dc again around post of joining hdc; join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3 (joining hdc counts as a ch-2 space)—Twelve 3-dc groups and 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc around post of joining hdc, sc in next 9 dc, [3 sc in next corner ch-2 space, sc in next 9 dc] 3 times, sc again around post of joining hdc; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. Fasten off.
SQUARE II (make 6 – 1 each in each color sequence)
Use first yarn color listed for Rounds 1 and 2, and second yarn color listed for Rounds 3–7.
Color Sequence #1: F, C.
Color Sequence #2: A, E.
Color Sequence #3: G, B.
Color Sequence #4: H, I.
Color Sequence #5: D, G.
Color Sequence #6: C, A.
With first color, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): With first color, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 3 dc in ring, [ch 2, 4 dc in ring] 3 times; join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3 (joining hdc counts as a ch-2 space)—Four 4-dc groups and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: With first color, ch 3, 3 dc around post of joining hdc, (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in each of next 3 ch-2 spaces (3 corners made), 4 dc again around post of joining hdc, ch 2 (last corner completed); join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Eight 4-dc groups and 4 corner ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, join second color with slip st in any ch-2 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same ch-2 space, [4 dc in next space between 4-dc groups, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 space] 3 times, 4 dc in last space between 4-dc groups; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Eight 3-dc groups, four 4-dc groups, and 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: With second color, ch 3, [dc in each dc to next corner ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space] 4 times, dc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—56 dc and 4 corner ch-3 spaces (14 dc along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces).
Round 5: With second color, ch 3, [dc in each dc to next corner ch-3 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in corner ch-3 space] 4 times, dc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—72 dc and 4 corner ch-3 spaces (18 dc along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces).
Round 6: Repeat Round 5—88 dc and 4 corner ch-3 spaces (22 dc along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces).
Round 7: With second color, ch 1, [sc in each dc to next corner ch-3 space, 3 sc in corner ch-3 space] 4 times, sc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in first sc—100 sc (22 sc along each of 4 sides between 3-sc corners). Fasten off.
SQUARE III (make 2 – 1 in each color sequence)
Use first yarn color listed for first 2 rounds, then use each following yarn color, in order listed, for 2 rounds.
Color Sequence #1: H, D, E, H, E, and D.
Color Sequence #2: J, B, F, J, F, and B.
With first color, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): With first color, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, [ch 2, 3 dc in ring] 3 times; join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3 (joining hdc counts as a ch-2 space)—Four 3-dc groups and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: With first color, ch 1, sc around post of joining hdc, [ch 3, sc in center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, ch 3, sc in center dc of last 3-dc group, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, join second color with slip st in any ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-3 space, [3 dc in next ch-3 space, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space (corner made)] 3 times, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 3 dc again in first ch-3 space; join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3 (joining hdc counts as a ch-2 space)—Twelve 3-dc groups and 4 corner ch-2 spaces (Three 3-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corner ch-2 spaces).
Round 4: With second color, ch 1, sc around post of joining hdc, *[ch 3, sc in next space between 3-dc groups] twice, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next corner ch-2 space; repeat from * 2 more times, [ch 3, sc in next space between 3-dc groups] twice, ch 3, sc again around post of joining hdc, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc and 16 ch-3 spaces (3 ch-3 spaces along each of 4 sides between ch-3 corner spaces). Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, join third color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same corner ch-3 space, [3 dc in each ch-3 space to next corner ch-3 space, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner ch-3 space (corner made)] 3 times, 3 dc in each ch-3 space to end of round, 3 dc again in first corner ch-3 space; join with hdc in top of beginning ch-3 (joining hdc counts as a ch-2 space)—Twenty 3-dc groups and 4 corner ch-2 spaces (Five 3-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corner ch-2 spaces).
Round 6: With third color, ch 1, sc around post of joining hdc, [*ch 3, sc in next space between 3-dc groups; repeat from *  to next corner ch-2 space, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in corner ch-2 space] 3 times, **ch 3, sc in next space between 3-dc groups; repeat from ** to end of round, ch 3, sc again around post of joining hdc, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 24 ch-3 spaces (5 ch-3 spaces along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces). Fasten off.
Rounds 7 and 8: With fourth color, repeat Rounds 5 and 6—32 sc and 32 ch-3 spaces in Round 8 (7 ch-3 spaces along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces). Fasten off.
Rounds 9 and 10: With fifth color, repeat Rounds 5 and 6—40 sc and 40 ch-3 spaces in Round 10 (9 ch-3 spaces along each of 4 sides between corner ch-3 spaces). Fasten off.
Round 11: With sixth color, repeat Round 5—Forty-four 3-dc groups and 4 corner ch-2 spaces (Eleven 3-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corner ch-2 spaces).
Round 12: With sixth color, ch 1, 3 sc around post of joining hdc, [sc in each st to next corner ch-2 space, 5 sc in corner ch-2 space] 3 times, sc in each st to end of round, 2 sc again around post of joining hdc; join with slip st in first sc—152 sc (33 sc along each of 4 sides between 5-sc corners). Fasten off.
Assembly
Hold Squares with right sides together. Whipstitch Squares together from wrong side, following Assembly Diagrams.
Notes
1. In Border Round, 60 sc are worked along each of the 4 sides and 3 sc at each corner. Detailed instructions for achieving this are provided. Alternatively, distribute the 60 sc along each side and work 3 sc in each corner in any way desired.
2. Work Border Round around each piece.
Border Round: With right side facing, join I with slip st in upper right corner, ch 1, 2 sc in same st, *[sc in next 15 sts, skip next st] 3 times, sc in next 15 sts, 3 sc in next st (corner made); repeat from * 2 more times, [sc in next 15 sts, skip next st] 3 times, sc in next 15 sts, sc in same st a first 2 sc of this round; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING FIRST PILLOW
With right sides of the two pieces together, whipstitch three sides together. Turn cover right side out, insert pillow form, and whipstitch last side together. Weave in any remaining ends.
STRIPED PILLOW
SQUARE IV (make 2)
With A, ch 60.
Row 1 (wrong side): With A, sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across and change to B in last st—30 sc and 29 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc and change to C—31 sc and 28 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: With C, ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc and change to D—30 sc and 29 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4–53: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 changing color every row as follows:
*Work next row with D, and then 1 row each with E, F, G, H, I, J, A, B, and C;
repeat from * 4 more times. Change to F in last st of Row 53.
Notes:
1. Square should measure about 15½ x 15½" [39.5 x 39.5 cm] before Border Round is worked. After Border Round is complete Square should measure 16 x 16" [40.5 x 40.5 cm].
2. In Border Round 1, 48 sc are worked along each of the 4 sides and 3 sc at each corner. Detailed instructions for achieving this are provided. Alternatively, distribute the 48 sc along each side and work 3 sc in each corner in any way desired.
BORDER 
Round 1: With F, ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, skip next ch-1 space, *[sc in next sc, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, skip next sc, [sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 3 times, skip next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, 3 sc in last sc; working in ends of rows along side edge, skip end of Row 53, sc in end of next 12 rows, [skip end of next row, sc in end of next 12 rows] 3 times, skip end of Row 1; working along opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in ch at base of first sc, skip next ch, *[sc in ch at base of next sc, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, skip ch at base of next sc, [sc in next ch-1 space, sc in ch at base of next sc] 3 times, skip next ch; repeat from * to ch at base of last sc, 3 sc in ch at base of last sc; working in ends of rows along side edge, skip end of Row 1, sc in end of next 12 rows, [skip end of next row, sc in end of next 12 rows] 3 times, skip end of Row 53, sc in same sc as first 2 sc of this round; join with slip st in first sc—204 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each st around working 3 dc in center sc of each 3-sc corner; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around working 3 sc in center dc of each 3-dc corner; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 4–7: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3 twice.
Fasten off.
FINISHING SECOND PILLOW
With right sides of the two Squares together, whipstitch three sides together. Turn cover right side out, insert pillow form, and whipstitch last side together. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Outdoor™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 249 yds/228 m)
Contrast B Summer Storm Gray (99003) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Round pillow form 16" [40.5 cm] in diameter.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (Make 1 in Contrast A. Make 1 in Contrast B)
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Ch 3.
1st rnd:  8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times all in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – bobble made. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 5 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 7 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 8 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 80 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 9 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 9 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 88 hdc.
12th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 10 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 96 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 11 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 11 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 11 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 104 hdc.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 12 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Bobble in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 112 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Note: Insert pillow form at half-way point of joining Front and Back.
Join Front and Back: With WS tog, join B with sl st to any hdc. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) - Contrast A Jazzy Ombre (3966) 3 balls or 1260 yds/1151 yds
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/197 g; 364 yds/333 m) - Contrast B Paddy Green (0368) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: 
• Follow directions shown on each chart for shaping and pattern instructions. See page 3. 
• Letters and Gussets are all worked in Contrast A. Contrast B is used for Finishing joining rnd only.
All Pillows 
Make 2 pieces alike, noting RS and WS will be reversed for Front and Back.
Main Gusset
With A, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain.
Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Letter or Number shape.
Fasten off.
Sew Gusset seam.

Interior Gusset (optional)
Work as for Main Gusset for each section of Letter shape that requires a separate.
Body of Exclamation Point
Ch 12. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 38 total rows have been worked. Fasten off.

"Dot" of Exclamation point.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Position Main Gusset seam at lower edge of Pillow and pin Main Gusset in position. With WS tog and using B, working through both thicknesses, join Front of Pillow and Main Gusset tog with 1 rnd of sc.
If necessary, attach Interior Gusset piece(s) in same manner.
Rep for Back of Pillow, leaving an opening approx 4" [10 cm] wide. Stuff Pillow. Join opening closed. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) White (9701) 2 balls or 630 yds/576 m
Contrast A Bone (9703) 1 ball or 101 yds/93 m
Contrast B Soft Green (9739) 1 ball or 101 yds/93 m
Contrast C Chartreuse (9771) 1 ball or 101 yds/93 m
Contrast D Gold (9782) 1 ball or 101 yds/93 m
Contrast E Pumpkin (9765) 1 ball or 101 yds/93 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Hdc/f_l = Half double crochet in front loop only
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.
• To change colors, work to last 3 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 3 loops and proceed with new color.
FRONT
With MC, ch 66. 
Set-up row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 65 sts.
**1st row: (WS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.**
Last 2 rows form Griddle St Pat.
Cont in Griddle St Pat until work from beg measures approx 2½" [6.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Break MC. Join A.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (WS). With A, ch 2. 1 hdc/f_l in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Texture Pat.
With A, cont in Texture Pat until work from beg measures 5½" [14 cm], ending on a WS row. Break A. Join B.
With B, cont in Texture Pat until work from beg measures 8½" [21.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Break B. Join C.
With C, cont in Texture Pat until work from beg measures 11½" [29 cm], ending on a WS row. Break C. Join D.
With D, cont in Texture Pat until work from beg measures 14½" [37 cm], ending on a WS row. Break D. Join E.
With E, cont in Texture Pat until work from beg measures 17½" [44.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Break E. Join MC.
Next row:  (RS). With MC, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Working from ** to **, cont in Griddle St Pat until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: With MC, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (WS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 65 sc evenly across side of ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Working from ** to **, cont in Griddle St Pat until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Fringe:  Cut lengths of yarn 8" [20.5 cm]. Taking 3 strands together, fold in half and knot into fringe into remaining front loops of each st across last row of each Contrast Color section.
Trim evenly.
FINISHING
With RS together, overlap Back pieces to match Front with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds /70 m) Dusk Blue (25015) or Tar (25005) or Chartreuse (25011) 4 balls
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Purchased round Ottoman approx 20" [51 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
abbreviations: Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] in diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 counts as hdc throughout.
Ch 3.
1st rnd:  9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch-2 counts as hdc). Join with sl st to Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (counts as 2 hdc). *2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 20 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 30 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st.  1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *2 hdc in next hdc.1 hdc in each ... 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 60 sts.
2nd rnd: Beg dec.  1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 50 sts.
Insert Ottoman.
3rd rnd: Beg dec.  1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 40 sts.
4th rnd:  Beg dec.  1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 30 sts.
5th rnd: Beg dec. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 20 sts.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 hdc in next st. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Thread end through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300g; 315 yds/288 m) Softened Blue (32008) 4 balls
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a look around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
gauge: 14 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in grid pat with larger hook. 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
FRONT 
Grid: Ch 85.
1st row: 1 hdc in 4th ch from hook (ch-3 counts as hdc, ch 1). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 84 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of last ch-3. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 41 rows have been worked. Fasten oﬀ .

Wiggles
**With smaller hook and RS facing, join yarn with sl st to ch-1 or hdc post indicated with a red arrow on Chart. Ch 3. 1 dc around same ch-1 or hdc post as last sl st. Work 2 dc around each ch-1 or hdc post, following arrows on Chart to create Wiggles. Fasten oﬀ .**
Rep from ** to ** for each section indicated in Chart.

BACK (make 2 alike)
Ch 61.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10½" [26.5 cm].
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm].
Fasten oﬀ .

Assembly
With RS tog, overlap Back pieces to match Front with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds/70 m)
Sizes U.S. L/11 (8 mm) and U.S. Q (15 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Contrast A and smaller hook. 12 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat with Contrast A and smaller hook.
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked in one piece. Contrast B will be woven through ch-1 sps in pat after Pillow is complete.
With A and smaller hook, ch 56.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 55 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next 1 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm]. Fasten off.

Weaving: Take care to weave evenly and ensure weaving is not gathering Pillow width. Cut new lengths of yarn to weave as needed, taking care to have enough yarn to weave across entire width of Pillow and keeping yarn ends tucked into sides.
Attach large safety pin onto end of B yarn. Beg at foundation row, weave B through ch-1 sps, under and over alternating sc. Cont to weave across every row, alternating sps each row (see photo).

FINISHING
Fold Pillow in half.
Joining rnd and edging: With larger hook, join B with sl st in bottom corner. Working through both thicknesses, work 25 sc to join bottom end, 3 sc in corner, work 17 sc across side, 3 sc in corner, 25 sc across top folded edge, 3 sc in corner. Insert pillow form, then work 17 sc across side. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 0319 Cherry Red, A; 0316 Soft White B; and 0385 Royal, C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Pillow measures  17” x 17” (43 x 43 cm) - tight fit
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows of sc = 2½” (6.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Give a cheer for the red, white and blue with this patriotic pillow. It’s perfect for a room accent or to give to anyone who has a loved one serving our country.
Repeat Round 2 until First White Stripe measures 3” (7.5 cm) from beginning. Fasten off B.
Second Red Stripe
Round 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in any st, ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st around; do not join.
Repeat Rounds 2-3 of First Red Strip until Second Red Strip measures 3” (7.5 cm) from beginning.
Second White Stripe
Repeat Round 2 of First White Strip until Second White Strip measures 3” (7.5 cm) from beginning.
Blue Field
Round 1: With right side facing, join C with a slip st in any st, ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st around; do not join.
Repeat Rounds 2-3 of First Red Stripe until blue field measures 5½” from beginning. Fasten off C.
STAR (make 10):
With B, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), *3 hdc in ring, ch 1; repeat from * 4 times; join with a slip st in first hdc – 15 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, *hdc in first hdc, tr in next hdc, picot, hdc in next hdc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length – 5 points.
NOTE
Flag is worked in rounds starting at the bottom edge. The open edges are sewn together, and the stars are appliquéd onto the pillow. Pillow is reversible. The red stripes and blue field are worked in a spiral, without joining. Join other rounds with a slip st in first hdc unless otherwise stated.
PILLOW
With A, ch 121, being careful not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
First Red Stripe
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first ch, sc in each ch around; do not join, work in a spiral – 121 sc. Mark first st of round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: *Sc in next sc, sc in back loop only of next sc; repeat from * around; do not join.
Round 3: *Sc in back loop only of next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; do not join.
Repeat Rounds 2-3 until First Red Stripe measures 3” (7.5 cm) from beginning, slip st in next st. Fasten off A.
First White Stripe
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in any st, ch 1 (does not count as a st), hdc in first st, hdc in each st around; join with a slip st in first hdc – 121 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in first st, hdc in each st around; join with a slip st in first hdc.
FINISHING
Weave in ends except long sewing ends. Flatten pillow cover. With A, whipstitch bottom edge closed. Insert pillow form, making sure corners are aligned with bottom corners, using C, whipstitch top edge closed. Weave in ends. Block stars. With sewing lengths, sew 5 stars evenly spaced on Blue Field, on both sides of pillow.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4” [10 cm]. 1 hexagon = 7½” x 6¾” [19 x 17 cm].
instructions:
Full Hexagons (Make 6 each with A and B; make 5 with C).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 2 dc in ring) 5 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.

Half Hexagons (Make 2).
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 2 dc in ring) twice. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in top of ch-3. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Hexagons tog as shown in Assembly Diagram. Fold in half, matching marks as illustrated, leaving top edge open. Insert pillow form. Sew rem edge closed.

materials: RED HEART® Soft™: 2 skeins 4422 Tangerine A, 3 skeins 9939 Jewel Tone B
1 yard contrasting fabric for both pillows
sewing thread in matching color to fabric
abbreviations: PS (puff stitch) = [Yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] 5 times in st or space specified, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pillows measure 16” in diameter excluding ruffled edging.
gauge: Rounds 1-9 = 4” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1: Ch 6; join with a slip st to form a ring; ch 3 (counts as dc), 14 dc in ring; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 15 dc.
Work in back loops every round EXCEPT for Rounds 7, 8, 11, and 14.
Round 2: Ch 3, PS in next dc, ch 1, 2 sc in next dc, [PS in next dc, ch 1, 2 sc in next dc] 6 times; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 29 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, sc in each st and ch around; join to first sc – 30 sc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, [dc in next 2 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 9 times; join – 40 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, PS in next dc, ch 1, 2 sc in each of next 2 dc, [PS in next dc, ch 1, 2 sc in each of next 2 dc] 12 times; join – 79 sts.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, sc in each st and ch around; join – 80 sc.
Round 7: Ch 3, 2 dc in same st as joining, skip 2 sc, [3 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc] 25 times, 3 dc in next sc, skip last sc; join – 81 dc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, skip next 2 dc, [PS in space between 3-dc-groups, ch 1, sc in next dc, skip next 2 dc] 27 times; join – 82 sts.
Round 9: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each st and ch around; join – 81 sc.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next sc, [2 dc in next sc, dc in next 2 sc] 26 times, 2 dc in last sc; join – 108 dc.
Round 11: Ch 3, PS in next dc, ch 1, sc in next 2 dc, [PS in next dc, ch 1, sc in next 3 dc] 26 times; join – 135 sts.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st and ch around; join – 135 sc.
Round 13: Ch 3, dc in each sc around; join – 135 dc.
Round 14: Ch 3, PS in next dc, ch 2, [sc in next dc, skip next dc] twice, * PS in next dc, ch 2, [sc in next dc, skip next dc] 3 times; repeat from * 17 more times, PS in next dc, ch 2, sc in next dc, skip next dc; join – 118 sts.
Round 15: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, sc in each st and ch around; join – 119 sc.
Round 16: Ch 3, 2 dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 3 sc, [3 dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 2 sc] 38 times; join – 156 sts.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and next 2 dc, [PS in next ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in next 3 dc] 38 times, PS in next ch-1 space, ch 1; join in first sc – 195 sts.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, [sc in PS, skip ch-1, sc in next 3 sc] 38 times, sc in last PS; join – 156 sc.
Ruffled Edging (Work on 1 Side Only Of Each Pillow)
Round 1: Working in back loops, ch 6, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 5, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 50 times, (ch 2, dc) in first ch of ch-6 to join and form last loop – 52 loops.
There’s nothing like a pillow for adding comfort and color to a room. This round pillow can be crocheted in little time in just the right shade to add a nice accent. Place it right where you need it to feel comfortable as you read or watch television.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Main Color (MC) Kelly Green (10510) 1 ball or 422 yds/386 m
Contrast A Grass Green (10620) 1 ball or 519 yds/475 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble Pompom = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close.
Trfp = Treble front post = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Lattice Pat worked over foundation ch multiple of 6 ch +7.
• Bobble Pompom Edging worked over 256 sts – multiple of 4 sts.
FRONT
With MC, ch 61. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 sc.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. PM around post of last sc made. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. Rep from * to last 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. *PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below (6th row). Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *(1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 8th row, skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 9th rows to form Lattice Pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm] ending on a 9th row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: With A, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 60 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work around Pillow as follows: (work 60 sc evenly across side of Pillow. 4 sc in corner) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 256 sc. Fasten off.
Proceed with Bobble Pompom Edging as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. Ch 4. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 10 times all in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close - Bobble Pompom made. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook (Bobble Pompom will naturally fold in half forming ball shape). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Bobble Pompom in 4th ch from hook. Sl st in same 4th ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Insert Pillow form.
STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)or
= slip stitch (sl st)
= single crochet (sc)
= Bobble Pompom

STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= single crochet (sc)
= marker
= front post treble crochet (trfp)
Bobble Pompom Edging

= chain (ch)or
= slip stitch (sl st)
= single crochet (sc)
= Bobble Pompom

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Bulky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 78 yds/71 m)
Contrast B Dark Grey Heather (89042) 4 balls
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 8 dc and 3½ rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held together.
instructions:
Note: Work in back loops only throughout.
Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
SIDE ONE
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 4. 
Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
Break 1 strand of A. Join 1 strand of B.
3rd rnd: With 1 strand each of A and B held tog, ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Break A. Join 2nd strand of B. 48 dc.
5th rnd: With 2 strands of B held tog, ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.

SIDE TWO
With 2 strands of B held tog, ch 4. 
Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. Break 1 strand of B. Join 1 strand of A.
3rd rnd: With 1 strand each of B and A held tog, ch 3. Working in back loops, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Break B. Join 2nd strand of A. 48 dc.
5th rnd: With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of Sides One and Two tog, join B with sl st to back loop of any dc. Working through both thicknesses, join sides by working 1 sl st into back loop of each dc around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Plus™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 78 yds/71 m) Cold Sea (17002) 5 balls
Sizes U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Trfp = Treble Front Post. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
instructions:
FRONT
Note: Pat worked over foundation ch multiple of 6 ch +5.
Ch 35.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 34 sts.
