2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. PM around post of last sc made. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. Rep from * to last 7 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. *PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from *, ending last rep 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below (6th row). Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *(1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 8th row, skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
10th to 33rd rows: Rep 2nd to 9th rows 3 times more.
34th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.  4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 34 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Insert Pillow form.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 2 skeins 885 Delft Blue A and 1 skein 316 Soft White B
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 3” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW (Make 2)
With A ch 55.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook, * skip next ch, (sc, dc) in next ch; repeat from * to last 2 ch; skip next ch, sc in last ch; turn.
Rows 2-45: Ch 1, dc in first sc, * skip next dc, (sc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sts; skip next dc, sc in top of turning ch; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 45.

Statue
Begin at lower edge, with B ch 18.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 17 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, sc in next 17 sc; turn – 20 sc.
Rows 7 and 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 18 sc; turn – 19 sc.
Row 10: Ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 18 sc, inc; turn – 21 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, inc, sc to last sc, inc; turn – 23 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, inc, sc in each sc across; turn – 24 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in each sc to last sc; inc; turn – 25 sc.
Divide for Book- Row 14 (Right Side): Ch 1, inc, sc in next 3 sc, dec; TURN – 6 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 3 sc, inc; turn – 6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, slip st in first sc, dec, sc in next sc, dec. Fasten off.

Torso-Row 14: Resume working across all stitches: with right side facing, join B in next sc of last long row; ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn – 19 sc.
Rows 15-18: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Divide for Arm-Row 19 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, dec; TURN – 5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 3 sc; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 21-28: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 29: Ch 1, [dec] twice; turn – 2 sc.

Torch-Row 30: Ch 1, [inc] twice; turn – 4 sc.
Row 31: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [inc] twice, sc in last sc; turn – 6 sc.
Row 32: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.

Flame-Row 33: Ch 1, slip st in next 2 sc, ch 1, sc in next 2 sc; TURN; turn – 2 sc.
Row 34: Ch 1, [inc] twice; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 35 and 36: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 37: Ch 1, [dec] twice; turn – 2 sc.
Row 38: Ch 1, dec; turn – 1 sc.
Row 39: Ch 1, sc in sc. Fasten off.

Neck and Head-Row 19: Resume working across all stitches: with wrong side facing, join B in next sc of last long row; ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn – 13 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, dec, sc to last 2 sc; dec; turn – 11 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc to last 2 sc; dec; turn – 10 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, dec, sc to last 2 sc; dec; turn – 8 sc.
Rows 23 and 24: Ch 1, inc, sc to last sc; inc; turn – 12 sc at end of Row 24.
Rows 25-29: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 30 and 31: Ch 1, dec, sc to last 2 sc; dec; turn – 8 sc at end of Row 31.
Edging
Ch 1, sc around entire piece, working 3 sc in each lower corner and in tip of flame, and increasing as necessary in other corners to keep work flat; join with a slip st in first sc.
Sew statue to front of pillow as shown in picture.

Points of Crown
With B, [ch 8, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last 2 ch] 7 times. Fasten off. Sew around top of head.

Sew pillow front to back around 3 sides; insert pillow form, then continue sewing 4th side closed.

pattern_name: Square Peg and Round Holes Pillow
materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Full o’ Sheep™”: 3 balls 2205 Little Lamb 2510 A
STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Full o’ Sheep™”: 7 balls 2205 Little Lamb 2510 A
3 yards heavy cotton yarn in a contrasting color
abbreviations: A, B, and C = color A, color B, and color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pillows measures 16” x 16” square, after felting.
gauge: 10 sts and 8 rows = 4” in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. Gauge is loose so that yarn will felt.
instructions:
Square Peg Pillow
Squares (Make 2)
Round 1 (Right Side): With C, ch 3 (beginning ch counts as hdc), 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), [3 hdc in next st (corner made), hdc in next st] 3 times, 3 hdc in next st (corner made); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc (consisting of four 3-hdc corners and 1 hdc on each side between corners).
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next st, [3 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] 3 times, 3 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc. Place a marker in the center hdc of each 3-hdc corner.
Round 4: Ch 2, [hdc in each st to next marker, 3 hdc in marked st, move marker to center hdc of 3-hdc corner just made] 4 times, hdc in each remaining st to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Repeat Round 4 until square measures 5” across. Fasten off C. 
NOTE: Each round increases the stitch count by 8 stitches.
With Right Side facing, join A with slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Repeat Round 4 once. Fasten off A. 
With Right Side facing, join B with slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Repeat Round 4 until square measures 16” across. Fasten off B. 
With Right Side facing, join A with slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Repeat Round 4 until square measures 25” across. Fasten off first square. Do not fasten off 2nd square.
FiNiSHiNg
Hold squares with Wrong Sides together. 
Seaming: Working through both thicknesses, [sc in each st to next corner st, sc in corner st] 2 times, sc in each st to about 2” from next corner. Note: Three sides of pillow should now be seamed, with top edge and top corners left open. 
With doubled strand of heavy cotton yarn, baste top edge and corners together. Note: It is very important that basting yarn is cotton. Cotton is easier to remove after pillow has been felted.
Felt Pillow: Weave in ends (except ends of basting yarn). Place pillow in washing machine. Wash using hot water, maximum agitation, and a small amount of laundry soap. Check progress of felting every 3-5 minutes. Remove pillow from washer before spin cycle. Repeat wash cycle until desired level of felting is achieved. Rinse in sink. Gently squeeze excess water from pillow, pull into shape and allow pillow to dry. Remove basting cotton. Insert pillow form. With A, sew top edge and corners closed.
Felting Hints: A few pairs of jeans or a couple of old bath towels (avoid very fluffy towels that may produce lint) can be added to the washing machine to increase agitation. Place pillow in a lingerie bag or pillow case before felting to capture lint.

rouNd HoleS Pillow
Squares (Make 2)
Round 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 3 (beginning ch counts as hdc), 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), [3 hdc in next st (corner made), hdc in next st] 3 times, 3 hdc in next st (corner made); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc (consisting of four 3-hdc corners and 1 hdc on each side between corners).
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next st, [3 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] 3 times, 3 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc. Place a marker in the center hdc of each 3-hdc corner.
Round 4: Ch 2, [hdc in each st to next marker, 3 hdc in marked st, move marker to center hdc of 3-hdc corner just made] 4 times, hdc in each remaining st to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc. 
Repeat Round 4 until square measures 25” across. NOTE: Each round increases the stitch count by 8 stitches.
Fasten off first square. Do not fasten off 2nd square.
Circles (Make 9 – 4 with B and 5 with C)
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (beginning ch counts as hdc), 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in next st (increase made), [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st (increase made)] 7 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc. Place a marker in 2nd hdc of each 2-hdc increase.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 2 balls 310 Copper Mist
18 x 18” premade pillow (or 18” x 18” pillow form and 5/8 yard of 44” wide fabric)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 12 filet blocks or mesh = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in filet pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
1. Pillow quilt block is worked following filet chart. Rows 1 and 2 of chart are written in detail below, to help you get started.
2. Border is worked around outside edge, after charted pattern is completed.
3. When using filet chart, read odd-numbered rows (Right Side rows) from right to left. Read even-numbered rows (Wrong Side rows) from left to right. Begin each row with a ch 3 (counts as first edc), then work blocks and mesh, as indicated in chart, to end of row. Turn at the end of each row, except Row 53.
QUILT BLOCK PILLOW
Ch 163.
Row 1 (Right Side): Edc in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first edc), edc in each remaining ch across, turn—160 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first edc here and throughout), edc in each of next 3 sts (block made), *ch 2, skip next 2 sts, edc in next st (mesh made); repeat from * across to last 3 sts, work block, turn – 2 blocks and 51 mesh.
Continue Charted Pattern
Rows 3–53: Work Rows 3–53 of filet chart. Do not turn at the end of Row 53.
Do not fasten off.
Border (Right Side): Ch 1, work 3 sc in top of last edc of Row 53 (corner made), work 2 sc around post of the last edc of Row 53, work 3 sc evenly spaced across end of each remaining row across side edge; working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc first ch (corner made), sc in each remaining ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch (corner made), work 2 sc in next 2 ch of beginning ch, work 3 sc evenly spaced across end of each remaining row of next side edge; working across sts of Row 53, 3 sc in first st (corner made), sc in each st across to first corner; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Wash and block crocheted piece to 18 x 18” square. Allow to dry completely.
Pillow Form Cover (optional)
Note: If you are using a premade pillow, this step is not required.
Cut fabric into 2 pieces, each measuring 19” x 19” square. With Right Sides of fabric together, sew three sides together, with ½” seam allowance. Turn piece Right Side out. Insert pillow form, and sew last side closed (use any hidden or invisible stitch desired).

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A, 316 Soft White B, and 312 Black C.
Yarn needle; purchased black fabric-covered 16” square pillow; black sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: A, B, C = colors A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Motif = 6½” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PIlLOW TOP
Square (Make 4)
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, 2 dc in ring, ch 2, 3 dc in ring, ch 2, drop A to wrong side, with B 3 dc in ring, ch 2, drop B to wrong side, with C 3 dc in ring, ch 2; join with a slip st in top of ch-3; TURN.
Round 2 (Wrong Side): With C (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) all in first ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop C, with B 3 dc in same space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop B, with A 3 dc in same space, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in first ch-2 space, ch 2; join with a slip st in top of ch-3; TURN.
Round 3 (Right Side): With A, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) all in first ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop A, with B 3 dc in same space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop B, with C 3 dc in same space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, 3 dc in first ch-2 space, ch 2; join; TURN.
Round 4 (Wrong Side): With C (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) all in first ch-2 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop C, with B 3 dc in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop B, with A 3 dc in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-2 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, 3 dc in first ch-2 space, ch 2; join; TURN.
Round 5 (Right Side): With A (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) all in first ch-2 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-2 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop A, with B 3 dc in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, drop B, with C 3 dc in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, 3 dc in first ch-2 space, ch 2; join. Fasten off.
Assembly
Arrange squares, right side up, being sure that colors form a pinwheel as shown. Join squares as follows: Holding 2 squares at a time with right sides together and working through both layers, join C in a corner ch-space with an sc; * [ch 3, sc in next ch-space] 5 times *, ch 2, pick up next pair of squares, sc in corner ch-space; repeat from * to * once more. Fasten off. Repeat across squares so that they are joined both vertically and horizontally.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing, join C in any corner ch-2 space; ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in corner space, [ch 3, sc in next space] 10 times, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Slip st into corner space, (ch 3, 2 dc, 3 dc) all in same space, * [3 dc in next space] 11 times **, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next corner space; repeat from * around, end at **; join in top of ch-3 – 39 dc on each side between corner spaces. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join A in any ch-2 space; ch 1, [3 sc in ch-2 space, sc in each dc to next ch-2 space] 4 times; join – 41 sc between center corner sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: Join B in center sc of any corner; ch 1, [3 sc in center corner sc, sc in each sc to next center corner sc] 4 times; join – 43 sc between center corner sc. Fasten off.
Round 5: Repeat Round 4 with A increasing 1 sc at center of each side – 46 sc between center corner sc.
Round 6: Join C in center sc of any corner; ch 3, (dc; ch 3; sc in top of dc just made – picot made; 2 dc) all in center corner sc, * dc in next sc, picot, [dc in next 3 dc, picot] 15 times **, (2 dc, picot, 2 dc) all in next center corner sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FiniSHinG
Center Pillow Top on purchased pillow. Sew in place with sewing needle and thread.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”, Art. E300 available in solids – 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m) and multis or flecks – 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m) skeins.

materials: Caron® Big Cakes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 603 yds/551 m) Tiramisu (26002) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Purchased pouf floor pillow approx 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35 cm] high.
abbreviations: Beglnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook into ring, yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Beginning Linked Dc made.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch (through top loops in usual manner), yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.
measurements: Approx. 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Do not join rnds. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count. After set-up rnd, beg first lnkdc of each rnd in horizontal bar of last st in previous rnd. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
Set-up rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). (1 dc. Place marker on last dc. 9 beglnkdc) in ring. 10 sts.
1st rnd: Beg in last dc from previous rnd, work 2 lnkdc in each st around. 20 lnkdc.
2nd rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in next lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 30 lnkdc.
3rd rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in next dc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *(1 lnkdc in next lnkdc) twice. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 40 lnkdc.
4th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 2 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 3 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 50 lnkdc.
5th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 3 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 4 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 60 lnkdc.
6th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 4 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 5 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 70 lnkdc.
7th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 5 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 6 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 80 lnkdc.
8th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 6 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 7 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 90 lnkdc.
9th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 7 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 8 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 100 lnkdc.
10th rnd: Beg in last st from previous rnd, 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc around.
11th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 8 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 9 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 110 lnkdc.
12th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 9 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 10 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 120 lnkdc.
13th rnd: As 10th rnd.
14th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 10 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 11 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 130 lnkdc.
15th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 11 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 12 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 140 lnkdc.
16th rnd: As 10th rnd.
17th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 12 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 13 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 150 lnkdc.
18th rnd: 1 lnkdc in last st from previous rnd. 1 lnkdc in each of next 13 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. *1 lnkdc in each of next 14 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 160 lnkdc.
19th rnd: As 10th rnd.
Rep 19th rnd until work from center measures 28" [71 cm].
Final rnd: Beg in last st from previous rnd, work 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next lnkdc. 1 sc in each of last 2 lnkdc. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold lower edge up 1" [2.5 cm] to WS for elastic casing and sew in position, leaving an opening to insert elastic. Trim elastic as necessary, ensuring sufficient length for cover to be removable. Draw elastic through casing. Sew ends of elastic tog securely. Sew opening of casing closed.

pattern_name: OH BABY! SPRING ALPHABET CROCHET PILLOWS
materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Contrast A Oatmeal (53010) 1 ball or 27 yds/25 m per Flower
Contrast B Navy (07711) 1 ball or 5 yds/5 m per Flower
Contrast C Teal Heather (53203) 1 ball or 7 yds/14 m per Leaf
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS)
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Flower = 4" [10 cm] diameter. Leaf = 2½" [6 cm] long.
instructions:
ALL LETTER PILLOWS (With MC, make 2 pieces alike, noting RS and WS will be reversed for Front and Back).
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE
Note: Follow directions shown on each chart for shaping and pattern instructions. See pages 4 to 14.
Main Gusset: With MC, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Letter shape.
Fasten off. Sew Gusset seam.
Interior Gusset (optional): Work as for Main Gusset for each section of Letter shape that requires a separate gusset.
Letter Pillow Finishing: Position Main Gusset seam at lower edge of Pillow and pin Main Gusset in position. With WS tog and working through both thicknesses, with MC join Front of Pillow and Main Gusset tog with 1 rnd of sc. If necessary, attach Interior Gusset piece(s) in same manner. Rep for Back of Pillow, leaving an opening approx 4" [10 cm] wide. Stuff Pillow. Join opening closed. Fasten off.
DECORATIONS
Note: Use diagram on page 15 to determine placement and number of Flowers and Leaves required for each Letter Pillow (or use the diagram as inspiration to decorate your own)!
Flower:
Petal Rounds (make 2) See diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st row: (WS). Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Working back down ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Sl st in next ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Working back down opposite side of last ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 2 sc in next rem loop. 1 dc in each of next 4 rem loop. Ch 3. Sl st in same rem loop as last dc. Sl st in each of next 2 ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
Last 2 rows form one Petal. Rep 1st and 2nd rows 4 times more to complete 4 more Petals (total of 5 Petals), ending with sl st in same rem loop as last dc. Fasten off.
Center: With B, ch 2. 1st rnd: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc of rnd. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 2 Lp sts in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st of rnd. 10 Lp sts. Fasten off. Cut the center of each loop to create 2 strands of yarn per loop.
Flower Finishing: Place two Petal Rounds RS up, aligning Ch-10 rings and offsetting Petals. Place Center RS up on top of Petal Rounds and sew all three pieces tog to form Flower (as shown in photo).
Leaf: With C, ch 5. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: (5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr) all in 5th ch from hook (counts as ch 4. 5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr). Ch 4. Sl st in same 5th ch from hook.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in first ch-4 sp (working around first ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf). 1 sc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 1 dc in next tr. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 1 sc in last tr. 5 sc in next ch-4 sp (working around last ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf). Join with sl st in first ch-1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Position Flower(s) and Leaves on Front of Letter Pillow as shown in diagram on page 15.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Terracotta Rose (10880) 1 ball or 115 yds/105 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Lilac (11015) 1 ball or 280 yds/256 m
Note: 1 ball of each color will make 2 Pillows, reversing Contrast A and B.
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Make 1 Pillow using Contrast A as Color 1, and Contrast B as Color 2.
Make 1 Pillow using Contrast B as Color 1, and Contrast A as Color 2.
Note: Join with sl st to first hdc at end of each rnd.
FRONT AND BACK (Make 2 pieces alike)
Flower Center
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 hdc in center of ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. 32 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Break Color 1. Join Color 2 by working Color 1 to last 2 loops on hook and draw Color 2 through last 2 loops, then proceed in Color 2. 48 hdc.
6th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
PETALS
Note: Petals are worked back and forth in rows.
First Petal
**1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
5th and 6th rows: Rep last row twice more. 4 sts.
Fasten off.**
Second Petal
Join Color 2 with sl st to next unworked hdc of 7th rnd of Flower Center.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal.
Third to Sixth Petals
Work as given for Second Petal 4 times more.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back
With WS of Front and Back tog and Petals aligned, join Color 2 with sl st to first st of any Petal.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, *1 sc in each of 4 sts along top edge of Petal, 6 sc down side of Petal, 1 sc before next Petal. 6 sc up side of next Petal. Rep from * around, stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz; 73 m/80 yds
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Round pillow form 16 ins [40.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike).
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
With A, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in back loop of last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in back loop of each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in back loop of each of last 4 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. 1 dc in back loop of each of last 5 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 dc. 1 dc in back loop of each of last 6 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 96 dc.
Cont in same manner, inc 12 sts every rnd until 13 rnds have been completed. 156 dc at end of 13th rnd. Fasten off.
Front Outer Ruffles: With RS of Front facing, join B with sl st in first unworked loop of 1st rnd.
1st rnd: *(1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first st. Ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first unworked loop of 2nd rnd. *3 dc in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first st. Ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first unworked loop of next rnd. *Miss next st. 5 dc in next st. Miss next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first st. Ch 3.
With A, rep 3rd rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Working in front loops only, sl st in first st of next rnd. *Miss next st. 5 dc in next st. Miss next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING: With WS of Front and Back tog, join A with sl st in any dc. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around, inserting pillow form as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Contrast A Linen (28021) 4 balls or 407 yds/372 m
Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m) Contrast B Seaglass (10005) 1 ball or 192 yds/176 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = Double treble crochet = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 8 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Bobble Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top RS of row and work sts around it being sure to maintain gauge.
• Push dtr sts out towards RS of work to form bobbles.
FRONT
With A, ch 40. Proceed in Bobble Pat as follows (see chart on page 3):
1st row:  (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 39 sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
3rd and alt rows:  (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *(With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * once more. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
8th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. Turn.
10th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) twice. With A, 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
12th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. With A 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
14th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 7 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
16th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in last 10 sc. Turn.
18th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
20th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 7 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (With B, 1 dtr in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc) 7 times. Turn.
22nd row: As 18th row.
24th row: As 16th row.
26th row: As 14th row.
28th row: As 12th row.
30th row: As 10th row.
32nd row: As 8th row.
34th row: As 6th row.
36th row: As 4th row.
38th row: As 2nd row.
39th row: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Fasten off.
BACK (Make 2)
Ribbing: With B, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 39 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbing sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With RS facing, join B with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

materials: Bernat® Tweedie™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 247 yds/226 m)
Note: 2 balls each of A and B will make 2 Pillows.
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 10 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Make 1 Pillow with A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Make 1 Pillow with B as Color 1 and A as Color 2.
Pillow Front
With Color 1, ch 2. 
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 2) 4 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) to next ch-2 sp. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) to next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Pillow Front measures 18" [45.5 cm] square. Fasten off.
Pillow Backs
(make 2 pieces alike)
With Color 1, ch 46.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 45 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Overlap Back pieces to match measure of Front, with last rows in center for opening. Place Back pieces on Front with WS facing each other. Pin to secure for joining as follows:
With RS of Front facing, join Color 2 with sl st through both thicknesses at top right corner of Pillow.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to next st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m) Dusk (62007) 2 balls or 105 yds/96 m
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
16" [40.5 cm] diameter round pillow form (Note: Pillow Form is smaller than finished dimensions of Pillow as yarn creates a dense and thick fabric that adds to the overall measurements).
abbreviations: Sl stbl = Slip stitch in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] diameter, including thickness of fabric and edging.
gauge: 2 sc and 2 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 4 sl stbl and 5 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Work in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: (Sl stbl) twice in each sc around. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: *(Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
4th rnd: *Sl stbl in next st. (Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in next st. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
5th rnd: *(Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 40 sts.
6th rnd: *Sl stbl in each of next 2 sts. (Sl stbl) twice in next st. Sl stbl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th to 9th rnds: Sl stbl in each st around.
Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: (RS). With WS of Front and Back facing each other, sl st Pillow tog on RS, working through back loop only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail around edge of Pillow (see diagram), inserting pillow form at halfway point and cont around to end. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

FLAT SL ST JOINING DIAGRAM
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Robin’s Egg (39780) or Fuchsia (39764) or Chartreuse (39771) 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] tall
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
• To change colors, work to last loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last loops and proceed.
Front and Back (make alike) 
With A, ch 47.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook.1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 45 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row, join B.
Shape top: 1st row: With B, ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 43 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row to 7 sts. Fasten off.
Door
Note: Door is worked sideways.
With B, ch 26.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 24 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Doorknob
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew Doorknob to Door.
Sew Door to Front.
Window
With C, ch 14.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Do not turn.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Window, having 3 sc in each corner. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. Sl st in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Window Panes (make 2) With B, ch 15. Fasten off. Sew chains to Window as shown in picture to create Panes.
Sew Window to Front.
Gusset
With A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit around outer edge of Pillow (noting Gusset seam will be at lower right corner of Pillow), changing to B where appropriate to match ‘Roof’ section of Front and Back.
Fasten off.
Sew Gusset seam.
With WS tog, beg with A and working through both thicknesses, join Front and Gusset tog with 1 rnd of sc, joining B where appropriate. Rep for Back, leaving an opening approx 4" [10 cm] wide. Stuff Pillow. Join opening closed. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 4313 Aran Fleck A, 1 skein each 406 Med. Thyme B, 320 Cornmeal C, 365 Coffee D and 336 Warm Brown E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = color A, B, C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Pillow cover fits 18” (46 cm) pillow form
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in dc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW
Pillow Top (Make 2)
With A and larger hook, ch 50.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 49 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), skip first sc, dct in each sc across; turn – 49 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc to last st, sc in top of ch-2; turn.
Rows 4-37: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 17 times; do not fasten off.
Border
Ch 1, sc around pillow working 3 sc in each corner and working 47 sc between corners; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Giraffe
Begin at bottom of body with C and smaller hook, ch 34.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 33 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog; turn – 31 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across; turn – 30 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 6-9: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 twice – 28 sc.
Row 10: Repeat Row 3 – 26 sc.
Row 11: Repeat Row 4 – 25 sc.
Row 12: Repeat Row 3 – 23 sc.
Row 13: Repeat Row 2.
Row 14: Repeat Row 4 – 22 sc.
Rows 15-17: Repeat Row 2.
Row 18: Repeat Row 4 – 21 sc.
Row 19-24: Repeat Rows 2 and 4 three times – 18 sc.
Rows 25-27: Repeat Row 3 – 12 sc at end of Row 27.
Row 28: Repeat Row 4 – 11 sc.
Row 29: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 30-33: Repeat Rows 4 and 2 twice – 9 sc.
Row 34: Repeat Row 4 – 8 sc.
Rows 35-44: Repeat Row 2.
Chin-Row 45: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in next 8 sc; turn – 12 sc.
Row 46: Ch 1, sc in next 11 sc; 2 sc in last sc; turn – 13 sc.
Row 47: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 16 sc.
Rows 48 and 49: Repeat Row 2.
Row 50: Ch 1, sc in next 14 sc, sc2tog; turn – 15 sc.
Row 51: Repeat Row 3 – 13 sc.
Row 52: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 7 sc.
Row 53: Repeat Row 3 – 5 sc.
Row 54: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Using photo as a guide, sew Giraffe to one Pillow Top, lightly stuffing face. Sew button eyes to Giraffe’s face. Use 12 strands of embroidery floss to backstitch mouth and embroider French knot nostrils.
Ear (Make 2)
With C and smaller hook, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working in remaining loops along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 4 ch; turn – 11 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 5 sc. Fasten off.
Sew bottom of one Ear to each side of Giraffe’s head, then tack center of each Ear in place, leaving ends free for dimension.
Mane
With D and smaller hook, ch 31; skip first ch from hook, * insert hook into next ch, using a left-hand finger to control the loop size, catch both strands of yarn below the loop on finger with the hook, pull loops through the ch, yo and pull through all 3 loops on hook; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
Sew Mane to back of neck.
Horn (Make 2)
With E and smaller hook, ch 5; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; slip st in next 3 ch. Fasten off.
Sew Horns to top of head.
Large Spot (Make 4)
Round 1: With E and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join in first sc – 12 sc. Fasten off.
Small Spot (Make 5)
Work same as Large Spot through Round 1. Fasten off.
Sew Large and Small Spots to Giraffe’s neck and body as desired.
Leaf (Make 10)
With B and smaller hook, ch 18.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 15 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working in remaining loops along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in 16 ch; turn – 35 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, hdc in next sc, dc in next 2 sc, tr in next 11 sc, 2 tr in next sc, 5 tr in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, tr in next 11 sc, dc in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc; turn – 41 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 20 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 20 sts. Fasten off.
Tack leaves in place, leaving some ends free for dimension.
Finishing
Working through both thicknesses with wrong sides together, sc Pillow Tops together along 3 sides; insert pillow form, sc last side closed; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Tweedie™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 247 yds/226 m) Rhapsody (02010) 3 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4” [10 cm] piece of cardboard for Tassels.
abbreviations: Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 12.5 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows counts as hdc.
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
Ch 58 (multiple of 4 ch + 2).
Foundation Row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across. Turn. 57 sts.
1st row: (WS). Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * across to last 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a 1st row. Fasten oﬀ.
FINISHING
Blocking: Pin Front and Back to measurements. Cover with a damp towel and let dry.

Joining Front and Back:
1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Tassels (make 8)
Wrap yarn around 4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard 25 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Tie yarn around Tassel 1" [2.5 cm] and 2" [5 cm] from tied end and secure with overhand knot. Wrap yarn 3 times around each knot. Fasten securely. Attach 2 Tassels to each corner of Pillow.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
With A, ch 94.
Foundation row:  (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Slip st in next ch. *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Slip st in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of last 3 ch. Turn.
1st row: Working in back loops only, *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in top of next ch 3 from previous row. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Sl st in top of next ch-3 from previous row. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc and top of ch-3 from previous row. Turn.
Last row forms pat.
Cont in pat as established until work from beg measures approx 40" [101.5 cm], working 2 rows of A and B throughout. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold work in half with WS tog. Sew 2 sides of tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem edge closed.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Vintage White (10006) or Pale Gray (10046) or Coal (10040) 2 balls or 440 yds/402 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Instructions
Pillow Front
Note: Tr sts worked on WS will push towards RS of work to form bobbles.
Ch 36.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st.  *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.  Turn.
4th and 5th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows.
6th row: As 2nd row. 
7th to 17th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows once more, then rep 2nd to 7th rows once. Fasten off.
Fringe Strips (make 2) 
Ch 36. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *Sl st in next sc.  Draw up a loop 10” [25.5 cm] long. Twist loop 25 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself.  Rep from * to end of row.  Fasten off.  
Pillow Back (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: Ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.  4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.  
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 20" [51 cm].  Do not fasten off. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 35 sc along side of ribbing. 
Turn. Place marker at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marker measures 11" [28 cm]. 
Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew Fringe Strips to Front of Pillow, below 1st and 2nd textured areas, as shown in photo. 
Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Vintage White (10006) 2 balls
Bernat® Blanket Stripes™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Meadowbrook (76003) 1 ball
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Use separate balls of yarn for each area of color in the design. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Front
Work Bottom Border as follows:
With A, ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Begin Tree Motif: (see chart shown right)
Tree Motif can be worked by following written instructions or by following chart, noting each square of chart represents 1 sc, and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd to 3rd rows: As 1st row.
4th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th to 14th rows: As 4th to 8th rows. 
15th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
16th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
17th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
18th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Work Top Border as follows:
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: As 1st row.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Back
Ch 29.
1st row: (RS) With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Back measures same length as Front. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 3 sides of Pillow tog. Insert pillow form. Sew rem side closed.

materials: RED HEART® With Love™: 2 skeins each 1303 Aran A, and 1308 Tan B, and 1 skein of 1970 Taupe C.
5" [12.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard (for making tassels)
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
measurements: Pillow measures about 18 x 18" [45.5 x 45.5 cm]
gauge: 9 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in alternating rows of double crochet (dc) and Front post double crochet (Fpdc), with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Making this easy pillow is a great way to relax and focus on crochet while taking a break from the world. The result is a pillow that will add comfort in whatever room you use it.

Notes:
1. Pillow cover is made from two pieces. Both pieces are worked back and forth in rows with two strands of yarn held together throughout.
2. Yarn color is changed to create stripes. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Do not cut old color until instructed. Carry color not in use carefully up side edge when next needed.
3. Fringe is attached to a ridge on front of the pillow cover and tassels are attached to all four corners.
4. Keep pillow form handy. As you work, compare size of each of the two pieces with pillow form. If a piece is too large or too small, adjust the size by adding or subtracting the number of beginning chains and/or number of rows worked.

Special Stitch:
Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front side of work to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip the top of the stitch "behind" the Fpdc.

PILLOW COVER PIECES (make 2):
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 42. 
Row 1 (right side): With A, working in back bumps only, dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc), dc in each remaining ch across—40 dc. 
Row 2: With A, ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in next st, Fpdc around each of next 36 sts, hdc in next st, hdc in top of beginning ch-3 and change to 2 strands of B held together—4 hdc and 36 post sts.
Row 3: With B, ch 3, turn, dc in each st across, dc in top of beginning ch-2—40 dc.
Row 4: With B, ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in next st, Fpdc around each of next 36 sts, hdc in next st, hdc in top of beginning ch-3 and change to 2 strands of A held together.
Row 5: With A, ch 3, turn, dc in each st across, dc in top of beginning ch-2.
Rows 6–9: Repeat Rows 2–5.
Rows 10–12: Repeat Rows 2–4.
Rows 13 and 14: With A, ch 3, turn, dc in each st across, dc in top of beginning ch-2 and change to 2 strands of B held together at the end of Row 14.
Rows 15 and 16: Repeat Rows 3 and 4. Place a marker in ridge just made on right side of piece (for tassel placement).
Row 17: Repeat Row 5.
Rows 18–25: Repeat Rows 2–5 twice.
Row 26: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off A. Do not fasten off B.

Edging Round: With B, ch 1, work sc stitches as evenly spaced as possible along all 4 sides of piece, working 3 sc in each corner. Take care to work the same number of sc along each side; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING:
Seaming: Hold the two pieces together with stripes running in the same direction, stitches matching and wrong sides facing inwards. With right side facing you and with 2 strands of B held together, working in inner loops of both pieces at the same time, join yarn with slip st in any edging st, slip st in each remaining edging st all the way around, and insert pillow form before completing seam. Fasten off.

Fringe:
Cut 1 strand each of A, B, and C, each 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strands in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from bottom through back most loop of first stitch in marked ridge on front of pillow cover. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in every other stitch across ridge. Trim ends evenly.

Tassels (make 4):
Holding 1 strand each of A, B, and C together, wrap yarn about 10 times around 5" (12.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard. Thread a 10" (25.5 cm) single strand of any of the yarn colors under the top of the wraps and tie into a tight knot for top of tassel. Do not trim the ends of the tie. Slip wraps off of cardboard. Tie a 10" (25.5 cm) length of yarn around wraps about ¾" (19 mm) from top for tassel neck. Wrap ends of tie around wraps about 6 times and then draw ends to inside of tassel. Cut the lower ends of the wraps and trim to even. Use yarn needle and ends of tie at top of tassel to sew one tassel securely to each of the four corners.

Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m) Contrast A Double Denim (65012) 3 balls or 9 Squares
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Misty Green (10878) 1 ball or 58 yds/53 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] square, not including tassels.
instructions:
MOTIF
With A, make 9.
See Diagram on page 2.
Notes: 
•  Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest section of color rep) from center of ball, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
•  All color changes occur at end of rnd where colors are spliced together.
•  Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
•  If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. 
•  If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
•  Color change occurs where yarn is spliced together and should align with sl st at end of rnd. 
•  If splicing is visible on RS adjust sts so splice sits to WS or work over splice on next rnd.
•  At end of final rnd Motif should measure 10½" [26.5 cm] square. 
Cut yarn where Color 5 (longest section of color rep) ends, leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] tail at end of Motif for joining.
•  Begin next Motif with Color 1 and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds:  Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off, leaving 42" [106.5 cm] tail.
FINISHING
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With B, sl st Motifs tog, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram). Join Motifs into 3 horizontal strips, having 3 Motifs in each strip. Join 3 Strips tog following Seaming Diagram.
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
Assembly 
Fold 3 corners to meet in center, as shown in Assembly diagram, to form a square. With B, and using the Flat Slip St Join method, join seams on RS, leaving 4th corner open to insert pillow form. Insert pillow form. Join rem seam. 
Note: Pillow form will fit snugly.
Tassels (Make 4)
Wrap B around a 6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard 20 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap A 5 times around tassel 1" [2.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Using long tails, sew 1 Tassel to each corner of Pillow (as shown in photo).

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 4 (5) balls 5628 Vineyard (shown on smaller pillow) or 5360 Suede (shown on larger pillow)
A pillow form either 18 x 18" (45.5 x 45.5 cm) or 20 x 20" (51 x 51 cm)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Pillow measures 18 x 18" (45.5 x 45.5 cm) or 20 x 20" (51 x 51 cm)
instructions:
PILLOW
Center Panel
Ch 39.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 38 sc.
Next 49 (57) rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Begin Infinity Cable Design
St counts are written as follows: sc sts, floating sts.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each of next 17 sc, OC, sc in each of next 17 sc, turn – 38, 6.
Row 2 & every even numbered row: Ch 1, sc in each st across skipping all floating sts, turn – 38 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of next 16, FF3DC, sc in each of next 6 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 16 sc, turn – 38, 6.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of next 4 sc, OC, sc in each of next 9 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 9, OC, sc in each of next 4 sc, turn – 38, 18.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each of next 3 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 6 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 20 sc skipping 2 center FF3DC groups, FF3DC, sc in each of next 6 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 3 sc, turn – 38, 12.
Row 9: Ch 1, [sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC] twice, sc in each of next 9 sc, LC using FF3DC groups from Row 5, sc in each of next 9 sc, [FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc] twice, turn – 38, 18.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each of next 15 sc skipping 2 rightmost FF3DC groups, FF3TR, sc in each of next 8 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 15 sc skipping 2 leftmost FF3DC groups, turn – 38, 6.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in each of next 4 sc, LC using FF3DC groups from Row 9, sc in each of next 5 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 4 sc, OC, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 5 sc, LC using FF3DC groups from Row 9, sc in each of next 4 sc, turn – 38, 24.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in each of next 2 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 8 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 2 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 6 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 2 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 8 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 2 sc, turn – 38, 24.
Row 17: Ch 1, [sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3TR] twice, sc in each of next 4, FF3DC, sc in each of next 5 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 5 sc, FF3DC, [sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3TR] twice, sc in each of next 4 sc, turn – 38, 24.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in each of next 12 sc skipping 2 rightmost FF3TR groups, FF3DC, sc in each of next 14 sc skipping 2 center FF3DC groups, FF3DC, sc in each of next 12 sc skipping 2 leftmost FF3TR groups, turn – 38, 6.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in each of next 4 sc, LC using FF3TR groups from Row 17, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 5 sc, LC using FF3DC groups from Row 17, sc in each of next 5 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc, LC using FF3TR groups from Row 17, sc in each of next 4 sc, turn – 38, 24.
Row 23: Repeat Row 15.
Row 25: Repeat Row 17.
Row 27: Repeat Row 19.
Row 29: Repeat Row 21.
Row 31: Repeat Row 15.
Row 33: Ch 1, [sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3TR] twice, sc in each of next 5 sc, [FF3DC, sc in each of next 4 sc] 3 times, FF3DC, sc in each of next 5 sc, [FF3TR, sc in each of next 4 sc] twice, turn – 38, 24.
Row 35: Ch 1, sc in each of next 15 sc skipping 2 rightmost FF3TR groups, FF3TR, sc in each of next 4 sc, CC (counts as 1 sc when completed), sc in each of next 3 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 15 sc skipping 2 leftmost FF3TR groups, turn – 38, 6.
Row 37: Ch 1, sc in each of next 4 sc, LC using FF3TR groups from Row 33, sc in each of next 9 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 4 sc, FF3TR, sc in each of next 9, LC using FF3TR groups from Row 33, sc in each of next 4, turn – 38, 18.
Row 39: Repeat row 7.
Row 41: Repeat row 9.
Row 43: Ch 1, sc in each of next 6, CC (counts as 1 sc when completed), sc in each of next 9 sc, FF3DC, sc in each of next 6, FF3DC, sc in each of next 10 sc, CC (counts as 1 sc when completed), sc in each of next 5 sc, turn – 38, 6.
Row 45: Ch 1, sc in each of next 17, FF3DC, sc in each of next 4, FF3DC, sc in each of next 17, turn – 38, 6.
Row 47: Sc in each of next 19, CC (counts as 1 sc when completed), sc in each of next 18 – 38, 0.
Next 50 (58) rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn – 38 sc.
Side Edges
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to one long side edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, slip st in edge st of each row, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in front loop only of each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, sc in back loop only of each st across, turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 only 3 (5) more times.
Fasten off.
Work opposite edge the same way.
Top Ribbing
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to top right corner.
Row 1: Work 58 (62) slip sts evenly across edge, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in front loop only of each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), fpdc around each of next 2 sts, bpdc around each of next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, fpdc around each of last 2 sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), bpdc around each of next 2 sts, fpdc around each of next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, bpdc around each of last 2 sts, turn.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 only twice more.
Work bottom ribbing the same way.
FINISHING
Block lightly to measurements, being sure to not over-block as fabric should fit snugly around pillow form.
With right side facing, fold Pillow at the corners and overlap bottom portion over top portion as shown on schematic.
Pin sides of Pillow using sewing pins, and turn piece inside out.
Seam sides of Pillow by slip-stitching through both layers of fabric, being sure to work through all 3 layers of fabric at the overlap.
Weave in all loose ends.
Turn piece right-side-out and insert pillow form.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A Forget-Me-Not (2012) 1 ball or 10 Squares
Contrast B Bluebell (2006) 1 ball or 10 Squares
Contrast C Marigold (2005) 1 ball or 10 Squares
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 18" x 30" [45.5 x 76 cm], to fit 20" x 30" [51 x 76 cm] pillow form.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Pillow form will be sewn into cover and will not be removable. 
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• Leave approx 24" [61 cm] tail of 3rd color at end of motif.
MOTIF
Make 10 each in A, B, and C.
See diagram on page 3.
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.
Crochet  I  Skill Level: Easy
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: With Color 3, sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join. Fasten off.
Assembly
Using long tails at end of Motifs and yarn needle, sew Motifs together following Assembly Diagram (page 3) and ensuring all Motifs are oriented in same direction. Do not use tails of top-most 5 Motifs.
Fold work in half, with WS tog, to make rectangle 3 Motifs x 5 Motifs. Using remaining tails of top-most 5 motifs, sew top and bottom edge together as one side, leaving remaining side open. Insert pillow form into opening, then sew opening shut.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Fool’s Gold (10610) or Winter White (10006) 5 balls per pillow
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
Ch 68.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 66 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 dc. Bobble in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a RS row.
Fasten off.
Edging: Joining Front and Back: 1st rnd: With WS facing each other, join yarn with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Spice Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 239 yds/218 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfl = Double crochet in front loop only
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
instructions:
Note: When joining new balls of yarn take care to match color changes as closely as possible to maintain color striping repeat.
FRONT
Ch 40 (multiple of 11 ch + 7). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal “bump” at back of each ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. (1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 7 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 39 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfl in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Ch 5. Skip next 4 sts. Sl st in rem loop of next dc 2 rows below. Ch 5. Skip next 4 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Working into sts 2 rows below and in front of ch-5 sp, 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfl in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 17½" [44.5 cm], ending on 3rd row. Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Working into sts 2 rows below and in front of ch-5 sp, 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
BACK (make 2)
Ribbing: Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 18" [45.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
1st row: (WS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 36 sc evenly across side edge of ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS tog, overlap Back pieces to match Front with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Sew outer edge seams. Turn Pillow RS out. Insert pillow form.

materials: Caron® Crystal Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 634 yds/580 m) Coral (06005) 2 cakes
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook Half double crochet Back Post.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a look around post of next stitch, at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 20 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in grid pat with larger hook.
instructions:
FRONT GRID
With larger hook ch 85.
1st row:  1 hdc in 4th ch from hook (ch-3 counts as hdc, ch 1). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 84 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of last ch-3. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 41 rows in total have been worked. Fasten off.

FRONT WIGGLE STRIPES
**With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to ch-1 or hdc post indicated with a red arrow on Chart. Ch 3. 1 dc around same ch-1 or hdc post as last sl st. Work 2 dc around each ch-1 or hdc post, following arrows on Chart to create Wiggles. Fasten off.**
Rep from ** to ** for each section indicated in Chart.

BACK (make 2 alike)
Ch 61.
