Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

NOTES
• Chain (Ch) 2 at beg of row does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
• Cross stitch details are worked after Pillow Front is complete.
• Row gauge is taller than usual to accommodate for the cross stitch stitches.

FRONT
With MC, chain (ch) 86.
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 85 stitches (sts).
2nd row: 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) 2nd row until 85 rows are worked.
Fasten off.
Using Cross Stitch Charts, cross stitch design onto Front, noting that 1 sc is equal to 1 square on Chart. Design is divided into 6 charts shown on pages 5 to 10.

BACK (make 2 alike)
With MC, ch 86.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 85 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm].
Next row: Ch 2. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. *1 half double crochet front post (hdcfp) around next hdc. 1 half double crochet back post (hdcbp) around next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm].
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Pin in place for easier joining. With RS facing, join yarn with slip stitch to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

pattern_name: Fiona the Frog Crochet Pillow Toy
materials: Contrast A Deep Sea (10920) 2 balls or 352 yds/322 m
Contrast B Moss (10803) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.

BODY
Bottom of Pillow
With A, ch 31.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch,  1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 62 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 68 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 74 sc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 80 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 5th rnd until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm].
Cont for Top of Pillow:
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 74 sc.
2nd rnd:   Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 68 sc.
4th rnd:   Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 62 sc.
6th rnd:   Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. (Sc2tog ) twice. Join. 56 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff Body.
Note: Safety eyes cannot be moved once they are properly attached, so it’s best to make sure you like eye placement using stitch markers before inserting them.
Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach Safety Eyes at markers.
With long yarn end, sew top edge tog.

Stomach
With B, ch 3.
See diagram on page 4.
1st row: (WS). 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 15 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 20 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 25 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 30 hdc.
Next row:  Cont along flat edge, ch 2. Work 20 hdc evenly across edge. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more.
Fasten off.
Sew Stomach to Body as shown in photo.

Arms and Legs (make 4 alike)
With A, ch 2.
See diagram on page 4.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off leaving a long end to sew to Body.
Sew Arms and Legs to Body as shown in photo.

Eyelids (make 2)
With A, ch 3.
See diagram on page 4.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook.
Fasten off.
Sew Eyelids over safety eyes as shown in photo.

Nostrils:  With length of B, embroider nostril on Body as shown in photo with straight stitch.

STRAIGHT STITCH

materials: 2 balls each 705 Dusty Pink A and 117 Sand Castle B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 10 mm [US N-15]
18" x 18" (45.5 x 45.5 cm) square pillow form
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
measurements: Pillow measures 18" x 18" (45.5 x 45.5 cm) square.
gauge: With 2 strands held together, 4 sc = 2" (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Pillow cover is a long rectangle, folded in half and sewn on 3 sides. 
2. Hold 2 strands together at all times. 
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.

PILLOW
Cover
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 37. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—36 sc.  
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.  
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 6" (15 cm); change 1 strand to B at end of last row. 
With 1 strand each of A and B, repeat Row 2 until piece measures 12" (30.5 cm); change A strand to B at end of last row. 
With 2 strands of B, repeat Row 2 until piece measures 24" (61 cm); change 1 strand of B to A at end of last row.
With 1 strand each of A and B, repeat Row 2 until piece measures 30" (76 cm); change B strand to A at end of last row. 
With 2 strands of A, repeat Row 2 until piece measures 36" (91.5 cm). Fasten off.

FINISHING
With wrong sides held together, fold rectangle in half widthwise. Whipstitch edges together on 2 sides, insert pillow form, and whipstitch remaining edges together.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Lattice™ (7.8 oz/220 g; 389 yds/356 m)
Contrast A Cherry (19006) 3 balls or 949 yds/868 m
Contrast B Rose Mix (19001) 2 balls or 447 yds/409 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Bobble = Working in front of work, [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
PILLOW FRONT
With A, ch 59.
1st row: (RS) 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 57 dc.
First row of chart is complete.
Note: Chart is shown on page 2.
Cont working chart, noting each Contrast A square is 1 dc and each Contrast B square is 1 bobble, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous row and work sts around it. This will ensure even gauge as all sts will be worked around an extra strand of yarn held across top of previous row. Carry both shades up side of work.
Cont working chart until 63rd row of chart is complete.
Fasten off.
PILLOW BACK (make 2 pieces alike).
With A, ch 59.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 57 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first st. *1 dcbp around next dc. 1 dcfp around next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for 2½" [6.5 cm].
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 16½" [42 cm].
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pillow Assembly
Holding WS tog, overlap Back pieces to match Front in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Working through both thicknesses, join A with sl st in corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Soft Ecru (01004) or Country Green (01222) or Light Blue (00026) 4 balls or 475 yds/434 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
10" [25.5 cm] length of ½" [1.5 cm] wide faux leather strapping for handle.
abbreviations: Hdc3bl = Half double crochet through 3rd loop at back of work
instructions:
Note: Pillow is worked in a spiral. There are no ch worked at beg of rnd unless otherwise indicated; simply work directly into the next st (noting marker to indicate end of rnd will move up each rnd).
FRONT
**Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 3. Set-up: (3 sc. 1 hdc. Place marker in last hdc for end of rnd. 6 hdc) all in ring. 1 hdc in each sc to marked st (end of rnd). 10 sts.
1st rnd: 2 hdc3bl in each hdc to end of rnd. 20 hd3bl.
2nd rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. 1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. Rep from * to end of rnd. 30 hdc3bl.
3rd rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) twice. Rep from * around. 40 hdc3bl.
4th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 3 times. Rep from * around. 50 hdc3bl.
5th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 4 times. Rep from * around. 60 hdc3bl.
6th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 5 times. Rep from * around. 70 hdc3bl.
7th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 6 times. Rep from * around. 80 hdc3bl.
8th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 7 times. Rep from * around. 90 hdc3bl.
9th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 8 times. Rep from * around. 100 hdc3bl.
10th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 9 times. Rep from * around. 110 hdc3bl.
11th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 10 times. Rep from * around. 120 hdc3bl.
12th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 11 times. Rep from * around. 130 hdc3bl.
13th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 12 times. Rep from * around. 140 hdc3bl.
14th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 13 times. Rep from * around. 150 hdc3bl.
15th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 14 times. Rep from * around. 160 hdc3bl.
16th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 15 times. Rep from * around. 170 hdc3bl.
17th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 16 times. Rep from * around. 180 hdc3bl.
18th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 17 times. Rep from * around. 190 hdc3bl.
19th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 18 times. Rep from * around. 200 hdc3bl.
20th rnd: *2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 19 times. Rep from * to last 20 sts. 2 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl. (1 hdc3bl in next hdc3bl) 16 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc3bl. Join with sl st to first hdc3bl. 210 sts.**
21st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 210 sts.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc and ch to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Thread faux leather strap through holes made with ch sps in 22nd rnd of Pillow Front; tie knots in both ends to secure Straps. Sew Back and Front tog, inserting pillow form when seam is halfway complete.

materials: Bernat® Suede-ish™ (7.9 oz/225 g; 428 yds/391 m) Birch Beige (24008) 2 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 14 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.

Buttonhole Side
Ch 61.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 59 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: (Buttonhole row – RS). Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each of first 6 sts. *Ch 2. Skip 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to last 8 sts. Ch 2. Skip 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 6 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row, working 2 hdc in each ch-2 sp. Turn.
5th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures 16½” [42 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next 2 rows: As 3rd and 4th rows.
Next row: As 2nd row. Fasten oﬀ.

Button Side
Work as given for Buttonhole Side, omitting all references to buttonholes.

FINISHING
Following diagram (note direction of pat ridges), sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes. Fold cushion flat, having rows of buttons in middle of Front and Back. Sew side seams. Insert pillow form. Close buttons.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1001 White A, 1814 True Blue B, and 1803 Blue Hawaii C
two 12” x 16” (30.5 x 40.5 cm) pillow forms
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pillow measures 16” wide x 13” long (40.5 x 33 cm)
gauge: 19 sc = 4” (10 cm) in ripple pattern; 8 rows = 5” (12.5 cm)
instructions: PILLOW (make 2 – 1 with A and B and 1 with A and C) With A, ch 78. Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, [sc in next 8 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 8 ch, 3 sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in next 8 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 8 ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—77 sc. Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, [sc in next 8 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, 3 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 8 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn. Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to 2nd color. Rows 5–8: Repeat Row 2; change to A at end of Row 8. Rows 9–12: Repeat Row 2; change to 2nd color at end of Row 12. Rows 13–60: Repeat Rows 5–12 six times. Rows 61–64: Repeat Rows 5–8 once more. Fasten off. FINISHING: With right sides held together, whipstitch first and last rows together. Whipstitch one side edge closed, matching same color rows. Turn right side out, insert pillow. Whipstitch 2nd side closed, matching same color rows. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Taupe (10029) 1 ball or 126 yds/115 m
Contrast B Coal (10040) 2 balls or 264 yds/241 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
instructions:
Notes: To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of previous stitch and draw new color through. Carry color not in use loosely up side of work.
FRONT
With A, ch 37.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 36 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more, joining B at end of last row. Turn. 
Beg zig-zag pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd and alt rows: With same color as previous row, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With A, as 2nd row.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below (2nd row). 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * once more. 1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Turn.
9th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sc 3 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
11th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *1 trfp around each of next 3 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn.
14th row: As 2nd row. Break B. 
15th row: With A, as 1st row.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more. 
Fasten off. 
Fringe
Holding Front upside down, join B with sl st to first rem front loop of 1st row of zig-zag pat.
Fringe row: Ch 1. *Sl st in next sc. Draw up a loop 10" [25.5 cm] long. Twist loop 40 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Holding Front right side up, join B with sl st to first rem front loop of 15th row of zig-zag pat. Work Fringe row as before. Fasten off. 
BACK
With B, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 36 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back measures same as Front. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Edging: Joining Front and Back: 
1st rnd:  With WS facing each other, join B with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around 3 sides of Pillow, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Complete rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: First Popcorn = Ch 3 (counts as ddc). 3 dc in same sp as sl st. Drop loop from hook, insert hook in 3rd ch of ch 3 and pull dropped loop through
Popcorn = 4 dc in next sc. Drop loop from hook, insert hook in first dc of 4 dc group and pull dropped loop through
instructions:
Stripe Pat (turn at end of each rnd)
With B – 6 rnds.
With A – 2 rnds.
With B – 2 rnds.
These 10 rnds form Stripe Pat.
FRONT
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: First popcorn. *Ch 1. Popcorn in next sc. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of first popcorn. 10 popcorns.
3rd rnd: First popcorn. *Ch 1. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Popcorn in next popcorn. Rep from * around, ending with: Popcorn in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of first popcorn. 20 popcorns.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 24 times more, ending with sl st in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 points.
Proceed in Stripe Pat, work in rnds, turning at end of each rnd as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *Working in rem loops of foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in side of last sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next sl st and sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Skip first sc. *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch 1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around, ending with: 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Skip first sc. *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around, ending with: 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rnds until 10 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Cont with A only until work between outer points measures 18" [45.5 cm] in diameter. Fasten off.
BACK
Work as given for Front, substituting A for B and B for A.
FINISHING
Sew Front and Back tog through back loops, matching points of Front with valleys of Back and leaving opening for pillow form. Insert pillow form. Sew opening closed.

materials: Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Main Color MC Pink Kiss (09051) 2 balls or 975 yds/887 m
Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Contrast A Grass Green (10620) 1 ball or 180 yds/165 m
Contrast B Black (10503) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Small amount of White (10501) for embroidery
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Joined dc = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of dc just worked and draw up a loop.
Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 3 loops on hook.
(Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. – Joined dc made

Joined dc-to-tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Skip next horizontal bar of same tr. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 3 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. – Joined dc-to-tr made

Joined tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into second horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. – Joined tr made.

Joined tr-to-dc = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of dc just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into bottom vertical bar at base of same dc and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. – Joined tr-to-dc made.

Joined tr-to-dtr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of dtr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into second horizontal bar of same dtr and draw up a loop. Skip next horizontal bar of same dtr. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 3 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. – Joined tr-to-dtr made.

Joined dtr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of dtr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into second horizontal bar of same dtr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into bottom vertical bar at base of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 5 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. – Joined dtr-to-tr made.

Joined dtr-to-tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into second horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into third horizontal bar of same dtr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 5 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. – Joined dtr made
Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook - 1 scbp made
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop between ‘legs’ in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] diameter x 17" [43 cm] tall, excluding leaves.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting and moving marker up as you progress. With MC, ch 2. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. PM on first st.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
Cont in same manner, inc 6 sc every rnd until there are 96 sc.
Next rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around.
Next rnd: Cont in same manner, work 1 splsc in each sc and inc 6 sc evenly around.
Rep last 2 rnds 4 times more. 126 sc.
Next 2 rnds: 1 splsc in each sc around.
Next rnd: Cont in same manner, work 1 splsc in each sc and inc 6 sc evenly around.
Rep last 3 rnds 4 times more. 156 sc. PM as second set at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from second marker measures 5" [12.5 cm].
Shape Top: 1st rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 12 sc. Splsc2tog. 1 splsc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 150 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: 1 splsc in each st around.
3rd rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 23 sc. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. 144 sts.
5th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 11 sc. Splsc2tog. 1 splsc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 138 sts.
7th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 21 sc. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. 132 sts.
9th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 10 sc. Splsc2tog. 1 splsc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 126 sts.
11th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 19 sc. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. 120 sts.
Cont in same manner, work splsc in each sc and dec 6 sts as established on every following alt rnd until there are 24 sts, suffing pillow as you go. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: (Rnd for leaves). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral as before.
Next rnd: *1 splsc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 splsc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
Finish stuffing pillow.
Next rnd: 1 splsc in each st around.
Next rnd: *1 splsc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
Next rnd: 1 splsc in each st around.
Next rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sts. Fasten off. Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
LEAVES
First stem: 1st row: Join MC with sl st to rem loop of any sc of Rnd for leaves. *Ch 40. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 11 ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 1 tr in each of next 6 ch. Skip next 3 sc. Join with sl st to rem loop of next sc. Fasten off.*
Second to eight stems: 1st row: Join MC with sl st to rem loop of sc before last sc 2 where previous Stem was joined. Rep from * to * as given for first Stem.
Leaves: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 10 ch of foundation chain of any Stem. Join A with sl st to rem loop of next foundation chain. Working in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 joined dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 joined tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 joined dtr in each of next 3 ch. 1 joined tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 joined dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. 2 sc in turning ch. Do not turn. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in next sl st. 1 hdc in next sl st. 1 dc in next sl st. 1 joined dc in next sl st. 1 joined tr in each of next 2 sl sts. 1 joined dtr in each of next 3 sl sts. 1 joined tr in each of next 3 sl sts. 1 joined ddc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Fasten off.
Rep for all stems.
Eyes (make 2).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of first sc. 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing and to embroider eyelashes.
Using photo as a guide, sew eyes to upper part of Beet pillow. Using Straight stitch, embroider 3 eyelashes approx 3 sts long and 1 row apart. With White, using photo as a guide, embroider eye reflection using 3 straight stitches.
Nose: Mark circle approx 1" [2.5 cm] diameter between eyes and 2" [5 cm] below lower edge of eyes. With MC run stitch around marked circle, having both ends long enough to secure later. Pull strand of MC to close circle and shape nose. Tie both ends of MC in a knot and fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Race Car Red (12001) 4 balls or 800 yds/728 m
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast B Go-Go Green (13004) 1 ball or 45 yds/41 m
Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Contrast C Dark Taupe (28013) 1 ball
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge with 2 strands of Bernat® Blanket Brights™ held together.
Purchased Pouf approx 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] high.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approximately 20" [51 cm] diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 6 rnds = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of Bernat Blanket Brights held tog.
instructions:
Apple
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Working seamlessly in rnds, mark first st of each rnd, moving marker up at beg of each subsequent rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sts.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 56 sts.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 64 sts.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 80 sts.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 88 sts.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 96 sts. Place marker at end of rnd.
Work 14 rnds even in sc (piece measures approx 11" [28 cm] from marked rnd).
Place purchased Pouf inside work to cont shaping top:
1st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 88 sts.
2nd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 80 sts.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 64 sts.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 56 sts.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 40 sts.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
10th rnd: *1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
11th rnd: *Sctog. Rep from * around. 8 sts. Fasten off.
Leaf
With 2 strands of B held tog, ch 10.
3 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Ch 1. Sl st in last ch 1 (leaf point). Working into opposite side of foundation ch, sl st in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 3 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Leaf Stem: Ch 4. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. Sl st to next dc of Leaf. Fasten off.
Apple Stem
With 3 strands of C held tog, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Apple Stem measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Apple Stem to top of Apple. Sew Leaf to Apple Stem.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 311 White A, 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red B and 385 Royal C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 17 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Heart pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER
With A, ch 120, leaving a long tail for sewing seam closed, slip st in first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around – 120 sc. Round 2: [Sc in next sc, sc in back loop only of next sc] around. Round 3: [Sc in back loop only of next sc, sc in next sc] around. Repeat Rounds 2-3 until piece measures 17" [43 cm], tugging from side to side to settle sts before measuring, slip st in first st on last round to join. Fasten off. 
HEART
Row 1 (Right Side): With B, ch 4 (skipped 3 ch count as first dc), work 4 dc in 4th ch from hook – 5 dc. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sc – 6 sc. Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st as ch 3, dc in each st to last st, 2 dc in last st – 8 dc. Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 3 sts – 10 sc. Fasten off. Row 5: With right side facing, join A in first sc with slip st, repeat Row 3 – 12 dc. Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 5 sts – 14 sc. Row 7: Repeat Row 3 – 16 dc. Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Row 9: With right side facing, join B in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 18 dc. Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 8 sts – 20 sc. Row 11: Repeat Row 3 – 22 dc. Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st – 26 sc. Fasten off. Row 13: With right side facing, join A in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 28 dc. Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 15: Repeat Row 3 – 30 dc. Row 16: Repeat Row 14. Fasten off. Row 17: With right side facing, join B in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 32 dc. Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] twice – 36 sc. Row 19: Repeat Row 3 – 38 dc. Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 34 sts, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last st – 40 sc. Fasten off. Rows 21-24: Repeat Rows 13-16 – 44 sc on last row worked. Rows 25-27: With B, repeat Rows 13-15 – 48 dc on last row worked. Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st] 4 times, sc in last 2 sts – 53 sc. Fasten off. Row 29: With right side facing, join C in first st with a slip st, ch 3, dc in each st across – 53 dc. Row 30: Repeat Row 14. Row 31: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 25 sts, ch 2, slip st in next st, ch 2, dc in each st to end – 52 dc and 2 ch-2 spaces.
First Heart Side
Row 32: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 23 sts, sc2tog over last dc and ch-2 space, leave remaining sts unworked – 25 sc. Row 33: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across – 25 dc. Row 34: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog – 22 sc. Row 35: Repeat Row 33. Row 36: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sts, sc2tog – 20 sc. Row 37: Repeat Row 33. Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, [sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] twice – 17 sc. Row 39: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 10 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in last st – 2 hdc, 2 dc, and 10 tr. Fasten off.
Second Heart Side
Row 32: With wrong side facing and working across unworked sts, join C in unworked ch-2 space of Row 33 with a slip st, ch 1, sc2tog over ch-2 space and first dc, sc in next 23 sts, sc2tog – 25 sc. Rows 33-39: Repeat Rows 33-39 as for First Heart Side.
Edging
With right side facing, join B in top edge of top red stripe with a slip st, sc evenly spaced around all red and white edges, change to C, sc evenly around blue edge, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.
Star (make 6)
With A, make an adjustable loop ring, leaving long end for sewing, [ch 2, dc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st in slip ring] 5 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Flatten Cover and sew one end closed. Insert pillow form. Sew opposite end closed. Sew stars in blue sections of Heart. Sew Heart in center of Pillow Cover. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 624 Tea Leaf A, 315 Artist Print B, 579 Pale Plum C, 316 Soft White D, 656 Real Teal E, 312 Black F, 256 Carrot G
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [F-5 US] and 5.5mm [I-9 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Pillow measures 16” x 16” (40.5 x 40.5 cm) including border
gauge: 12 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 6 rows = 4” (10 cm), with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com

Whether used on the sofa or in the bedroom, this adorable owl adds a touch of color and playfulness to your style. Crochet him in the colors shown, or change them up to suit your décor.
OWL
Note When fastening off, leave long tails on each piece for sewing.
Body
Beginning at top of head, with B, ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—11 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Rows 4–9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times—17 sc.
Rows 10 and 11: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 12–14: Repeat Row 2—23 sc.
Rows 15–28: Repeat Row 3.
Row 29: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—21 sc.
Rows 30 and 31: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 32–37: Repeat Row 29—9 sc.
Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
With B, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
PILLOW (make 2)
With A, ch 49.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—47 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), *dc in front loop of next dc, dc in back loop of next dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, dc in front loop of next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Rows 3–23: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
Edging
Note Skip a stitch as needed to work an odd number of stitches on each side between 3-sc groups in each corner.
Round 1: With right side facing and G, join with sc in first corner dc, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in each st to next corner dc, 3 sc in corner dc; sc evenly spaced across ends of rows of first side; working across opposite
Belly
With C, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—15 sc.
Rows 6–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Rows 14–17: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—7 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With D, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Fasten off.
With smaller hook, join E with sc in any sc.
Edging: Sc in each sc and in end of each row around; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
Eye Pupil (make 2)
With F, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and last ch, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. Fasten off.
Wing (make 2)
With E, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, turn—3 sc.
Rows 3–7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—8 sc.
Rows 8–12: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc, turn—3 sc.
Fasten off.
Beak
With G, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. Fasten off.
Feet (make 2)
With G, ch 3.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and last ch, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in last sc. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Use photograph as a guide to all placement. Sew ears to top of head and belly to body. Fold one edge of each eye under slightly and place eyes with these straight edges together on head; sew in place. Sew pupils on each eye close to center of face with points positioned vertically (like a diamond shape). With points placed vertically, sew beak between eyes. Center owl body on one pillow square and sew with running stitches. Sew wings and feet to body and pillow.
FINISHING
Edging: With wrong sides together, larger hook, and working through both thicknesses, join E with sc in any center sc of 3-sc group, picot, sc in same sc as join, [*picot, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to center sc of next 3-sc group, (sc, picot, sc) in center sc] 3 times, insert pillow form, **picot, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from ** to first sc; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Gumdrop®: 3 balls 620 Cherry A
RED HEART® Lolli™: 1 ball 9764 Watermelon B
Yarn needle, 2 stitch markers, four 1½” (38 mm) buttons, 16” (40.5 cm) square pillow form, sewing needle and matching thread (optional).
abbreviations: A and B = Yarn A, and Yarn B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern with A. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
Rows 2–5: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st across; change to B at end of Row 5, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, loosely sc in each st across; change to A, turn—36 sc.
Rows 7–9: Repeat Row 2 three times; change to B at end of Row 9.
Row 10: Repeat Row 6.
Rows 11–15: Repeat Row 2 five times; change to B at end of Row 15.
Rows 16–65: Repeat Rows 6-15 five times.

Flap
Row 66: Repeat Row 6. Note. Place a stitch marker at each end of row for assembly.
Rows 67 and 68: Repeat Row 2 twice.
Row 69 (buttonhole row): Ch 2, hdc in first 6 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts (for buttonhole), hdc in next 5 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, hdc in next 6 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, hdc in next 5 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, hdc in remaining sts, turn—28 hdc and 4 ch-2 spaces (for buttonholes).
Row 71: Ch 2, *hdc in each st to next ch-2 space, hdc in next 2 ch; repeat from * 3 times, hdc in remaining sts—36 hdc. Fasten off. 
Fold cover at Row 33 so that Row 1 is aligned with marked row and all B rows match. Pin sides together. Hold cover with wrong side of flap facing and to your left (hold to your right if you are left-handed).
Row 72: Working through both thicknesses and across ends of rows between first 2 sts, join B with sc in first row at bottom of cover, sc evenly spaced across ends of rows and flap to last row, 3 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 3 sc in last st, working across ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across other end of flap and ends of rows through both thicknesses and between first 2 sts. Fasten off.

Notes
1. Hold two strands of A together throughout.
2. Working with B:
   a. The yarn is comprised of a strand of chenille and a strand of thread. Treat the yarn as if it were one strand; do not work into spaces between the chenille and thread. 
   b. Work with a slightly looser tension than with A.
   c. Begin each wrong side row with a plain section of yarn, not at a cluster of loops (if necessary, cut off the first cluster before joining the yarn at the end of the previous row). When you reach a cluster, do not work into it or pull through a loop; instead, guide it to the right side of the fabric and continue to crochet with the plain sections of the strand.
3. To change yarn at the end of a row or round, work last stitch of old yarn to last yarn over. Yarn over with new yarn and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new yarn. Cut old yarn.
4. Catch the tails behind the stitching of the next row to minimize weaving in ends. Weaving in doesn’t need to be too precise as all ends will be tucked into the wrong side of the pillow cover before the pillow form is inserted.
5. If your buttons are sew-through style with holes, be sure to create a shank when sewing to the pillow cover so the fabric doesn’t tug when buttoned.

PILLOW COVER
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 37.
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc) and in each ch across, turn—36 hdc.
obtain the gauge.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (make alike)
Version 1: A as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3.
Version 2: C as Color 1, B as Color 2 and A as Color 3.
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. See chart on page 2.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first dc. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st (counts as 2 dc). *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st (counts as 2 dc). *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as sl st (counts as shell). *Skip next 2 dc. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next dc – shell made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 shells.
6th rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
9th rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
10th rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
11th rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 1. 5 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (5 dc. Ch 1. 5 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join Color 3 with sl st to top of ch 3.
12th rnd: With Color 3, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *(Ch 1. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row below. Ch 1) 6 times.** 1 sc in same sp as last sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row above) 6 times. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. Rep from * around, ending at **. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 2. (Skip first sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg dc3tog made. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. (Skip next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Skip next sc. (Skip next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc3tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
14th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS tog, join C with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each st around, insert pillow form at halfway point and cont around to end. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) Main Color (MC) (00083 Cornflower Blue) 6 balls
Sizes 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) and 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
3 inch [7.5 cm] thick piece of foam 24 ins [61 cm] long x 16 ins [40.5 cm] wide
measurements: Approx 24 ins [61 cm] long x 16 ins [40.5 cm] wide x 3 ins [7.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
FRONT 
With MC and larger hook, ch 79.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 78 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Turn.
Rep last row until 62 rows in total have been worked. Fasten off.
BACK
With MC and larger hook, ch 79.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 78 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, as 2nd row. Join A.
Turn.
4th and 5th rows: With A, as 2nd row.
Join B. Turn.
6th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join MC.
Turn.
7th and 8th rows: With MC, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 8th rows 9 times more (62 rows in total). Fasten off.
Side Panel
With B and larger hook, ch 10.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 80 ins [203 cm] when slightly stretched.
Fasten off. Place sets of markers on side edges 24 ins [61 cm], 40 ins [101.5 cm], 64 ins [162.5 cm] up from foundation row (leaving 16 ins [40.5 cm] free at end).
FINISHING
Appliqué Words
“I’m”
For ‘I’, with B and smaller hook, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Turn.
Rep 2nd row 13 times more. Fasten off.
For ‘’’ (apostrophe), with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Sl st in next ch. Fasten off.
For ‘m’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Turn.
Rep 2nd row 3 times more.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next st. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
8th to 11th rows: Rep 6th and 7th rows twice more.
12th row: Ch 7 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
15th to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. Fasten off at end of 20th row.
“digging”
For ‘d’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd to 15th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
**Place a marker on last sc worked. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Sl st in side of last 2 rows. Ch 10. Miss side of next 5 rows. Sl st in side of next 2 rows. Turn.
Work 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Sl st in marked sc. Fasten off.**
For ‘i’ (make 2), with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Fasten off at end of 7th row.
For '.' (dot), with B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
For ‘g’ (make 3), with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
6th to 21st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across.
Rep from ** to ** as for ‘d’.
For ‘n’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next st. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
8th to 11th rows: Rep 6th and 7th rows twice more.
12th row: With working yarn, ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
“this!”
For ‘t’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
With separate length of yarn, join B with sl st to first sc of last row. Ch 2. Fasten off.
12th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 6 sc.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
14th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
15th and 16th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Fasten off.
For ‘h’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
8th to 11th rows: Rep 6th and 7th rows twice more.
With separate length of yarn, join B with sl st to first hdc of last row. Ch 7. Fasten off.
12th row: Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Turn. 15 sc.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Work ‘i’ as for ‘digging’.
For ‘s’, with B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
5th to 8th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in next hdc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
12th to 17th rows: Rep 10th and 11th rows 3 times more.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next hdc. Fasten off.
For ‘!’, with B and smaller hook, ch 11.
1st rnd: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working along opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 8 ch . Sl st in last 2 ch. Fasten off.
Work '.' (dot) as for 'i'.
Position ‘I’m digging this!’ letters on Front as shown. Sew around outer edge of letters securely.
Pin Front and Back pieces to Side Panel, having markers on Side Panel at corners of Front and Back.
Back Edging: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st at any corner of Back. Ch 1. Working through Back and Side Panel at same time to join, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in corners. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break MC.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Front Edging: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st at bottom right corner of Front. Ch 1. Working through Front and Side Panel at same time to join, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge working 3 sc in corners to opposite bottom left corner of Front. Work rem of rnd in sc across Front only, leaving Side Panel free to insert zipper. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break MC.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew zipper in position.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton™: 2 balls 621 Green A, 4 balls 529 Turquoise B.
11 x 16” (28 x 40.5 cm) purchased pillow (or preferred rectangular pillow), sewing needle and matching thread, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, and B = Color A, and Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 18 sts = 4” (10 cm); Rnds 1–5 measure about 5” (12.5 cm) across, slightly stretched.
instructions:
FRONT
Center Motif
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 8; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, small-Cl, [ch 2, Cl in ring] 7 times, ch 2; join with slip st in small-Cl—8 clusters and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-2 space, *ch 5, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, 3 sc) in first ch-5 space, *ch 2, 3 sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in next 2 sts, (slip st, ch 2, dc) in first ch-2 space (beginning ch-2 and dc count as first small-Cl), [ch 2, small-Cl in same ch-2 space] twice, *ch 3, (small-Cl, [ch 2, small-Cl] twice) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in first dc—24 clusters, 16 ch-2 spaces, and 8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining (beginning ch-2 and dc count as first small-Cl), ch 3, V-st in next small-Cl, ch 3, small-Cl in next small-Cl, *ch 1, small-Cl in next small-Cl, ch 3, V-st in next small-Cl, ch 3, small-Cl in next small-Cl; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in first dc—16 clusters and 8 V-sts. Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing and 1 strand each of A and B held together, draw up a loop in any small-Cl immediately following a V-st, ch 2, dc in next small-Cl (beginning ch-2 and first dc count as first dc2tog-over-3), ch 4, shell in ch-3 space of next V-st, *ch 4, dc2tog, ch 4, shell in ch-3 space of next V-st; repeat from * around, ch 4; join with slip st in first dc—8 shells, and 8 dc2tog-over-3.
Special Stitches
small-Cl (2 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Cl (3 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
V-st (V-stitch) = (Sc, ch 3, sc) in indicated stitch.
dc2tog-over 3 (double crochet 2 stitches together worked over 3 stitches) = Yarn over, insert hook in next cluster, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops, skip next ch-1 space, yarn over, insert hook in next cluster, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
shell = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated space.
Notes
1. Pattern is for pillow front and is worked with 2 strands of yarn held together throughout, beginning with center motif.
2. Center motif is worked in joined rounds beginning at center. Rounds are worked with right side facing at all times. Do not turn rounds.
3. End sections are worked back and forth in rows across two opposite side edges of the center motif to form the piece into a rectangle.
4. Size of piece can be adjusted to fit size of preferred purchased pillow.
Designed by Kristen Stoltzfus
Round 7: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-4 space, *ch 4, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, [ch 4, sc in next ch-4 space] twice, ch 4, sc in ch-2 space of next shell, [ch 4, sc in next ch-4 space] twice; repeat from * around omitting last sc; join with slip st in first sc—4 shells and 24 ch-4 spaces.
Round 8: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), 4 dc in same ch-4 space, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, *4 dc in each of next 6 ch-4 spaces, shell in ch-2 space of next shell; repeat from * to last 5 ch-4 spaces, 4 dc in each of last 5 ch-4 spaces; join with slip st in first dc—4 shells and 96 dc (24 dc across each side between corner shells).
Rounds 9 and 10: Ch 2, [dc in each dc to next ch-2 space, shell in next ch-2 space] 4 times, dc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in first dc—4 shells and 128 dc at the end of Round 10. Fasten off.
Round 11: With right side facing and 2 strands of B held together, draw up a loop in any dc, ch 2, [dc in each dc to next ch-2 space, shell in next ch-2 space] 4 times, dc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in first dc—4 shells and 144 dc.
With B, repeat Round 9 three more times, or as many times as needed to cover width of pillow. Fasten off.
First End Section
Row 1: With right side facing and 2 strands of B held together, draw up a loop in ch-2 space of any corner shell, ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), dc in same ch-2 space, skip next dc, dc in each dc across to 1 dc before next corner ch-2 space, skip next dc, dc in ch-2 space of shell, turn; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each dc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 four more times or until piece is long enough to cover one end of pillow, when center motif is placed at center of pillow. Fasten off.
Second End Section
With right side facing and 2 strands of B held together, draw up a loop in ch-2 sp of first unworked shell following first end section, to work across opposite side of center motif. Work second end section same as first end section, but do not fasten off when section is complete.
Edging
If necessary, turn piece so that right side is facing, ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire outer edge of pillow front, working 2 sc in each corner; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block piece, if desired. With sewing needle and matching thread, whipstitch pillow front to front of purchased pillow.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m) Contrast A Off White (10514) 1 ball
Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Contrast B Seaside (16002) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Circle and Leaf Motifs = Approx 4" [10 cm] square.
instructions:
FRONT
Circle Motif (make 4).
With B, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2. 
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 23 tr in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-4. 24 sts. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join A with sl st to first tr. 
Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 2 dtr in next st. Ch 2. 2 dtr in next st. *1 tr in each of next 4 sts. 2 dtr in next st. Ch 2. 2 dtr in next st. Rep from * twice more. 1 tr in next st. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 32 sts and 4 ch-2 sps. Fasten off.
Leaf Motif (make 12).
With B, ch 14. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in each of next 5 ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in next ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in each of next 5 ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join A with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in same next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in next st. 2 tr in next st. (1 dtr. Ch 2. 1 dtr) in next st. 2 tr in next st. 1 tr in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts and 4 ch-2 sps.
Fasten off.
With A, sew Circle and Leaf Motifs tog as seen in Diagram using whipstitch through back loops only.
BACK (make 2 pieces alike) 
Ribbing: With A, ch 7. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
1st row: Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 48 sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. Place marker at end of row. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marker measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Joining Front and Back: 
Overlap Back pieces to match measurements of Front, with WS facing each other and ribbed sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. Pin in place for easier joining. 
With RS facing, join A with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, working 3 sc in each corner. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break A.
2nd rnd: With B and working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Insert pillow form.

materials: Red Heart® Team Spirit™: 3 skeins 964 Burgundy/Gold
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Dorm Pillow
Crochet a pillow to support your back in colors that support your favorite team! Self-striping yarn makes it easy to crochet and perfect for your dorm room or a gift for a sports enthusiast.

Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Sides of pillow are worked back and forth in rows on the diagonal. All stitching is in back loops only.
2. Pull tails to wrong side of piece to minimize weaving in ends.

PILLOW 
Side (make 2)
Ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loop, 3 sc in sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only here and throughout, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 4 (increase row): Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Repeat Row 4 until perpendicular edges each measure 20” (51 cm).
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Next Row (decrease row): Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn. 
Repeat last row until 3 sts remain. 
Last Row: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Round: Holding wrong sides together, working through both thicknesses of sts and ends of rows, and working 3 sc in each corner, join yarn with sc in any st or row, sc evenly around 3 sides; insert pillow form, sc evenly in remaining sts and rows; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Home Bundle™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 207 yds/189 m) - Morning Blue (14031) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from back to front, to form loop. Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
instructions:
FRONT
Note: Push tr sts worked on WS to RS of work to form bobbles. Ch 36. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 

Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until piece from beg measures approx 17½" [44.5 cm] ending on a RS row. Turn. Do not fasten off. Beg working in rnds as follows: Loopy Edging: 1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work Lp st evenly around 4 sides of Front, working 4 Lp st in each corner. Join with sl st to first Lp st. Do not Turn. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 Lp st in each st around. Join with sl st to first Lp st. Fasten off. 

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 36. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until piece from beg measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Beg working in rnds as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around 4 sides of Back, working 4 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front to create center opening to insert pillow form. 1st rnd: Join yarn with sl st to any corner st. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Contrast A Soft Sunshine 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast B Twilight 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast C Bleached Aqua 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast D Rich Blue 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast E Ever After Pink 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast F Burgundy Plum 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast G Orchid Hush 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast H Gray Orchid 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
STRIPE PAT
Work 7 rows each in A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H. These 56 rows form Stripe Pat.
FRONT & BACK (Make 2 alike).
With A, ch 31.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row until 56 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Note:
• To change color while working joining rnd, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
Join Front and Back:
With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join A with sl st to bottom right corner.
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc into side of each of next 7 rows, joining B at end of last st. With B, work 1 sc into side of each of next 7 rows, joining C at end of last st.
Cont as established, changing colors as needed to correspond with Stripe Pat, having 3 sc in each top corner and working 1 sc in each sc along top edge in H. Cont in same manner down left side edge, working 3 sc in last row (with A). Insert Pillow form. Work 1 sc in each rem loops of foundation ch. Work 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
